[He]93-mr. bounderby ’d open [his]93-mr. bounderby eyes , [that boy]648-that boy would , if [he]93-mr. bounderby knew how empty of learning [[my]0-i young maw]649-my young maw was , at [his]93-mr. bounderby time of life . ’ Which , by the by , [he]93-mr. bounderby probably did know , for [he]93-mr. bounderby had heard of it often enough . ‘[93-mr. bounderby] But it ’s extraordinary the difficulty [I]0-i have on scores of such subjects , in speaking to [any one on equal terms]650-any one on equal terms . Here , for example , [I]0-i have been speaking to [you]651-you this morning about tumblers . Why , what do [you]651-you know about [tumblers]652-tumblers ? At the time when , to have been [a tumbler in the mud of [the streets]2975-the streets]653-a tumbler in the mud of the streets , would have been [a godsend to [me]0-i]655-a godsend to me , a prize in the lottery to [me]0-i , [you]651-you were at the Italian Opera . [You]651-you were coming out of [the Italian Opera]656-the italian opera , [ma’am]361-ma’am , in white satin and jewels , a blaze of splendour , when [I]0-i had n’t a penny to buy a link to light [you]651-you . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i certainly , [sir]2771-sir , ’ returned [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , with a dignity serenely mournful , ‘[0-i] was familiar with the Italian Opera at a very early age . ’ ‘[361-ma’am] Egad , [ma’am]361-ma’am , so was [I]0-i , ’ said [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , ‘[0-i] — with the wrong side of it . A hard bed [the pavement of [its]661-its Arcade]660-the pavement of its arcade used to make , [I]0-i assure [you]361-ma’am . [People like [you]361-ma’am]662-people like you , [ma’am]361-ma’am , accustomed from infancy to lie on Down feathers , have no idea how hard a paving - stone is , without trying it . No , no , it ’s of no use [my]0-i talking to [you]361-ma’am about tumblers . [I]0-i should speak of [foreign dancers]664-foreign dancers , and [the West End of [London]8-london]665-the west end of london , and May Fair , and [lords]634-lords and [ladies]667-ladies and [honourables]668-honourables . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i trust , [sir]2771-sir , ’ rejoined [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , with decent resignation , ‘[0-i] it is not necessary that [you]2771-sir should do anything of that kind . [I]0-i hope [I]0-i have learnt how to accommodate [myself]0-i to the changes of life . If [I]0-i have acquired an interest in hearing of [your]2771-sir instructive experiences , and can scarcely hear enough of them , [I]0-i claim no merit for that , since [I]0-i believe it is a general sentiment . ’ ‘[0-i] Well , [ma’am]361-ma’am , ’ said [[her]126-mrs. sparsit patron]597-her patron , ‘[0-i] perhaps [some people]671-some people may be pleased to say that [they]671-some people do like to hear , in [his]671-some people own unpolished way , what [Josiah Bounderby]97-bounderby , of [Coketown]4-coketown , has gone through . But [you]2771-sir must confess that [you]2771-sir were born in the lap of luxury , [yourself]2771-sir . Come , [ma’am]361-ma’am , [you]2771-sir know [you]2771-sir were born in the lap of luxury . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i do not , [sir]2771-sir , ’ returned [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit with a shake of [her]126-mrs. sparsit head , ‘[0-i] deny it . ’ [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby was obliged to get up from table , and stand with [his]93-mr. bounderby back to the fire , looking at [her]126-mrs. sparsit ; [she]126-mrs. sparsit was such an enhancement of [his]93-mr. bounderby position . ‘[0-i] And [you]2771-sir were in [crack society]674-crack society . [Devilish high society]675-devilish high society , ’ [he]93-mr. bounderby said , warming [his]93-mr. bounderby legs . ‘[2771-sir] It is true , [sir]2771-sir , ’ returned [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , with an affectation of humility the very opposite of [his]93-mr. bounderby , and therefore in no danger of jostling it . ‘[2771-sir] [You]2771-sir were in the tiptop fashion , and all the rest of it , ’ said [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby . ‘[2771-sir] Yes , [sir]2771-sir , ’ returned [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , with a kind of social widowhood upon [her]126-mrs. sparsit . ‘[2771-sir] It is unquestionably true . ’ [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , bending [himself]93-mr. bounderby at the knees , literally embraced [his]93-mr. bounderby legs in [his]93-mr. bounderby great satisfaction and laughed aloud . [Mr.]3158-mr. and [Miss Gradgrind]132-miss gradgrind being then announced , [he]93-mr. bounderby received [the former]3159-the former with a shake of the hand , and [the latter]3160-the latter with a kiss . ‘[2771-sir] Can [Jupe]76-sissy be sent [here]366-here , [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ? ’ asked [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom . Certainly . [So Jupe]3161-so jupe was sent [there]425-there . On coming in , [she]76-sissy curtseyed to [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , and to [[his]93-mr. bounderby friend]2921-his friend [Tom Gradgrind]71-tom , and also to [Louisa]92-louisa ; but in [her]76-sissy confusion unluckily omitted [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit . Observing this , [the blustrous Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby had the following remarks to make : ‘[76-sissy] Now , [I]0-i tell [you]679-you what , [[my]0-i girl]680-my girl . The name of [that lady by the teapot]681-that lady by the teapot , is [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit . [That lady]3135-that lady acts as [mistress of [this house]684-this house]683-mistress of this house , and [she]3135-that lady is [a highly connected lady]685-a highly connected lady . Consequently , if ever [you]679-you come again into [any room in [this house]684-this house]686-any room in this house , [you]679-you will make a short stay in [it]684-this house if [you]679-you do n’t behave towards [that lady]3135-that lady in [your]679-you most respectful manner . Now , [I]0-i do n’t care a button what [you]679-you do to [me]0-i , because [I]0-i do n’t affect to be [anybody]2887-anybody . So far from having high connections [I]0-i have no connections at all , and [I]0-i come of the scum of [the earth]690-the earth . But towards [that lady]3135-that lady , [I]0-i do care what [you]679-you do ; and [you]679-you shall do what is deferential and respectful , or [you]679-you shall not come here . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i hope , [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , in a conciliatory voice , ‘[0-i] that this was merely an oversight . ’ ‘[508-my friend] [[My]0-i friend]508-my friend [Tom Gradgrind]71-tom suggests , [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , ’ said [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , ‘[126-mrs. sparsit] that this was merely an oversight . Very likely . However , as [you]679-you are aware , [ma’am]361-ma’am , [I]0-i do n’t allow of even oversights towards [you]679-you . ’ ‘[0-i] [You]0-i are very good indeed , [sir]2771-sir , ’ returned [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , shaking [her]126-mrs. sparsit head with [her]126-mrs. sparsit State humility . ‘[2771-sir] It is not worth speaking of . ’ [Sissy]76-sissy , who all this time had been faintly excusing [herself]76-sissy with tears in [her]76-sissy eyes , was now waved over by [the master of [the house]2918-the house]3164-the master of the house to [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom . [She]76-sissy stood looking intently at [him]71-tom , and [Louisa]92-louisa stood coldly by , with [her]92-louisa eyes upon the ground , while [he]0-i proceeded thus : ‘[76-sissy] [Jupe]76-sissy , [I]0-i have made up [my]0-i mind to take [you]679-you into [[my]0-i house]695-my house ; and , when [you]679-you are not in attendance at [the school]313-the school , to employ [you]679-you about [Mrs. Gradgrind]95-mrs. gradgrind , who is rather [an invalid]697-an invalid . [I]0-i have explained to [Miss Louisa]92-louisa — this is [Miss Louisa]92-louisa — the miserable but natural end of [your]679-you late career ; and [you]679-you are to expressly understand that the whole of that subject is past , and is not to be referred to any more . From this time [you]679-you begin [your]679-you history . [You]679-you are , at present , ignorant , [I]0-i know . ’ ‘[2771-sir] Yes , [sir]2771-sir , very , ’ [she]679-you answered , curtseying . ‘[2771-sir] [I]0-i shall have the satisfaction of causing [you]679-you to be strictly educated ; and [you]679-you will be a living proof to all who come into communication with [you]679-you , of the advantages of the training [you]679-you will receive . [You]679-you will be reclaimed and formed . [You]679-you have been in the habit now of reading to [[your]679-you father]2783-your father , and [those people [I]0-i found [you]679-you among]700-those people i found you among , [I]0-i dare say ? ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , beckoning [her]679-you nearer to [him]71-tom before [he]71-tom said so , and dropping [his]71-tom voice . ‘[0-i] Only to [father]2781-father and [Merrylegs]106-merrylegs , [sir]2771-sir . At least [I]0-i mean to [father]2781-father , when [Merrylegs]106-merrylegs was always there . ’ ‘[106-merrylegs] Never mind [Merrylegs]106-merrylegs , [Jupe]76-sissy , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , with a passing frown . ‘[76-sissy] [I]0-i do n’t ask about [him]2783-your father . [I]0-i understand [you]679-you to have been in the habit of reading to [[your]679-you father]2783-your father ? ’ ‘[679-you] O , yes , [sir]2771-sir , thousands of times . [They]706-they were the happiest — O , of all the happy times [we]707-we had together , [sir]2771-sir ! ’ It was only now when [her]679-you sorrow broke out , that [Louisa]92-louisa looked at [her]679-you . ‘[706-they] And what , ’ asked [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , in a still lower voice , ‘[679-you] did [you]679-you read to [[your]679-you father]2783-your father , [Jupe]76-sissy ? ’ ‘[679-you] About [the Fairies]133-the fairies , [sir]2771-sir , and [the Dwarf]711-the dwarf , and [the Hunchback]134-the hunchback , and [the Genies]135-the genies , ’ [she]92-louisa sobbed out ; ‘[679-you] and about — ’ ‘[679-you] Hush ! ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , ‘[679-you] that is enough . Never breathe a word of such destructive nonsense any more . [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , this is a case for rigid training , and [I]0-i shall observe it with interest . ’ ‘[93-mr. bounderby] Well , ’ returned [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , ‘[93-mr. bounderby] [I]0-i have given [you]679-you [my]0-i opinion already , and [I]0-i should n’t do as [you]679-you do . But , very well , very well . Since [you]679-you are bent upon it , very well ! ’ So , [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom and [[his]71-tom daughter]2865-his daughter took [Cecilia Jupe]76-sissy off with [them]3167-them to [Stone Lodge]3-stone lodge , and on the way [Louisa]92-louisa never spoke one word , good or bad . And [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby went about [his]93-mr. bounderby daily pursuits . And [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit got behind [her]126-mrs. sparsit eyebrows and meditated in the gloom of [that retreat]3168-that retreat , all the evening . Let [us]3169-us strike the key - note again , before pursuing the tune . When [she]92-louisa was half a dozen years younger , [Louisa]92-louisa had been overheard to begin a conversation with [[her]92-louisa brother]2932-her brother one day , by saying ‘[71-tom] [Tom]71-tom , [I]0-i wonder ’ — upon which [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , who was [the person overhearing]3171-the person overhearing , stepped forth into the light and said , ‘[92-louisa] [Louisa]92-louisa , never wonder ! ’ Herein lay the spring of the mechanical art and mystery of educating the reason without stooping to the cultivation of the sentiments and affections . Never wonder . By means of addition , subtraction , multiplication , and division , settle everything somehow , and never wonder . Bring to [me]0-i , says [M’Choakumchild]80-m’choakumchild , [yonder baby just able to walk]3172-yonder baby just able to walk , and [I]0-i will engage that it shall never wonder . Now , besides [very many babies just able to walk]3173-very many babies just able to walk , there happened to be in [Coketown]4-coketown a considerable population of [babies who had been walking against time towards the infinite world , twenty , thirty , forty , fifty years and more]3174-babies who had been walking against time towards the infinite world , twenty , thirty , forty , fifty years and more . [These portentous infants]3175-these portentous infants being [alarming creatures to stalk about in any human society]3176-alarming creatures to stalk about in any human society , [the eighteen denominations]3177-the eighteen denominations incessantly scratched [one another]551-one another ’s faces and pulled [one another]551-one another ’s hair by way of agreeing on the steps to be taken for [their]3177-the eighteen denominations improvement — which [they]3177-the eighteen denominations never did ; a surprising circumstance , when the happy adaptation of the means to the end is considered . Still , although [they]3177-the eighteen denominations differed in every other particular , conceivable and inconceivable ( especially inconceivable ) , [they]3177-the eighteen denominations were pretty well united on the point that [these unlucky infants]3180-these unlucky infants were never to wonder . [Body number one]3181-body number one , said [they]3181-body number one must take everything on trust . [Body number two]3182-body number two , said [they]3181-body number one must take everything on political economy . [Body number three]3183-body number three , wrote leaden little books for [them]3177-the eighteen denominations , showing how [the good grown - up baby]3184-the good grown - up baby invariably got to [the Savings - bank]3185-the savings - bank , and [the bad grown - up baby]3186-the bad grown - up baby invariably got transported . [Body number four]3187-body number four , under dreary pretences of being droll ( when it was very melancholy indeed ) , made the shallowest pretences of concealing pitfalls of knowledge , into which it was the duty of [these babies]3188-these babies to be smuggled and inveigled . But , [all the bodies]3189-all the bodies agreed that [they]3177-the eighteen denominations were never to wonder . There was [a library in [Coketown]4-coketown]3190-a library in coketown , to which general access was easy . [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom greatly tormented [his]71-tom mind about what [the people]2827-the people read in [this library]3192-this library : a point whereon little rivers of tabular statements periodically flowed into the howling ocean of tabular statements , which [no diver]3193-no diver ever got to any depth in and came up sane . It was a disheartening circumstance , but a melancholy fact , that even [these readers]3194-these readers persisted in wondering . [They]2848-children wondered about human nature , human passions , human hopes and fears , the struggles , triumphs and defeats , the cares and joys and sorrows , the lives and deaths of [common men]3195-common men and [women]3196-women ! [They]2848-children sometimes , after fifteen hours ’[0-i] work , sat down to read mere fables about [men]545-men and [women]3196-women , more or less like [themselves]714-themselves , and about [children]2848-children , more or less like [their]2848-children own . [They]2848-children took [De Foe]136-de foe to [their]2848-children bosoms , instead of [Euclid]137-euclid , and seemed to be on the whole more comforted by [Goldsmith]138-goldsmith than by [Cocker]139-cocker . [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom was for ever working , in print and out of print , at this eccentric sum , and [he]71-tom never could make out how it yielded this unaccountable product . ‘ [I]71-tom am sick of [my]71-tom life , [Loo]101-loo . [I]71-tom , hate it altogether , and [I]71-tom hate [everybody]404-everybody except [you]101-loo , ’[71-tom] said the unnatural young [Thomas Gradgrind]71-tom in the hair - cutting chamber at twilight . ‘ [You]71-tom do n’t hate [Sissy]76-sissy , [Tom]71-tom ? ’[71-tom] ‘ [I]71-tom hate to be obliged to call [her]76-sissy [Jupe]76-sissy . And [she]76-sissy hates [me]71-tom , ’[71-tom] said [Tom]71-tom , moodily . ‘ No , [she]76-sissy does not , [Tom]71-tom , [I]71-tom am sure ! ’[71-tom] ‘ [She]76-sissy must , ’[71-tom] said [Tom]71-tom . ‘ [She]76-sissy must just hate and detest the whole set - out of [us]3198-us . [They]3199-they ’ll bother [her]76-sissy head off , [I]71-tom think , before [they]3199-they have done with [her]76-sissy . Already [she]76-sissy ’s getting as pale as wax , and as heavy as — [I]71-tom am . ’[71-tom] [Young Thomas]71-tom expressed these sentiments sitting astride of a chair before the fire , with [his]71-tom arms on the back , and [his]71-tom sulky face on [his]71-tom arms . [[His]71-tom sister]716-his sister sat in the darker corner by the fireside , now looking at [him]71-tom , now looking at the bright sparks as they dropped upon the hearth . ‘ As to [me]71-tom , ’[71-tom] said [Tom]71-tom , tumbling [his]71-tom hair all manner of ways with [his]71-tom sulky hands , ‘ [I]71-tom am [a Donkey]3200-a donkey , that ’s what [I]71-tom am . [I]71-tom am as obstinate as one , [I]71-tom am more stupid than one , [I]71-tom get as much pleasure as one , and [I]71-tom should like to kick like one . ’[71-tom] ‘ Not [me]71-tom , [I]71-tom hope , [Tom]71-tom ? ’[71-tom] ‘ No , [Loo]101-loo ; [I]71-tom would n’t hurt [you]101-loo . [I]71-tom made an exception of [you]101-loo at first . [I]71-tom do n’t know what this — [jolly old — Jaundiced Jail]3201-jolly old — jaundiced jail , ’[71-tom] [Tom]71-tom had paused to find a sufficiently complimentary and expressive name for [the parental roof]717-the parental roof , and seemed to relieve [his]71-tom mind for a moment by the strong alliteration of this one , ‘ would be without [you]101-loo . ’[71-tom] ‘ Indeed , [Tom]71-tom ? Do [you]71-tom really and truly say so ? ’[71-tom] ‘ Why , of course [I]71-tom do . What ’s the use of talking about it ! ’[71-tom] returned [Tom]71-tom , chafing [his]71-tom face on [his]71-tom coat - sleeve , as if to mortify [his]71-tom flesh , and have it in unison with [his]71-tom spirit . ‘ Because , [Tom]71-tom , ’[716-his sister] said [[his]71-tom sister]716-his sister , after silently watching the sparks awhile , ‘ as [I]716-his sister get older , and nearer growing up , [I]716-his sister often sit wondering here , and think how unfortunate it is for [me]716-his sister that [I]716-his sister ca n’t reconcile [you]101-loo to [home]2856-home better than [I]716-his sister am able to do . [I]716-his sister do n’t know what [other girls]3203-other girls know . [I]716-his sister ca n’t play to [you]101-loo , or sing to [you]101-loo . [I]716-his sister ca n’t talk to [you]101-loo so as to lighten [your]101-loo mind , for [I]716-his sister never see any amusing sights or read any amusing books that it would be a pleasure or a relief to [you]101-loo to talk about , when [you]101-loo are tired . ’[716-his sister] ‘ Well , no more do [I.]0-i [I]720-a prig am as bad as [you]101-loo in that respect ; and [I]720-a prig am [a Mule]3204-a mule too , which [you]101-loo ’re[720-a prig] not . If [father]2781-father was determined to make [me]0-i either [a Prig]720-a prig or [a Mule]3204-a mule , and [I]0-i am not [a Prig]720-a prig , why , it stands to reason , [I]0-i must be [a Mule]3204-a mule . And so [I]0-i am , ’ said [Tom]71-tom , desperately . ‘[0-i] It ’s a great pity , ’ said [Louisa]92-louisa , after another pause , and speaking thoughtfully out of [her]92-louisa dark corner : ‘[71-tom] it ’s a great pity , [Tom]71-tom . It ’s very unfortunate for both of [us]724-us . ’ ‘[725-you] Oh ! [You]725-you , ’ said [Tom]71-tom ; ‘[725-you] [you]725-you are [a girl]726-a girl , [Loo]101-loo , and [a girl]726-a girl comes out of it better than [a boy]728-a boy does . [I]0-i do n’t miss anything in [you]725-you . [You]725-you are the only pleasure [I]0-i have — [you]725-you can brighten even [this place]729-this place — and [you]725-you can always lead [me]0-i as [you]725-you like . ’ ‘[725-you] [You]71-tom are [a dear brother]730-a dear brother , [Tom]71-tom ; and while [you]71-tom think [I]0-i can do such things , [I]0-i do n’t so much mind knowing better . Though [I]0-i do know better , [Tom]71-tom , and am very sorry for it . ’ [She]3205-she came and kissed [him]71-tom , and went back into [her]3205-she corner again . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could collect all the Facts [we]731-we hear so much about , ’ said [Tom]71-tom , spitefully setting [his]71-tom teeth , ‘[732-the figures] and all [the Figures]732-the figures , and all [the people who found them out]733-the people who found them out : and [I]0-i wish [I]0-i could put a thousand barrels of gunpowder under [them]734-them , and blow them all up together ! However , when [I]0-i go to live with [old Bounderby]101-loo , [I]0-i ’ll have [my]0-i revenge . ’ ‘[0-i] [Your]0-i revenge , [Tom]71-tom ? ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i mean , [I]0-i ’ll enjoy [myself]0-i a little , and go about and see something , and hear something . [I]0-i ’ll recompense [myself]0-i for the way in which [I]0-i have been brought up . ’ ‘[0-i] But do n’t disappoint [yourself]71-tom beforehand , [Tom]71-tom . [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby thinks as [father]2781-father thinks , and is a great deal rougher , and not half so kind . ’ ‘[93-mr. bounderby] Oh ! ’ said [Tom]71-tom , laughing ; ‘[93-mr. bounderby] [I]0-i do n’t mind that . [I]0-i shall very well know how to manage and smooth [old Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ! ’ [Their]3206-their shadows were defined upon the wall , but those of the high presses in [the room]2901-the room were all blended together on the wall and on the ceiling , as if [the brother and sister]3208-the brother and sister were overhung by [a dark cavern]3209-a dark cavern . Or , a fanciful imagination — if such treason could have been there — might have made it out to be the shadow of [[their]3206-their subject]3210-their subject , and of its lowering association with [their]3206-their future . ‘[93-mr. bounderby] What is [your]71-tom great mode of smoothing and managing , [Tom]71-tom ? Is it a secret ? ’ ‘[93-mr. bounderby] Oh ! ’ said [Tom]71-tom , ‘[93-mr. bounderby] if it is a secret , it ’s not far off . It ’s [you]71-tom . [You]71-tom are [[his]93-mr. bounderby little pet]736-his little pet , [you]71-tom are [[his]93-mr. bounderby favourite]737-his favourite ; [he]93-mr. bounderby ’ll do anything for [you]71-tom . When [he]93-mr. bounderby says to [me]0-i what [I]0-i do n’t like , [I]0-i shall say to [him]93-mr. bounderby , “ [[My]0-i sister]738-my sister [Loo]101-loo will be hurt and disappointed , [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby . [She]738-my sister always used to tell [me]0-i [she]738-my sister was sure [you]93-mr. bounderby would be easier with [me]0-i than this . ” That ’ll bring [him]93-mr. bounderby about , or nothing will . ’ After waiting for some answering remark , and getting none , [Tom]71-tom wearily relapsed into the present time , and twined [himself]71-tom yawning round and about the rails of [his]71-tom chair , and rumpled [his]71-tom head more and more , until [he]71-tom suddenly looked up , and asked : ‘[738-my sister] Have [you]101-loo gone to sleep , [Loo]101-loo ? ’ ‘[101-loo] No , [Tom]71-tom . [I]0-i am looking at the fire . ’ ‘[0-i] [You]101-loo seem to find more to look at in it than ever [I]0-i could find , ’ said [Tom]71-tom . ‘[101-loo] Another of the advantages , [I]0-i suppose , of being [a girl]726-a girl . ’ ‘[71-tom] [Tom]71-tom , ’ enquired [[his]71-tom sister]716-his sister , slowly , and in a curious tone , as if [she]716-his sister were reading what [she]716-his sister asked in the fire , and it was not quite plainly written there , ‘[71-tom] do [you]71-tom look forward with any satisfaction to this change to [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ’s ? ’ ‘[71-tom] Why , there ’s one thing to be said of it , ’ returned [Tom]71-tom , pushing [his]71-tom chair from [him]71-tom , and standing up ; ‘[101-loo] it will be getting away from [home]2856-home . ’ ‘[101-loo] There is one thing to be said of it , ’ [Louisa]92-louisa repeated in [her]92-louisa former curious tone ; ‘[101-loo] it will be getting away from [home]2856-home . Yes . ’ ‘[101-loo] Not but what [I]0-i shall be very unwilling , both to leave [you]101-loo , [Loo]101-loo , and to leave [you]101-loo [here]366-here . But [I]0-i must go , [you]101-loo know , whether [I]0-i like it or not ; and [I]0-i had better go where [I]0-i can take with [me]0-i some advantage of [your]101-loo influence , than where [I]0-i should lose it altogether . Do n’t [you]101-loo see ? ’ ‘[71-tom] Yes , [Tom]71-tom . ’ The answer was so long in coming , though there was no indecision in it , that [Tom]71-tom went and leaned on the back of [her]101-loo chair , to contemplate the fire which so engrossed [her]101-loo , from [her]101-loo point of view , and see what [he]71-tom could make of it . ‘[71-tom] Except that it is a fire , ’ said [Tom]71-tom , ‘[101-loo] it looks to [me]0-i as stupid and blank as everything else looks . What do [you]101-loo see in it ? Not a circus ? ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t see anything in it , [Tom]71-tom , particularly . But since [I]0-i have been looking at it , [I]0-i have been wondering about [you]101-loo and [me]0-i , grown up . ’ ‘[0-i] Wondering again ! ’ said [Tom]71-tom . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i have such unmanageable thoughts , ’ returned [[his]71-tom sister]716-his sister , ‘[0-i] that [they]743-they will wonder . ’ ‘[743-they] Then [I]0-i beg of [you]101-loo , [Louisa]92-louisa , ’ said [Mrs. Gradgrind]95-mrs. gradgrind , who had opened the door without being heard , ‘[0-i] to do nothing of that description , for goodness ’ sake , [[you]101-loo inconsiderate girl]3213-you inconsiderate girl , or [I]92-louisa shall never hear the last of it from [[your]101-loo father]2783-your father . And , [Thomas]71-tom , it is really shameful , with [my]92-louisa poor head continually wearing [me]92-louisa out , that [a boy brought up as [you]101-loo have been]3215-a boy brought up as you have been , and whose education has cost what [yours]101-loo has , should be found encouraging [[his]3215-a boy brought up as you have been sister]716-his sister to wonder , when [he]3215-a boy brought up as you have been knows [[his]3215-a boy brought up as you have been father]3044-his father has expressly said that [she]716-his sister is not to do it . ’[92-louisa] [Louisa]92-louisa denied [Tom]71-tom ’s participation in the offence ; but [[her]92-louisa mother]744-her mother stopped [her]92-louisa with the conclusive answer , ‘ [Louisa]92-louisa , do n’t tell [me]92-louisa , in [my]92-louisa state of health ; for unless [you]92-louisa had been encouraged , it is morally and physically impossible that [you]92-louisa could have done it . ’[92-louisa] ‘ [I]744-her mother was encouraged by nothing , [mother]3218-mother , but by looking at the red sparks dropping out of the fire , and whitening and dying . It made [me]744-her mother think , after all , how short [my]744-her mother life would be , and how little [I]744-her mother could hope to do in it . ’[744-her mother] ‘ Nonsense ! ’[95-mrs. gradgrind] said [Mrs. Gradgrind]95-mrs. gradgrind , rendered almost energetic . ‘ Nonsense ! Do n’t stand there and tell [me]95-mrs. gradgrind such stuff , [Louisa]92-louisa , to [my]95-mrs. gradgrind face , when [you]92-louisa know very well that if it was ever to reach [[your]92-louisa father]2783-your father ’s ears [I]95-mrs. gradgrind should never hear the last of it . After all the trouble that has been taken with [you]92-louisa ! After the lectures [you]92-louisa have attended , and the experiments [you]92-louisa have seen ! After [I]95-mrs. gradgrind have heard [you]92-louisa [myself]95-mrs. gradgrind , when the whole of [my]95-mrs. gradgrind right side has been benumbed , going on with [[your]92-louisa master]3220-your master about combustion , and calcination , and calorification , and [I]95-mrs. gradgrind may say every kind of ation that could drive [a poor invalid]3221-a poor invalid distracted , to hear [you]92-louisa talking in this absurd way about sparks and ashes ! [I]95-mrs. gradgrind wish , ’[95-mrs. gradgrind] whimpered [Mrs. Gradgrind]95-mrs. gradgrind , taking a chair , and discharging [her]95-mrs. gradgrind strongest point before succumbing under these mere shadows of facts , ‘ yes , [I]95-mrs. gradgrind really do wish that [I]95-mrs. gradgrind had never had [a family]3222-a family , and then [you]92-louisa would have known what it was to do without [me]95-mrs. gradgrind ! ’[95-mrs. gradgrind] [Sissy Jupe]76-sissy had not an easy time of it , between [Mr. M’Choakumchild]78-mr. m’choakumchild and [Mrs. Gradgrind]95-mrs. gradgrind , and was not without strong impulses , in the first months of [her]76-sissy probation , to run away . It hailed facts all day long so very hard , and life in general was opened to [her]76-sissy as such a closely ruled ciphering - book , that assuredly [she]76-sissy would have run away , but for only one restraint . It is lamentable to think of ; but this restraint was the result of no arithmetical process , was self - imposed in defiance of all calculation , and went dead against any table of probabilities that [any Actuary]745-any actuary would have drawn up from [the premises]746-the premises . [The girl]262-the girl believed that [[her]262-the girl father]2855-her father had not deserted [her]262-the girl ; [she]262-the girl lived in the hope that [he]2855-her father would come back , and in the faith that [he]2855-her father would be made the happier by [her]262-the girl remaining where [she]262-the girl was . The wretched ignorance with which [Jupe]76-sissy clung to this consolation , rejecting the superior comfort of knowing , on a sound arithmetical basis , that [[her]76-sissy father]2855-her father was [an unnatural vagabond]750-an unnatural vagabond , filled [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom with pity . Yet , what was to be done ? [M’Choakumchild]78-mr. m’choakumchild reported that [she]76-sissy had a very dense head for figures ; that , once possessed with a general idea of the globe , [she]76-sissy took the smallest conceivable interest in its exact measurements ; that [she]76-sissy was extremely slow in the acquisition of dates , unless some pitiful incident happened to be connected therewith ; that [she]76-sissy would burst into tears on being required ( by the mental process ) immediately to name the cost of two hundred and forty - seven muslin caps at fourteen - pence halfpenny ; that [she]76-sissy was as low down , in [the school]313-the school , as low could be ; that after eight weeks of induction into the elements of [Political Economy]18-political economy , [she]76-sissy had only yesterday been set right by [a prattler three feet high]752-a prattler three feet high , for returning to the question , ‘ What is the first principle of this science ? ’[71-tom] the absurd answer , ‘ To do unto [others]3223-others as [I]71-tom would that [they]3223-others should do unto [me]71-tom . ’[71-tom] [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom observed , shaking [his]71-tom head , that all this was very bad ; that it showed the necessity of infinite grinding at the mill of knowledge , as per system , schedule , blue book , report , and tabular statements A to Z ; and that [Jupe]76-sissy ‘ must be kept to it . ’[76-sissy] So [Jupe]76-sissy was kept to it , and became low - spirited , but no wiser . ‘ It would be a fine thing to be [you]92-louisa , [Miss Louisa]92-louisa ! ’[76-sissy] [she]76-sissy said , one night , when [Louisa]92-louisa had endeavoured to make [her]92-louisa perplexities for next day something clearer to [her]92-louisa . ‘ Do [you]92-louisa think so ? ’[76-sissy] ‘ [I]76-sissy should know so much , [Miss Louisa]92-louisa . All that is difficult to [me]76-sissy now , would be so easy then . ’[76-sissy] ‘ [You]76-sissy might not be the better for it , [Sissy]76-sissy . ’[76-sissy] [Sissy]76-sissy submitted , after a little hesitation , ‘ [I]76-sissy should not be the worse , [Miss Louisa]92-louisa . ’[76-sissy] To which [Miss Louisa]92-louisa answered , ‘ [I]92-louisa do n’t know that . ’[92-louisa] There had been so little communication between [these two]753-these two — both because life at [Stone Lodge]3-stone lodge went monotonously round like a piece of machinery which discouraged human interference , and because of the prohibition relative to [Sissy]76-sissy ’s past career — that [they]753-these two were still [almost strangers]754-almost strangers . [Sissy]76-sissy , with [her]76-sissy dark eyes wonderingly directed to [Louisa]92-louisa ’s face , was uncertain whether to say more or to remain silent . ‘ [You]92-louisa are more useful to [[my]92-louisa mother]367-my mother , and more pleasant with [her]367-my mother than [I]92-louisa can ever be , ’[92-louisa] [Louisa]92-louisa resumed . ‘ [You]92-louisa are pleasanter to [yourself]92-louisa , than [I]92-louisa am to [myself]92-louisa . ’[92-louisa] ‘ But , if [you]92-louisa please , [Miss Louisa]92-louisa , ’[76-sissy] [Sissy]76-sissy pleaded , ‘ [I]92-louisa am — O so stupid ! ’[92-louisa] [Louisa]92-louisa , with a brighter laugh than usual , told [her]92-louisa [she]92-louisa would be wiser by - and - by . ‘ [You]92-louisa do n’t know , ’[76-sissy] said [Sissy]76-sissy , half crying , ‘ what [a stupid girl]3225-a stupid girl [I]76-sissy am . All through school hours [I]76-sissy make mistakes . [Mr.]3226-mr. and [Mrs. M’Choakumchild]141-mrs. m’choakumchild call [me]76-sissy up , over and over again , regularly to make mistakes . [I]76-sissy ca n’t help [them]3227-they . [They]3227-they seem to come natural to [me]76-sissy . ’[76-sissy] ‘ [Mr.]3228-mr. and [Mrs. M’Choakumchild]141-mrs. m’choakumchild never make any mistakes [themselves]3227-they , [I]92-louisa suppose , [Sissy]76-sissy ? ’[92-louisa] ‘ O no ! ’[92-louisa] [she]92-louisa eagerly returned . ‘ [They]3227-they know everything . ’[92-louisa] ‘ Tell [me]92-louisa some of [your]92-louisa mistakes . ’[92-louisa] ‘ [I]76-sissy am almost ashamed , ’[76-sissy] said [Sissy]76-sissy , with reluctance . ‘ But to - day , for instance , [Mr. M’Choakumchild]78-mr. m’choakumchild was explaining to [us]3229-us about Natural Prosperity . ’[76-sissy] ‘ National , [I]92-louisa think it must have been , ’[92-louisa] observed [Louisa]92-louisa . ‘ Yes , it was . — But is n’t it the same ? ’[92-louisa] [she]92-louisa timidly asked . ‘ [You]92-louisa had better say , National , as [he]78-mr. m’choakumchild said so , ’[92-louisa] returned [Louisa]92-louisa , with [her]92-louisa dry reserve . ‘ National Prosperity . And [he]78-mr. m’choakumchild said , Now , [this schoolroom]3230-this schoolroom is [a Nation]3231-a nation . And in [this nation]3232-this nation , there are fifty millions of money . Is n’t this [a prosperous nation]3233-a prosperous nation ? [Girl]142-girl number twenty , is n’t [this]3234-this [a prosperous nation]3233-a prosperous nation , and a’n’t [you]92-louisa in [a thriving state]3236-a thriving state ? ’[92-louisa] ‘ What did [you]92-louisa say ? ’[92-louisa] asked [Louisa]92-louisa . ‘ [Miss Louisa]92-louisa , [I]76-sissy said [I]76-sissy did n’t know . [I]76-sissy thought [I]76-sissy could n’t know whether it was [a prosperous nation]3233-a prosperous nation or not , and whether [I]76-sissy was in [a thriving state]3236-a thriving state or not , unless [I]76-sissy knew who had got the money , and whether any of it was [mine]76-sissy . But that had nothing to do with it . It was not in the figures at all , ’[76-sissy] said [Sissy]76-sissy , wiping [her]76-sissy eyes . ‘ That was a great mistake of [yours]92-louisa , ’[92-louisa] observed [Louisa]92-louisa . ‘ Yes , [Miss Louisa]92-louisa , [I]92-louisa know it was , now . Then [Mr. M’Choakumchild]78-mr. m’choakumchild said [he]78-mr. m’choakumchild would try [me]92-louisa again . And [he]78-mr. m’choakumchild said , [This schoolroom]3230-this schoolroom is [an immense town]3240-an immense town , and in [it]3230-this schoolroom there are [a million of inhabitants]3241-a million of inhabitants , and only five - and - twenty are starved to death in [the streets]2975-the streets , in the course of a year . What is [your]92-louisa remark on that proportion ? And [my]92-louisa remark was — for [I]92-louisa could n’t think of a better one — that [I]92-louisa thought it must be just as hard upon [those who were starved , whether the others]3243-those who were starved , whether the others were [a million , or a million million]3244-a million , or a million million . And that was wrong , too . ’[92-louisa] ‘ Of course it was . ’[92-louisa] ‘ Then [Mr. M’Choakumchild]78-mr. m’choakumchild said [he]78-mr. m’choakumchild would try [me]92-louisa once more . And [he]78-mr. m’choakumchild said , Here are the stutterings — ’[92-louisa] ‘ Statistics , ’[92-louisa] said [Louisa]92-louisa . ‘ Yes , [Miss Louisa]92-louisa — [they]3245-they always remind [me]92-louisa of stutterings , and that ’s another of [my]92-louisa mistakes — of accidents upon [the sea]3246-the sea . And [I]92-louisa find ( [Mr. M’Choakumchild]78-mr. m’choakumchild said ) that in a given time [a hundred thousand persons]3247-a hundred thousand persons went to [sea]3248-sea on long voyages , and only five hundred of [them]3247-a hundred thousand persons were drowned or burnt to death . What is the percentage ? And [I]92-louisa said , [Miss]3249-miss ; ’[92-louisa] here [Sissy]76-sissy fairly sobbed as confessing with extreme contrition to [her]76-sissy greatest error ; ‘ [I]76-sissy said it was nothing . ’[76-sissy] ‘ Nothing , [Sissy]76-sissy ? ’[92-louisa] ‘ Nothing , [Miss]3250-miss — to the relations and friends of [the people who were killed]3251-the people who were killed . [I]76-sissy shall never learn , ’[76-sissy] said [Sissy]76-sissy . ‘ And the worst of all is , that although [[my]76-sissy poor father]3252-my poor father wished [me]76-sissy so much to learn , and although [I]76-sissy am so anxious to learn , because [he]3252-my poor father wished [me]76-sissy to , [I]76-sissy am afraid [I]76-sissy do n’t like it . ’[76-sissy] [Louisa]92-louisa stood looking at the pretty modest head , as it drooped abashed before [her]92-louisa , until it was raised again to glance at [her]92-louisa face . Then [she]92-louisa asked : ‘ Did [[your]92-louisa father]2783-your father know so much [himself]3252-my poor father , that [he]3252-my poor father wished [you]92-louisa to be well taught too , [Sissy]76-sissy ? ’[92-louisa] [Sissy]76-sissy hesitated before replying , and so plainly showed [her]76-sissy sense that [they]755-they were entering on [forbidden ground]756-forbidden ground , that [Louisa]92-louisa added , ‘ [No one]3086-no one hears [us]755-they ; and if [any one]495-any one did , [I]92-louisa am sure no harm could be found in such an innocent question . ’[92-louisa] ‘ No , [Miss Louisa]92-louisa , ’[76-sissy] answered [Sissy]76-sissy , upon this encouragement , shaking [her]76-sissy head ; ‘ [father]2781-father knows very little indeed . It ’s as much as [he]2781-father can do to write ; and it ’s more than [people in general]3257-people in general can do to read [his]2781-father writing . Though it ’s plain to [me]76-sissy . ’[76-sissy] ‘ [[Your]92-louisa mother]3258-your mother ? ’[92-louisa] ‘ [Father]108-father says [she]3258-your mother was quite [a scholar]3259-a scholar . [She]3258-your mother died when [I]76-sissy was born . [She]3258-your mother was ; ’[76-sissy] [Sissy]76-sissy made the terrible communication nervously ; ‘ [she]3258-your mother was [a dancer]3260-a dancer . ’[76-sissy] ‘ Did [[your]92-louisa father]2783-your father love [her]3258-your mother ? ’[92-louisa] [Louisa]92-louisa asked these questions with a strong , wild , wandering interest peculiar to [her]92-louisa ; an interest gone astray like a banished creature , and hiding in solitary places . ‘ O yes ! As dearly as [he]2783-your father loves [me]92-louisa . [Father]108-father loved [me]92-louisa , first , for [her]3258-your mother sake . [He]2783-your father carried [me]92-louisa about with [him]2783-your father when [I]92-louisa was quite [a baby]3262-a baby . [We]3263-we have never been asunder from that time . ’[92-louisa] ‘ Yet [he]2783-your father leaves [you]92-louisa now , [Sissy]76-sissy ? ’[92-louisa] ‘ Only for [my]92-louisa good . [Nobody]365-nobody understands [him]2783-your father as [I]92-louisa do ; [nobody]365-nobody knows [him]2783-your father as [I]92-louisa do . When [he]2783-your father left [me]92-louisa for [my]92-louisa good — [he]2783-your father never would have left [me]92-louisa for [his]2783-your father own — [I]92-louisa know [he]2783-your father was almost broken - hearted with the trial . [He]2783-your father will not be happy for a single minute , till [he]2783-your father comes back . ’[92-louisa] ‘ Tell [me]92-louisa more about [him]2783-your father , ’[92-louisa] said [Louisa]92-louisa , ‘ [I]92-louisa will never ask [you]76-sissy again . Where did [you]76-sissy live ? ’[92-louisa] ‘ [We]3266-we travelled about [the country]336-the country , and had no fixed place to live in . [Father]108-father ’s a ; ’[76-sissy] [Sissy]76-sissy whispered the awful word , ‘ [a clown]3268-a clown . ’[76-sissy] ‘ To make [the people]2827-the people laugh ? ’[92-louisa] said [Louisa]92-louisa , with a nod of intelligence . ‘ Yes . But [they]2827-the people would n’t laugh sometimes , and then [father]2781-father cried . Lately , [they]2827-the people very often would n’t laugh , and [he]2783-your father used to come [home]2856-home despairing . [Father]108-father ’s not like most . Those who did n’t know [him]2783-your father as well as [I]92-louisa do , and did n’t love [him]2783-your father as dearly as [I]92-louisa do , might believe [he]2783-your father was not quite right . Sometimes [they]2827-the people played tricks upon [him]2783-your father ; but [they]2827-the people never knew how [he]2783-your father felt [them]2827-the people , and shrunk up , when [he]2783-your father was alone with [me]92-louisa . [He]2783-your father was far , far timider than [they]2827-the people thought ! ’[92-louisa] ‘ And [you]92-louisa were [his]2783-your father comfort through everything ? ’[757-i] [She]757-i nodded , with the tears rolling down [her]757-i face . ‘ [I]757-i hope so , and [father]2781-father said [I]757-i was . It was because [he]2783-your father grew so scared and trembling , and because [he]2783-your father felt [himself]2783-your father to be [a poor , weak , ignorant , helpless man]3273-a poor , weak , ignorant , helpless man ( those used to be [his]2783-your father words ) , that [he]2783-your father wanted [me]757-i so much to know a great deal , and be different from [him]2783-your father . [I]757-i used to read to [him]2783-your father to cheer [his]2783-your father courage , and [he]2783-your father was very fond of that . [They]3274-they were wrong books — [I]757-i am never to speak of them here — but [we]3275-we did n’t know there was any harm in them . ’[757-i] ‘ And [he]2783-your father liked [them]3274-they ? ’[92-louisa] said [Louisa]92-louisa , with a searching gaze on [Sissy]76-sissy all this time . ‘ O very much ! [They]3274-they kept [him]2783-your father , many times , from what did [him]2783-your father real harm . And often and often of a night , [he]2783-your father used to forget all [his]2783-your father troubles in wondering whether [the Sultan]3276-the sultan would let [the lady]3277-the lady go on with the story , or would have [her]3277-the lady head cut off before it was finished . ’[92-louisa] ‘ And [[your]76-sissy father]2783-your father was always kind ? To the last ? ’[92-louisa] asked [Louisa]92-louisa contravening the great principle , and wondering very much . ‘ Always , always ! ’[76-sissy] returned [Sissy]76-sissy , clasping [her]76-sissy hands . ‘ Kinder and kinder than [I]92-louisa can tell . [He]2783-your father was angry only one night , and that was not to [me]92-louisa , but [Merrylegs]106-merrylegs . [Merrylegs]106-merrylegs ; ’[92-louisa] [she]92-louisa whispered the awful fact ; ‘ is [his]2783-your father performing dog . ’[92-louisa] ‘ Why was [he]2783-your father angry with the dog ? ’[92-louisa] [Louisa]92-louisa demanded . ‘ [Father]108-father , soon after [they]3279-they came [home]2856-home from performing , told [Merrylegs]106-merrylegs to jump up on the backs of the two chairs and stand across [them]3279-they — which is one of [his]2783-your father tricks . [He]106-merrylegs looked at [father]2781-father , and did n’t do it at once . Everything of [father]2781-father ’s had gone wrong that night , and [he]2783-your father had n’t pleased [the public]252-the public at all . [He]2783-your father cried out that the very dog knew [he]2783-your father was failing , and had no compassion on [him]2783-your father . Then [he]2783-your father beat the dog , and [I]92-louisa was frightened , and said , “ [Father]108-father , [father]2781-father ! Pray do n’t hurt the creature who is so fond of [you]2781-father ! O Heaven forgive [you]2781-father , [father]2781-father , stop ! ” And [he]2783-your father stopped , and the dog was bloody , and [father]2781-father lay down crying on the floor with the dog in [his]2781-father arms , and the dog licked [his]2783-your father face . ’[92-louisa] [Louisa]92-louisa saw that [she]92-louisa was sobbing ; and going to [her]92-louisa , kissed [her]92-louisa , took [her]92-louisa hand , and sat down beside [her]92-louisa . ‘ Finish by telling [me]92-louisa how [[your]92-louisa father]2783-your father left [you]92-louisa , [Sissy]76-sissy . Now that [I]92-louisa have asked [you]92-louisa so much , tell [me]92-louisa the end . The blame , if there is any blame , is [mine]92-louisa , not [yours]92-louisa . ’[92-louisa] ‘ [Dear Miss Louisa]92-louisa , ’[76-sissy] said [Sissy]76-sissy , covering [her]92-louisa eyes , and sobbing yet ; ‘ [I]76-sissy came [home]2856-home from [the school]313-the school that afternoon , and found [poor father]3290-poor father just come [home]2856-home too , from [the booth]3032-the booth . And [he]3290-poor father sat rocking [himself]3290-poor father over the fire , as if [he]3290-poor father was in pain . And [I]76-sissy said , “ Have [you]3290-poor father hurt [yourself]3290-poor father , [father]2781-father ? ” ( as [he]3290-poor father did sometimes , like [they]3294-they all did ) , and [he]3290-poor father said , “ A little , [[my]76-sissy darling]3295-my darling . ” And when [I]76-sissy came to stoop down and look up at [his]3290-poor father face , [I]76-sissy saw that [he]3290-poor father was crying . The more [I]76-sissy spoke to [him]3290-poor father , the more [he]3290-poor father hid [his]3290-poor father face ; and at first [he]3290-poor father shook all over , and said nothing but “ [[My]76-sissy darling]3295-my darling ; ” and “ [My]76-sissy love ! ” ’[76-sissy] Here [Tom]71-tom came lounging in , and stared at [the two]758-the two with a coolness not particularly savouring of interest in anything but [himself]71-tom , and not much of that at present . ‘ [I]716-his sister am asking [Sissy]76-sissy a few questions , [Tom]71-tom , ’[716-his sister] observed [[his]71-tom sister]716-his sister . ‘ [You]71-tom have no occasion to go away ; but do n’t interrupt [us]758-the two for a moment , [[Tom]71-tom dear]3297-tom dear . ’[716-his sister] ‘ Oh ! very well ! ’[71-tom] returned [Tom]71-tom . ‘ [Only father]3298-only father has brought [old Bounderby]101-loo [home]2856-home , and [I]71-tom want [you]76-sissy to come into [the drawing - room]3300-the drawing - room . Because if [you]76-sissy come , there ’s a good chance of [old Bounderby]101-loo ’s asking [me]71-tom to dinner ; and if [you]76-sissy do n’t , there ’s none . ’[71-tom] ‘ [I]716-his sister ’ll come directly . ’[716-his sister] ‘ [I]71-tom ’ll wait for [you]76-sissy , ’[71-tom] said [Tom]71-tom , ‘ to make sure . ’[76-sissy] [Sissy]76-sissy resumed in a lower voice . ‘ At last [poor father]3290-poor father said that [he]3290-poor father had given no satisfaction again , and never did give any satisfaction now , and that [he]3290-poor father was a shame and disgrace , and [I]76-sissy should have done better without [him]3290-poor father all along . [I]76-sissy said all the affectionate things to [him]3290-poor father that came into [my]76-sissy heart , and presently [he]3290-poor father was quiet and [I]76-sissy sat down by [him]3290-poor father , and told [him]3290-poor father all about [the school]313-the school and everything that had been said and done [there]425-there . When [I]76-sissy had no more left to tell , [he]3290-poor father put [his]3290-poor father arms round [my]76-sissy neck , and kissed [me]76-sissy a great many times . Then [he]3290-poor father asked [me]76-sissy to fetch some of the stuff [he]3290-poor father used , for the little hurt [he]3290-poor father had had , and to get it at the best place , which was at [the other end of [town]439-town]3304-the other end of town from there ; and then , after kissing [me]76-sissy again , [he]3290-poor father let [me]76-sissy go . When [I]76-sissy had gone down - [stairs]3306-stairs , [I]76-sissy turned back that [I]76-sissy might be a little bit more company to [him]3290-poor father yet , and looked in at the door , and said , “ [[Father]108-father dear]3307-father dear , shall [I]76-sissy take [Merrylegs]106-merrylegs ? ” [Father]108-father shook [his]108-father head and said , “ No , [Sissy]76-sissy , no ; take nothing that ’s known to be [mine]108-father , [[my]76-sissy darling]3295-my darling ; ” and [I]76-sissy left [him]3290-poor father sitting by the fire . Then the thought must have come upon [him]3290-poor father , [poor , poor father]582-poor , poor father ! of going away to try something for [my]76-sissy sake ; for when [I]76-sissy came back , [he]3290-poor father was gone . ’[76-sissy] ‘ [I]71-tom say ! Look sharp for [old Bounderby]101-loo , [Loo]101-loo ! ’[71-tom] [Tom]71-tom remonstrated . ‘ There ’s no more to tell , [Miss Louisa]92-louisa . [I]71-tom keep the nine oils ready for [him]3290-poor father , and [I]71-tom know [he]3290-poor father will come back . Every letter that [I]71-tom see in [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom ’s hand takes [my]71-tom breath away and blinds [my]71-tom eyes , for [I]71-tom think it comes from [father]2781-father , or from [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary about [father]2781-father . [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary promised to write as soon as ever [father]2781-father should be heard of , and [I]71-tom trust to [him]3290-poor father to keep [his]3290-poor father word . ’[71-tom] ‘ Do look sharp for [old Bounderby]101-loo , Loo ! ’[71-tom] said [Tom]71-tom , with an impatient whistle . ‘ [He]3290-poor father ’ll be off if [you]76-sissy do n’t look sharp ! ’[71-tom] After this , whenever [Sissy]76-sissy dropped a curtsey to [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom in the presence of [[his]71-tom family]2852-his family , and said in a faltering way , ‘ [I]76-sissy beg [your]71-tom pardon , [sir]2771-sir , for being troublesome — but — have [you]71-tom had any letter yet about [me]76-sissy ? ’[76-sissy] [Louisa]92-louisa would suspend the occupation of the moment , whatever it was , and look for the reply as earnestly as [Sissy]76-sissy did . And when [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom regularly answered , ‘ No , [Jupe]76-sissy , nothing of the sort , ’[71-tom] the trembling of [Sissy]76-sissy ’s lip would be repeated in [Louisa]92-louisa ’s face , and [her]92-louisa eyes would follow [Sissy]76-sissy with compassion to the door . [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom usually improved these occasions by remarking , when [she]92-louisa was gone , that if [Jupe]76-sissy had been properly trained from an early age [she]92-louisa would have remonstrated to [herself]92-louisa on sound principles the baselessness of these fantastic hopes . Yet it did seem ( though not to [him]71-tom , for [he]71-tom saw nothing of it ) as if fantastic hope could take as strong a hold as Fact . This observation must be limited exclusively to [[his]71-tom daughter]2865-his daughter . As to [Tom]71-tom , [he]71-tom was becoming that not unprecedented triumph of calculation which is usually at work on number one . As to [Mrs. Gradgrind]95-mrs. gradgrind , if [she]95-mrs. gradgrind said anything on the subject , [she]95-mrs. gradgrind would come a little way out of [her]95-mrs. gradgrind wrappers , like [a feminine dormouse]762-a feminine dormouse , and say : ‘ Good gracious bless [me]95-mrs. gradgrind , how [my]95-mrs. gradgrind poor head is vexed and worried by [that girl Jupe]3314-that girl jupe ’s so perseveringly asking , over and over again , about [her]3314-that girl jupe tiresome letters ! Upon [my]95-mrs. gradgrind word and honour [I]95-mrs. gradgrind seem to be fated , and destined , and ordained , to live in the midst of things that [I]95-mrs. gradgrind am never to hear the last of . It really is a most extraordinary circumstance that it appears as if [I]95-mrs. gradgrind never was to hear the last of anything ! ’[95-mrs. gradgrind] At about this point , [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom ’s eye would fall upon [her]95-mrs. gradgrind ; and under the influence of that wintry piece of fact , [she]95-mrs. gradgrind would become torpid again . [I]0-i entertain a weak idea that [the English people]763-the english people are as hard - worked as [any people upon whom the sun shines]764-any people upon whom the sun shines . [I]0-i acknowledge to this ridiculous idiosyncrasy , as a reason why [I]0-i would give [them]763-the english people a little more play . In [the hardest working part of [Coketown]4-coketown]765-the hardest working part of coketown ; in [the innermost fortifications of [that ugly citadel]767-that ugly citadel]766-the innermost fortifications of that ugly citadel , where Nature was as strongly bricked out as killing airs and gases were bricked in ; at the heart of the labyrinth of narrow courts upon [courts]768-courts , and [close streets upon streets]769-close streets upon streets , which had come into existence piecemeal , every piece in a violent hurry for [some one man]770-some one man ’s purpose , and [the whole an unnatural family]771-the whole an unnatural family , shouldering , and trampling , and pressing [one another]551-one another to death ; in [the last close nook of [this great exhausted receiver]774-this great exhausted receiver]773-the last close nook of this great exhausted receiver , where the chimneys , for want of air to make a draught , were built in an immense variety of stunted and crooked shapes , as though [every house]775-every house put out a sign of the kind of [people who might be expected to be born in]776-people who might be expected to be born in [it]775-every house ; among [the multitude of [Coketown]4-coketown]777-the multitude of coketown , generically called ‘ [the Hands]3315-the hands , ’[777-the multitude of coketown] — a race who would have found more favour with [some people]671-some people , if [Providence]143-providence had seen fit to make [them]671-some people only hands , or , like the lower creatures of [the seashore]779-the seashore , only hands and stomachs — lived a certain [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen , forty years of age . [Stephen]144-stephen looked older , but [he]144-stephen had had a hard life . It is said that every life has its roses and thorns ; there seemed , however , to have been a misadventure or mistake in [Stephen]144-stephen ’s case , whereby [somebody else]780-somebody else had become possessed of [his]144-stephen roses , and [he]144-stephen had become possessed of the same [somebody else]780-somebody else ’s thorns in addition to [his]144-stephen own . [He]144-stephen had known , to use [his]144-stephen words , a peck of trouble . [He]144-stephen was usually called [Old Stephen]145-old stephen , in a kind of rough homage to the fact . [A rather stooping man , with a knitted brow , a pondering expression of face , and a hard - looking head sufficiently capacious]782-a rather stooping man , with a knitted brow , a pondering expression of face , and a hard - looking head sufficiently capacious , on which [his]144-stephen iron - grey hair lay long and thin , [Old Stephen]144-stephen might have passed for [a particularly intelligent man in [his]144-stephen condition]783-a particularly intelligent man in his condition . Yet [he]144-stephen was not . [He]144-stephen took no place among [those remarkable ‘ Hands , ’[784-those remarkable ‘ hands , ’ who , piecing together their broken intervals of leisure through many years , had mastered difficult sciences , and acquired a knowledge of most unlikely things] who , piecing together [their]784-those remarkable ‘ hands , ’ who , piecing together their broken intervals of leisure through many years , had mastered difficult sciences , and acquired a knowledge of most unlikely things broken intervals of leisure through many years , had mastered difficult sciences , and acquired a knowledge of most unlikely things]784-those remarkable ‘ hands , ’ who , piecing together their broken intervals of leisure through many years , had mastered difficult sciences , and acquired a knowledge of most unlikely things . [He]144-stephen held no station among [the Hands who could make speeches and carry on debates]785-the hands who could make speeches and carry on debates . [Thousands of [his]144-stephen compeers]786-thousands of his compeers could talk much better than [he]144-stephen , at any time . [He]144-stephen was [a good power - loom weaver]787-a good power - loom weaver , and [a man of perfect integrity]788-a man of perfect integrity . What more [he]144-stephen was , or what else [he]144-stephen had in [him]144-stephen , if anything , let [him]144-stephen show for [himself]144-stephen . The lights in [the great factories]789-the great factories , which looked , when they were illuminated , like [Fairy palaces]790-fairy palaces — or the travellers by [express - train]791-express - train said so — were all extinguished ; and the bells had rung for knocking off for the night , and had ceased again ; and [the Hands]3315-the hands , [men]545-men and [women]3196-women , [boy]2807-boy and [girl]2800-girl , were clattering [home]2856-home . [Old Stephen]145-old stephen was standing in [the street]461-the street , with the old sensation upon [him]145-old stephen which the stoppage of the machinery always produced — the sensation of its having worked and stopped in [his]145-old stephen own head . ‘ Yet [I]145-old stephen do n’t see [Rachael]146-rachael , still ! ’[145-old stephen] said [he]145-old stephen . It was a wet night , and [many groups of [young women]800-young women]799-many groups of young women passed [him]145-old stephen , with [their]799-many groups of young women shawls drawn over [their]799-many groups of young women bare heads and held close under [their]799-many groups of young women chins to keep the rain out . [He]145-old stephen knew [Rachael]146-rachael well , for a glance at [any one of [these groups]802-these groups]801-any one of these groups was sufficient to show [him]145-old stephen that [she]146-rachael was not [there]425-there . At last , there were no more to come ; and then [he]145-old stephen turned away , saying in a tone of disappointment , ‘ Why , then , ha ’[145-old stephen] missed [her]146-rachael ! ’ But , [he]145-old stephen had not gone the length of [three streets]3316-three streets , when [he]145-old stephen saw another of the shawled figures in advance of [him]145-old stephen , at which [he]145-old stephen looked so keenly that perhaps its mere shadow indistinctly reflected on the wet pavement — if [he]145-old stephen could have seen it without the figure itself moving along from lamp to lamp , brightening and fading as it went — would have been enough to tell [him]145-old stephen who was there . Making [his]145-old stephen pace at once much quicker and much softer , [he]145-old stephen darted on until [he]145-old stephen was very near [this figure]3317-this figure , then fell into [his]145-old stephen former walk , and called ‘[145-old stephen] [Rachael]146-rachael ! ’ [She]146-rachael turned , being then in the brightness of a lamp ; and raising [her]146-rachael hood a little , showed a quiet oval face , dark and rather delicate , irradiated by a pair of very gentle eyes , and further set off by the perfect order of [her]146-rachael shining black hair . It was not a face in its first bloom ; [she]146-rachael was [a woman five and thirty years of age]3318-a woman five and thirty years of age . ‘[804-lad] Ah , [lad]804-lad ! ’ Tis [thou]146-rachael ? ’[804-lad] When [she]146-rachael had said this , with a smile which would have been quite expressed , though nothing of [her]146-rachael had been seen but [her]146-rachael pleasant eyes , [she]146-rachael replaced [her]146-rachael hood again , and [they]805-they went on together . ‘ [I]146-rachael thought [thou]146-rachael wast ahind [me]146-rachael , [Rachael]146-rachael ? ’[146-rachael] ‘ No . ’[146-rachael] ‘ Early t’night , [lass]3319-lass ? ’[146-rachael] ‘ ’[146-rachael] Times [I]0-i ’m a little early , [Stephen]144-stephen ! ’[146-rachael] times a little late . The expression was not lost upon [her]146-rachael ; [she]146-rachael laid [her]146-rachael hand lightly on [his]144-stephen arm a moment as if to thank [him]144-stephen for it . ‘[144-stephen] [We]806-we are [such true friends]807-such true friends , [lad]804-lad , and [such old friends]809-such old friends , and getting to be [such old folk]810-such old folk , now . ’ ‘[146-rachael] No , [Rachael]146-rachael , [thou’rt]811-thou as young as ever [thou]811-thou wast . ’ ‘[146-rachael] [One of [us]806-we]812-one of us would be puzzled how to get old , [Stephen]144-stephen , without ’ t other getting so too , [both being alive]3321-both being alive , ’[813-she] [she]813-she answered , laughing ; ‘ but , anyways , [we]806-we ’re[813-she] [such old friends]809-such old friends , and t ’ hide a word of honest truth fro ’[813-she] one another would be a sin and a pity . ’ Tis better not to walk too much together . ’[813-she] Times , yes ! ’ Twould be hard , indeed , if ’[813-she] twas not to be at all , ’ [she]813-she said , with a cheerfulness [she]813-she sought to communicate to [him]144-stephen . ‘[813-she] ’ Tis hard , anyways , [Rachael]146-rachael . ’[813-she] ‘ Try to think not ; and ’[813-she] twill seem better . ’ ‘[813-she] [I]0-i ’ve tried a long time , and ’ ta’nt got better . Ah , [lass]3319-lass , and a bright good law ! Better than [some real ones]816-some real ones . ’ ‘[144-stephen] Never fret about [them]817-them , [Stephen]144-stephen , ’ [she]813-she answered quickly , and not without an anxious glance at [his]144-stephen face . ‘[144-stephen] Let the laws be . ’ ‘[144-stephen] Yes , ’ [he]144-stephen said , with a slow nod or two . ‘[144-stephen] Let [’em]3322-’em be . Let all sorts alone . ’[144-stephen] Tis a muddle , and that ’s aw . ’ ‘[144-stephen] Always a muddle ? ’ said [Rachael]146-rachael , with another gentle touch upon [his]144-stephen arm , as if to recall [him]144-stephen out of the thoughtfulness , in which [he]144-stephen was biting the long ends of [his]144-stephen loose neckerchief as [he]144-stephen walked along . The touch had its instantaneous effect . [He]144-stephen let [them]3323-them fall , turned a smiling face upon [her]813-she , and said , as [he]144-stephen broke into a good - humoured laugh , ‘[146-rachael] Ay , [Rachael]146-rachael , [lass]3319-lass , awlus a muddle . That ’s where [I]0-i stick . [The woman]3326-the woman ’s was the first reached . [She]813-she stopped at the corner , and putting [her]813-she hand in [his]144-stephen , wished [him]144-stephen good night . ‘[0-i] Good night , [dear lass]819-dear lass ; good night ! ’ [She]813-she went , with [her]813-she neat figure and [her]813-she sober womanly step , down [the dark street]3331-the dark street , and [he]144-stephen stood looking after [her]813-she until [she]813-she turned into [one of [the small houses]3333-the small houses]3332-one of the small houses . There was not a flutter of [her]813-she coarse shawl , perhaps , but had its interest in [this man]2994-this man ’s eyes ; not a tone of [her]813-she voice but had its echo in [his]144-stephen innermost heart . When [she]813-she was lost to [his]144-stephen view , [he]144-stephen pursued [his]144-stephen homeward way , glancing up sometimes at the sky , where the clouds were sailing fast and wildly . But , they were broken now , and the rain had ceased , and the moon shone , — looking down [the high chimneys of [Coketown]4-coketown]3335-the high chimneys of coketown on the deep furnaces below , and casting Titanic shadows of the steam - engines at rest , upon the walls where [they]3336-they were lodged . [The man]516-the man seemed to have brightened with the night , as [he]516-the man went on . [[His]516-the man home]3338-his home , in such [another street as the first]3339-another street as the first , saving that [it]3338-his home was narrower , was over [a little shop]3340-a little shop . How it came to pass that [any people]3341-any people found it worth [their]3341-any people while to sell or buy the wretched little toys , mixed up in [its]3340-a little shop window with cheap newspapers and pork ( there was a leg to be raffled for to - morrow - night ) , matters not [here]366-here . [He]516-the man took [his]516-the man end of candle from a shelf , lighted it at another end of candle on the counter , without disturbing [the mistress of the shop who was asleep in [[her]3343-the mistress of the shop who was asleep in her little room , and went upstairs into his lodging little room]3344-her little room , and went [upstairs]3345-upstairs into [[his]516-the man lodging]3346-his lodging]3343-the mistress of the shop who was asleep in her little room , and went upstairs into his lodging . It was [a room , not unacquainted with the black ladder under various tenants]3347-a room , not unacquainted with the black ladder under various tenants ; but as neat , at present , as such [a room]283-a room could be . A few books and writings were on an old bureau in a corner , the furniture was decent and sufficient , and , though the atmosphere was tainted , [the room]2901-the room was clean . Going to the hearth to set the candle down upon a round three - legged table standing there , [he]516-the man stumbled against something . As [he]516-the man recoiled , looking down at it , it raised itself up into the form of [a woman in a sitting attitude]3350-a woman in a sitting attitude . ‘[0-i] Heaven ’s mercy , [woman]820-woman ! ’ [he]516-the man cried , falling farther off from [the figure]3351-the figure . ‘[0-i] Hast [thou]821-thou come back again ! ’ [Such a woman]3352-such a woman ! [A disabled , drunken creature]3353-a disabled , drunken creature , barely able to preserve [her]820-woman sitting posture by steadying [herself]820-woman with one begrimed hand on the floor , while the other was so purposeless in trying to push away [her]820-woman tangled hair from [her]820-woman face , that it only blinded [her]820-woman the more with the dirt upon it . [A creature so foul to look at]3354-a creature so foul to look at , in [her]820-woman tatters , stains and splashes , but so much fouler than that in [her]820-woman moral infamy , that it was a shameful thing even to see [her]820-woman . After an impatient oath or two , and some stupid clawing of [herself]820-woman with the hand not necessary to [her]820-woman support , [she]820-woman got [her]820-woman hair away from [her]820-woman eyes sufficiently to obtain a sight of [him]804-lad . Then [she]820-woman sat swaying [her]820-woman body to and fro , and making gestures with [her]820-woman unnerved arm , which seemed intended as the accompaniment to a fit of laughter , though [her]820-woman face was stolid and drowsy . ‘[0-i] Eigh , [lad]804-lad ? What , yo’r there ? ’ Some hoarse sounds meant for this , came mockingly out of [her]820-woman at last ; and [her]820-woman head dropped forward on [her]820-woman breast . ‘[0-i] Back agen ? ’ [she]820-woman screeched , after some minutes , as if [he]804-lad had that moment said it . ‘[0-i] Yes ! And back agen . Back agen ever and ever so often . Back ? Yes , back . Why not ? ’ Roused by the unmeaning violence with which [she]820-woman cried it out , [she]820-woman scrambled up , and stood supporting [herself]820-woman with [her]820-woman shoulders against the wall ; dangling in one hand by the string , a dunghill - fragment of a bonnet , and trying to look scornfully at [him]804-lad . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ’ll sell [thee]804-lad off again , and [I]0-i ’ll sell [thee]804-lad off again , and [I]0-i ’ll sell [thee]804-lad off a score of times ! ’ [she]820-woman cried , with something between a furious menace and an effort at a defiant dance . ‘[0-i] Come awa ’ from th ’[0-i] bed ! ’ [He]804-lad was sitting on the side of it , with [his]804-lad face hidden in [his]804-lad hands . ‘[0-i] Come awa ! from ’ t. ’[0-i] Tis mine , and [I]0-i ’ve a right to t ’ ! ’[823-her] As [she]823-her staggered to it , [he]804-lad avoided [her]823-her with a shudder , and passed — [his]804-lad face still hidden — to the opposite end of [the room]2901-the room . [She]823-her threw [herself]823-her upon the bed heavily , and soon was snoring hard . [He]804-lad sunk into a chair , and moved but once all that night . It was to throw a covering over [her]823-her ; as if [his]804-lad hands were not enough to hide [her]823-her , even in the darkness . [The Fairy palaces]825-the fairy palaces burst into illumination , before pale morning showed the monstrous serpents of smoke trailing themselves over [Coketown]4-coketown . A clattering of clogs upon [the pavement]466-the pavement ; a rapid ringing of bells ; and [all the melancholy mad elephants , polished and oiled up for the day]827-all the melancholy mad elephants , polished and oiled up for the day ’s monotony , were at [their]827-all the melancholy mad elephants , polished and oiled up for the day heavy exercise again . [Stephen]144-stephen bent over [his]144-stephen loom , quiet , watchful , and steady . A special contrast , as [every man]828-every man was in [the forest of looms where [Stephen]144-stephen worked]829-the forest of looms where stephen worked , to the crashing , smashing , tearing piece of mechanism at which [he]144-stephen laboured . Never fear , [good people of an anxious turn of mind]830-good people of an anxious turn of mind , that Art will consign Nature to oblivion . Set anywhere , side by side , the work of [God]147-god and the work of [man]2967-man ; and the former , even though it be [a troop of Hands of very small account]832-a troop of hands of very small account , will gain in dignity from the comparison . So many hundred Hands in [this Mill]833-this mill ; so many hundred horse Steam Power . It is known , to the force of a single pound weight , what the engine will do ; but , not all the calculators of the National Debt can tell [me]0-i the capacity for good or evil , for love or hatred , for patriotism or discontent , for the decomposition of virtue into vice , or the reverse , at any single moment in the soul of [one of [these its quiet servants]835-these its quiet servants]834-one of these its quiet servants , with the composed faces and the regulated actions . There is no mystery in it ; there is an unfathomable mystery in the meanest of them , for ever . — Supposing [we]836-we were to reverse [our]836-we arithmetic for material objects , and to govern these awful unknown quantities by other means ! The day grew strong , and showed itself outside , even against the flaming lights within . The lights were turned out , and the work went on . The rain fell , and the Smoke - serpents , submissive to the curse of [all that tribe]837-all that tribe , trailed themselves upon [the earth]690-the earth . In [the waste - yard outside]839-the waste - yard outside , the steam from the escape pipe , the litter of barrels and old iron , the shining heaps of coals , the ashes everywhere , were shrouded in a veil of mist and rain . The work went on , until the noon - bell rang . More clattering upon the pavements . The looms , and wheels , and Hands all out of gear for an hour . [Stephen]144-stephen came out of [the hot mill]840-the hot mill into the damp wind and cold wet streets , haggard and worn . [He]144-stephen turned from [[his]144-stephen own class]841-his own class and [[his]144-stephen own quarter]842-his own quarter , taking nothing but a little bread as [he]144-stephen walked along , towards [the hill on which [[his]144-stephen principal employer]844-his principal employer lived]843-the hill on which his principal employer lived , in [a red house with black outside shutters]845-a red house with black outside shutters , green inside blinds , a black street door , up two white steps , [Bounderby]101-loo ( in letters very like [himself]101-loo ) upon a brazen plate , and a round brazen door - handle underneath it , like a brazen full - stop . [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby was at [his]93-mr. bounderby lunch . So [Stephen]144-stephen had expected . Would [[his]144-stephen servant]846-his servant say that [one of [the Hands]3315-the hands]847-one of the hands begged leave to speak to [him]144-stephen ? Message in return , requiring name of [such Hand]849-such hand . [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen . There was nothing troublesome against [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen ; yes , [he]144-stephen might come in . [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen in [the parlour]850-the parlour . [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ( whom [he]144-stephen just knew by sight ) , at lunch on chop and sherry . [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit netting at the fireside , in a side - saddle attitude , with one foot in a cotton stirrup . It was a part , at once of [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit ’s dignity and service , not to lunch . [She]126-mrs. sparsit supervised the meal officially , but implied that in [[her]126-mrs. sparsit own stately person]851-her own stately person [she]126-mrs. sparsit considered lunch a weakness . ‘ Now , [Stephen]144-stephen , ’[93-mr. bounderby] said [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , ‘ what ’s the matter with [you]144-stephen ? ’[93-mr. bounderby] [Stephen]144-stephen made a bow . [The institutions of [[your]0-i country]889-your country]890-the institutions of your country are not [your]0-i piece - work , and the only thing [you]0-i have got to do , is , to mind [your]0-i piece - work .
