If [she]892-your wife has turned out worse — why , all [we]893-we have got to say is , [she]892-your wife might have turned out better . ’ ‘[144-stephen] ’ Tis a muddle , ’[144-stephen] said [Stephen]144-stephen , shaking [his]144-stephen head as [he]144-stephen moved to the door . ‘ ’[144-stephen] Tis a ’ a muddle ! ’[144-stephen] ‘ Now , [I]93-mr. bounderby ’ll tell [you]0-i what ! ’[93-mr. bounderby] [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby resumed , as a valedictory address . ‘ With what [I]93-mr. bounderby shall call [your]0-i unhallowed opinions , [you]0-i have been quite shocking [this lady]619-this lady : who , as [I]93-mr. bounderby have already told [you]0-i , is [a born lady]860-a born lady , and who , as [I]93-mr. bounderby have not already told [you]0-i , has had [her]619-this lady own marriage misfortunes to the tune of tens of thousands of pounds — tens of Thousands of Pounds ! ’[93-mr. bounderby] ( [he]93-mr. bounderby repeated it with great relish ) . ‘ Now , [you]894-you have always been [a steady Hand]857-a steady hand hitherto ; but [my]93-mr. bounderby opinion is , and so [I]93-mr. bounderby tell [you]894-you plainly , that [you]894-you are turning into [the wrong road]3393-the wrong road . [You]894-you have been listening to [some mischievous stranger or other]3394-some mischievous stranger or other — [they]3394-some mischievous stranger or other ’re[93-mr. bounderby] always about — and the best thing [you]894-you can do is , to come out of that . Now [you]894-you know ; ’ here [his]93-mr. bounderby countenance expressed marvellous acuteness ; ‘[894-you] [I]0-i can see as far into a grindstone as [another man]895-another man ; farther than a good many , perhaps , because [I]0-i had [my]0-i nose well kept to it when [I]0-i was young . [I]0-i see traces of the turtle soup , and venison , and gold spoon in this . Yes , [I]0-i do ! ’ cried [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , shaking [his]93-mr. bounderby head with obstinate cunning . ‘[0-i] By [the Lord Harry]118-the lord harry , [I]0-i do ! ’ With a very different shake of the head and deep sigh , [Stephen]144-stephen said , ‘[118-the lord harry] Thank [you]0-i , [sir]2771-sir , [I]0-i wish [you]0-i good day . ’ So [he]144-stephen left [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby swelling at [his]93-mr. bounderby own portrait on the wall , as if [he]93-mr. bounderby were going to explode [himself]93-mr. bounderby into it ; and [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit still ambling on with [her]126-mrs. sparsit foot in [her]126-mrs. sparsit stirrup , looking quite cast down by the popular vices . [Old Stephen]145-old stephen descended the two white steps , shutting the black door with the brazen door - plate , by the aid of the brazen full - stop , to which [he]145-old stephen gave a parting polish with the sleeve of [his]145-old stephen coat , observing that [his]145-old stephen hot hand clouded it . [He]145-old stephen crossed [the street]461-the street with [his]145-old stephen eyes bent upon the ground , and thus was walking sorrowfully away , when [he]145-old stephen felt a touch upon [his]145-old stephen arm . It was not the touch [he]145-old stephen needed most at such a moment — the touch that could calm the wild waters of [his]145-old stephen soul , as the uplifted hand of the sublimest love and patience could abate the raging of [the sea]3246-the sea — yet it was [a woman]3397-a woman ’s hand too . [It]3397-a woman was [an old woman , tall and shapely still , though withered by time , on whom [his]145-old stephen eyes fell when [he]145-old stephen stopped and turned]3398-an old woman , tall and shapely still , though withered by time , on whom his eyes fell when he stopped and turned . [She]3397-a woman was very cleanly and plainly dressed , had country mud upon [her]3397-a woman shoes , and was newly come from a journey . The flutter of [her]3397-a woman manner , in the unwonted noise of [the streets]2975-the streets ; the spare shawl , carried unfolded on [her]3397-a woman arm ; the heavy umbrella , and little basket ; the loose long - fingered gloves , to which [her]3397-a woman hands were unused ; all bespoke [an old woman from [the country]336-the country]3400-an old woman from the country , in [her]3397-a woman plain holiday clothes , come into [Coketown]4-coketown on an expedition of rare occurrence . Remarking this at a glance , with the quick observation of [[his]145-old stephen class]3402-his class , [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen bent [his]145-old stephen attentive face — [his]145-old stephen face , which , like the faces of many of [his]145-old stephen order , by dint of long working with eyes and hands in the midst of a prodigious noise , had acquired the concentrated look with which [we]3403-we are familiar in the countenances of [the deaf]3404-the deaf — the better to hear what [she]3397-a woman asked [him]145-old stephen . ‘[0-i] Pray , [sir]2771-sir , ’ said [the old woman]3405-the old woman , ‘[2771-sir] did n’t [I]0-i see [you]2771-sir come out of [[that gentleman]547-that gentleman ’s house]899-that gentleman ’s house ? ’ pointing back to [[Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ’s]3406-mr. bounderby ’s . ‘[2771-sir] [I]0-i believe it was [you]2771-sir , unless [I]0-i have had the bad luck to mistake [the person in following]900-the person in following ? ’ ‘[901-missus] Yes , [missus]901-missus , ’ returned [Stephen]144-stephen , ‘[0-i] it were [me]0-i . ’ ‘[0-i] Have [you]2771-sir — [you]2771-sir ’ll excuse [an old woman]452-an old woman ’s curiosity — have [you]2771-sir seen [the gentleman]281-the gentleman ? ’ ‘[901-missus] Yes , [missus]901-missus . ’ ‘[901-missus] And how did [he]281-the gentleman look , [sir]2771-sir ? Was [he]281-the gentleman portly , bold , outspoken , and hearty ? ’ As [she]901-missus straightened [her]901-missus own figure , and held up [her]901-missus head in adapting [her]901-missus action to [her]901-missus words , the idea crossed [Stephen]144-stephen that [he]144-stephen had seen [this old woman]453-this old woman before , and had not quite liked [her]453-this old woman . ‘[281-the gentleman] O yes , ’ [he]144-stephen returned , observing [her]453-this old woman more attentively , ‘[281-the gentleman] [he]281-the gentleman were all that . ’ ‘[281-the gentleman] And healthy , ’ said [the old woman]3405-the old woman , ‘[281-the gentleman] as the fresh wind ? ’ ‘[281-the gentleman] Yes , ’ returned [Stephen]144-stephen . ‘[281-the gentleman] [He]281-the gentleman were ett’n and drinking — as large and as loud as a Hummobee . ’ ‘[281-the gentleman] Thank [you]2771-sir ! ’ said [the old woman]3405-the old woman , with infinite content . ‘[2771-sir] Thank [you]2771-sir ! ’ [He]144-stephen certainly never had seen [this old woman]453-this old woman before . Yet there was a vague remembrance in [his]144-stephen mind , as if [he]144-stephen had more than once dreamed of [some old woman like [her]3405-the old woman]3411-some old woman like her . [She]3405-the old woman walked along at [his]144-stephen side , and , gently accommodating [himself]144-stephen to [her]3405-the old woman humour , [he]144-stephen said [Coketown]4-coketown was [a busy place]3412-a busy place , was it not ? To which [she]3405-the old woman answered ‘[2771-sir] Eigh sure ! Dreadful busy ! ’ Then [he]144-stephen said , [she]3405-the old woman came from [the country]336-the country , [he]144-stephen saw ? To which [she]3405-the old woman answered in the affirmative . ‘[906-the chatty old woman] By Parliamentary , this morning . [I]0-i came forty mile by [Parliamentary]19-parliamentary this morning , and [I]0-i ’m going back the same forty mile this afternoon . [I]906-the chatty old woman walked nine mile to [the station]3414-the station this morning , and if [I]906-the chatty old woman find [[nobody]365-nobody on [the road]2846-the road]3416-nobody on the road to give [me]906-the chatty old woman a lift , [I]906-the chatty old woman shall walk the nine mile back to - night . That ’s pretty well , [sir]2771-sir , at [my]906-the chatty old woman age ! ’[906-the chatty old woman] said [the chatty old woman]906-the chatty old woman , [her]906-the chatty old woman eye brightening with exultation . ‘ ’[906-the chatty old woman] Deed ’ tis . Do n’t do’t too often , [missus]901-missus . ’[906-the chatty old woman] ‘ No , no . Once a year , ’[906-the chatty old woman] [she]906-the chatty old woman answered , shaking [her]906-the chatty old woman head . ‘ [I]906-the chatty old woman spend [my]906-the chatty old woman savings so , once every year . [I]906-the chatty old woman come regular , to tramp about [the streets]2975-the streets , and see [the gentlemen]3421-the gentlemen . ’[906-the chatty old woman] ‘ Only to see [’em]3422-’em[906-the chatty old woman] ? ’ returned [Stephen]144-stephen . ‘[906-the chatty old woman] That ’s enough for [me]0-i , ’ [she]906-the chatty old woman replied , with great earnestness and interest of manner . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ask no more ! [I]0-i have been standing about , on this side of the way , to see [that gentleman]547-that gentleman , ’ turning [her]906-the chatty old woman head back towards [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ’s again , ‘[547-that gentleman] come out . But , [he]547-that gentleman ’s late this year , and [I]0-i have not seen [him]547-that gentleman . [You]908-you came out instead . Now , if [I]0-i am obliged to go back without a glimpse of [him]547-that gentleman — [I]0-i only want a glimpse — well ! [I]0-i have seen [you]908-you , and [you]908-you have seen [him]547-that gentleman , and [I]0-i must make that do . ’ Saying this , [she]906-the chatty old woman looked at [Stephen]144-stephen as if to fix [his]144-stephen features in [her]906-the chatty old woman mind , and [her]906-the chatty old woman eye was not so bright as it had been . With a large allowance for difference of tastes , and with all submission to [the patricians of [Coketown]4-coketown]3423-the patricians of coketown , this seemed so extraordinary a source of interest to take so much trouble about , that it perplexed [him]144-stephen . But [they]3424-they were passing [the church]3425-the church now , and as [his]144-stephen eye caught the clock , [he]144-stephen quickened [his]144-stephen pace . [He]144-stephen was going to [his]144-stephen work ? [the old woman]3405-the old woman said , quickening [hers]3405-the old woman , too , quite easily . Yes , time was nearly out . On [his]144-stephen telling [her]3405-the old woman where [he]144-stephen worked , [the old woman]3405-the old woman became [a more singular old woman]3428-a more singular old woman than before . ‘[0-i] An’t [you]909-you happy ? ’ [she]3405-the old woman asked [him]144-stephen . ‘[0-i] Why — there ’s awmost nobbody but has [their]910-they troubles , [missus]901-missus . ’ [He]144-stephen answered evasively , because [the old woman]3405-the old woman appeared to take it for granted that [he]144-stephen would be very happy indeed , and [he]144-stephen had not the heart to disappoint [her]3405-the old woman . [He]144-stephen knew that there was trouble enough in [the world]301-the world ; and if [the old woman]3405-the old woman had lived so long , and could count upon [his]144-stephen having so little , why so much the better for [her]3405-the old woman , and none the worse for [him]144-stephen . ‘[901-missus] Ay , ay ! [You]909-you have [your]909-you troubles at [home]2856-home , [you]909-you mean ? ’ [she]3405-the old woman said . ‘[909-you] Times . Just now and then , ’ [he]144-stephen answered , slightly . ‘[909-you] But , working under [such a gentleman]913-such a gentleman , [they]910-they do n’t follow [you]909-you to [the Factory]914-the factory ? ’ No , no ; [they]910-they did n’t follow [him]144-stephen there , said [Stephen]144-stephen . All correct there . Everything accordant [there]425-there . ( [He]144-stephen did not go so far as to say , for [her]3405-the old woman pleasure , that there was a sort of Divine Right there ; but , [I]910-they have heard claims almost as magnificent of late years . ) [They]910-they were now in [the black by - road]3433-the black by - road near [the place]2849-the place , and [the Hands]150-the hands were crowding in . The bell was ringing , and the Serpent was a Serpent of many coils , and [the Elephant]3435-the elephant was getting ready . [The strange old woman]3436-the strange old woman was delighted with the very bell . It was the beautifullest bell [she]3436-the strange old woman had ever heard , [she]3436-the strange old woman said , and sounded grand ! [She]3436-the strange old woman asked [him]144-stephen , when [he]144-stephen stopped good - naturedly to shake hands with [her]3436-the strange old woman before going in , how long [he]144-stephen had worked [there]425-there ? ‘[910-they] A dozen year , ’ [he]144-stephen told [her]3436-the strange old woman . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i must kiss the hand , ’ said [she]3436-the strange old woman , ‘[0-i] that has worked in [this fine factory]915-this fine factory for a dozen year ! ’ And [she]3436-the strange old woman lifted it , though [he]144-stephen would have prevented [her]3436-the strange old woman , and put it to [her]3436-the strange old woman lips . What harmony , besides [her]3436-the strange old woman age and [her]3436-the strange old woman simplicity , surrounded [her]3436-the strange old woman , [he]144-stephen did not know , but even in this fantastic action there was a something neither out of time nor place : a something which it seemed as if [nobody else]3438-nobody else could have made as serious , or done with such a natural and touching air . [He]144-stephen had been at [[his]144-stephen loom]3439-his loom full half an hour , thinking about [this old woman]453-this old woman , when , having occasion to move round the loom for its adjustment , [he]144-stephen glanced through a window which was in [his]144-stephen corner , and saw [her]3436-the strange old woman still looking up at [the pile of building]3441-the pile of building , lost in admiration . Heedless of the smoke and mud and wet , and of [her]3436-the strange old woman two long journeys , [she]3436-the strange old woman was gazing at it , as if the heavy thrum that issued from its many stories were proud music to [her]3436-the strange old woman . [She]3436-the strange old woman was gone by and by , and the day went after [her]3436-the strange old woman , and the lights sprung up again , and [the Express]20-the express whirled in full sight of [the Fairy Palace]21-the fairy palace over the arches near : little felt amid the jarring of the machinery , and scarcely heard above its crash and rattle . Long before then [his]144-stephen thoughts had gone back to [the dreary room above [the little shop]3443-the little shop]3442-the dreary room above the little shop , and to [the shameful figure heavy on the bed]3444-the shameful figure heavy on the bed , but heavier on [his]144-stephen heart . [Machinery]151-machinery slackened ; throbbing feebly like a fainting pulse ; stopped . The bell again ; the glare of light and heat dispelled ; [the factories]3445-the factories , looming heavy in the black wet night — [their]3445-the factories tall chimneys rising up into the air like competing Towers of [Babel]22-babel . [He]144-stephen had spoken to [Rachael]146-rachael only last night , it was true , and had walked with [her]146-rachael a little way ; but [he]144-stephen had [his]144-stephen new misfortune on [him]144-stephen , in which [no one else]3446-no one else could give [him]144-stephen a moment ’s relief , and , for the sake of it , and because [he]144-stephen knew [himself]144-stephen to want that softening of [his]144-stephen anger which no voice but [hers]146-rachael could effect , [he]144-stephen felt [he]144-stephen might so far disregard what [she]146-rachael had said as to wait for [her]146-rachael again . [He]144-stephen waited , but [she]146-rachael had eluded [him]144-stephen . [She]146-rachael was gone . On no other night in the year could [he]144-stephen so ill have spared [her]146-rachael patient face . O ! Better to have no home in which to lay [his]144-stephen head , than to have [a home]3447-a home and dread to go to it , through such a cause . [He]144-stephen ate and drank , for [he]144-stephen was exhausted — but [he]144-stephen little knew or cared what ; and [he]144-stephen wandered about in the chill rain , thinking and thinking , and brooding and brooding . No word of a new marriage had ever passed between [them]3448-them ; but [Rachael]146-rachael had taken great pity on [him]144-stephen years ago , and to [her]146-rachael alone [he]144-stephen had opened [his]144-stephen closed heart all this time , on the subject of [his]144-stephen miseries ; and [he]144-stephen knew very well that if [he]144-stephen were free to ask [her]146-rachael , [she]146-rachael would take [him]144-stephen . [He]144-stephen thought of the home [he]144-stephen might at that moment have been seeking with pleasure and pride ; of [the different man [he]144-stephen might have been that night]3449-the different man he might have been that night ; of the lightness then in [his]144-stephen now heavy - laden breast ; of the then restored honour , self - respect , and tranquillity all torn to pieces . [He]144-stephen thought of the waste of the best part of [his]144-stephen life , of the change it made in [his]144-stephen character for the worse every day , of the dreadful nature of [his]144-stephen existence , bound hand and foot , to [a dead woman]3450-a dead woman , and tormented by [a demon in [her]3450-a dead woman shape]3451-a demon in her shape . [He]144-stephen thought of [Rachael]146-rachael , how young when [they]3452-they were first brought together in these circumstances , how mature now , how soon to grow old . [He]144-stephen thought of the number of [girls]2767-girls and [women]3196-women [she]146-rachael had seen marry , how many homes with [children]2848-children in [them]3456-them [she]146-rachael had seen grow up around [her]146-rachael , how [she]146-rachael had contentedly pursued [her]146-rachael own lone quiet path — for [him]144-stephen — and how [he]144-stephen had sometimes seen a shade of melancholy on [her]146-rachael blessed face , that smote [him]144-stephen with remorse and despair . [He]144-stephen set the picture of [her]146-rachael up , beside the infamous image of last night ; and thought , Could it be , that the whole earthly course of [one so gentle , good , and self - denying]3457-one so gentle , good , and self - denying , was subjugate to [such a wretch as that]3458-such a wretch as that ! Filled with these thoughts — so filled that [he]144-stephen had an unwholesome sense of growing larger , of being placed in some new and diseased relation towards the objects among which [he]144-stephen passed , of seeing the iris round every misty light turn red — [he]144-stephen went [home]2856-home for shelter . A candle faintly burned in the window , to which the black ladder had often been raised for the sliding away of all that was most precious in [this world]3460-this world to [a striving wife]3461-a striving wife and [a brood of hungry babies]3462-a brood of hungry babies ; and [Stephen]144-stephen added to [his]144-stephen other thoughts the stern reflection , that of all the casualties of this existence upon [earth]276-earth , not one was dealt out with so unequal a hand as Death . The inequality of Birth was nothing to it . For , say that [the child of [a King]3465-a king]3464-the child of a king and [the child of a Weaver]3466-the child of a weaver were born to - night in the same moment , what was that disparity , to the death of [any human creature who was serviceable to , or beloved by , another]3467-any human creature who was serviceable to , or beloved by , another , while [this abandoned woman]3468-this abandoned woman lived on ! From the outside of [[his]144-stephen home]3338-his home [he]144-stephen gloomily passed to the inside , with suspended breath and with a slow footstep . [He]144-stephen went up to [his]144-stephen door , opened it , and so into [the room]2901-the room . Quiet and peace were there . [Rachael]146-rachael was there , sitting by the bed . [She]146-rachael turned [her]146-rachael head , and the light of [her]146-rachael face shone in upon the midnight of [his]144-stephen mind . [She]146-rachael sat by the bed , watching and tending [[his]144-stephen wife]3471-his wife . That is to say , [he]144-stephen saw that [some one]3472-some one lay there , and [he]144-stephen knew too well it must be [she]146-rachael ; but [Rachael]146-rachael ’s hands had put a curtain up , so that [she]146-rachael was screened from [his]144-stephen eyes . [Her]146-rachael disgraceful garments were removed , and some of [Rachael]146-rachael ’s were in [the room]2901-the room . Everything was in its place and order as [he]144-stephen had always kept it , the little fire was newly trimmed , and the hearth was freshly swept . It appeared to [him]144-stephen that [he]144-stephen saw all this in [Rachael]146-rachael ’s face , and looked at nothing besides . While looking at it , it was shut out from [his]144-stephen view by the softened tears that filled [his]144-stephen eyes ; but not before [he]144-stephen had seen how earnestly [she]146-rachael looked at [him]144-stephen , and how [her]146-rachael own eyes were filled too . [She]146-rachael turned again towards the bed , and satisfying [herself]146-rachael that all was quiet there , spoke in a low , calm , cheerful voice . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i am glad [you]916-you have come at last , [Stephen]144-stephen . [You]916-you are very late . ’ ‘[916-you] [I]0-i ha ’ been walking up an ’[916-you] down . ’ ‘[916-you] [I]0-i thought so . But ’ tis too bad a night for that . The rain falls very heavy , and the wind has risen . ’[916-you] The wind ? True . It was blowing hard . Hark to the thundering in the chimney , and the surging noise ! To have been out in such a wind , and not to have known it was blowing ! ‘ [I]917-her have been [here]366-here once before , to - day , [Stephen]144-stephen . [Landlady]3475-landlady came round for [me]917-her at dinner - time . There was some one here that needed looking to , [she]146-rachael said . And ‘[917-her] deed [she]917-her was right . All wandering and lost , [Stephen]144-stephen . Wounded too , and bruised . ’ [He]144-stephen slowly moved to a chair and sat down , drooping [his]144-stephen head before [her]146-rachael . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i came to do what little [I]0-i could , [Stephen]144-stephen ; first , for that [she]917-her worked with [me]0-i when [we]918-we were [girls]2767-girls both , and for that [you]144-stephen courted [her]917-her and married [her]917-her when [I]0-i was [[her]917-her friend]920-her friend — ’ [He]144-stephen laid [his]144-stephen furrowed forehead on [his]144-stephen hand , with a low groan . ‘[144-stephen] And next , for that [I]0-i know [your]144-stephen heart , and am right sure and certain that ’ tis far too merciful to let [her]917-her die , or even so much as suffer , for want of aid . [Thou]3476-thou knowest who said , “ Let [him]3477-him who is without sin among [you]3476-thou cast the first stone at [her]917-her ! ” There have been plenty to do that . [Thou]3476-thou art not [the man to cast the last stone]3478-the man to cast the last stone , [Stephen]144-stephen , when [she]917-her is brought so low . ’[0-i] ‘ O [Rachael]146-rachael , [Rachael]146-rachael ! ’[921-she] ‘ [Thou]3476-thou hast been [a cruel sufferer]3479-a cruel sufferer , [Heaven]81-heaven reward [thee]3476-thou ! ’[921-she] [she]921-she said , in compassionate accents . ‘ [I]921-she am [[thy]3476-thou poor friend]3480-thy poor friend , with all [my]921-she heart and mind . ’[921-she]

The wounds of which [she]921-she had spoken , seemed to be about the neck of [the self - made outcast]922-the self - made outcast . [She]921-she dressed them now , still without showing [her]921-she . [She]921-she steeped a piece of linen in a basin , into which [she]921-she poured some liquid from a bottle , and laid it with a gentle hand upon the sore . The three - legged table had been drawn close to the bedside , and on it there were two bottles . This was one . It was not so far off , but that [Stephen]144-stephen , following [her]921-she hands with [his]144-stephen eyes , could read what was printed on it in large letters . [He]144-stephen turned of a deadly hue , and a sudden horror seemed to fall upon [him]144-stephen . ‘ [I]146-rachael will stay [here]366-here , [Stephen]144-stephen , ’[146-rachael] said [Rachael]146-rachael , quietly resuming [her]146-rachael seat , ‘ till the bells go Three . ’[146-rachael] Tis to be done again at three , and then [she]921-she may be left till morning . ’ ‘[146-rachael] But [thy]921-she rest agen to - morrow ’s work , [[my]0-i dear]601-my dear . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i slept sound last night . [I]0-i can wake many nights , when [I]0-i am put to it . ’ Tis [thou]921-she who art in need of rest — so white and tired . Try to sleep in the chair there , while [I]144-stephen watch . [Thou]921-she hadst no sleep last night , [I]144-stephen can well believe . To - morrow ’s work is far harder for [thee]921-she than for [me]144-stephen . ’[144-stephen] [He]144-stephen heard the thundering and surging out of doors , and it seemed to [him]144-stephen as if [his]144-stephen late angry mood were going about trying to get at [him]144-stephen . [She]921-she had cast it out ; [she]921-she would keep it out ; [he]144-stephen trusted to [her]921-she to defend [him]144-stephen from [himself]144-stephen . ‘ [She]921-she do n’t know [me]921-she , [Stephen]144-stephen ; [she]921-she just drowsily mutters and stares . [I]921-she have spoken to [her]921-she times and again , but [she]921-she do n’t notice ! ’[921-she] Tis as well so . When [she]921-she comes to [her]921-she right mind once more , [I]0-i shall have done what [I]0-i can , and [she]921-she never the wiser . ’ ‘[921-she] How long , [Rachael]146-rachael , is ’ t looked for , that [she]921-she ’ll be so ? ’[146-rachael] ‘ [Doctor]152-doctor said [she]921-she would haply come to [her]921-she mind to - morrow . ’[144-stephen] [His]144-stephen eyes fell again on the bottle , and a tremble passed over [him]144-stephen , causing [him]144-stephen to shiver in every limb . [She]921-she thought [he]144-stephen was chilled with the wet . ‘ No , ’[144-stephen] [he]144-stephen said , ‘ it was not that . [He]144-stephen had had a fright . ’[144-stephen] ‘ A fright ? ’[921-she] ‘ Ay , ay ! coming in . When [I]144-stephen were walking . When [I]144-stephen were thinking . When [I]144-stephen — ’[144-stephen] It seized [him]144-stephen again ; and [he]144-stephen stood up , holding by the mantel - shelf , as [he]144-stephen pressed [his]144-stephen dank cold hair down with a hand that shook as if it were palsied . ‘ [Stephen]144-stephen ! ’[144-stephen] [She]921-she was coming to [him]144-stephen , but [he]144-stephen stretched out [his]144-stephen arm to stop [her]921-she . ‘ No ! Do n’t , please ; do n’t . Let [me]144-stephen see [thee]921-she setten by the bed . Let [me]144-stephen see [thee]921-she , a ’[144-stephen] so good , and so forgiving . Let [me]0-i see [thee]921-she as [I]0-i see [thee]921-she when [I]0-i coom in . [I]0-i can never see [thee]921-she better than so . Never , never , never ! ’ [He]144-stephen had a violent fit of trembling , and then sunk into [his]144-stephen chair . After a time [he]144-stephen controlled [himself]144-stephen , and , resting with an elbow on one knee , and [his]144-stephen head upon that hand , could look towards [Rachael]146-rachael . Seen across the dim candle with [his]144-stephen moistened eyes , [she]146-rachael looked as if [she]146-rachael had a glory shining round [her]146-rachael head . [He]144-stephen could have believed [she]146-rachael had . [He]144-stephen did believe it , as the noise without shook the window , rattled at the door below , and went about [the house]2918-the house clamouring and lamenting . ‘[144-stephen] When [she]921-she gets better , [Stephen]144-stephen , ’ tis to be hoped [she]921-she ’ll leave [thee]144-stephen to [thyself]3483-thyself again , and do [thee]144-stephen no more hurt . Anyways [we]3484-we will hope so now . And now [I]144-stephen shall keep silence , for [I]144-stephen want [thee]144-stephen to sleep . ’[144-stephen] [He]144-stephen closed [his]144-stephen eyes , more to please [her]921-she than to rest [his]144-stephen weary head ; but , by slow degrees as [he]144-stephen listened to the great noise of the wind , [he]144-stephen ceased to hear it , or it changed into the working of [his]144-stephen loom , or even into the voices of the day ( [his]144-stephen own included ) saying what had been really said . Even this imperfect consciousness faded away at last , and [he]144-stephen dreamed a long , troubled dream . [He]144-stephen thought that [he]144-stephen , and [some one on whom [his]144-stephen heart had long been set]924-some one on whom his heart had long been set — but [she]921-she was not [Rachael]146-rachael , and that surprised [him]144-stephen , even in the midst of [his]144-stephen imaginary happiness — stood in [the church]3425-the church being married . While the ceremony was performing , and while [he]144-stephen recognized among the witnesses [some whom [he]144-stephen knew to be living , and many whom [he]144-stephen knew to be dead]926-some whom he knew to be living , and many whom he knew to be dead , darkness came on , succeeded by the shining of a tremendous light . It broke from one line in the table of commandments at the altar , and illuminated [the building]927-the building with the words . They were sounded through [the church]3425-the church , too , as if there were voices in the fiery letters . Upon this , the whole appearance before [him]144-stephen and around [him]144-stephen changed , and nothing was left as it had been , but [himself]144-stephen and [the clergyman]929-the clergyman . [They]930-they stood in the daylight before [a crowd so vast]931-a crowd so vast , that if [all the people in [the world]301-the world]932-all the people in the world could have been brought together into one space , [they]932-all the people in the world could not have looked , [he]144-stephen thought , more numerous ; and [they]932-all the people in the world all abhorred [him]144-stephen , and there was not one pitying or friendly eye among the millions that were fastened on [his]144-stephen face . [He]144-stephen stood on a raised stage , under [his]144-stephen own loom ; and , looking up at the shape the loom took , and hearing the burial service distinctly read , [he]144-stephen knew that [he]144-stephen was there to suffer death . In an instant what [he]144-stephen stood on fell below [him]144-stephen , and [he]144-stephen was gone . — Out of what mystery [he]144-stephen came back to [his]144-stephen usual life , and to places that [he]144-stephen knew , [he]144-stephen was unable to consider ; but [he]144-stephen was back in [those places]934-those places by some means , and with this condemnation upon [him]144-stephen , that [he]144-stephen was never , in [this world]3460-this world or the next , through all the unimaginable ages of eternity , to look on [Rachael]146-rachael ’s face or hear [her]146-rachael voice . Wandering to and fro , unceasingly , without hope , and in search of [he]144-stephen knew not what ( [he]144-stephen only knew that [he]144-stephen was doomed to seek it ) , [he]144-stephen was [the subject of a nameless , horrible dread , a mortal fear of one particular shape which everything took]936-the subject of a nameless , horrible dread , a mortal fear of one particular shape which everything took . Whatsoever [he]144-stephen looked at , grew into that form sooner or later . The object of [his]144-stephen miserable existence was to prevent its recognition by [any one among [the various people [he]144-stephen encountered]938-the various people he encountered]937-any one among the various people he encountered . Hopeless labour ! If [he]144-stephen led [them]939-them out of [rooms where it was]940-rooms where it was , if [he]144-stephen shut up drawers and closets where [it]941-it stood , if [he]144-stephen drew the curious from places where [he]144-stephen knew it to be secreted , and got [them]939-them out into [the streets]2975-the streets , [the very chimneys of [the mills]944-the mills]943-the very chimneys of the mills assumed that shape , and round [them]943-the very chimneys of the mills was the printed word . The wind was blowing again , the rain was beating on the house - tops , and the larger spaces through which [he]144-stephen had strayed contracted to the four walls of [[his]144-stephen room]945-his room . Saving that the fire had died out , it was as [his]144-stephen eyes had closed upon it . [Rachael]146-rachael seemed to have fallen into a doze , in the chair by the bed . [She]146-rachael sat wrapped in [her]146-rachael shawl , perfectly still . The table stood in the same place , close by the bedside , and on [it]946-it , in its real proportions and appearance , was the shape so often repeated . [He]144-stephen thought [he]144-stephen saw the curtain move . [He]144-stephen looked again , and [he]144-stephen was sure it moved . [He]144-stephen saw a hand come forth and grope about a little . Then the curtain moved more perceptibly , and [the woman in the bed]947-the woman in the bed put it back , and sat up . With [her]146-rachael woful eyes , so haggard and wild , so heavy and large , [she]146-rachael looked all round [the room]2901-the room , and passed the corner where [he]144-stephen slept in [his]144-stephen chair . [Her]146-rachael eyes returned to that corner , and [she]146-rachael put [her]146-rachael hand over them as a shade , while [she]146-rachael looked into it . Again [they]949-them went all round [the room]2901-the room , scarcely heeding [Rachael]146-rachael if at all , and returned to that corner . [He]144-stephen thought , as [she]146-rachael once more shaded [them]949-them — not so much looking at [him]144-stephen , as looking for [him]144-stephen with a brutish instinct that [he]144-stephen was there — that no single trace was left in those debauched features , or in the mind that went along with [them]949-them , of [the woman [he]144-stephen had married eighteen years before]951-the woman he had married eighteen years before . But that [he]144-stephen had seen [her]146-rachael come to this by inches , [he]144-stephen never could have believed [her]146-rachael to be the same . All this time , as if a spell were on [him]144-stephen , [he]144-stephen was motionless and powerless , except to watch [her]146-rachael . Stupidly dozing , or communing with [her]146-rachael incapable self about nothing , [she]146-rachael sat for a little while with [her]146-rachael hands at [her]146-rachael ears , and [her]146-rachael head resting on them . Presently , [she]146-rachael resumed [her]146-rachael staring round [the room]2901-the room . And now , for the first time , [her]146-rachael eyes stopped at the table with the bottles on it . Straightway [she]146-rachael turned [her]146-rachael eyes back to [his]144-stephen corner , with the defiance of last night , and moving very cautiously and softly , stretched out [her]146-rachael greedy hand . [She]146-rachael drew a mug into the bed , and sat for a while considering which of the two bottles [she]146-rachael should choose . Finally , [she]146-rachael laid [her]146-rachael insensate grasp upon the bottle that had swift and certain death in it , and , before [his]144-stephen eyes , pulled out the cork with [her]146-rachael teeth . Dream or reality , [he]144-stephen had no voice , nor had [he]144-stephen power to stir . If this be real , and [her]146-rachael allotted time be not yet come , wake , [Rachael]146-rachael , wake ! [She]146-rachael thought of that , too . [She]146-rachael looked at [Rachael]146-rachael , and very slowly , very cautiously , poured out the contents . The draught was at [her]146-rachael lips . A moment and [she]146-rachael would be past all help , let [the whole world]953-the whole world wake and come about [her]146-rachael with its utmost power . But in that moment [Rachael]146-rachael started up with a suppressed cry . [The creature]954-the creature struggled , struck [her]146-rachael , seized [her]146-rachael by the hair ; but [Rachael]146-rachael had the cup . [Stephen]144-stephen broke out of [his]144-stephen chair . ‘ [Rachael]146-rachael , am [I]144-stephen wakin ’[144-stephen] or dreamin ’ this dreadfo ’[954-the creature] night ? ’ ‘[144-stephen] ’ Tis all well , [Stephen]144-stephen . [I]954-the creature have been asleep , [myself]954-the creature . ’[954-the creature] Tis near three . Hush ! [I]0-i hear the bells . ’ The wind brought the sounds of the church clock to the window . [They]3485-they listened , and it struck three . [Stephen]144-stephen looked at [her]146-rachael , saw how pale [she]146-rachael was , noted the disorder of [her]146-rachael hair , and the red marks of fingers on [her]146-rachael forehead , and felt assured that [his]144-stephen senses of sight and hearing had been awake . [She]146-rachael held the cup in [her]146-rachael hand even now . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i thought it must be near three , ’ [she]146-rachael said , calmly pouring from the cup into the basin , and steeping the linen as before . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i am thankful [I]0-i stayed ! ’ Tis done now , when [I]955-i have put this on . There ! And now [she]146-rachael ’s quiet again . The few drops in [the basin]3486-the basin [I]955-i ’ll pour away , for ’[955-i] tis bad stuff to leave about , though ever so little of it . ’ As [she]146-rachael spoke , [she]146-rachael drained the basin into the ashes of the fire , and broke the bottle on the hearth . [She]146-rachael had nothing to do , then , but to cover [herself]146-rachael with [her]146-rachael shawl before going out into the wind and rain . ‘[955-i] [Thou’lt]955-i let [me]0-i walk wi ’ [thee]956-her at this hour , [Rachael]146-rachael ? ’[955-i] ‘ No , [Stephen]144-stephen . ’[955-i] Tis but a minute , and [I]0-i ’m [home]2856-home . ’[955-i] ‘ [Thou’rt]955-i not fearfo ’[955-i] ; ’ [he]0-i said it in a low voice , as [they]3488-they went out at the door ; ‘[955-i] to leave [me]0-i alone wi ’ [her]956-her ! ’[956-her] As [she]956-her looked at [him]0-i , saying , ‘ [Stephen]144-stephen ? ’[956-her] [he]0-i went down on [his]0-i knee before [her]956-her , on the poor mean stairs , and put an end of [her]956-her shawl to [his]0-i lips . ‘ [Thou]955-i art [an Angel]3489-an angel . Bless [thee]955-i , bless [thee]955-i ! ’[0-i] ‘ [I]958-she am , as [I]958-she have told [thee]0-i , [Stephen]144-stephen , [[thy]0-i poor friend]3480-thy poor friend . [Angels]3491-angels are not like [me]958-she . Between [them]3491-angels , and [a working woman]3492-a working woman fu ’[958-she] of faults , there is a deep gulf set . [[My]0-i little sister]957-my little sister is among [them]958-she , but [she]957-my little sister is changed . ’ [She]958-she raised [her]958-she eyes for a moment as [she]958-she said the words ; and then they fell again , in all [their]958-she gentleness and mildness , on [his]0-i face . ‘[957-my little sister] [Thou]959-thou changest [me]0-i from bad to good . [Thou]959-thou mak’st [me]0-i humbly wishfo ’ to be more like [thee]957-my little sister , and fearfo ’[959-thou] to lose [thee]957-my little sister when this life is ower , and a ’ the muddle cleared awa ’[959-thou] . [Thou’rt]959-thou [an Angel]3489-an angel ; it may be , [thou]959-thou hast saved [my]0-i soul alive ! ’ [She]958-she looked at [him]0-i , on [his]0-i knee at [her]958-she feet , with [her]958-she shawl still in [his]0-i hand , and the reproof on [her]958-she lips died away when [she]958-she saw the working of [his]0-i face . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i coom [home]2856-home desp’rate . [I]0-i coom [home]2856-home wi’out a hope , and mad wi ’ thinking that when [I]0-i said a word o ’[0-i] complaint [I]0-i was reckoned a unreasonable Hand . [I]0-i told [thee]963-her [I]0-i had had a fright . It were the Poison - bottle on table . [I]0-i never hurt a livin ’ creetur ; but happenin ’[0-i] so suddenly upon ’ t , [I]0-i thowt , “ How can [I]0-i say what [I]0-i might ha ’[0-i] done to [myseln]964-myseln , or [her]965-her , or both ! ” ’ [She]146-rachael put [her]146-rachael two hands on [his]0-i mouth , with a face of terror , to stop [him]0-i from saying more . [He]0-i caught them in [his]0-i unoccupied hand , and holding them , and still clasping the border of [her]146-rachael shawl , said hurriedly : ‘[0-i] But [I]0-i see [thee]963-her , [Rachael]146-rachael , setten by the bed . [I]0-i ha ’ seen [thee]963-her , aw this night . In [my]0-i troublous sleep [I]0-i ha ’[0-i] known [thee]963-her still to be there . Evermore [I]0-i will see [thee]963-her there . [I]0-i nevermore will see [her]963-her or think o ’ [her]963-her , but [thou]963-her shalt be beside [her]963-her . [I]963-her nevermore will see or think o ’[963-her] anything that angers [me]0-i , but [thou]963-her , so much better than [me]0-i , shalt be by th ’ side on’t . And so [I]0-i will try t ’[0-i] look t ’ th ’[0-i] time , and so [I]0-i will try t ’ trust t ’[0-i] th ’ time , when [thou]963-her and [me]0-i at last shall walk together far awa ’[0-i] , beyond [the deep gulf]966-the deep gulf , in [th ’ country where [[thy]963-her little sister]3494-thy little sister is]3493-th ’ country where thy little sister is . ’[0-i] [He]0-i kissed the border of [her]963-her shawl again , and let [her]963-her go . [She]963-her bade [him]0-i good night in a broken voice , and went out into [the street]461-the street . The wind blew from [the quarter where the day would soon appear]968-the quarter where the day would soon appear , and still blew strongly . It had cleared the sky before it , and the rain had spent itself or travelled elsewhere , and the stars were bright . [He]0-i stood bare - headed in [the road]2846-the road , watching [her]963-her quick disappearance . As the shining stars were to the heavy candle in the window , so was [Rachael]146-rachael , in the rugged fancy of [this man]2994-this man , to the common experiences of [his]0-i life . Time went on in [Coketown]4-coketown like [its]4-coketown own machinery : so much material wrought up , so much fuel consumed , so many powers worn out , so much money made . But , less inexorable than iron , steel , and brass , it brought its varying seasons even into that wilderness of smoke and brick , and made the only stand that ever was made in [the place]2849-the place against its direful uniformity . ‘ [Louisa]92-louisa is becoming , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , ‘ almost [a young woman]3495-a young woman . ’[71-tom] Time , with [his]0-i innumerable horse - power , worked away , not minding what [anybody]2887-anybody said , and presently turned out [young [Thomas]71-tom a foot taller than when [[his]71-tom father]3044-his father had last taken particular notice of [him]71-tom]973-young thomas a foot taller than when his father had last taken particular notice of him . ‘ [Thomas]71-tom is becoming , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , ‘ almost [a young man]503-a young man . ’[71-tom] Time passed [Thomas]71-tom on in [the mill]975-the mill , while [[his]71-tom father]3044-his father was thinking about it , and there [he]71-tom stood in a long - tailed coat and a stiff shirt - collar . ‘ Really , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , ‘ the period has arrived when [Thomas]71-tom ought to go to [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby . ’[71-tom] Time , sticking to [him]71-tom , passed [him]71-tom on into [Bounderby ’s Bank]24-bounderby ’s bank , made [him]71-tom [an inmate of [[Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ’s house]978-bounderby ’s house]977-an inmate of bounderby ’s house , necessitated the purchase of [his]71-tom first razor , and exercised [him]71-tom diligently in [his]71-tom calculations relative to number one . [The same great manufacturer , always with an immense variety of work on hand , in every stage of development]979-the same great manufacturer , always with an immense variety of work on hand , in every stage of development , passed [Sissy]76-sissy onward in [[his]979-the same great manufacturer , always with an immense variety of work on hand , in every stage of development mill]980-his mill , and worked [her]76-sissy up into a very pretty article indeed . ‘ [I]71-tom fear , [Jupe]76-sissy , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , ‘ that [your]76-sissy continuance at [the school]313-the school any longer would be useless . ’[71-tom] ‘ [I]76-sissy am afraid it would , [sir]2771-sir , ’[76-sissy] [Sissy]76-sissy answered with a curtsey . ‘ [I]71-tom can not disguise from [you]76-sissy , [Jupe]76-sissy , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , knitting [his]71-tom brow , ‘ that the result of [your]76-sissy probation there has disappointed [me]71-tom ; has greatly disappointed [me]71-tom . [You]76-sissy have not acquired , under [Mr.]3499-mr. and [Mrs. M’Choakumchild]141-mrs. m’choakumchild , anything like that amount of exact knowledge which [I]71-tom looked for . [You]76-sissy are extremely deficient in [your]76-sissy facts . [Your]76-sissy acquaintance with figures is very limited . [You]76-sissy are altogether backward , and below the mark . ’[71-tom] ‘ [I]71-tom am sorry , [sir]2771-sir , ’[71-tom] [she]76-sissy returned ; ‘ but [I]71-tom know it is quite true . Yet [I]71-tom have tried hard , [sir]2771-sir . ’[71-tom] ‘ Yes , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , ‘ yes , [I]71-tom believe [you]76-sissy have tried hard ; [I]71-tom have observed [you]76-sissy , and [I]71-tom can find no fault in that respect . ’[71-tom] ‘ Thank [you]71-tom , [sir]2771-sir . [I]71-tom have thought sometimes ; ’[71-tom] [Sissy]76-sissy very timid here ; ‘ that perhaps [I]71-tom tried to learn too much , and that if [I]71-tom had asked to be allowed to try a little less , [I]71-tom might have — ’[71-tom] ‘ No , [Jupe]76-sissy , no , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , shaking [his]71-tom head in [his]71-tom profoundest and most eminently practical way . ‘ No . The course [you]76-sissy pursued , [you]76-sissy pursued according to the system — the system — and there is no more to be said about it . [I]71-tom can only suppose that the circumstances of [your]76-sissy early life were too unfavourable to the development of [your]76-sissy reasoning powers , and that [we]3503-we began too late . Still , as [I]71-tom have said already , [I]71-tom am disappointed . ’[71-tom] ‘ [I]71-tom wish [I]71-tom could have made a better acknowledgment , [sir]2771-sir , of [your]2771-sir kindness to [a poor forlorn girl who had no claim upon [you]2771-sir , and of [your]2771-sir protection of [her]3506-her]3505-a poor forlorn girl who had no claim upon you , and of your protection of her . ’[71-tom] ‘ Do n’t shed tears , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom . ‘ Do n’t shed tears . [I]71-tom do n’t complain of [you]76-sissy . [You]76-sissy are [an affectionate , earnest , good young woman]3507-an affectionate , earnest , good young woman — and — and [we]3503-we must make that do . ’[71-tom] ‘ Thank [you]2771-sir , [sir]2771-sir , very much , ’[76-sissy] said [Sissy]76-sissy , with a grateful curtsey . ‘ [You]76-sissy are useful to [Mrs. Gradgrind]95-mrs. gradgrind , and ( in a generally pervading way ) [you]76-sissy are serviceable in [the family]3509-the family also ; so [I]71-tom understand from [Miss Louisa]92-louisa , and , indeed , so [I]71-tom have observed [myself]71-tom . [I]71-tom therefore hope , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , ‘ that [you]76-sissy can make [yourself]76-sissy happy in those relations . ’[71-tom] ‘ [I]71-tom should have nothing to wish , [sir]2771-sir , if — ’[71-tom] ‘ [I]71-tom understand [you]76-sissy , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom ; ‘ [you]76-sissy still refer to [[your]76-sissy father]2783-your father . [I]71-tom have heard from [Miss Louisa]92-louisa that [you]76-sissy still preserve that bottle . Well ! If [your]76-sissy training in the science of arriving at exact results had been more successful , [you]76-sissy would have been wiser on these points . [I]71-tom will say no more . ’[71-tom] [He]71-tom really liked [Sissy]76-sissy too well to have a contempt for [her]76-sissy ; otherwise [he]71-tom held [her]76-sissy calculating powers in such very slight estimation that [he]71-tom must have fallen upon that conclusion . Somehow or other , [he]71-tom had become possessed by an idea that there was something in [this girl]435-this girl which could hardly be set forth in a tabular form . [Her]76-sissy capacity of definition might be easily stated at a very low figure , [her]76-sissy mathematical knowledge at nothing ; yet [he]71-tom was not sure that if [he]71-tom had been required , for example , to tick [her]76-sissy off into columns in a parliamentary return , [he]71-tom would have quite known how to divide [her]76-sissy . In some stages of [his]71-tom manufacture of the human fabric , the processes of Time are very rapid . [Young Thomas]71-tom and [Sissy]76-sissy being both at such a stage of [their]982-their working up , these changes were effected in a year or two ; while [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom [himself]71-tom seemed stationary in [his]71-tom course , and underwent no alteration . Except one , which was apart from [his]71-tom necessary progress through [the mill]975-the mill . Time hustled [him]71-tom into a little noisy and rather dirty machinery , in a by - comer , and made [him]71-tom Member of [Parliament]984-parliament for [Coketown]4-coketown : one of [the respected members for ounce weights and measures]985-the respected members for ounce weights and measures , one of [the representatives of the multiplication table]986-the representatives of the multiplication table , one of [the deaf honourable gentlemen]987-the deaf honourable gentlemen , [dumb honourable gentlemen]988-dumb honourable gentlemen , [blind honourable gentlemen]989-blind honourable gentlemen , [lame honourable gentlemen]990-lame honourable gentlemen , [dead honourable gentlemen]991-dead honourable gentlemen , to every other consideration . Else wherefore live [we]992-we in [a Christian land]993-a christian land , eighteen hundred and odd years after [[our]992-we Master]994-our master ? All this while , [Louisa]92-louisa had been passing on , so quiet and reserved , and so much given to watching the bright ashes at twilight as they fell into [the grate]995-the grate , and became extinct , that from the period when [[her]92-louisa father]2855-her father had said [she]92-louisa was almost [a young woman]3495-a young woman — which seemed but yesterday — [she]92-louisa had scarcely attracted [his]2855-her father notice again , when [he]2855-her father found [her]92-louisa quite [a young woman]3495-a young woman . ‘ Quite [a young woman]3495-a young woman , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , musing . ‘ Dear [me]71-tom ! ’[71-tom] Soon after this discovery , [he]2855-her father became more thoughtful than usual for several days , and seemed much engrossed by one subject . On a certain night , when [he]2855-her father was going out , and [Louisa]92-louisa came to bid [him]2855-her father good - bye before [his]2855-her father departure — as [he]2855-her father was not to be [home]2856-home until late and [she]92-louisa would not see [him]2855-her father again until the morning — [he]2855-her father held [her]92-louisa in [his]2855-her father arms , looking at [her]92-louisa in [his]2855-her father kindest manner , and said : ‘ [[My]2855-her father dear]601-my dear [Louisa]92-louisa , [you]92-louisa are [a woman]3397-a woman ! ’[2855-her father] [She]92-louisa answered with the old , quick , searching look of the night when [she]92-louisa was found at [the Circus]407-the circus ; then cast down [her]92-louisa eyes . ‘ Yes , [father]2781-father . ’[92-louisa] ‘ [[My]71-tom dear]601-my dear , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , ‘ [I]71-tom must speak with [you]92-louisa alone and seriously . Come to [me]71-tom in [[my]71-tom room]3517-my room after breakfast to - morrow , will [you]92-louisa ? ’[71-tom] ‘ Yes , [father]2781-father . ’[92-louisa] ‘ [Your]92-louisa hands are rather cold , [Louisa]92-louisa . Are [you]92-louisa not well ? ’[92-louisa] ‘ Quite well , [father]2781-father . ’[71-tom] ‘ And cheerful ? ’[92-louisa] [She]92-louisa looked at [him]71-tom again , and smiled in [her]92-louisa peculiar manner . ‘ [I]92-louisa am as cheerful , [father]2781-father , as [I]92-louisa usually am , or usually have been . ’[92-louisa] ‘ That ’s well , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom . So , [he]71-tom kissed [her]92-louisa and went away ; and [Louisa]92-louisa returned to [the serene apartment of]1001-the serene apartment of [the hair - cutting character]1002-the hair - cutting character , and leaning [her]92-louisa elbow on [her]92-louisa hand , looked again at the short - lived sparks that so soon subsided into ashes . ‘ Are [you]92-louisa there , [Loo]101-loo ? ’[2932-her brother] said [[her]92-louisa brother]2932-her brother , looking in at the door . [He]2932-her brother was quite [a young gentleman of pleasure]1004-a young gentleman of pleasure now , and not quite [a prepossessing one]1005-a prepossessing one . ‘ Dear [Tom]71-tom , ’[92-louisa] [she]92-louisa answered , rising and embracing [him]2932-her brother , ‘ how long it is since [you]2932-her brother have been to see [me]92-louisa ! ’[92-louisa] ‘ Why , [I]2932-her brother have been otherwise engaged , [Loo]101-loo , in the evenings ; and in the daytime [old Bounderby]101-loo has been keeping [me]2932-her brother at it rather . But [I]2932-her brother touch [him]2932-her brother up with [you]71-tom when [he]2932-her brother comes it too strong , and so [we]3521-we preserve an understanding . [I]2932-her brother say ! Has [father]2781-father said anything particular to [you]71-tom to - day or yesterday , [Loo]101-loo ? ’[2932-her brother] ‘ No , [Tom]71-tom . But [he]2781-father told [me]92-louisa to - night that [he]2781-father wished to do so in the morning . ’[92-louisa] ‘ Ah ! That ’s what [I]71-tom mean , ’[71-tom] said [Tom]71-tom . ‘ Do [you]71-tom know where [he]2781-father is to - night ? ’[71-tom] — with a very deep expression . ‘ No . ’[71-tom] ‘ Then [I]1006-i ’ll tell [you]71-tom . [He]2781-father ’s with [old Bounderby]101-loo . [They]3523-they are having a regular confab together up at [the Bank]3524-the bank . Why at [the Bank]3524-the bank , do [you]71-tom think ? Well , [I]1006-i ’ll tell [you]71-tom again . To keep [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit ’s ears as far off as possible , [I]1006-i expect . ’[1006-i] With [her]1006-i hand upon [[her]1006-i brother]2932-her brother ’s shoulder , [Louisa]92-louisa still stood looking at the fire . [[Her]1006-i brother]2932-her brother glanced at [her]92-louisa face with greater interest than usual , and , encircling [her]92-louisa waist with [his]2932-her brother arm , drew [her]92-louisa coaxingly to [him]2932-her brother . ‘ [You]71-tom are very fond of [me]2932-her brother , an’t [you]71-tom , [Loo]101-loo ? ’[2932-her brother] ‘ Indeed [I]2932-her brother am , [Tom]71-tom , though [you]71-tom do let such long intervals go by without coming to see [me]2932-her brother . ’[2932-her brother] ‘ Well , sister of [mine]71-tom , ’[71-tom] said [Tom]71-tom , ‘ when [you]92-louisa say that , [you]92-louisa are near [my]71-tom thoughts . [We]3526-we might be so much oftener together — might n’t [we]3526-we ? Always together , almost — might n’t [we]3526-we ? It would do [me]71-tom a great deal of good if [you]92-louisa were to make up [your]92-louisa mind to [I]71-tom know what , [Loo]101-loo . It would be a splendid thing for [me]71-tom . It would be uncommonly jolly ! ’[71-tom] [Her]1009-i thoughtfulness baffled [his]71-tom cunning scrutiny . [He]71-tom could make nothing of [her]1009-i face . [He]71-tom pressed [her]1009-i in [his]71-tom arm , and kissed [her]1009-i cheek . [She]1009-i returned the kiss , but still looked at the fire . ‘ [I]1009-i say , [Loo]101-loo ! [I]1009-i thought [I]1009-i ’d come , and just hint to [you]101-loo what was going on : though [I]1009-i supposed [you]101-loo ’d most likely guess , even if [you]101-loo did n’t know . [I]1009-i ca n’t stay , because [I]1009-i ’m[1009-i] engaged to [some fellows]1010-some fellows to - night . [You]71-tom wo n’t forget how fond [you]71-tom are of [me]0-i ? ’ ‘[71-tom] No , dear [Tom]71-tom , [I]0-i wo n’t forget . ’ ‘[0-i] That ’s [a capital girl]1011-a capital girl , ’ said [Tom]71-tom . ‘[0-i] Good - bye , [Loo]101-loo . ’ [She]1009-i gave [him]71-tom an affectionate good - night , and went out with [him]71-tom to the door , whence the fires of [Coketown]4-coketown could be seen , making the distance lurid . [She]1009-i stood there , looking steadfastly towards [them]3527-them , and listening to [his]71-tom departing steps . [They]3527-them retreated quickly , as glad to get away from [Stone Lodge]3-stone lodge ; and [she]1009-i stood there yet , when [he]71-tom was gone and all was quiet . It seemed as if , first in [her]1009-i own fire within [the house]2918-the house , and then in the fiery haze without , [she]1009-i tried to discover what kind of woof Old Time , [that greatest and longest - established Spinner of all]3529-that greatest and longest - established spinner of all , would weave from the threads [he]71-tom had already spun into [a woman]3397-a woman . But [[his]71-tom factory]3531-his factory is [a secret place]3532-a secret place , [his]71-tom work is noiseless , and [his]71-tom Hands are mutes . Although [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom did not take after [Blue Beard]154-blue beard , [[his]71-tom room]945-his room was quite [a blue chamber in [its]945-his room abundance of blue books]3534-a blue chamber in its abundance of blue books . Whatever [they]154-blue beard could prove ( which is usually anything [you]3535-you like ) , [they]154-blue beard proved [there]425-there , in an army constantly strengthening by the arrival of [new recruits]3537-new recruits . In [that charmed apartment]3538-that charmed apartment , the most complicated social questions were cast up , got into exact totals , and finally settled — if [those concerned]3539-those concerned could only have been brought to know it . As if [an astronomical observatory]3540-an astronomical observatory should be made without any windows , and [the astronomer within]3541-the astronomer within should arrange [the starry universe]3542-the starry universe solely by pen , ink , and paper , so [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , in [[his]71-tom Observatory]3543-his observatory ( and there are many like [it]3543-his observatory ) , had no need to cast an eye upon [the teeming myriads of [human beings]3545-human beings around [him]71-tom]3544-the teeming myriads of human beings around him , but could settle all [their]3544-the teeming myriads of human beings around him destinies on a slate , and wipe out all [their]3544-the teeming myriads of human beings around him tears with one dirty little bit of sponge . To [this Observatory]3546-this observatory , then : [a stern room]3547-a stern room , with a deadly statistical clock in it , which measured every second with a beat like a rap upon a coffin - lid ; [Louisa]92-louisa repaired on the appointed morning . A window looked towards [Coketown]4-coketown ; and when [she]92-louisa sat down near [[her]92-louisa father]2855-her father ’s table , [she]92-louisa saw the high chimneys and the long tracts of smoke looming in the heavy distance gloomily . ‘[101-loo] [[My]0-i dear]601-my dear [Louisa]92-louisa , ’ said [[her]92-louisa father]2855-her father , ‘[101-loo] [I]0-i prepared [you]92-louisa last night to give [me]0-i [your]92-louisa serious attention in the conversation [we]1013-we are now going to have together . [You]92-louisa have been so well trained , and [you]92-louisa do , [I]0-i am happy to say , so much justice to the education [you]92-louisa have received , that [I]0-i have perfect confidence in [your]92-louisa good sense . [You]92-louisa are not impulsive , [you]92-louisa are not romantic , [you]92-louisa are accustomed to view everything from the strong dispassionate ground of reason and calculation . From that ground alone , [I]0-i know [you]92-louisa will view and consider what [I]0-i am going to communicate . ’ [He]0-i waited , as if [he]0-i would have been glad that [she]92-louisa said something . But [she]92-louisa said never a word . ‘[92-louisa] [Louisa]92-louisa , [[my]0-i dear]601-my dear , [you]92-louisa are the subject of a proposal of marriage that has been made to [me]0-i . ’ Again [he]0-i waited , and again [she]92-louisa answered not one word . This so far surprised [him]0-i , as to induce [him]0-i gently to repeat , ‘[92-louisa] a proposal of marriage , [[my]0-i dear]601-my dear . ’ To which [she]92-louisa returned , without any visible emotion whatever : ‘[92-louisa] [I]0-i hear [you]0-i , [father]2781-father . [I]0-i am attending , [I]0-i assure [you]0-i . ’ ‘[0-i] Well ! ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , breaking into a smile , after being for the moment at a loss , ‘[92-louisa] [you]92-louisa are even more dispassionate than [I]0-i expected , [Louisa]92-louisa . Or , perhaps , [you]92-louisa are not unprepared for the announcement [I]0-i have it in charge to make ? ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i can not say that , [father]2781-father , until [I]0-i hear it . Prepared or unprepared , [I]0-i wish to hear it all from [you]0-i . [I]0-i wish to hear [you]0-i state it to [me]0-i , [father]2781-father . ’ Strange to relate , [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom was not so collected at this moment as [[his]71-tom daughter]2865-his daughter was . [He]71-tom took a paper - knife in [his]71-tom hand , turned it over , laid it down , took it up again , and even then had to look along the blade of it , considering how to go on . ‘[0-i] What [you]92-louisa say , [[my]0-i dear]601-my dear [Louisa]92-louisa , is perfectly reasonable . [I]0-i have undertaken then to let [you]92-louisa know that — in short , that [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby has informed [me]0-i that [he]93-mr. bounderby has long watched [your]92-louisa progress with particular interest and pleasure , and has long hoped that the time might ultimately arrive when [he]93-mr. bounderby should offer [you]92-louisa [his]93-mr. bounderby hand in marriage . That time , to which [he]93-mr. bounderby has so long , and certainly with great constancy , looked forward , is now come . [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby has made [his]93-mr. bounderby proposal of marriage to [me]0-i , and has entreated [me]0-i to make it known to [you]92-louisa , and to express [his]93-mr. bounderby hope that [you]92-louisa will take it into [your]92-louisa favourable consideration . ’ Silence between [them]3551-them . The deadly statistical clock very hollow . The distant smoke very black and heavy . ‘[93-mr. bounderby] [Father]108-father , ’ said [Louisa]92-louisa , ‘[108-father] do [you]108-father think [I]0-i love [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ? ’ [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom was extremely discomfited by this unexpected question . ‘[108-father] Well , [[my]0-i child]1020-my child , ’ [he]0-i returned , ‘[0-i] [I]0-i — really — can not take upon [myself]0-i to say . ’ ‘[0-i] [Father]2781-father , ’ pursued [Louisa]92-louisa in exactly the same voice as before , ‘[108-father] do [you]108-father ask [me]0-i to love [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ? ’ ‘[108-father] [[My]0-i dear]601-my dear [Louisa]92-louisa , no . No . [I]0-i ask nothing . ’ ‘[0-i] [Father]2781-father , ’ [she]92-louisa still pursued , ‘[2781-father] does [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ask [me]0-i to love [him]93-mr. bounderby ? ’ ‘[93-mr. bounderby] Really , [[my]0-i dear]601-my dear , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , ‘[93-mr. bounderby] it is difficult to answer [your]601-my dear question — ’ ‘[601-my dear] Difficult to answer it , Yes or No , [father]2781-father ? ‘ Certainly , [[my]2781-father dear]601-my dear . Because ; ’[2781-father] here was something to demonstrate , and it set [him]2781-father up again ; ‘ because the reply depends so materially , [Louisa]92-louisa , on the sense in which [we]3553-we use the expression . Now , [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby does not do [you]92-louisa the injustice , and does not do [himself]93-mr. bounderby the injustice , of pretending to anything fanciful , fantastic , or ( [I]2781-father am using synonymous terms ) sentimental . [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby would have seen [you]92-louisa grow up under [his]93-mr. bounderby eyes , to very little purpose , if [he]93-mr. bounderby could so far forget what is due to [your]92-louisa good sense , not to say to [his]93-mr. bounderby , as to address [you]92-louisa from any such ground . Therefore , perhaps the expression itself — [I]2781-father merely suggest this to [you]92-louisa , [[my]2781-father dear]601-my dear — may be a little misplaced . ’[2781-father] ‘ What would [you]71-tom advise [me]601-my dear to use in its stead , [father]2781-father ? ’[601-my dear] ‘ Why , [[my]71-tom dear]601-my dear [Louisa]92-louisa , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , completely recovered by this time , ‘ [I]71-tom would advise [you]92-louisa ( since [you]92-louisa ask [me]71-tom ) to consider this question , as [you]92-louisa have been accustomed to consider every other question , simply as one of tangible Fact . [The ignorant]3557-the ignorant and the giddy may embarrass [such subjects]3558-such subjects with irrelevant fancies , and other absurdities that have no existence , properly viewed — really no existence — but it is no compliment to [you]92-louisa to say , that [you]92-louisa know better . Now , what are the Facts of this case ? [You]92-louisa are , [we]3559-we will say in round numbers , twenty years of age ; [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby is , [we]3559-we will say in round numbers , fifty . There is some disparity in [your]92-louisa respective years , but in [your]92-louisa means and positions there is none ; on the contrary , there is a great suitability . Then the question arises , Is this one disparity sufficient to operate as a bar to such a marriage ? In considering this question , it is not unimportant to take into account the statistics of marriage , so far as they have yet been obtained , in [England]1-england and [Wales]25-wales . [I]71-tom find , on reference to the figures , that a large proportion of these marriages are contracted between [parties of very unequal ages]3560-parties of very unequal ages , and that [the elder of these contracting parties]3561-the elder of these contracting parties is , in rather more than three - fourths of these instances , [the bridegroom]3562-the bridegroom . It is remarkable as showing the wide prevalence of this law , that among [the natives of [the British]3564-the british possessions in [India]26-india]3563-the natives of the british possessions in india , also in [a considerable part of [China]27-china]3565-a considerable part of china , and among [the Calmucks of [Tartary]28-tartary]3566-the calmucks of tartary , the best means of computation yet furnished [us]3559-we by [travellers]3567-travellers , yield similar results . The disparity [I]71-tom have mentioned , therefore , almost ceases to be disparity , and ( virtually ) all but disappears . ’[71-tom] ‘ What do [you]2855-her father recommend , [father]2781-father , ’[92-louisa] asked [Louisa]92-louisa , [her]92-louisa reserved composure not in the least affected by these gratifying results , ‘ that [I]92-louisa should substitute for the term [I]92-louisa used just now ? For the misplaced expression ? ’[92-louisa] ‘ [Louisa]92-louisa , ’[2855-her father] returned [[her]92-louisa father]2855-her father , ‘ it appears to [me]2855-her father that nothing can be plainer . Confining [yourself]92-louisa rigidly to Fact , the question of Fact [you]92-louisa state to [yourself]92-louisa is : Does [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ask [me]2855-her father to marry [him]93-mr. bounderby ? Yes , [he]93-mr. bounderby does . The sole remaining question then is : Shall [I]2855-her father marry [him]93-mr. bounderby ? [I]2855-her father think nothing can be plainer than that ? ’[2855-her father] ‘ Shall [I]92-louisa marry [him]93-mr. bounderby ? ’[92-louisa] repeated [Louisa]92-louisa , with great deliberation . ‘ Precisely . And it is satisfactory to [me]92-louisa , as [[your]92-louisa father]2783-your father , [[my]92-louisa dear]601-my dear [Louisa]92-louisa , to know that [you]92-louisa do not come to the consideration of that question with the previous habits of mind , and habits of life , that belong to [many young women]3571-many young women . ’[92-louisa] ‘ No , [father]2781-father , ’[92-louisa] [she]92-louisa returned , ‘ [I]92-louisa do not . ’[92-louisa] ‘ [I]71-tom now leave [you]92-louisa to judge for [yourself]92-louisa , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom . ‘ [I]71-tom have stated the case , as such cases are usually stated among practical minds ; [I]71-tom have stated it , as the case of [[your]92-louisa mother]3258-your mother and [myself]71-tom was stated in its time . The rest , [[my]71-tom dear]601-my dear [Louisa]92-louisa , is for [you]92-louisa to decide . ’[71-tom] From the beginning , [she]92-louisa had sat looking at [him]71-tom fixedly . As [he]71-tom now leaned back in [his]71-tom chair , and bent [his]71-tom deep - set eyes upon [her]92-louisa in [his]71-tom turn , perhaps [he]71-tom might have seen one wavering moment in [her]92-louisa , when [she]92-louisa was impelled to throw [herself]92-louisa upon [his]71-tom breast , and give [him]71-tom the pent - up confidences of [her]92-louisa heart . But , to see it , [he]71-tom must have overleaped at a bound the artificial barriers [he]71-tom had for many years been erecting , between [himself]71-tom and all those subtle essences of humanity which will elude the utmost cunning of algebra until the last trumpet ever to be sounded shall blow even algebra to wreck . The barriers were too many and too high for such a leap . With [his]71-tom unbending , utilitarian , matter - of - fact face , [he]71-tom hardened [her]92-louisa again ; and the moment shot away into the plumbless depths of the past , to mingle with all the lost opportunities that are drowned there . Removing [her]92-louisa eyes from [him]71-tom , [she]92-louisa sat so long looking silently towards [the town]2838-the town , that [he]71-tom said , at length : ‘ Are [you]92-louisa consulting the chimneys of [the Coketown works]3575-the coketown works , [Louisa]92-louisa ? ’[71-tom] ‘ There seems to be nothing there but languid and monotonous smoke . Yet when the night comes , Fire bursts out , [father]2781-father ! ’[92-louisa] [she]92-louisa answered , turning quickly . ‘ Of course [I]92-louisa know that , [Louisa]92-louisa . [I]92-louisa do not see the application of the remark . ’[92-louisa] To do [him]71-tom justice [he]71-tom did not , at all . [She]92-louisa passed it away with a slight motion of [her]92-louisa hand , and concentrating [her]92-louisa attention upon [him]71-tom again , said , ‘ [Father]108-father , [I]92-louisa have often thought that life is very short . ’[92-louisa] — This was so distinctly one of [[his]71-tom subjects]1028-his subjects that [he]71-tom interposed . ‘ It is short , no doubt , [[my]92-louisa dear]601-my dear . Still , the average duration of human life is proved to have increased of late years . The calculations of various life assurance and annuity offices , among other figures which can not go wrong , have established the fact . ’[92-louisa] ‘ [I]92-louisa speak of [my]92-louisa own life , [father]2781-father . ’[92-louisa] ‘ O indeed ? Still , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , ‘ [I]71-tom need not point out to [you]92-louisa , [Louisa]92-louisa , that it is governed by the laws which govern lives in the aggregate . ’[71-tom] ‘ While it lasts , [I]92-louisa would wish to do the little [I]92-louisa can , and the little [I]92-louisa am fit for . What does it matter ? ’[92-louisa] [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom seemed rather at a loss to understand the last four words ; replying , ‘ How , matter ? What matter , [[my]71-tom dear]601-my dear ? ’[71-tom] ‘ [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , ’[1029-i] [she]1029-i went on in a steady , straight way , without regarding this , ‘ asks [me]1029-i to marry [him]93-mr. bounderby . The question [I]1029-i have to ask [myself]1029-i is , shall [I]1029-i marry [him]93-mr. bounderby ? That is so , [father]2781-father , is it not ? [You]2781-father have told [me]1029-i so , [father]2781-father . Have [you]2781-father not ? ’[1029-i] ‘ Certainly , [[my]92-louisa dear]601-my dear . ’[92-louisa] ‘ Let it be so . Since [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby likes to take [me]1029-i thus , [I]1029-i am satisfied to accept [his]93-mr. bounderby proposal . Tell [him]93-mr. bounderby , [father]2781-father , as soon as [you]2781-father please , that this was [my]1029-i answer . Repeat it , word for word , if [you]2781-father can , because [I]1029-i should wish [him]93-mr. bounderby to know what [I]1029-i said . ’[1029-i] ‘ It is quite right , [[my]2855-her father dear]601-my dear , ’[2855-her father] retorted [[her]1030-her father]2855-her father approvingly , ‘ to be exact . [I]2855-her father will observe [your]1030-her very proper request . Have [you]1030-her any wish in reference to the period of [your]1030-her marriage , [[my]2855-her father child]1020-my child ? ’[2855-her father] ‘ None , [father]2781-father . What does it matter ! ’[71-tom] [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom had drawn [his]71-tom chair a little nearer to [her]1030-her , and taken [her]1030-her hand . But , [her]1030-her repetition of these words seemed to strike with some little discord on [his]71-tom ear . [He]71-tom paused to look at [her]1030-her , and , still holding [her]1030-her hand , said : ‘ [Louisa]92-louisa , [I]71-tom have not considered it essential to ask [you]1030-her one question , because the possibility implied in it appeared to [me]71-tom to be too remote . But perhaps [I]71-tom ought to do so . [You]1030-her have never entertained in secret any other proposal ? ’[71-tom] ‘ [Father]108-father , ’[1030-her] [she]1030-her returned , almost scornfully , ‘ what other proposal can have been made to [me]1030-her ? Whom have [I]1030-her seen ? Where have [I]1030-her been ? What are [my]1030-her heart ’s experiences ? ’[1030-her] ‘ [[My]71-tom dear]601-my dear [Louisa]92-louisa , ’[71-tom] returned [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , reassured and satisfied . ‘ [You]1030-her correct [me]71-tom justly . [I]71-tom merely wished to discharge [my]71-tom duty . ’[71-tom] ‘ What do [I]92-louisa know , [father]2781-father , ’[92-louisa] said [Louisa]92-louisa in [her]1030-her quiet manner , ‘ of tastes and fancies ; of aspirations and affections ; of all that part of [my]92-louisa nature in which such light things might have been nourished ? What escape have [I]92-louisa had from problems that could be demonstrated , and realities that could be grasped ? ’[92-louisa] As [she]1030-her said it , [she]1030-her unconsciously closed [her]1030-her hand , as if upon a solid object , and slowly opened it as though [she]1030-her were releasing dust or ash . ‘ [[My]1030-her dear]601-my dear , ’[1030-her] assented [[her]1030-her eminently practical parent]1032-her eminently practical parent , ‘ quite true , quite true . ’[1030-her] ‘ Why , [father]2781-father , ’[1030-her] [she]1030-her pursued , ‘ what a strange question to ask [me]1030-her ! The baby - preference that even [I]1030-her have heard of as common among [children]2848-children , has never had its innocent resting - place in [my]1030-her breast . [You]2781-father have been so careful of [me]1030-her , that [I]1030-her never had [a child]436-a child ’s heart . [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby is [a very remarkable man]3600-a very remarkable man ; and what little disparity can be said to exist between [you]2865-his daughter — if any — is more than counterbalanced by the tone [your]2865-his daughter mind has acquired . Well , [I]95-mrs. gradgrind ’m[95-mrs. gradgrind] sure [I]0-i hope [your]1036-the esteemed lady with no nonsense about her health may be good , [Louisa]92-louisa ; for if [your]1036-the esteemed lady with no nonsense about her head begins to split as soon as [you]1036-the esteemed lady with no nonsense about her are married , which was the case with [mine]0-i , [I]0-i can not consider that [you]1036-the esteemed lady with no nonsense about her are to be envied , though [I]0-i have no doubt [you]1036-the esteemed lady with no nonsense about her think [you]1036-the esteemed lady with no nonsense about her are , as [all girls]1038-all girls do .
