Why , [you]167-mr. harthouse wo n’t tell [me]71-tom , [Mr. Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse , that [you]167-mr. harthouse really suppose [[my]71-tom sister]738-my sister [Loo]101-loo does care for [old Bounderby]101-loo . ’[71-tom] ‘ [[My]287-the other dear fellow]3799-my dear fellow , ’[287-the other] returned [the other]287-the other , ‘ what am [I]287-the other bound to suppose , when [I]287-the other find [two married people living in harmony and happiness]3800-two married people living in harmony and happiness ? ’[287-the other] [Tom]71-tom had by this time got both [his]71-tom legs on the sofa . If [his]71-tom second leg had not been already there when [he]71-tom was called [a dear fellow]1413-a dear fellow , [he]71-tom would have put it up at that great stage of the conversation . Feeling it necessary to do something then , [he]71-tom stretched [himself]71-tom out at greater length , and , reclining with the back of [his]71-tom head on the end of the sofa , and smoking with an infinite assumption of negligence , turned [his]71-tom common face , and not too sober eyes , towards the face looking down upon [him]71-tom so carelessly yet so potently . ‘ [You]3801-you know [[our]3802-our governor]3803-our governor , [Mr. Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse , ’[71-tom] said [Tom]71-tom , ‘ and therefore , [you]3801-you need n’t be surprised that [Loo]101-loo married [old Bounderby]101-loo . [She]101-loo never had [a lover]3804-a lover , and [the governor]3805-the governor proposed [old Bounderby]101-loo , and [she]101-loo took [him]3804-a lover . ’[71-tom] ‘ Very dutiful in [[your]167-mr. harthouse interesting sister]3806-your interesting sister , ’[167-mr. harthouse] said [Mr. James Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse . ‘ Yes , but [she]101-loo would n’t have been as dutiful , and it would not have come off as easily , ’[1387-the whelp] returned [the whelp]1387-the whelp , ‘ if it had n’t been for [me]1387-the whelp . ’[1387-the whelp] [The tempter]1415-the tempter merely lifted [his]1415-the tempter eyebrows ; but [the whelp]1387-the whelp was obliged to go on . ‘ [I]1387-the whelp persuaded [her]101-loo , ’[1387-the whelp] [he]1387-the whelp said , with an edifying air of superiority . ‘ [I]1387-the whelp was stuck into [old [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ’s bank]3807-old bounderby ’s bank ( where [I]1387-the whelp never wanted to be ) , and [I]1387-the whelp knew [I]1387-the whelp should get into scrapes there , if [she]101-loo put [old Bounderby]101-loo ’s pipe out ; so [I]1387-the whelp told [her]101-loo [my]1387-the whelp wishes , and [she]101-loo came into them . [She]101-loo would do anything for [me]1387-the whelp . It was very game of [her]101-loo , was n’t it ? ’[1387-the whelp] ‘ It was charming , [Tom]71-tom ! ’[1387-the whelp] ‘ Not that it was altogether so important to [her]101-loo as it was to [me]71-tom , ’[71-tom] continued [Tom]71-tom coolly , ‘ because [my]71-tom liberty and comfort , and perhaps [my]71-tom getting on , depended on it ; and [she]101-loo had [no other lover]3808-no other lover , and staying at [home]2856-home was like staying in [jail]3810-jail — especially when [I]71-tom was gone . It was n’t as if [she]101-loo gave up [another lover]3811-another lover for [old Bounderby]101-loo ; but still it was a good thing in [her]101-loo . ’[71-tom] ‘ Perfectly delightful . And [she]101-loo gets on so placidly . ’[1387-the whelp] ‘ Oh , ’[71-tom] returned [Tom]71-tom , with contemptuous patronage , ‘ [she]101-loo ’s [a regular girl]3812-a regular girl . [A girl]726-a girl can get on anywhere . [She]101-loo has settled down to the life , and [she]101-loo do n’t mind . [It]3814-it does just as well as another . Besides , though [Loo]101-loo is [a girl]726-a girl , [she]101-loo ’s not [a common sort of girl]3816-a common sort of girl . [She]101-loo can shut [herself]101-loo up within [herself]101-loo , and think — as [I]71-tom have often known [her]101-loo sit and watch the fire — for an hour at a stretch . ’[71-tom] ‘ Ay , ay ? Has resources of [her]101-loo own , ’[167-mr. harthouse] said [Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse , smoking quietly . ‘ Not so much of that as [you]167-mr. harthouse may suppose , ’[71-tom] returned [Tom]71-tom ; ‘ for [[our]3817-our governor]3803-our governor had [her]101-loo crammed with all sorts of dry bones and sawdust . It ’s [his]3803-our governor system . ’[71-tom] ‘ Formed [[his]3803-our governor daughter]2865-his daughter on [his]3803-our governor own model ? ’[167-mr. harthouse] suggested [Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse . ‘ [[His]3803-our governor daughter]2865-his daughter ? Ah ! and [everybody else]3821-everybody else . Why , [he]3803-our governor formed [Me]71-tom that way ! ’[71-tom] said [Tom]71-tom . ‘ Impossible ! ’[71-tom] ‘ [He]3803-our governor did , though , ’[71-tom] said [Tom]71-tom , shaking [his]71-tom head . ‘ [I]71-tom mean to say , [Mr. Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse , that when [I]71-tom first left [home]2856-home and went to [old Bounderby ’s]93-mr. bounderby , [I]71-tom was as flat as a warming - pan , and knew no more about life , than any oyster does . ’[71-tom] ‘ Come , [Tom]71-tom ! [I]71-tom can hardly believe that . A joke ’s a joke . ’[71-tom] ‘ Upon [my]1387-the whelp soul ! ’[1387-the whelp] said [the whelp]1387-the whelp . ‘ [I]1387-the whelp am serious ; [I]1387-the whelp am indeed ! ’[1387-the whelp] [He]1387-the whelp smoked with great gravity and dignity for a little while , and then added , in a highly complacent tone , ‘ Oh ! [I]1387-the whelp have picked up a little since . [I]1387-the whelp do n’t deny that . But [I]1387-the whelp have done it [myself]1387-the whelp ; no thanks to [the governor]3805-the governor . ’[1387-the whelp] ‘ And [[your]1387-the whelp intelligent sister]3824-your intelligent sister ? ’[71-tom] ‘ [[My]1387-the whelp intelligent sister]3825-my intelligent sister is about where [she]3825-my intelligent sister was . [She]3825-my intelligent sister used to complain to [me]1387-the whelp that [she]3825-my intelligent sister had nothing to fall back upon , that [girls]2767-girls usually fall back upon ; and [I]1387-the whelp do n’t see how [she]3825-my intelligent sister is to have got over that since . But [she]3825-my intelligent sister do n’t mind , ’[1387-the whelp] [he]1387-the whelp sagaciously added , puffing at [his]1387-the whelp cigar again . ‘ [Girls]2767-girls can always get on , somehow . ’[1387-the whelp] ‘ Calling at [the Bank]3524-the bank yesterday evening , for [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ’s address , [I]167-mr. harthouse found [an ancient lady there]3829-an ancient lady there , who seems to entertain great admiration for [[your]1387-the whelp sister]354-your sister , ’[167-mr. harthouse] observed [Mr. James Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse , throwing away the last small remnant of the cigar [he]1387-the whelp had now smoked out . ‘ [Mother Sparsit]170-mother sparsit ! ’[71-tom] said [Tom]71-tom . ‘ What ! [you]2921-his friend have seen [her]170-mother sparsit already , have [you]2921-his friend ? ’[71-tom] [[His]1387-the whelp friend]2921-his friend nodded . [Tom]71-tom took [his]71-tom cigar out of [his]71-tom mouth , to shut up [his]71-tom eye ( which had grown rather unmanageable ) with the greater expression , and to tap [his]71-tom nose several times with [his]71-tom finger . ‘ [Mother Sparsit]170-mother sparsit ’s feeling for [Loo]101-loo is more than admiration , [I]71-tom should think , ’[71-tom] said [Tom]71-tom . ‘ Say affection and devotion . [Mother Sparsit]170-mother sparsit never set [her]170-mother sparsit cap at [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby when [he]1387-the whelp was [a bachelor]616-a bachelor . Oh no ! ’[71-tom] These were the last words spoken by [the whelp]1387-the whelp , before a giddy drowsiness came upon [him]1387-the whelp , followed by complete oblivion . [He]1387-the whelp was roused from the latter state by an uneasy dream of being stirred up with a boot , and also of a voice saying : ‘ Come , it ’s late . Be off ! ’[71-tom] ‘ Well ! ’[1387-the whelp] [he]1387-the whelp said , scrambling from the sofa . ‘ [I]1387-the whelp must take [my]1387-the whelp leave of [you]1407-his entertainer though . [I]1387-the whelp say . [Yours]1407-his entertainer is very good tobacco . But it ’s too mild . ’[1387-the whelp] ‘ Yes , it ’s too mild , ’[1407-his entertainer] returned [[his]1387-the whelp entertainer]1407-his entertainer . ‘ It ’s — it ’s ridiculously mild , ’[71-tom] said [Tom]71-tom . ‘ Where ’s the door ! Good night ! ’[71-tom] ‘ [He]1387-the whelp had another odd dream of being taken by [a waiter]3832-a waiter through a mist , which , after giving [him]1387-the whelp some trouble and difficulty , resolved itself into [the main street]3833-the main street , in which [he]1387-the whelp stood alone . [He]1387-the whelp then walked [home]2856-home pretty easily , though not yet free from an impression of the presence and influence of [[his]1387-the whelp new friend]1405-his new friend — as if [he]1405-his new friend were lounging somewhere in the air , in the same negligent attitude , regarding [him]1387-the whelp with the same look . [The whelp]1387-the whelp went [home]2856-home , and went to bed . If [he]1387-the whelp had had any sense of what [he]1387-the whelp had done that night , and had been less of [a whelp and more of a brother]3838-a whelp and more of a brother , [he]1387-the whelp might have turned short on [the road]2846-the road , might have gone down to [the ill - smelling river]3840-the ill - smelling river that was dyed black , might have gone to bed in [it]3840-the ill - smelling river for good and all , and have curtained [his]1387-the whelp head for ever with its filthy waters . ‘[1421-my friends] Oh , [[my]0-i friends]1421-my friends , [the down - trodden operatives of [Coketown]4-coketown]1422-the down - trodden operatives of coketown ! Oh , [[my]0-i friends]1421-my friends and [fellow - countrymen]1424-fellow - countrymen , [the slaves of an iron - handed and a grinding despotism]1425-the slaves of an iron - handed and a grinding despotism ! Oh , [[my]0-i friends]1421-my friends and [fellow - sufferers]1427-fellow - sufferers , and [fellow - workmen]1428-fellow - workmen , and [fellow - men]1429-fellow - men ! [I]0-i tell [you]1430-you that the hour is come , when [we]1431-our must rally round [one another]551-one another as One united power , and crumble into dust [the oppressors]1433-the oppressors that too long have battened upon the plunder of [[our]1431-our families]1434-our families , upon the sweat of [our]1431-our brows , upon the labour of [our]1431-our hands , upon the strength of [our]1431-our sinews , upon the God - created glorious rights of Humanity , and upon the holy and eternal privileges of Brotherhood ! ’ ‘[545-men] Good ! ’ ‘[545-men] Hear , hear , hear ! ’ ‘[545-men] Hurrah ! ’ and other cries , arose in many voices from various parts of the densely crowded and suffocatingly close Hall , in which [the orator]3841-the orator , perched on a stage , delivered [himself]3841-the orator of this and what other froth and fume [he]3841-the orator had in [him]3841-the orator . [He]3841-the orator had declaimed [himself]3841-the orator into a violent heat , and was as hoarse as [he]3841-the orator was hot . By dint of roaring at the top of [his]3841-the orator voice under a flaring gaslight , clenching [his]3841-the orator fists , knitting [his]3841-the orator brows , setting [his]3841-the orator teeth , and pounding with [his]3841-the orator arms , [he]3841-the orator had taken so much out of [himself]3841-the orator by this time , that [he]3841-the orator was brought to a stop , and called for a glass of water . As [he]3841-the orator stood there , trying to quench [his]3841-the orator fiery face with [his]3841-the orator drink of water , the comparison between [the orator]3841-the orator and [the crowd of attentive faces]3843-the crowd of attentive faces turned towards [him]3841-the orator , was extremely to [his]3841-the orator disadvantage . Judging [him]3841-the orator by [Nature]171-nature ’s evidence , [he]3841-the orator was above the mass in very little but the stage on which [he]3841-the orator stood . In many great respects [he]3841-the orator was essentially below [them]3844-their . [He]3841-the orator was not so honest , [he]3841-the orator was not so manly , [he]3841-the orator was not so good - humoured ; [he]3841-the orator substituted cunning for [their]3844-their simplicity , and passion for [their]3844-their safe solid sense . [An ill - made , high - shouldered man]3845-an ill - made , high - shouldered man , with lowering brows , and [his]3841-the orator features crushed into an habitually sour expression , [he]3841-the orator contrasted most unfavourably , even in [his]3841-the orator mongrel dress , with the great body of [[his]3841-the orator hearers]3846-his hearers in [their]3846-his hearers plain working clothes . Strange as it always is to consider any assembly in the act of submissively resigning itself to the dreariness of [some complacent person]3847-some complacent person , [lord]3848-lord or [commoner , whom three - fourths of it]3849-commoner , whom three - fourths of it could , by no human means , raise out of the slough of inanity to [their]3844-their own intellectual level , it was particularly strange , and it was even particularly affecting , to see [this crowd of earnest faces , whose honesty in the main [no competent observer free from bias]3851-no competent observer free from bias could doubt , so agitated by [such a leader]3852-such a leader]3850-this crowd of earnest faces , whose honesty in the main no competent observer free from bias could doubt , so agitated by such a leader . Good ! Hear , hear ! Hurrah ! The eagerness both of attention and intention , exhibited in all the countenances , made them a most impressive sight . There was no carelessness , no languor , no idle curiosity ; none of the many shades of indifference to be seen in all other assemblies , visible for one moment there . That [every man]828-every man felt [his]828-every man condition to be , somehow or other , worse than it might be ; that [every man]828-every man considered it incumbent on [him]828-every man to join [the rest]474-the rest , towards the making of it better ; that [every man]828-every man felt [his]828-every man only hope to be in [his]828-every man allying [himself]828-every man to [the comrades by whom [he]828-every man was surrounded]3857-the comrades by whom he was surrounded ; and that in this belief , right or wrong ( unhappily wrong then ) , [the whole of that crowd]3858-the whole of that crowd were gravely , deeply , faithfully in earnest ; must have been as plain to [any one who chose to see what was there , as the bare beams of the roof and the whitened brick walls]3859-any one who chose to see what was there , as the bare beams of the roof and the whitened brick walls . Nor could [any such spectator]3860-any such spectator fail to know in [his]3860-any such spectator own breast , that [these men]3861-these men , through [their]3861-these men very delusions , showed great qualities , susceptible of being turned to the happiest and best account ; and that to pretend ( on the strength of sweeping axioms , howsoever cut and dried ) that [they]3861-these men went astray wholly without cause , and of [their]3861-these men own irrational wills , was to pretend that there could be smoke without fire , death without birth , harvest without seed , anything or everything produced from nothing . [The orator]3841-the orator having refreshed [himself]3841-the orator , wiped [his]3841-the orator corrugated forehead from left to right several times with [his]3841-the orator handkerchief folded into a pad , and concentrated all [his]3841-the orator revived forces , in a sneer of great disdain and bitterness . ‘[545-men] But oh , [[my]0-i friends]1421-my friends and [brothers]1436-brothers ! Oh , [men]545-men and [Englishmen]1438-englishmen , [the down - trodden operatives of [Coketown]4-coketown]1422-the down - trodden operatives of coketown ! What shall [we]1440-we say of [that man]523-that man — [that working - man]1442-that working - man , that [I]0-i should find it necessary so to libel the glorious name — who , being practically and well acquainted with the grievances and wrongs of [you]1443-you , [the injured pith and marrow of [this land]3382-this land]1444-the injured pith and marrow of this land , and having heard [you]1443-you , with a noble and majestic unanimity that will make [Tyrants]1446-tyrants tremble , resolve for to subscribe to the funds of [the United Aggregate Tribunal]1447-the united aggregate tribunal , and to abide by the injunctions issued by [that body]1448-that body for [your]1443-you benefit , whatever they may be — what , [I]0-i ask [you]1443-you , will [you]1443-you say of [that working - man]1442-that working - man , since such [I]0-i must acknowledge [him]1442-that working - man to be , who , at such a time , deserts [his]1442-that working - man post , and sells [his]1442-that working - man flag ; who , at such a time , turns [a traitor]1450-a traitor and [a craven]1451-a craven and a recreant , who , at such a time , is not ashamed to make to [you]1443-you the dastardly and humiliating avowal that [he]1442-that working - man will hold [himself]1442-that working - man aloof , and will not be one of those associated in the gallant stand for Freedom and for Right ? ’ [The assembly]3863-the assembly was divided at this point . There were some groans and hisses , but the general sense of honour was much too strong for the condemnation of [a man]484-a man unheard . ‘[1452-one strong voice] Be sure [you]0-i ’re right , [Slackbridge]172-slackbridge ! ’[1452-one strong voice] ‘ Put [him]1442-that working - man up ! ’[1452-one strong voice] ‘ Let ’s hear [him]1442-that working - man ! ’[1452-one strong voice] Such things were said on many sides . Finally , [one strong voice]1452-one strong voice called out , ‘ Is [the man heer]3865-the man heer ? If [the man]516-the man ’s heer , [Slackbridge]172-slackbridge , let ’s hear [the man himseln , ’[1452-one strong voice] stead o ’ yo]3867-the man himseln , ’ stead o ’ yo . ’[1452-one strong voice] Which was received with a round of applause . [Slackbridge]172-slackbridge , [the orator]3841-the orator , looked about [him]172-slackbridge with a withering smile ; and , holding out [his]172-slackbridge right hand at arm ’s length ( as the manner of all [Slackbridges]173-slackbridges is ) , to still [the thundering sea]1454-the thundering sea , waited until there was a profound silence . ‘ Oh , [[my]172-slackbridge friends]1421-my friends and [fellow - men]1429-fellow - men ! ’[172-slackbridge] said [Slackbridge]172-slackbridge then , shaking [his]172-slackbridge head with violent scorn , ‘ [I]172-slackbridge do not wonder that [you]3870-you , [the prostrate sons of labour]3871-the prostrate sons of labour , are incredulous of the existence of [such a man]3872-such a man . But [he]516-the man who sold [his]516-the man birthright for a mess of pottage existed , and [Judas Iscariot]174-judas iscariot existed , and [Castlereagh]175-castlereagh existed , and [this man]2994-this man exists ! ’[172-slackbridge] Here , a brief press and confusion near the stage , ended in [the man]516-the man [himself]516-the man standing at [the orator]3841-the orator ’s side before [the concourse]1457-the concourse . [He]516-the man was pale and a little moved in the face — [his]516-the man lips especially showed it ; but [he]516-the man stood quiet , with [his]516-the man left hand at [his]516-the man chin , waiting to be heard . There was [a chairman]1458-a chairman to regulate the proceedings , and [this functionary]1459-this functionary now took the case into [his]1459-this functionary own hands . ‘ [[My]516-the man friends]1421-my friends , ’[516-the man] said [he]516-the man , ‘ by virtue o ’[516-the man] [[my]0-i office]3153-my office as [[your]1461-you president]1462-your president , [I]0-i askes [o]1463-o ’ [[our]3875-our friend]3876-our friend [Slackbridge]172-slackbridge , who may be a little over hetter in this business , to take [his]172-slackbridge seat , whiles [this man [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen]3877-this man stephen blackpool is heern . [You]1461-you all know [this man [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen]3877-this man stephen blackpool . [You]1461-you know [him]3877-this man stephen blackpool awlung o ’[516-the man] [his]1464-his misfort’ns , and [his]1464-his good name . ’ With that , [the chairman]3879-the chairman shook [him]172-slackbridge frankly by the hand , and sat down again . [Slackbridge]172-slackbridge likewise sat down , wiping [his]172-slackbridge hot forehead — always from left to right , and never the reverse way . ‘[0-i] [[My]0-i friends]1421-my friends , ’ [Stephen]144-stephen began , in the midst of a dead calm ; ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ha ’ [he]3877-this man stephen blackpool d what ’s been spok’n o ’[172-slackbridge] [me]0-i , and ’ tis lickly that [I]172-slackbridge sha n’t mend it . But [I]172-slackbridge ’d liefer [you]1421-my friends ’d hearn the truth concernin [myseln]3880-myseln , fro [my]172-slackbridge lips than fro onny other man ’s , though [I]172-slackbridge never cud’n speak afore so monny , wi’out bein moydert and muddled . ’[172-slackbridge] [Slackbridge]172-slackbridge shook [his]172-slackbridge head as if [he]172-slackbridge would shake it off , in [his]172-slackbridge bitterness . ‘ [I]1466-i ’m[1466-i] [th]1466-i ’ one single Hand in [Bounderby ’s mill]3881-bounderby ’s mill , [o ’[172-slackbridge] a ’]3882-o ’ a ’ [the men]3089-the men theer , as do n’t coom in wi ’[1466-i] th ’ proposed reg’lations . [I]172-slackbridge canna coom in wi ’[172-slackbridge] ’em . [[My]172-slackbridge friends]1421-my friends , [I]172-slackbridge doubt [their]3089-the men doin’ [yo]1421-my friends onny good . Licker [they]3089-the men ’ll do yo hurt . ’[172-slackbridge] [Slackbridge]172-slackbridge laughed , folded [his]172-slackbridge arms , and frowned sarcastically . ‘ But ’[172-slackbridge] t an’t sommuch for that as [I]0-i stands out . If that were aw , [I]0-i ’d coom in wi ’ th ’[172-slackbridge] rest . But [I]0-i ha ’ [my]172-slackbridge reasons — [mine]172-slackbridge , [yo]1421-my friends see — for being hindered ; not on’y now , but awlus — awlus — life long ! ’[172-slackbridge] [Slackbridge]172-slackbridge jumped up and stood beside [him]172-slackbridge , gnashing and tearing . ‘ Oh , [[my]172-slackbridge friends]1421-my friends , what but this did [I]172-slackbridge tell [you]1421-my friends ? Oh , [[my]172-slackbridge fellow - countrymen]3886-my fellow - countrymen , what warning but this did [I]172-slackbridge give [you]1421-my friends ? And how shows this recreant conduct in [a man on whom unequal laws are known to have fallen heavy]3887-a man on whom unequal laws are known to have fallen heavy ? Oh , [[you]1421-my friends Englishmen]3888-you englishmen , [I]172-slackbridge ask [you]1421-my friends how does this subornation show in one of [yourselves]1421-my friends , who is thus consenting to [his]516-the man own undoing and to [yours]1421-my friends , and to [[your]1421-my friends children]3889-your children ’s and [[your]1421-my friends children]3889-your children ’s children ’s ? ’[172-slackbridge] There was some applause , and some crying of Shame upon [the man]516-the man ; but [the greater part of [the audience]1469-the audience]1468-the greater part of the audience were quiet . [They]1468-the greater part of the audience looked at [Stephen]144-stephen ’s worn face , rendered more pathetic by the homely emotions it evinced ; and , in the kindness of [their]1468-the greater part of the audience nature , [they]1468-the greater part of the audience were more sorry than indignant . ‘ ’[1468-the greater part of the audience] Tis [this Delegate]1470-this delegate ’s trade for t ’ speak , ’[144-stephen] said [Stephen]144-stephen , ‘ an ’[144-stephen] [he]1470-this delegate ’s paid for ’ t , an ’[1468-the greater part of the audience] [he]1470-this delegate knows [his]1470-this delegate work . Let [him]1470-this delegate keep to ’ t. Let [him]1470-this delegate give no heed to what [I]1472-the same strong voice ha had’n to bear . That ’s not for [him]1470-this delegate . That ’s not for nobbody but [me]1472-the same strong voice . ’[1472-the same strong voice] There was a propriety , not to say a dignity in these words , that made [the hearers]1471-the hearers yet more quiet and attentive . [The same strong voice]1472-the same strong voice called out , ‘ [Slackbridge]172-slackbridge , let [the man]516-the man be heern , and how d [thee]172-slackbridge tongue ! ’[1472-the same strong voice] Then [the place]2849-the place was wonderfully still . ‘ [[My]144-stephen brothers]3892-my brothers , ’[144-stephen] said [Stephen]144-stephen , whose low voice was distinctly heard , ‘ and [[my]144-stephen fellow - workmen]3893-my fellow - workmen — for that [yo]3892-my brothers are to [me]144-stephen , though not , as [I]144-stephen knows on , to [this delegate here]3894-this delegate here — [I]144-stephen ha but a word to [sen]3895-sen , and [I]144-stephen could sen nommore if [I]144-stephen was to speak till Strike o ’[144-stephen] day . [I]0-i know weel , aw what ’s afore [me]0-i . [I]0-i know [weel]1474-weel that [yo]1475-yo aw resolve to [ha]1476-ha nommore ado wi ’ [a man who is not wi ’[1474-weel] yo in this matther]3896-a man who is not wi ’ yo in this matther . [I]0-i know weel that if [I]0-i was a lyin parisht [i]0-i ’ [th ’[0-i] road]3897-th ’ road , [yo’d]1475-yo feel it right to pass [me]0-i by , as [a forrenner and stranger]1477-a forrenner and stranger . What [I]0-i ha getn , [I]0-i mun mak th ’ best on . ’[3879-the chairman] ‘ [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen , ’[3879-the chairman] said [the chairman]3879-the chairman , rising , ‘ think on ’[3879-the chairman] t agen . Think on ’ t once agen , [lad]804-lad , afore [thou’rt]3899-thou’rt shunned by [aw owd friends]3900-aw owd friends . ’[3879-the chairman] There was an universal murmur to the same effect , though [no man]1479-no man articulated a word . Every eye was fixed on [Stephen]144-stephen ’s face . To repent of [his]144-stephen determination , would be to take a load from all [their]1480-their minds . [He]144-stephen looked around [him]144-stephen , and knew that it was so . Not a grain of anger with [them]1480-their was in [his]144-stephen heart ; [he]144-stephen knew [them]1480-their , far below [their]1480-their surface weaknesses and misconceptions , as [no one]3086-no one but [[their]1480-their fellow - labourer]1482-their fellow - labourer could . ‘ [I]2771-sir ha thowt on ’[2771-sir] t , above a bit , [sir]2771-sir . [I]0-i simply canna coom in . [I]0-i mun go th ’ way as lays afore [me]0-i . [I]0-i mun tak [my]0-i leave o ’[0-i] aw heer . ’ [He]144-stephen made a sort of reverence to [them]1480-their by holding up [his]144-stephen arms , and stood for the moment in that attitude ; not speaking until [they]1480-their slowly dropped at [his]144-stephen sides . ‘[0-i] [Monny]176-monny ’s the pleasant word as [soom heer]1484-soom heer has spok’n wi ’ [me]1484-soom heer ; [monny]3901-monny ’s the face [I]1484-soom heer see heer , as [I]1484-soom heer first seen when [I]1484-soom heer were yoong and lighter heart’n than now . [I]1484-soom heer ha ’[1484-soom heer] never had [no fratch]1485-no fratch afore , sin ever [I]0-i were born , wi ’ any o ’[0-i] [my]0-i like ; Gonnows [I]0-i ha ’ none now that ’s o ’[0-i] [my]0-i makin ’ . [Yo’ll]0-i ca ’[0-i] [me]0-i traitor and that — [yo]0-i [I]0-i mean t ’ say , ’[0-i] addressing [Slackbridge]172-slackbridge , ‘ but ’[0-i] tis easier to ca ’ than [mak ’]3902-mak ’[0-i] out . So let be . ’ [He]0-i had moved away a pace or two to come down from [the platform]3903-the platform , when [he]0-i remembered something [he]0-i had not said , and returned again . ‘[0-i] Haply , ’ [he]0-i said , turning [his]0-i furrowed face slowly about , that [he]0-i might as it were individually address [the whole audience]3904-the whole audience , [those both near and distant]3905-those both near and distant ; ‘[0-i] haply , when this question has been tak’n up and discoosed , there ’ll be a threat to turn out if [I]0-i ’m let to work among [yo]1421-my friends . [I]1487-i hope [I]1487-i shall die ere ever such a time cooms , and [I]1487-i shall work solitary among [yo]1421-my friends unless it cooms — truly , [I]1487-i mun do ’[1487-i] t , [[my]0-i friends]1421-my friends ; not to brave [yo]1421-my friends , but to live . [I]0-i ha nobbut work to live by ; and [wheerever]177-wheerever can [I]0-i go , [I]0-i who [ha]1487-i worked sin [I]0-i were no heighth at aw , in [Coketown]4-coketown heer ? [I]0-i mak ’ no complaints o ’[0-i] bein turned to the wa ’ , o ’[0-i] bein outcasten and overlooken fro this time forrard , but hope [I]0-i shall be let to work . If there is any right for [me]0-i at aw , [[my]0-i friends]1421-my friends , [I]0-i think ’ tis that . ’[0-i] Not a word was spoken . Not a sound was audible in [the building]927-the building , but the slight rustle of [men]545-men moving a little apart , all along the centre of [the room]2901-the room , to open a means of passing out , to [the man with whom [they]545-men had all bound [themselves]545-men to renounce companionship]1492-the man with whom they had all bound themselves to renounce companionship . Looking at [no one]3086-no one , and going [his]0-i way with a lowly steadiness upon [him]0-i that asserted nothing and sought nothing , [Old Stephen]145-old stephen , with all [his]145-old stephen troubles on [his]145-old stephen head , left the scene . Then [Slackbridge]172-slackbridge , who had kept [his]172-slackbridge oratorical arm extended during the going out , as if [he]172-slackbridge were repressing with infinite solicitude and by a wonderful moral power the vehement passions of [the multitude]1494-the multitude , applied [himself]172-slackbridge to raising [their]1494-the multitude spirits . Had not [the Roman Brutus]178-the roman brutus , oh , [[my]0-i British countrymen]1495-my british countrymen , condemned [[his]178-the roman brutus son]1496-his son to death ; and had not [the Spartan mothers]1497-the spartan mothers , oh [[my]0-i soon to be victorious friends]1498-my soon to be victorious friends , driven [[their]1497-the spartan mothers flying children]1499-their flying children on the points of [[their]1497-the spartan mothers enemies]1500-their enemies ’ swords ? Then was it not the sacred duty of [the men of [Coketown]4-coketown]3906-the men of coketown , with [forefathers]3907-forefathers before [them]3906-the men of coketown , [an admiring world in company with [them]3906-the men of coketown]3908-an admiring world in company with them , and [a posterity]3909-a posterity to come after [them]3906-the men of coketown , to hurl out [traitors]3910-traitors from [the tents [they]3906-the men of coketown had pitched in a sacred and a God - like cause]3911-the tents they had pitched in a sacred and a god - like cause ? [The winds of [heaven]1147-heaven]3912-the winds of heaven answered Yes ; and bore Yes , east , west , north , and south . And consequently three cheers for the United Aggregate Tribunal ! [Slackbridge]172-slackbridge acted as fugleman , and gave the time . [The multitude of doubtful faces]3914-the multitude of doubtful faces ( a little conscience - stricken ) brightened at the sound , and took it up . Private feeling must yield to the common cause . Hurrah ! The roof yet vibrated with the cheering , when [the assembly]3863-the assembly dispersed . Thus easily did [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen fall into the loneliest of lives , the life of solitude among [a familiar crowd]3916-a familiar crowd . [The stranger in [the land]3918-the land who looks into [ten thousand faces for some answering look and never finds it]3919-ten thousand faces for some answering look and never finds it , is in cheering society as compared with [him]3917-the stranger in the land who looks into ten thousand faces for some answering look and never finds it , is in cheering society as compared with him who passes ten averted faces daily , that were once the countenances of friends who passes ten averted faces daily , that were once the countenances of [friends]3920-friends]3917-the stranger in the land who looks into ten thousand faces for some answering look and never finds it , is in cheering society as compared with him who passes ten averted faces daily , that were once the countenances of friends . Such experience was to be [Stephen]144-stephen ’s now , in every waking moment of [his]144-stephen life ; at [his]144-stephen work , on [his]144-stephen way to [it]3921-it and from [it]3921-it , at [his]144-stephen door , at [his]144-stephen window , everywhere . By general consent , [they]3922-they even avoided that side of [the street]461-the street on which [he]144-stephen habitually walked ; and left [it]3924-it , of [all the working men]3925-all the working men , to [him]144-stephen only . [He]144-stephen had been for many years , [a quiet silent man]3926-a quiet silent man , associating but little with [other men]3138-other men , and used to companionship with [his]144-stephen own thoughts . [He]144-stephen had never known before the strength of the want in [his]144-stephen heart for the frequent recognition of a nod , a look , a word ; or the immense amount of relief that had been poured into it by drops through such small means . It was even harder than [he]144-stephen could have believed possible , to separate in [his]144-stephen own conscience [his]144-stephen abandonment by all [[his]144-stephen fellows]3928-his fellows from a baseless sense of shame and disgrace . The first four days of [his]144-stephen endurance were days so long and heavy , that [he]144-stephen began to be appalled by the prospect before [him]144-stephen . Not only did [he]144-stephen see no [Rachael]146-rachael all the time , but [he]144-stephen avoided every chance of seeing [her]146-rachael ; for , although [he]144-stephen knew that the prohibition did not yet formally extend to [the women working in [the factories]3445-the factories]3929-the women working in the factories , [he]144-stephen found that [some of [them]3929-the women working in the factories with whom [he]144-stephen was acquainted]3931-some of them with whom he was acquainted were changed to [him]144-stephen , and [he]144-stephen feared to try [others]3223-others , and dreaded that [Rachael]146-rachael might be even singled out from the rest if [she]146-rachael were seen in [his]144-stephen company . So , [he]144-stephen had been quite alone during the four days , and had spoken to [no one]3086-no one , when , as [he]144-stephen was leaving [his]144-stephen work at night , [a young man of a very light complexion]3934-a young man of a very light complexion accosted [him]144-stephen in [the street]461-the street . ‘[1501-you] [Your]1501-you name ’s [Blackpool]144-stephen , ai n’t it ? ’ said [the young man]3936-the young man . [Stephen]144-stephen coloured to find [himself]144-stephen with [his]144-stephen hat in [his]144-stephen hand , in [his]144-stephen gratitude for being spoken to , or in the suddenness of it , or both . [He]144-stephen made a feint of adjusting the lining , and said , ‘[144-stephen] Yes . ’ ‘[144-stephen] [You]1501-you are the Hand [they]1502-they have sent to [Coventry]179-coventry , [I]0-i mean ? ’ said [Bitzer]77-bitzer , [the very light young man in question]3937-the very light young man in question . [Stephen]144-stephen answered ‘[0-i] Yes , ’ again . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i supposed so , from [their]1502-they all appearing to keep away from [you]1501-you . [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby wants to speak to [you]1501-you . [You]1501-you know [[his]93-mr. bounderby house]1503-his house , do n’t [you]1501-you ? ’ [Stephen]144-stephen said ‘[1501-you] Yes , ’ again . ‘[1501-you] Then go straight up there , will [you]1501-you ? ’ said [Bitzer]77-bitzer . ‘[1501-you] [You]1501-you ’re expected , and have only to tell [the servant]3938-the servant it ’s [you]1501-you . [I]144-stephen belong to [the Bank]3524-the bank ; so , if [you]1501-you go straight up without [me]144-stephen ( [I]144-stephen was sent to fetch [you]1501-you ) , [you]1501-you ’ll save [me]144-stephen a walk . ’[144-stephen] [Stephen]144-stephen , whose way had been in the contrary direction , turned about , and betook [himself]144-stephen as in duty bound , to [the red brick castle of the giant [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby]1504-the red brick castle of the giant bounderby . ‘ Well , [Stephen]144-stephen , ’[93-mr. bounderby] said [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , in [his]93-mr. bounderby windy manner , ‘ what ’s this [I]93-mr. bounderby hear ? What have these pests of [the earth]690-the earth been doing to [you]144-stephen ? Come in , and speak up . ’[93-mr. bounderby] It was into [the drawing - room]3300-the drawing - room that [he]144-stephen was thus bidden . A tea - table was set out ; and [[Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ’s young wife]1506-mr. bounderby ’s young wife , and [[her]1506-mr. bounderby ’s young wife brother]2932-her brother , and [a great gentleman from [London]8-london]1508-a great gentleman from london , were present . To whom [Stephen]144-stephen made [his]144-stephen obeisance , closing the door and standing near it , with [his]144-stephen hat in [his]144-stephen hand . ‘ This is [the man [I]93-mr. bounderby was telling [you]93-mr. bounderby about]3941-the man i was telling you about , [Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse , ’[93-mr. bounderby] said [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby . [The gentleman [he]93-mr. bounderby addressed , who was talking to [Mrs. Bounderby]155-mrs. bounderby on the sofa]1509-the gentleman he addressed , who was talking to mrs. bounderby on the sofa , got up , saying in an indolent way , ‘ Oh really ? ’[155-mrs. bounderby] and dawdled to the hearthrug where [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby stood . ‘ Now , ’[155-mrs. bounderby] said [Bounderby]155-mrs. bounderby , ‘ speak up ! ’[155-mrs. bounderby] After the four days [he]93-mr. bounderby had passed , this address fell rudely and discordantly on [Stephen]144-stephen ’s ear . Besides being a rough handling of [his]144-stephen wounded mind , it seemed to assume that [he]144-stephen really was [the self - interested deserter [he]144-stephen had been called]1510-the self - interested deserter he had been called . ‘ What were it , [sir]2771-sir , ’[144-stephen] said [Stephen]144-stephen , ‘ as [yo]2771-sir were pleased to want wi ’[0-i] [me]0-i ? ’ ‘[144-stephen] Why , [I]0-i have told [you]144-stephen , ’ returned [Bounderby]155-mrs. bounderby . ‘[0-i] Speak up like [a man]484-a man , since [you]144-stephen are [a man]484-a man , and tell [us]1513-us about [yourself]144-stephen and [this Combination]1514-this combination . ’ ‘[0-i] Wi ’ yor pardon , [sir]2771-sir , ’[144-stephen] said [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen , ‘ [I]144-stephen ha ’[144-stephen] nowt to sen about it . ’ [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , who was always more or less like a Wind , finding something in [his]93-mr. bounderby way here , began to blow at it directly . ‘[144-stephen] Now , look here , [Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse , ’ said [he]93-mr. bounderby , ‘[167-mr. harthouse] here ’s a specimen of [’em]3944-’em . When [this man]2994-this man was [here]366-here once before , [I]167-mr. harthouse warned [this man]2994-this man against [the mischievous strangers who are always about — and who ought to be hanged wherever [they]3948-the mischievous strangers who are always about — and who ought to be hanged wherever they are found are found]3948-the mischievous strangers who are always about — and who ought to be hanged wherever they are found — and [I]167-mr. harthouse told [this man]2994-this man that [he]2994-this man was going in the wrong direction . Ah ! [I]0-i know what [you]0-i said ; more than that , [I]0-i know what [you]0-i mean , [you]0-i see . Not always the same thing , by [the Lord Harry]118-the lord harry ! Quite different things . [You]0-i had better tell [us]1515-us at once , that that fellow [Slackbridge]172-slackbridge is not in [the town]2838-the town , stirring up [the people]2827-the people to mutiny ; and that [he]172-slackbridge is not [a regular qualified leader of [the people]2827-the people]1518-a regular qualified leader of the people : that is , [a most confounded scoundrel]1520-a most confounded scoundrel . [You]0-i had better tell [us]1515-us so at once ; [you]0-i ca n’t deceive [me]0-i . [You]0-i want to tell [us]1515-us so . Why do n’t [you]0-i ? ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ’m as sooary as [yo]0-i , [sir]2771-sir , when [[the people]2827-the people ’s leaders]3954-the people ’s leaders is bad , ’[144-stephen] said [Stephen]144-stephen , shaking [his]144-stephen head . ‘ [They]1521-they taks such as offers . Pray , [Mr. Blackpool]180-mr. blackpool ’ — wind springing up very fast — ‘[180-mr. blackpool] may [I]0-i take the liberty of asking [you]0-i how it happens that [you]0-i refused to be in this Combination ? ’ ‘[0-i] How ’ t happens ? ’[93-mr. bounderby] ‘ Ah ! ’[93-mr. bounderby] said [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , with [his]93-mr. bounderby thumbs in the arms of [his]93-mr. bounderby coat , and jerking [his]93-mr. bounderby head and shutting [his]93-mr. bounderby eyes in confidence with the opposite wall : ‘ how it happens . ’[93-mr. bounderby] ‘ [I]93-mr. bounderby ’d leefer not coom to ’[93-mr. bounderby] t , [sir]2771-sir ; but sin [you]2771-sir put th ’ question — an ’[93-mr. bounderby] not want’n t ’ be ill - manner’n — [I]93-mr. bounderby ’ll answer . ( Gusty weather with deceitful calms . One now prevailing . ) ‘ O no , [sir]2771-sir . Look round [town]439-town — so rich as ’[0-i] tis — and see [the numbers o ’ people]3983-the numbers o ’ people as has been broughten into bein heer , fur to weave , an ’[3983-the numbers o ’ people] to card , an ’ to piece out a livin ’[3983-the numbers o ’ people] , aw the same one way , somehows , ’ twixt [their]1545-you people cradles and [their]1545-you people graves . [We]1546-we ’ll indict [the blackguards]1553-the blackguards for felony , and get ’em shipped off to [penal settlements]3990-penal settlements . ’[144-stephen] [Stephen]144-stephen gravely shook [his]144-stephen head . ‘ Do n’t tell [me]144-stephen [we]1546-we wo n’t , [man]2967-man , ’[144-stephen] said [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , by this time blowing a hurricane , ‘ because [we]1546-we will , [I]144-stephen tell [you]1547-you ! ’[144-stephen] ‘ [Sir]2771-sir , ’[144-stephen] returned [Stephen]144-stephen , with the quiet confidence of absolute certainty , ‘ if [yo]144-stephen was t ’[144-stephen] tak a hundred Slackbridges — aw as there is , and aw the number ten times towd — an ’ was t ’[1554-mischeevous strangers] sew ’em up in separate sacks , an ’[144-stephen] sink ’em in [the deepest ocean]3993-the deepest ocean as were made ere ever [dry land]3994-dry land coom to be , yo’d leave the muddle just wheer ’[1554-mischeevous strangers] tis . [Mischeevous strangers]1554-mischeevous strangers ! ’ said [Stephen]144-stephen , with an anxious smile ; ‘[1554-mischeevous strangers] when [ha]1555-ha [we]1546-we not heern , [I]0-i am sure , sin ever [we]1546-we can call to mind , [o ’ th ’[1556-o ’ th ’ mischeevous strangers] mischeevous strangers]1556-o ’ th ’ mischeevous strangers ! ’ Tis not by [them]1554-mischeevous strangers the trouble ’s made , [sir]2771-sir . ’[1556-o ’ th ’ mischeevous strangers] Tis not wi ’ [them]1554-mischeevous strangers ’[0-i] t commences . [I]0-i ha no favour for ’em — [I]1556-o ’ th ’ mischeevous strangers ha no reason to favour ’em[1556-o ’ th ’ mischeevous strangers] — but ’ tis hopeless and useless to dream o ’[0-i] takin [them]1554-mischeevous strangers fro [their]1554-mischeevous strangers trade , ’ stead o ’[0-i] takin [their]1554-mischeevous strangers trade fro [them]1554-mischeevous strangers ! Aw that ’s now about [me]0-i in [this room]1557-this room were heer afore [I]0-i coom , an ’ will be heer when [I]0-i am gone . Put that clock aboard [a ship]3996-a ship an ’[0-i] pack it off to [Norfolk Island]39-norfolk island , an ’ the time will go on just the same . So ’[0-i] tis wi ’ [Slackbridge]172-slackbridge every bit . ’[0-i] Reverting for a moment to [his]0-i former refuge , [he]0-i observed a cautionary movement of [her]1558-her eyes towards the door . Stepping back , [he]0-i put [his]0-i hand upon the lock . But [he]0-i had not spoken out of [his]0-i own will and desire ; and [he]0-i felt it in [his]0-i heart a noble return for [his]0-i late injurious treatment to be faithful to the last to [those who had repudiated [him]0-i]1559-those who had repudiated him . [He]0-i stayed to finish what was in [his]0-i mind . ‘ [Sir]2771-sir , [I]0-i canna , wi ’[0-i] [my]0-i little learning an ’ [my]1561-my common way , tell [the genelman]3998-the genelman what will better aw this — though [some working men o ’]3999-some working men o ’[1561-my] [this town]1229-this town could , above [my]0-i powers — but [I]0-i can tell [him]1561-my what [I]0-i know will never do ’ t. The strong hand will never do ’[1561-my] t. Vict’ry and triumph will never do ’ t. Agreeing fur to mak one side unnat’rally [awlus]181-awlus and for ever right , and toother side unnat’rally [awlus]181-awlus and for ever wrong , will never , never do ’[1561-my] t. Nor yet lettin alone will never do ’ t. Let [thousands upon thousands]4000-thousands upon thousands alone , aw leading the like lives and aw faw’en into the like muddle , and [they]551-one another will be as one , and [yo]1563-yo will be as anoother , wi ’[1561-my] [a black unpassable world]1562-a black unpassable world betwixt [yo]1563-yo , just as long or short a time as sich - like misery can last . Not drawin nigh to fok , wi ’ kindness and patience an ’[1561-my] cheery ways , that so draws nigh to [one another]551-one another in [their]551-one another monny troubles , and so cherishes [one another]551-one another in [their]551-one another distresses wi ’ what [they]551-one another need [themseln]4001-themseln — like , [I]1561-my humbly believe , as [no people the genelman ha seen in aw [his]1561-my travels]4002-no people the genelman ha seen in aw his travels can beat — will never do ’[1561-my] t till th ’ Sun turns t ’[1561-my] ice . [Most o ’ aw]4003-most o ’ aw , rating ’em[4003-most o ’ aw] as so much Power , and reg’latin ’em as if [they]551-one another was [figures in a soom , or machines]4004-figures in a soom , or machines : [wi’out loves and likens]4005-wi’out loves and likens , wi’out memories and inclinations , wi’out [souls to weary and souls to hope]4006-souls to weary and souls to hope — when aw goes quiet , draggin on wi ’[4003-most o ’ aw] ’em as if [they]551-one another ’d nowt o ’[4003-most o ’ aw] th ’ kind , and when aw goes onquiet , reproachin ’em[4003-most o ’ aw] for [their]551-one another want o ’ sitch humanly feelins in [their]551-one another dealins wi ’[4003-most o ’ aw] yo — this will never do ’ t , [sir]2771-sir , till [God]147-god ’s work is onmade . ’[4003-most o ’ aw] [Stephen]144-stephen stood with the open door in [his]144-stephen hand , waiting to know if anything more were expected of [him]144-stephen . ‘ Just stop a moment , ’[93-mr. bounderby] said [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , excessively red in the face . ‘ [I]93-mr. bounderby told [you]144-stephen , the last time [you]144-stephen were here with a grievance , that [you]144-stephen had better turn about and come out of that . And [I]93-mr. bounderby also told [you]144-stephen , if [you]144-stephen remember , that [I]93-mr. bounderby was up to the gold spoon look - out . ’[93-mr. bounderby] ‘ [I]0-i were not up to ’[0-i] t [myseln]1566-myseln , [sir]2771-sir ; [I]0-i do assure [yo]2771-sir . ’ ‘[0-i] Now it ’s clear to [me]0-i , ’ said [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , ‘[0-i] that [you]144-stephen are one of [those chaps who have always got a grievance]1568-those chaps who have always got a grievance . And [you]144-stephen go about , sowing it and raising crops . That ’s the business of [your]144-stephen life , [[my]0-i friend]508-my friend . ’ [Stephen]144-stephen shook [his]144-stephen head , mutely protesting that indeed [he]144-stephen had other business to do for [his]144-stephen life . ‘[144-stephen] [You]144-stephen are such [a waspish , raspish , ill - conditioned chap]1570-a waspish , raspish , ill - conditioned chap , [you]144-stephen see , ’ said [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , ‘[1570-a waspish , raspish , ill - conditioned chap] that even [[your]144-stephen own Union]1571-your own union , [the men who know [you]144-stephen best]1572-the men who know you best , will have nothing to do with [you]144-stephen . [I]0-i never thought [those fellows]1573-those fellows could be right in anything ; but [I]0-i tell [you]144-stephen what ! [I]0-i so far go along with [them]1573-those fellows for a novelty , that [I]0-i ’ll have nothing to do with [you]144-stephen either . ’ [Stephen]144-stephen raised [his]144-stephen eyes quickly to [his]144-stephen face . ‘[144-stephen] [You]144-stephen can finish off what [you]144-stephen ’re at , ’[93-mr. bounderby] said [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , with a meaning nod , ‘ and then go elsewhere . ’[93-mr. bounderby] ‘ [Sir]2771-sir , [yo]93-mr. bounderby know weel , ’[144-stephen] said [Stephen]144-stephen expressively , ‘ that if [I]93-mr. bounderby canna get work wi ’[93-mr. bounderby] [yo]93-mr. bounderby , [I]0-i canna get it elsewheer . ’ The reply was , ‘[0-i] What [I]0-i know , [I]0-i know ; and what [you]144-stephen know , [you]144-stephen know . [I]0-i have no more to say about it . ’ [Stephen]144-stephen glanced at [Louisa]92-louisa again , but [her]92-louisa eyes were raised to [his]144-stephen no more ; therefore , with a sigh , and saying , barely above [his]144-stephen breath , ‘[0-i] Heaven help [us]1574-us aw in [this world]3460-this world ! ’ [he]144-stephen departed . It was falling dark when [Stephen]144-stephen came out of [[Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ’s house]1160-mr. bounderby ’s house . The shadows of night had gathered so fast , that [he]144-stephen did not look about [him]144-stephen when [he]144-stephen closed the door , but plodded straight along [the street]461-the street . Nothing was further from [his]144-stephen thoughts than [the curious old woman [he]144-stephen had encountered on [his]144-stephen previous visit to [the same house]4012-the same house]4011-the curious old woman he had encountered on his previous visit to the same house , when [he]144-stephen heard a step behind [him]144-stephen that [he]144-stephen knew , and turning , saw [her]4011-the curious old woman he had encountered on his previous visit to the same house in [[Rachael]146-rachael ’s company]4013-rachael ’s company . [He]144-stephen saw [Rachael]146-rachael first , as [he]144-stephen had heard [her]4011-the curious old woman he had encountered on his previous visit to the same house only . ‘[0-i] Ah , [Rachael]146-rachael , [[my]0-i dear]601-my dear ! [Missus]1577-missus , [thou]1578-thou wi ’ [her]146-rachael ! ’[0-i] ‘ Well , and now [you]144-stephen are surprised to be sure , and with reason [I]3405-the old woman must say , ’[3405-the old woman] [the old woman]3405-the old woman returned . ‘ Here [I]3405-the old woman am again , [you]144-stephen see . ’[3405-the old woman] ‘ But how wi ’[146-rachael] [Rachael]146-rachael ? ’ said [Stephen]144-stephen , falling into [their]4014-their step , walking between [them]4014-their , and looking from [the one]4015-the one to the other . ‘[146-rachael] Why , [I]0-i come to be with [this good lass]1580-this good lass pretty much as [I]0-i came to be with [you]0-i , ’ said [the old woman]3405-the old woman , cheerfully , taking the reply upon [herself]3405-the old woman . ‘[0-i] [My]0-i visiting time is later this year than usual , for [I]0-i have been rather troubled with shortness of breath , and so put it off till the weather was fine and warm . For the same reason [I]0-i do n’t make all [my]0-i journey in one day , but divide it into two days , and get a bed to - night at [the Travellers ’ Coffee House down by the railroad]4017-the travellers ’ coffee house down by the railroad ( [a nice clean house]4018-a nice clean house ) , and go back [Parliamentary]19-parliamentary , at six in the morning . Well , but what has this to do with [this good lass]1580-this good lass , says [you]0-i ? [I]93-mr. bounderby ’m[93-mr. bounderby] going to tell [you]0-i . [I]0-i have heard of [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby being married . [I]0-i read it in the paper , where it looked grand — oh , it looked fine ! ’ [the old woman]3405-the old woman dwelt on it with strange enthusiasm : ‘[0-i] and [I]0-i want to see [[his]93-mr. bounderby wife]3471-his wife . [I]0-i have never seen [her]3471-his wife yet . Now , if [you]0-i ’ll believe [me]0-i , [she]3471-his wife has n’t come out of [that house]1582-that house since noon to - day . So not to give [her]3471-his wife up too easily , [I]0-i was waiting about , a little last bit more , when [I]0-i passed close to [this good lass]1580-this good lass two or three times ; and [her]3471-his wife face being so friendly [I]0-i spoke to [her]3471-his wife , and [she]3471-his wife spoke to [me]0-i . There ! ’ said [the old woman]3405-the old woman to [Stephen]144-stephen , ‘[3471-his wife] [you]0-i can make all the rest out for [yourself]0-i now , a deal shorter than [I]0-i can , [I]0-i dare say ! ’ Once again , [Stephen]144-stephen had to conquer an instinctive propensity to dislike [this old woman]453-this old woman , though [her]453-this old woman manner was as honest and simple as a manner possibly could be . With a gentleness that was as natural to [him]144-stephen as [he]144-stephen knew it to be to [Rachael]146-rachael , [he]144-stephen pursued the subject that interested [her]453-this old woman in [her]453-this old woman old age . ‘[0-i] Well , [missus]901-missus , ’ said [he]144-stephen , ‘[901-missus] [I]0-i ha seen [the lady]3277-the lady , and [she]3277-the lady were young and hansom . Wi ’ fine dark thinkin eyes , and a still way , [Rachael]146-rachael , as [I]3405-the old woman ha never seen [the like on]4023-the like on . ’[3405-the old woman] ‘ Young and handsome . Yes ! ’[3405-the old woman] cried [the old woman]3405-the old woman , quite delighted . ‘ As bonny as a rose ! And what [a happy wife]4024-a happy wife ! ’[3405-the old woman] ‘ Aye , [missus]901-missus , [I]144-stephen suppose [she]3277-the lady be , ’[144-stephen] said [Stephen]144-stephen . But with a doubtful glance at [Rachael]146-rachael . ‘ Suppose [she]3277-the lady be ? [She]3277-the lady must be . [She]3277-the lady ’s [[[your]144-stephen master]3220-your master ’s wife]4027-your master ’s wife , ’[3405-the old woman] returned [the old woman]3405-the old woman . [Stephen]144-stephen nodded assent . ‘ Though as to [master]2966-master , ’[144-stephen] said [he]144-stephen , glancing again at [Rachael]146-rachael , ‘ not master onny more . That ’s aw enden ’[144-stephen] twixt [him]1588-his and [me]0-i . ’ ‘[144-stephen] Have [you]144-stephen left [his]1588-his work , [Stephen]144-stephen ? ’ asked [Rachael]146-rachael , anxiously and quickly . ‘[144-stephen] Why , [Rachael]146-rachael , ’ [he]144-stephen replied , ‘[146-rachael] whether [I]0-i ha lef’n [his]1588-his work , or whether [his]1588-his work [ha]1589-ha lef’n [me]0-i , cooms t ’ th ’[146-rachael] same . [His]1588-his work and [me]0-i are parted . ’ Tis as weel so — better , [I]0-i were thinkin when [yo]1590-yo coom up wi ’[0-i] [me]0-i . It would ha brought’n trouble upon trouble if [I]0-i had stayed [theer]1590-yo . Haply ’ tis a kindness to [monny]176-monny that [I]146-rachael go ; haply ’[146-rachael] tis a kindness to [myseln]1591-myseln ; anyways it mun be done . [I]0-i mun turn [my]0-i face fro [Coketown]4-coketown fur th ’ time , and seek a fort’n , [dear]3016-dear , by beginnin fresh . ’[0-i] ‘ Where will [you]0-i go , [Stephen]144-stephen ? ’[0-i] ‘ [I]0-i donno t’night , ’[0-i] said [he]0-i , lifting off [his]0-i hat , and smoothing [his]0-i thin hair with the flat of [his]0-i hand . ‘ But [I]0-i ’m[0-i] not goin t’night , [Rachael]146-rachael , nor yet t’morrow . ’ Tan’t easy overmuch t ’[0-i] know wheer t ’ turn , but a good heart will coom to [me]0-i . ’[0-i] Herein , too , the sense of even thinking unselfishly aided [him]0-i . Before [he]0-i had so much as closed [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ’s door , [he]0-i had reflected that at least [his]0-i being obliged to go away was good for [her]146-rachael , as it would save [her]146-rachael from the chance of being brought into question for not withdrawing from [him]0-i . Though it would cost [him]0-i a hard pang to leave [her]146-rachael , and though [he]0-i could think of no similar place in which [his]0-i condemnation would not pursue [him]0-i , perhaps it was almost a relief to be forced away from the endurance of the last four days , even to unknown difficulties and distresses . So [he]0-i said , with truth , ‘ [I]0-i ’m[0-i] more leetsome , [Rachael]146-rachael , under ’ t , than [I]0-i could’n ha believed . ’[0-i] It was not [her]146-rachael part to make [his]0-i burden heavier . [She]146-rachael answered with [her]146-rachael comforting smile , and [the three]1592-the three walked on together . Age , especially when it strives to be self - reliant and cheerful , finds much consideration among [the poor]1593-the poor . [The old woman]3405-the old woman was so decent and contented , and made so light of [her]3405-the old woman infirmities , though [they]1595-they had increased upon [her]3405-the old woman since [her]3405-the old woman former interview with [Stephen]144-stephen , that [they]1595-they both took an interest in [her]3405-the old woman . [She]146-rachael was too sprightly to allow of [their]1592-the three walking at a slow pace on [her]146-rachael account , but [she]146-rachael was very grateful to be talked to , and very willing to talk to any extent : so , when [they]1592-the three came to [[their]1592-the three part of [the town]2838-the town]1596-their part of the town , [she]146-rachael was more brisk and vivacious than ever . ‘ Come to [[my]144-stephen poor place]4030-my poor place , [missus]901-missus , ’[144-stephen] said [Stephen]144-stephen , ‘ and tak a coop o ’[144-stephen] tea . [Rachael]146-rachael will coom then ; and arterwards [I]0-i ’ll see [thee]146-rachael safe t ’ [[thy]146-rachael Travellers ’[144-stephen] lodgin]4032-thy travellers ’ lodgin . ’ T may be long , [Rachael]146-rachael , ere ever [I]144-stephen ha th ’[144-stephen] chance o ’ [thy]146-rachael coompany agen . ’[1592-the three] [They]1592-the three complied , and [the three]1592-the three went on to [the house where [he]144-stephen lodged]1599-the house where he lodged . When [they]1592-the three turned into [a narrow street]1600-a narrow street , [Stephen]144-stephen glanced at [his]144-stephen window with a dread that always haunted [[his]144-stephen desolate home]1601-his desolate home ; but it was open , as [he]144-stephen had left [it]1601-his desolate home , and [no one]3086-no one was there . The evil spirit of [his]144-stephen life had flitted away again , months ago , and [he]144-stephen had heard no more of [her]1603-her since . The only evidence of [her]1603-her last return now , were the scantier moveables in [[his]144-stephen room]945-his room , and the grayer hair upon [his]144-stephen head . [He]144-stephen lighted a candle , set out [his]144-stephen little tea - board , got hot water from below , and brought in small portions of tea and sugar , a loaf , and some butter from [the nearest shop]1605-the nearest shop . The bread was new and crusty , the butter fresh , and the sugar lump , of course — in fulfilment of the standard testimony of [the Coketown magnates]1606-the coketown magnates , that [these people]570-these people lived like [princes]633-princes , [sir]2771-sir . [Rachael]146-rachael made the tea ( so large a party necessitated the borrowing of a cup ) , and [the visitor]3670-the visitor enjoyed it mightily . It was the first glimpse of sociality [the host]1611-the host had had for many days . [He]144-stephen too , with [the world]301-the world a wide heath before [him]144-stephen , enjoyed the meal — again in corroboration of [the magnates]1613-the magnates , as exemplifying the utter want of calculation on the part of [these people]570-these people , [sir]2771-sir . ‘ [I]144-stephen ha never thowt yet , [missus]901-missus , ’[144-stephen] said [Stephen]144-stephen , ‘ o ’[144-stephen] askin [thy]1616-thy name . ’ [The old lady]4034-the old lady announced [herself]4034-the old lady as ‘[144-stephen] [Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler . ’ ‘[182-mrs. pegler] [A widder]1617-a widder , [I]0-i think ? ’ said [Stephen]144-stephen . ‘[1617-a widder] Oh , many long years ! ’ [[Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler ’s husband]4035-mrs. pegler ’s husband ( one of the best on record ) was already dead , by [Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler ’s calculation , when [Stephen]144-stephen was born . ‘[1617-a widder] ’ Twere a bad job , too , to lose so good a one , ’[144-stephen] said [Stephen]144-stephen . ‘ [Onny children]4036-onny children ? ’[144-stephen] [Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler ’s cup , rattling against [her]182-mrs. pegler saucer as [she]182-mrs. pegler held it , denoted some nervousness on [her]182-mrs. pegler part . ‘ No , ’[182-mrs. pegler] [she]182-mrs. pegler said . ‘ Not now , not now . ’[182-mrs. pegler] ‘ Dead , [Stephen]144-stephen , ’[146-rachael] [Rachael]146-rachael softly hinted . ‘ [I]146-rachael ’m[146-rachael] sooary [I]0-i ha spok’n on ’ t , ’[144-stephen] said [Stephen]144-stephen , ‘ [I]144-stephen ought t ’[144-stephen] hadn in [my]0-i mind as [I]0-i might touch a sore place . [I]0-i — [I]0-i blame [myseln]1618-myseln . ’ While [he]144-stephen excused [himself]144-stephen , [the old lady]4034-the old lady ’s cup rattled more and more . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i had [a son]1619-a son , ’ [she]4034-the old lady said , curiously distressed , and not by any of the usual appearances of sorrow ; ‘[1619-a son] and [he]1619-a son did well , wonderfully well . But [he]1619-a son is not to be spoken of if [you]144-stephen please . [He]1619-a son is — ’ Putting down [her]4034-the old lady cup , [she]4034-the old lady moved [her]4034-the old lady hands as if [she]4034-the old lady would have added , by [her]4034-the old lady action , ‘[1619-a son] dead ! ’ Then [she]4034-the old lady said aloud , ‘[0-i] [I]0-i have lost [him]1619-a son . ’ [Stephen]144-stephen had not yet got the better of [his]144-stephen having given [the old lady]4034-the old lady pain , when [[his]144-stephen landlady]4039-his landlady came stumbling up the narrow stairs , and calling [him]144-stephen to the door , whispered in [his]144-stephen ear . [Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler was by no means deaf , for [she]4034-the old lady caught a word as it was uttered . ‘[0-i] [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ! ’ [she]4034-the old lady cried , in a suppressed voice , starting up from the table . ‘[93-mr. bounderby] Oh hide [me]0-i ! Do n’t let [me]0-i be seen for [the world]301-the world . Do n’t let [him]1619-a son come up till [I]0-i ’ve got away . Pray , pray ! ’ [She]4034-the old lady trembled , and was excessively agitated ; getting behind [Rachael]146-rachael , when [Rachael]146-rachael tried to reassure [her]4034-the old lady ; and not seeming to know what [she]4034-the old lady was about . ‘[901-missus] But hearken , [missus]901-missus , hearken , ’ said [Stephen]144-stephen , astonished . ‘[901-missus] ’ Tisn’t [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ; ’[901-missus] tis [[his]1619-a son wife]3471-his wife . [Yo’r]1623-yo’r not fearfo ’ o ’[901-missus] [her]3471-his wife . [Yo]1623-yo’r was hey - go - mad about [her]3471-his wife , but an hour sin . ’ ‘[1623-yo’r] But are [you]1623-yo’r sure it ’s [the lady]3277-the lady , and not [the gentleman]281-the gentleman ? ’ [she]4034-the old lady asked , still trembling . ‘[1623-yo’r] Certain sure ! ’ ‘[1623-yo’r] Well then , pray do n’t speak to [me]0-i , nor yet take any notice of [me]0-i , ’ said [the old woman]3405-the old woman . ‘[1623-yo’r] Let [me]0-i be quite to [myself]0-i in this corner . ’ [Stephen]144-stephen nodded ; looking to [Rachael]146-rachael for an explanation , which [she]146-rachael was quite unable to give [him]144-stephen ; took the candle , went [downstairs]613-downstairs , and in a few moments returned , lighting [Louisa]92-louisa into [the room]2901-the room . [She]92-louisa was followed by [the whelp]1387-the whelp . [Rachael]146-rachael had risen , and stood apart with [her]146-rachael shawl and bonnet in [her]146-rachael hand , when [Stephen]144-stephen , [himself]144-stephen profoundly astonished by this visit , put the candle on the table . Then [he]144-stephen too stood , with [his]144-stephen doubled hand upon the table near it , waiting to be addressed . For the first time in [her]92-louisa life [Louisa]92-louisa had come into [one of [the dwellings of the Coketown Hands]4045-the dwellings of the coketown hands]4044-one of the dwellings of the coketown hands ; for the first time in [her]92-louisa life [she]92-louisa was face to face with anything like individuality in connection with [them]4046-them . [She]92-louisa knew of [their]4046-them existence by hundreds and by thousands . [She]92-louisa knew what results in work a given number of [them]4046-them would produce in a given space of time . [She]92-louisa knew [them]4046-them in crowds passing to and from [[their]4046-them nests]4047-their nests , like ants or beetles . But [she]92-louisa knew from [her]92-louisa reading infinitely more of the ways of toiling insects than of [these toiling men]4048-these toiling men and [women]3196-women . Something to be worked so much and paid so much , and there ended ; something to be infallibly settled by laws of supply and demand ; something that blundered against those laws , and floundered into difficulty ; something that was a little pinched when wheat was dear , and over - ate itself when wheat was cheap ; something that increased at such a rate of percentage , and yielded such another percentage of crime , and such another percentage of pauperism ; something wholesale , of which vast fortunes were made ; something that occasionally rose like [a sea]4050-a sea , and did some harm and waste ( chiefly to itself ) , and fell again ; this [she]92-louisa knew the Coketown Hands to be . But , [she]92-louisa had scarcely thought more of separating them into units , than of separating [the sea]3246-the sea itself into its component drops . [She]92-louisa stood for some moments looking round [the room]2901-the room . From the few chairs , the few books , the common prints , and the bed , [she]92-louisa glanced to [the two women]4053-the two women , and to [Stephen]144-stephen . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i have come to speak to [you]1626-you , in consequence of what passed just now . [I]0-i should like to be serviceable to [you]1626-you , if [you]1626-you will let [me]0-i . Is this [[your]1626-you wife]892-your wife ? ’ [Rachael]146-rachael raised [her]146-rachael eyes , and they sufficiently answered no , and dropped again . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i remember , ’ said [Louisa]92-louisa , reddening at [her]92-louisa mistake ; ‘[0-i] [I]0-i recollect , now , to have heard [your]1626-you domestic misfortunes spoken of , though [I]0-i was not attending to the particulars at the time . It was not [my]0-i meaning to ask a question that would give pain to [any one here]1628-any one here . If [I]0-i should ask any other question that may happen to have that result , give [me]0-i credit , if [you]1626-you please , for being in ignorance how to speak to [you]1626-you as [I]0-i ought . ’ As [Stephen]144-stephen had but a little while ago instinctively addressed [himself]144-stephen to [her]1626-you , so [she]1626-you now instinctively addressed [herself]1626-you to [Rachael]146-rachael . [Her]1626-you manner was short and abrupt , yet faltering and timid . ‘[1629-he] [He]1629-he has told [you]1626-you what has passed between [himself]1629-he and [[my]0-i husband]1283-my husband ? [You]1626-you would be [his]1629-he first resource , [I]0-i think . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i have heard the end of it , [young lady]1631-young lady , ’ said [Rachael]146-rachael . ‘[0-i] Did [I]0-i understand , that , being rejected by [one employer]1632-one employer , [he]1629-he would probably be rejected by [all]1633-all ? [I]0-i thought [he]1629-he said as much ? ’ ‘[1629-he] The chances are very small , [young lady]1631-young lady — next to nothing — for [a man who gets a bad name among [them]1636-them]1635-a man who gets a bad name among them . ’ ‘[1626-you] What shall [I]0-i understand that [you]1626-you mean by a bad name ? ’ ‘[1626-you] The name of being troublesome . ’ ‘[1626-you] Then , by the prejudices of [[his]1629-he own class]841-his own class , and by the prejudices of [the other]287-the other , [he]1629-he is sacrificed alike ? Are the two so deeply separated in [this town]1229-this town , that there is no place whatever for [an honest workman]1640-an honest workman between [them]1641-them ? ’ [Rachael]146-rachael shook [her]146-rachael head in silence . ‘[1629-he] [He]1629-he fell into suspicion , ’ said [Louisa]92-louisa , ‘[1629-he] with [[his]1629-he fellow - weavers]1642-his fellow - weavers , because — [he]1629-he had made a promise not to be one of [them]1642-his fellow - weavers . [I]0-i think it must have been to [you]1626-you that [he]1629-he made that promise . Might [I]0-i ask [you]1626-you why [he]1629-he made it ? ’ [Rachael]146-rachael burst into tears . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i did n’t seek it of [him]1629-he , [poor lad]1643-poor lad . [I]0-i prayed [him]1629-he to avoid trouble for [his]1629-he own good , little thinking [he]1629-he ’d come to it through [me]0-i . But [I]0-i know [he]1629-he ’d die a hundred deaths , ere ever [he]1629-he ’d break [his]1629-he word . [I]0-i know that of [him]1629-he well . ’ [Stephen]144-stephen had remained quietly attentive , in [his]144-stephen usual thoughtful attitude , with [his]144-stephen hand at [his]144-stephen chin . [He]144-stephen now spoke in a voice rather less steady than usual . ‘[0-i] [No one]3086-no one , excepting [myseln]1645-myseln , can ever know what honour , an ’ what love , an ’[0-i] respect , [I]0-i bear to [Rachael]146-rachael , or wi ’ what cause . When [I]0-i passed [that promess]4054-that promess , [I]0-i towd [her]4054-that promess true , [she]4054-that promess were th ’[0-i] Angel o ’ [my]0-i life . ’[0-i] Twere [a solemn promess]1646-a solemn promess . ’ Tis gone fro ’[0-i] [me]0-i , for ever . ’ [Louisa]92-louisa turned [her]92-louisa head to [him]0-i , and bent it with a deference that was new in [her]92-louisa . [She]92-louisa looked from [him]0-i to [Rachael]146-rachael , and [her]92-louisa features softened . ‘[0-i] What will [you]0-i do ? ’ [she]92-louisa asked [him]0-i . And [her]92-louisa voice had softened too . ‘[183-weel] [Weel]183-weel , [ma’am]361-ma’am , ’ said [Stephen]144-stephen , making the best of it , with a smile ; ‘[183-weel] when [I]0-i ha finished off , [I]0-i mun quit this part , and try another . Fortnet or misfortnet , [a man]484-a man can but try ; there ’s nowt to be done wi’out tryin ’ — cept laying down and dying . ’[361-ma’am] ‘ How will [you]0-i travel ? ’[361-ma’am] ‘ Afoot , [my]92-louisa kind ledy , afoot . ’[92-louisa] [Louisa]92-louisa coloured , and a purse appeared in [her]92-louisa hand . The rustling of a bank - note was audible , as [she]92-louisa unfolded one and laid it on the table . ‘ [Rachael]146-rachael , will [you]146-rachael tell [him]0-i — for [you]146-rachael know how , without offence — that this is freely [his]0-i , to help [him]0-i on [his]0-i way ? Will [you]146-rachael entreat [him]0-i to take it ? ’[92-louisa] ‘ [I]92-louisa canna do that , [young lady]1631-young lady , ’[92-louisa] [she]92-louisa answered , turning [her]92-louisa head aside . ‘ Bless [you]146-rachael for thinking o ’[92-louisa] [the poor lad]1649-the poor lad wi ’ such tenderness . But ’[92-louisa] tis for [him]1649-the poor lad to know [his]1649-the poor lad heart , and what is right according to it . ’ [Louisa]92-louisa looked , in part incredulous , in part frightened , in part overcome with quick sympathy , when [this man of so much self - command , who had been so plain and steady through the late interview]4056-this man of so much self - command , who had been so plain and steady through the late interview , lost [his]4056-this man of so much self - command , who had been so plain and steady through the late interview composure in a moment , and now stood with [his]4056-this man of so much self - command , who had been so plain and steady through the late interview hand before [his]4056-this man of so much self - command , who had been so plain and steady through the late interview face . [She]92-louisa stretched out [hers]92-louisa , as if [she]92-louisa would have touched [him]4056-this man of so much self - command , who had been so plain and steady through the late interview ; then checked [herself]92-louisa , and remained still . ‘[92-louisa] Not e’en [Rachael]146-rachael , ’ said [Stephen]144-stephen , when [he]144-stephen stood again with [his]144-stephen face uncovered , ‘[1650-mak] could [mak]1650-mak sitch a kind offerin , by onny words , kinder . T ’ show that [I]484-a man ’m[484-a man] not [a man]484-a man wi’out reason and gratitude , [I]0-i ’ll tak two pound . [I]0-i ’ll borrow ’ t for t ’[0-i] pay ’ t back . ’[0-i] Twill be the sweetest work as ever [I]0-i ha done , that puts it in [my]0-i power t ’ acknowledge once more [my]146-rachael lastin thankfulness for this present action . ’[146-rachael] [She]146-rachael was fain to take up the note again , and to substitute the much smaller sum [he]0-i had named . [He]0-i was neither courtly , nor handsome , nor picturesque , in any respect ; and yet [his]0-i manner of accepting it , and of expressing [his]0-i thanks without more words , had a grace in it that [Lord Chesterfield]184-lord chesterfield could not have taught [[his]184-lord chesterfield son]1496-his son in a century . [Tom]71-tom had sat upon the bed , swinging one leg and sucking [his]71-tom walking - stick with sufficient unconcern , until the visit had attained this stage . Seeing [[his]71-tom sister]716-his sister ready to depart , [he]71-tom got up , rather hurriedly , and put in a word . ‘ Just wait a moment , [Loo]101-loo ! Before [we]4057-we go , [I]71-tom should like to speak to [him]0-i a moment . Something comes into [my]71-tom head . If [you]71-tom ’ll step out on the stairs , [Blackpool]144-stephen , [I]71-tom ’ll mention it . Never mind a light , [man]2967-man ! ’[71-tom] [Tom]71-tom was remarkably impatient of [his]71-tom moving towards the cupboard , to get one . ‘ It do n’t want a light . ’[144-stephen] [Stephen]144-stephen followed [him]71-tom out , and [Tom]71-tom closed the room door , and held the lock in [his]71-tom hand . ‘ [I]71-tom say ! ’[71-tom] [he]71-tom whispered . ‘ [I]71-tom think [I]71-tom can do [you]144-stephen a good turn . Do n’t ask [me]71-tom what it is , because it may not come to anything . But there ’s no harm in [my]71-tom trying . ’[71-tom] [His]71-tom breath fell like a flame of fire on [Stephen]144-stephen ’s ear , it was so hot . ‘ That was [[our]4059-our light porter at [the Bank]3524-the bank]4060-our light porter at the bank , ’[71-tom] said [Tom]71-tom , ‘ who brought [you]144-stephen the message to - night . When are [you]144-stephen off ? ’[71-tom] ‘ T ’[144-stephen] day ’s Monday , ’ replied [Stephen]144-stephen , considering . ‘[144-stephen] Why , [sir]2771-sir , Friday or Saturday , nigh ’bout . ’[71-tom] ‘ Friday or Saturday , ’[71-tom] said [Tom]71-tom . ‘ Now look here ! So [I]71-tom tell [you]144-stephen what . [You]144-stephen ’ll know [[our]4066-our light porter]4062-our light porter again ? ’[71-tom] ‘ Yes , sure , ’[144-stephen] said [Stephen]144-stephen . ‘ Very well , ’[71-tom] returned [Tom]71-tom . ‘ When [you]144-stephen leave work of a night , between this and [your]144-stephen going away , just hang about [the Bank]3524-the bank an hour or so , will [you]144-stephen ? [You]144-stephen are sure [you]144-stephen understand . ’[1655-i] [He]1655-i had wormed a finger , in the darkness , through a button - hole of [Stephen]144-stephen ’s coat , and was screwing that corner of the garment tight up round and round , in an extraordinary manner . ‘ [I]144-stephen understand , [sir]2771-sir , ’[144-stephen] said [Stephen]144-stephen . ‘ Now look here ! ’[71-tom] repeated [Tom]71-tom . ‘ Be sure [you]144-stephen do n’t make any mistake then , and do n’t forget . [You]1656-you ’re[71-tom] all right , are [you]1656-you ? [You]1656-you understand all about it ? Very well then . [He]1655-i was at the bottom when [she]101-loo began to descend , and was in [the street]461-the street before [she]101-loo could take [his]1655-i arm . [Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler remained in [[her]182-mrs. pegler corner]4077-her corner until [the brother and sister]3208-the brother and sister were gone , and until [Stephen]144-stephen came back with the candle in [his]144-stephen hand . [She]182-mrs. pegler was in a state of inexpressible admiration of [Mrs. Bounderby]155-mrs. bounderby , and , like [an unaccountable old woman]4079-an unaccountable old woman , wept , ‘[1657-she] because [she]1657-she was such [a pretty dear]1658-a pretty dear . ’ Yet [Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler was so flurried lest the object of [her]182-mrs. pegler admiration should return by chance , or [anybody else]4080-anybody else should come , that [her]182-mrs. pegler cheerfulness was ended for that night . It was late too , to [people who rose early and worked hard]4081-people who rose early and worked hard ; therefore the party broke up ; and [Stephen]144-stephen and [Rachael]146-rachael escorted [[their]1659-they mysterious acquaintance]4082-their mysterious acquaintance to the door of [the Travellers ’[1657-she] Coffee House]4083-the travellers ’ coffee house , where [they]1659-they parted from [her]1657-she . [They]1659-they walked back together to [the corner of [the street]461-the street where [Rachael]146-rachael lived]1660-the corner of the street where rachael lived , and as [they]1659-they drew nearer and nearer to [it]1660-the corner of the street where rachael lived , silence crept upon [them]1659-they .
