[Her]126-mrs. sparsit hands rested in one another , like the hands of a statue ; and even [her]126-mrs. sparsit manner of speaking was not hurried . ‘ [[My]167-mr. harthouse dear child]4468-my dear child , ’[167-mr. harthouse] said [Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse ; [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit saw with delight that [his]167-mr. harthouse arm embraced [her]126-mrs. sparsit ; ‘ will [you]126-mrs. sparsit not bear with [[my]167-mr. harthouse society]4469-my society for a little while ? ’[167-mr. harthouse] ‘ Not here . ’[126-mrs. sparsit] ‘ Where , [Louisa]92-louisa ? ‘[167-mr. harthouse] Not here . ’ ‘[126-mrs. sparsit] But [we]2006-we have so little time to make so much of , and [I]0-i have come so far , and am altogether so devoted , and distracted . There never was [a slave]2007-a slave at once so devoted and ill - used by [[his]2007-a slave mistress]2008-his mistress . To look for [your]126-mrs. sparsit sunny welcome that has warmed [me]0-i into life , and to be received in [your]126-mrs. sparsit frozen manner , is heart - rending . ’ ‘[0-i] Am [I]0-i to say again , that [I]0-i must be left to [myself]0-i here ? ’ ‘[0-i] But [we]2006-we must meet , [[my]0-i dear]601-my dear [Louisa]92-louisa . Where shall [we]2006-we meet ? ’ [They]2006-we both started . [The listener]4470-the listener started , guiltily , too ; for [she]4470-the listener thought there was [another listener among the trees]4471-another listener among the trees . It was only rain , beginning to fall fast , in heavy drops . ‘[0-i] Shall [I]0-i ride up to [the house]2918-the house a few minutes hence , innocently supposing that [its master]338-its master is at [home]2856-home and will be charmed to receive [me]0-i ? ’ ‘[0-i] No ! ’ ‘[0-i] [Your]126-mrs. sparsit cruel commands are implicitly to be obeyed ; though [I]0-i am [the most unfortunate fellow in [the world]301-the world]2013-the most unfortunate fellow in the world , [I]0-i believe , to have been insensible to [all other women]2015-all other women , and to have fallen prostrate at last under the foot of the most beautiful , and the most engaging , and the most imperious . [[My]0-i dearest]2016-my dearest [Louisa]92-louisa , [I]0-i can not go [myself]0-i , or let [you]92-louisa go , in this hard abuse of [your]92-louisa power . ’ [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit saw [him]0-i detain [her]92-louisa with [his]0-i encircling arm , and heard [him]0-i then and there , within [her]126-mrs. sparsit ( [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit ’s ) greedy hearing , tell [her]92-louisa how [he]0-i loved [her]92-louisa , and how [she]92-louisa was the stake for which [he]0-i ardently desired to play away all that [he]0-i had in life . The objects [he]0-i had lately pursued , turned worthless beside [her]92-louisa ; such success as was almost in [his]0-i grasp , [he]0-i flung away from [him]0-i like the dirt it was , compared with [her]92-louisa . Its pursuit , nevertheless , if it kept [him]0-i near [her]92-louisa , or its renunciation if it took [him]0-i from [her]92-louisa , or flight if [she]92-louisa shared it , or secrecy if [she]92-louisa commanded it , or any fate , or every fate , all was alike to [him]0-i , so that [she]92-louisa was true to [him]0-i , — [the man who had seen how cast away [she]92-louisa was , whom [she]92-louisa had inspired at [their]4473-they first meeting with an admiration , an interest , of which [he]0-i had thought [himself]0-i incapable , whom [she]92-louisa had received into [her]92-louisa confidence , who was devoted to [her]92-louisa and adored [her]92-louisa]4472-the man who had seen how cast away she was , whom she had inspired at their first meeting with an admiration , an interest , of which he had thought himself incapable , whom she had received into her confidence , who was devoted to her and adored her . All this , and more , in [his]0-i hurry , and in [hers]92-louisa , in the whirl of [her]92-louisa own gratified malice , in the dread of being discovered , in the rapidly increasing noise of heavy rain among the leaves , and a thunderstorm rolling up — [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit received into [her]92-louisa mind , set off with such an unavoidable halo of confusion and indistinctness , that when at length [he]0-i climbed the fence and led [his]0-i horse away , [she]92-louisa was not sure where [they]4473-they were to meet , or when , except that [they]4473-they had said it was to be that night . But one of [them]4473-they yet remained in the darkness before [her]92-louisa ; and while [she]92-louisa tracked [that one]4474-that one [she]92-louisa must be right . ‘[4465-my dearest love] Oh , [[my]0-i dearest love]4465-my dearest love , ’ thought [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , ‘[4465-my dearest love] [you]4465-my dearest love little think how well attended [you]4465-my dearest love are ! ’ [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit saw [her]92-louisa out of the wood , and saw [her]92-louisa enter [the house]2918-the house . What to do next ? It rained now , in a sheet of water . [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit ’s white stockings were of many colours , green predominating ; prickly things were in [her]126-mrs. sparsit shoes ; caterpillars slung [themselves]4476-themselves , in hammocks of [their]4476-themselves own making , from various parts of [her]126-mrs. sparsit dress ; rills ran from [her]126-mrs. sparsit bonnet , and [her]126-mrs. sparsit Roman nose . In such condition , [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit stood hidden in the density of the shrubbery , considering what next ? [Lo]207-lo , [Louisa]92-louisa coming out of [the house]2918-the house ! Hastily cloaked and muffled , and stealing away . [She]92-louisa elopes ! [She]92-louisa falls from the lowermost stair , and is swallowed up in [the gulf]4430-the gulf . Indifferent to the rain , and moving with a quick determined step , [she]92-louisa struck into a side - path parallel with [the ride]4479-the ride . [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit followed in the shadow of the trees , at but a short distance ; for it was not easy to keep [a figure]4480-a figure in view going quickly through the umbrageous darkness . When [she]92-louisa stopped to close the side - gate without noise , [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit stopped . When [she]92-louisa went on , [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit went on . [She]126-mrs. sparsit went by the way [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit had come , emerged from [the green lane]4481-the green lane , crossed [the stony road]4482-the stony road , and ascended the wooden steps to [the railroad]1105-the railroad . [A train]4484-a train for [Coketown]4-coketown would come through presently , [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit knew ; so [she]126-mrs. sparsit understood [Coketown]4-coketown to be [[her]126-mrs. sparsit first place of destination]4485-her first place of destination . In [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit ’s limp and streaming state , no extensive precautions were necessary to change [her]126-mrs. sparsit usual appearance ; but , [she]126-mrs. sparsit stopped under the lee of the station wall , tumbled [her]126-mrs. sparsit shawl into a new shape , and put it on over [her]126-mrs. sparsit bonnet . So disguised [she]126-mrs. sparsit had no fear of being recognized when [she]126-mrs. sparsit followed up [the railroad steps]4486-the railroad steps , and paid [her]126-mrs. sparsit money in [the small office]4487-the small office . [Louisa]92-louisa sat waiting in a corner . [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit sat waiting in another corner . [Both]2854-both listened to the thunder , which was loud , and to the rain , as it washed off the roof , and pattered on the parapets of the arches . Two or three lamps were rained out and blown out ; so , [both]2854-both saw the lightning to advantage as it quivered and zigzagged on [the iron tracks]4490-the iron tracks . The seizure of [the station]3414-the station with a fit of trembling , gradually deepening to a complaint of the heart , announced [the train]1988-the train . Fire and steam , and smoke , and red light ; a hiss , a crash , a bell , and a shriek ; [Louisa]92-louisa put into [one carriage]4493-one carriage , [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit put into another : [the little station]1991-the little station a desert speck in the thunderstorm . Though [her]126-mrs. sparsit teeth chattered in [her]126-mrs. sparsit head from wet and cold , [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit exulted hugely . The figure had plunged down the precipice , and [she]126-mrs. sparsit felt [herself]126-mrs. sparsit , as it were , attending on the body . Could [she]126-mrs. sparsit , who had been so active in the getting up of the funeral triumph , do less than exult ? ‘[2018-her] [She]2018-her will be at [Coketown]4-coketown long before [him]2019-him , ’ thought [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , ‘[2018-her] though [his]2019-him horse is never so good . Where will [she]2018-her wait for [him]2019-him ? And where will [they]2020-they go together ? Patience . [We]2021-we shall see . ’ The tremendous rain occasioned infinite confusion , when [the train]1988-the train stopped at its destination . [Gutters]4496-gutters and pipes had burst , drains had overflowed , and [streets]4497-streets were under water . In the first instant of alighting , [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit turned [her]126-mrs. sparsit distracted eyes towards [the waiting coaches]4498-the waiting coaches , which were in great request . ‘[2018-her] [She]2018-her will get into one , ’ [she]126-mrs. sparsit considered , ‘[2018-her] and will be away before [I]0-i can follow in another . At all risks of being run over , [I]0-i must see the number , and hear the order given to [the coachman]2022-the coachman . ’ But , [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit was wrong in [her]126-mrs. sparsit calculation . [Louisa]92-louisa got into [no coach]4499-no coach , and was already gone . The black eyes kept upon [the railroad - carriage]4500-the railroad - carriage in which [she]92-louisa had travelled , settled upon [it]4500-the railroad - carriage a moment too late . The door not being opened after several minutes , [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit passed it and repassed it , saw nothing , looked in , and found [it]4500-the railroad - carriage empty . Wet through and through : with [her]2018-her feet squelching and squashing in [her]2018-her shoes whenever [she]2018-her moved ; with a rash of rain upon [her]2018-her classical visage ; with a bonnet like an over - ripe fig ; with all [her]2018-her clothes spoiled ; with damp impressions of every button , string , and hook - and - eye [she]2018-her wore , printed off upon [her]2018-her highly connected back ; with a stagnant verdure on [her]2018-her general exterior , such as accumulates on an old park fence in [a mouldy lane]4501-a mouldy lane ; [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit had no resource but to burst into tears of bitterness and say , ‘[0-i] [I]0-i have lost [her]2023-her ! ’ [The national dustmen]4502-the national dustmen , after entertaining [one another]551-one another with a great many noisy little fights among [themselves]4502-the national dustmen , had dispersed for the present , and [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom was at [home]2856-home for the vacation . [He]71-tom sat writing in [the room]2901-the room with the deadly statistical clock , proving something no doubt — probably , in the main , that [the Good Samaritan]4506-the good samaritan was [a Bad Economist]4507-a bad economist . The noise of the rain did not disturb [him]71-tom much ; but it attracted [his]71-tom attention sufficiently to make [him]71-tom raise [his]71-tom head sometimes , as if [he]71-tom were rather remonstrating with the elements . When it thundered very loudly , [he]71-tom glanced towards [Coketown]4-coketown , having it in [his]71-tom mind that some of the tall chimneys might be struck by lightning . The thunder was rolling into distance , and the rain was pouring down like a deluge , when the door of [[his]71-tom room]945-his room opened . [He]71-tom looked round the lamp upon [his]71-tom table , and saw , with amazement , [[his]71-tom eldest daughter]4509-his eldest daughter . ‘[92-louisa] [Louisa]92-louisa ! ’ ‘[92-louisa] [Father]108-father , [I]0-i want to speak to [you]108-father . ’ ‘[0-i] What is the matter ? How strange [you]92-louisa look ! And good Heaven , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , wondering more and more , ‘[0-i] have [you]92-louisa come here exposed to this storm ? ’ [She]92-louisa put [her]92-louisa hands to [her]92-louisa dress , as if [she]92-louisa hardly knew . ‘[0-i] Yes . ’ Then [she]92-louisa uncovered [her]92-louisa head , and letting [her]92-louisa cloak and hood fall where they might , stood looking at [him]108-father : so colourless , so dishevelled , so defiant and despairing , that [he]108-father was afraid of [her]92-louisa . ‘[0-i] What is it ? [I]0-i conjure [you]92-louisa , [Louisa]92-louisa , tell [me]0-i what is the matter . ’ [She]92-louisa dropped into a chair before [him]108-father , and put [her]92-louisa cold hand on [his]108-father arm . ‘[92-louisa] [Father]108-father , [you]108-father have trained [me]0-i from [my]0-i cradle ? ’ ‘[92-louisa] Yes , [Louisa]92-louisa . ’ ‘[92-louisa] [I]0-i curse the hour in which [I]0-i was born to such a destiny . ’ [He]108-father looked at [her]92-louisa in doubt and dread , vacantly repeating : ‘[0-i] Curse the hour ? Curse the hour ? ’ ‘[0-i] How could [you]108-father give [me]0-i life , and take from [me]0-i all the inappreciable things that raise it from the state of conscious death ? Where are the graces of [my]0-i soul ? Where are the sentiments of [my]0-i heart ? What have [you]108-father done , O [father]2781-father , what have [you]108-father done , with the garden that should have bloomed once , in [this great wilderness]2025-this great wilderness here ! ’ [She]92-louisa struck [herself]92-louisa with both [her]92-louisa hands upon [her]92-louisa bosom . ‘[108-father] If it had ever been here , its ashes alone would save [me]0-i from the void in which [my]0-i whole life sinks . [I]0-i did not mean to say this ; but , [father]2781-father , [you]2781-father remember the last time [we]2027-we conversed in [this room]1557-this room ? ’ [He]2781-father had been so wholly unprepared for what [he]2781-father heard now , that it was with difficulty [he]2781-father answered , ‘[92-louisa] Yes , [Louisa]92-louisa . ’ ‘[92-louisa] What has risen to [my]0-i lips now , would have risen to [my]0-i lips then , if [you]2781-father had given [me]0-i a moment ’s help . [I]0-i do n’t reproach [you]2781-father , [father]2781-father . What [you]2781-father have never nurtured in [me]0-i , [you]2781-father have never nurtured in [yourself]2781-father ; but O ! if [you]2781-father had only done so long ago , or if [you]2781-father had only neglected [me]0-i , what [a much better and much happier creature]2030-a much better and much happier creature [I]0-i should have been this day ! ’ On hearing this , after all [his]2781-father care , [he]2781-father bowed [his]2781-father head upon [his]2781-father hand and groaned aloud . ‘[108-father] [Father]108-father , if [you]108-father had known , when [we]2031-we were last together [here]366-here , what even [I]0-i feared while [I]0-i strove against it — as it has been [my]0-i task from infancy to strive against every natural prompting that has arisen in [my]0-i heart ; if [you]108-father had known that there lingered in [my]0-i breast , sensibilities , affections , weaknesses capable of being cherished into strength , defying all the calculations ever made by [man]2967-man , and no more known to [his]2967-man arithmetic than [[his]2967-man Creator]2034-his creator is , — would [you]108-father have given [me]0-i to [the husband whom [I]0-i am now sure that [I]0-i hate]2035-the husband whom i am now sure that i hate ? ’ [He]0-i said , ‘[108-father] No . No , [[my]0-i poor child]2036-my poor child . ’ ‘[108-father] Would [you]108-father have doomed [me]0-i , at any time , to the frost and blight that have hardened and spoiled [me]0-i ? Would [you]108-father have robbed [me]0-i — for [no one]3086-no one ’s enrichment — only for the greater desolation of [this world]3460-this world — of the immaterial part of [my]0-i life , the spring and summer of [my]0-i belief , [my]0-i refuge from what is sordid and bad in the real things around [me]0-i , [[my]0-i school]2039-my school in which [I]0-i should have learned to be more humble and more trusting with [them]2040-them , and to hope in [my]0-i little sphere to make [them]2040-them better ? ’ ‘[92-louisa] O no , no . No , [Louisa]92-louisa . ’ ‘[92-louisa] Yet , [father]2781-father , if [I]0-i had been stone blind ; if [I]0-i had groped [my]0-i way by [my]0-i sense of touch , and had been free , while [I]0-i knew the shapes and surfaces of things , to exercise [my]0-i fancy somewhat , in regard to them ; [I]0-i should have been a million times wiser , happier , more loving , more contented , more innocent and human in all good respects , than [I]0-i am with the eyes [I]0-i have . Now , hear what [I]0-i have come to say . ’ [He]2781-father moved , to support [her]92-louisa with [his]2781-father arm . [She]92-louisa rising as [he]2781-father did so , [they]4510-they stood close together : [she]92-louisa , with a hand upon [his]2781-father shoulder , looking fixedly in [his]2781-father face . ‘[0-i] With a hunger and thirst upon [me]0-i , [father]2781-father , which have never been for a moment appeased ; with an ardent impulse towards some region where rules , and figures , and definitions were not quite absolute ; [I]0-i have grown up , battling every inch of [my]0-i way . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i never knew [you]0-i were unhappy , [[my]0-i child]1020-my child . ’ ‘[2781-father] [Father]2781-father , [I]0-i always knew it . In this strife [I]0-i have almost repulsed and crushed [[my]0-i better angel]2045-my better angel into a demon . What [I]0-i have learned has left [me]0-i doubting , misbelieving , despising , regretting , what [I]0-i have not learned ; and [my]0-i dismal resource has been to think that life would soon go by , and that nothing in it could be worth the pain and trouble of a contest . ’ ‘[0-i] And [you]0-i so young , [Louisa]92-louisa ! ’ [he]2781-father said with pity . ‘[0-i] And [I]0-i so young . In this condition , [father]2781-father — for [I]0-i show [you]2781-father now , without fear or favour , the ordinary deadened state of [my]0-i mind as [I]0-i know it — [you]2781-father proposed [[my]0-i husband]1283-my husband to [me]0-i . [I]0-i took [him]1283-my husband . [I]0-i never made a pretence to [him]1283-my husband or [you]2781-father that [I]0-i loved [him]1283-my husband . [I]0-i knew , and , [father]2781-father , [you]2781-father knew , and [he]1283-my husband knew , that [I]0-i never did . [I]0-i was not wholly indifferent , for [I]0-i had a hope of being pleasant and useful to [Tom]71-tom . [I]0-i made that wild escape into something visionary , and have slowly found out how wild it was . But [Tom]71-tom had been the subject of all the little tenderness of [my]0-i life ; perhaps [he]71-tom became so because [I]0-i knew so well how to pity [him]71-tom . It matters little now , except as it may dispose [you]2781-father to think more leniently of [his]71-tom errors . ’ As [[her]2781-father father]2855-her father held [her]2781-father in [his]2855-her father arms , [she]2781-father put [her]2781-father other hand upon [his]2855-her father other shoulder , and still looking fixedly in [his]2855-her father face , went on . ‘[71-tom] When [I]0-i was irrevocably married , there rose up into rebellion against the tie , the old strife , made fiercer by all those causes of disparity which arise out of [our]2049-our two individual natures , and which no general laws shall ever rule or state for [me]0-i , [father]2781-father , until [they]2051-they shall be able to direct [the anatomist]2052-the anatomist where to strike [his]2052-the anatomist knife into the secrets of [my]0-i soul . ’ ‘[2052-the anatomist] [Louisa]92-louisa ! ’ [he]2855-her father said , and said imploringly ; for [he]2855-her father well remembered what had passed between [them]2049-our in [their]2049-our former interview . ‘[92-louisa] [I]0-i do not reproach [you]2781-father , [father]2781-father , [I]0-i make no complaint . [I]0-i am here with another object . ’ ‘[0-i] What can [I]0-i do , [child]1347-child ? Ask [me]0-i what [you]1347-child will . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i am coming to it . [Father]108-father , chance then threw into [my]0-i way a new acquaintance ; [a man such as [I]0-i had had no experience of ; used to [the world]301-the world]2055-a man such as i had had no experience of ; used to the world ; light , polished , easy ; making no pretences ; avowing the low estimate of everything , that [I]0-i was half afraid to form in secret ; conveying to [me]0-i almost immediately , though [I]0-i do n’t know how or by what degrees , that [he]2055-a man such as i had had no experience of ; used to the world understood [me]0-i , and read [my]0-i thoughts . [I]0-i could not find that [he]2055-a man such as i had had no experience of ; used to the world was worse than [I.]0-i There seemed to be a near affinity between [us]2057-us . [I]0-i only wondered it should be worth [his]2055-a man such as i had had no experience of ; used to the world while , who cared for nothing else , to care so much for [me]0-i . ’ ‘[2055-a man such as i had had no experience of ; used to the world] For [you]1347-child , [Louisa]92-louisa ! ’ [[Her]1347-child father]2855-her father might instinctively have loosened [his]2855-her father hold , but that [he]2855-her father felt [her]1347-child strength departing from [her]1347-child , and saw a wild dilating fire in the eyes steadfastly regarding [him]2855-her father . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i say nothing of [his]2055-a man such as i had had no experience of ; used to the world plea for claiming [my]0-i confidence . It matters very little how [he]2055-a man such as i had had no experience of ; used to the world gained it . [Father]108-father , [he]2055-a man such as i had had no experience of ; used to the world did gain it . What [you]108-father know of the story of [my]0-i marriage , [he]2055-a man such as i had had no experience of ; used to the world soon knew , just as well . ’ [[Her]1347-child father]2855-her father ’s face was ashy white , and [he]2855-her father held [her]1347-child in both [his]2855-her father arms . ‘[2055-a man such as i had had no experience of ; used to the world] [I]0-i have done no worse , [I]0-i have not disgraced [you]108-father . But if [you]108-father ask [me]0-i whether [I]0-i have loved [him]2055-a man such as i had had no experience of ; used to the world , or do love [him]2055-a man such as i had had no experience of ; used to the world , [I]0-i tell [you]108-father plainly , [father]2781-father , that it may be so . [I]0-i do n’t know . ’ [She]1347-child took [her]1347-child hands suddenly from [his]2781-father shoulders , and pressed them both upon [her]1347-child side ; while in [her]1347-child face , not like itself — and in [her]1347-child figure , drawn up , resolute to finish by a last effort what [she]1347-child had to say — the feelings long suppressed broke loose . ‘[0-i] This night , [[my]0-i husband]1283-my husband being away , [he]2055-a man such as i had had no experience of ; used to the world has been with [me]0-i , declaring [himself]2055-a man such as i had had no experience of ; used to the world [[my]0-i lover]2060-my lover . This minute [he]2055-a man such as i had had no experience of ; used to the world expects [me]0-i , for [I]0-i could release [myself]0-i of [his]2055-a man such as i had had no experience of ; used to the world presence by no other means . [I]0-i do not know that [I]0-i am sorry , [I]0-i do not know that [I]0-i am ashamed , [I]0-i do not know that [I]0-i am degraded in [my]0-i own esteem . All that [I]0-i know is , [your]2061-your philosophy and [your]2061-your teaching will not save [me]0-i . Now , [father]2781-father , [you]2061-your have brought [me]0-i to this . Save [me]0-i by some other means ! ’ [He]2781-father tightened [his]2781-father hold in time to prevent [her]4514-her sinking on the floor , but [she]4514-her cried out in a terrible voice , ‘[2061-your] [I]0-i shall die if [you]2061-your hold [me]0-i ! Let [me]0-i fall upon the ground ! ’ And [he]2781-father laid [her]4514-her down there , and saw the pride of [his]2781-father heart and the triumph of [his]2781-father system , lying , an insensible heap , at [his]2781-father feet . [Louisa]92-louisa awoke from a torpor , and [her]92-louisa eyes languidly opened on [her]92-louisa old bed at [home]2856-home , and [[her]92-louisa old room]4516-her old room . It seemed , at first , as if all that had happened since the days when these objects were familiar to [her]92-louisa were the shadows of a dream , but gradually , as the objects became more real to [her]92-louisa sight , the events became more real to [her]92-louisa mind . [She]92-louisa could scarcely move [her]92-louisa head for pain and heaviness , [her]92-louisa eyes were strained and sore , and [she]92-louisa was very weak . A curious passive inattention had such possession of [her]92-louisa , that the presence of [[her]92-louisa little sister]4517-her little sister in [the room]2901-the room did not attract [her]92-louisa notice for some time . Even when [their]4519-their eyes had met , and [[her]92-louisa sister]1886-her sister had approached the bed , [Louisa]92-louisa lay for minutes looking at [her]1886-her sister in silence , and suffering [her]1886-her sister timidly to hold [her]1886-her sister passive hand , before [she]92-louisa asked : ‘[2061-your] When was [I]0-i brought to [this room]1557-this room ? ’ ‘[0-i] Last night , [Louisa]92-louisa . ’ ‘[92-louisa] Who brought [me]0-i [here]366-here ? ’ ‘[92-louisa] [Sissy]76-sissy , [I]0-i believe . ’ ‘[0-i] Why do [you]0-i believe so ? ’ ‘[0-i] Because [I]0-i found [her]76-sissy [here]366-here this morning . [She]76-sissy did n’t come to [my]0-i bedside to wake [me]0-i , as [she]76-sissy always does ; and [I]0-i went to look for [her]76-sissy . [She]76-sissy was not in [[her]76-sissy own room]2066-her own room either ; and [I]0-i went looking for [her]76-sissy all over [the house]2918-the house , until [I]0-i found [her]76-sissy here taking care of [you]0-i and cooling [your]0-i head . Will [you]0-i see [father]2781-father ? [Sissy]76-sissy said [I]0-i was to tell [him]2781-father when [you]0-i woke . ’ ‘[0-i] What a beaming face [you]0-i have , [Jane]100-jane ! ’ said [Louisa]92-louisa , as [[her]92-louisa young sister]4521-her young sister — timidly still — bent down to kiss [her]4521-her young sister . ‘[0-i] Have [I]0-i ? [I]0-i am very glad [you]0-i think so . [I]0-i am sure it must be [Sissy]76-sissy ’s doing . ’ The arm [Louisa]92-louisa had begun to twine around [her]4521-her young sister neck , unbent itself . ‘[0-i] [You]0-i can tell [father]2781-father if [you]0-i will . ’ Then , staying [her]4521-her young sister for a moment , [she]92-louisa said , ‘[0-i] It was [you]2781-father who made [[my]0-i room]3517-my room so cheerful , and gave [it]3517-my room this look of welcome ? ’ ‘[2781-father] Oh no , [Louisa]92-louisa , it was done before [I]0-i came . It was — ’ [Louisa]92-louisa turned upon [her]92-louisa pillow , and heard no more . When [[her]92-louisa sister]1886-her sister had withdrawn , [she]92-louisa turned [her]92-louisa head back again , and lay with [her]92-louisa face towards the door , until it opened and [[her]92-louisa father]2855-her father entered . [He]2855-her father had a jaded anxious look upon [him]2855-her father , and [his]2855-her father hand , usually steady , trembled in [hers]92-louisa . [He]2855-her father sat down at the side of the bed , tenderly asking how [she]92-louisa was , and dwelling on the necessity of [her]92-louisa keeping very quiet after [her]92-louisa agitation and exposure to the weather last night . [He]2855-her father spoke in a subdued and troubled voice , very different from [his]2855-her father usual dictatorial manner ; and was often at a loss for words . ‘[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]601-my dear [Louisa]92-louisa . [[My]0-i poor daughter]2072-my poor daughter . ’ [He]2855-her father was so much at a loss at [that place]1896-that place , that [he]2855-her father stopped altogether . [He]2855-her father tried again . ‘[0-i] [[My]0-i unfortunate child]2073-my unfortunate child . ’ [The place]2849-the place was so difficult to get over , that [he]2855-her father tried again . ‘[0-i] It would be hopeless for [me]0-i , [Louisa]92-louisa , to endeavour to tell [you]92-louisa how overwhelmed [I]0-i have been , and still am , by what broke upon [me]0-i last night . The ground on which [I]0-i stand has ceased to be solid under [my]0-i feet . The only support on which [I]0-i leaned , and the strength of which it seemed , and still does seem , impossible to question , has given way in an instant . [I]0-i am stunned by these discoveries . [I]0-i have no selfish meaning in what [I]0-i say ; but [I]0-i find the shock of what broke upon [me]0-i last night , to be very heavy indeed . ’ [She]92-louisa could give [him]0-i no comfort herein . [She]92-louisa had suffered the wreck of [her]92-louisa whole life upon [the rock]4526-the rock . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i will not say , [Louisa]92-louisa , that if [you]92-louisa had by any happy chance undeceived [me]0-i some time ago , it would have been better for [us]2074-us both ; better for [your]92-louisa peace , and better for [mine]0-i . For [I]0-i am sensible that it may not have been a part of [my]0-i system to invite any confidence of that kind . [I]0-i had proved [my]0-i — [my]0-i system to [myself]0-i , and [I]0-i have rigidly administered it ; and [I]0-i must bear the responsibility of its failures . [I]0-i only entreat [you]92-louisa to believe , [[my]0-i favourite child]3599-my favourite child , that [I]0-i have meant to do right . ’ [He]0-i said it earnestly , and to do [him]3599-my favourite child justice [he]0-i had . In gauging fathomless deeps with [his]0-i little mean excise - rod , and in staggering over [the universe]4527-the universe with [his]0-i rusty stiff - legged compasses , [he]0-i had meant to do great things . Within the limits of [his]0-i short tether [he]0-i had tumbled about , annihilating the flowers of existence with greater singleness of purpose than many of [the blatant personages whose company [he]0-i kept]4528-the blatant personages whose company he kept . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i am well assured of what [you]92-louisa say , [father]2781-father . [I]0-i know [I]0-i have been [[your]92-louisa favourite child]2077-your favourite child . [I]0-i know [you]92-louisa have intended to make [me]0-i happy . [I]0-i have never blamed [you]92-louisa , and [I]0-i never shall . ’ [He]0-i took [her]601-my dear outstretched hand , and retained it in [his]0-i . ‘[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]601-my dear , [I]0-i have remained all night at [my]0-i table , pondering again and again on what has so painfully passed between [us]2079-us . When [I]0-i consider [your]601-my dear character ; when [I]0-i consider that what has been known to [me]0-i for hours , has been concealed by [you]601-my dear for years ; when [I]0-i consider under what immediate pressure it has been forced from [you]601-my dear at last ; [I]0-i come to the conclusion that [I]0-i can not but mistrust [myself]0-i . ’ [He]0-i might have added more than all , when [he]0-i saw the face now looking at [him]0-i . [He]0-i did add it in effect , perhaps , as [he]0-i softly moved [her]92-louisa scattered hair from [her]92-louisa forehead with [his]0-i hand . Such little actions , slight in [another man]895-another man , were very noticeable in [him]0-i ; and [[his]0-i daughter]2865-his daughter received them as if they had been words of contrition . ‘[0-i] But , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , slowly , and with hesitation , as well as with a wretched sense of happiness , ‘[0-i] if [I]0-i see reason to mistrust [myself]0-i for the past , [Louisa]92-louisa , [I]0-i should also mistrust [myself]0-i for the present and the future . To speak unreservedly to [you]92-louisa , [I]0-i do . [I]0-i am far from feeling convinced now , however differently [I]0-i might have felt only this time yesterday , that [I]0-i am fit for the trust [you]92-louisa repose in [me]0-i ; that [I]0-i know how to respond to the appeal [you]92-louisa have come [home]2856-home to make to [me]0-i ; that [I]0-i have the right instinct — supposing it for the moment to be some quality of that nature — how to help [you]92-louisa , and to set [you]92-louisa right , [[my]0-i child]1020-my child . ’ [She]92-louisa had turned upon [her]92-louisa pillow , and lay with [her]92-louisa face upon [her]92-louisa arm , so that [he]0-i could not see it . All [her]92-louisa wildness and passion had subsided ; but , though softened , [she]92-louisa was not in tears . [[Her]92-louisa father]2855-her father was changed in nothing so much as in the respect that [he]0-i would have been glad to see [her]92-louisa in tears . ‘[2082-some persons] [Some persons]2082-some persons hold , ’ [he]0-i pursued , still hesitating , ‘[2082-some persons] that there is a wisdom of the Head , and that there is a wisdom of the Heart . [I]0-i have not supposed so ; but , as [I]0-i have said , [I]0-i mistrust [myself]0-i now . [I]0-i have supposed the head to be all - sufficient . It may not be all - sufficient ; how can [I]0-i venture this morning to say it is ! If that other kind of wisdom should be what [I]0-i have neglected , and should be the instinct that is wanted , [Louisa]92-louisa — ’ [He]0-i suggested it very doubtfully , as if [he]0-i were half unwilling to admit it even now . [She]92-louisa made [him]0-i no answer , lying before [him]0-i on [her]92-louisa bed , still half - dressed , much as [he]0-i had seen [her]92-louisa lying on the floor of [[his]0-i room]945-his room last night . ‘[92-louisa] [Louisa]92-louisa , ’ and [his]0-i hand rested on [her]92-louisa hair again , ‘[92-louisa] [I]0-i have been absent from [here]366-here , [[my]0-i dear]601-my dear , a good deal of late ; and though [[your]92-louisa sister]354-your sister ’s training has been pursued according to — the system , ’ [he]0-i appeared to come to that word with great reluctance always , ‘[0-i] it has necessarily been modified by daily associations begun , in [her]354-your sister case , at an early age . [I]0-i ask [you]92-louisa — ignorantly and humbly , [[my]0-i daughter]2086-my daughter — for the better , do [you]92-louisa think ? ’ ‘[108-father] [Father]108-father , ’ [she]92-louisa replied , without stirring , ‘[108-father] if any harmony has been awakened in [her]354-your sister young breast that was mute in [mine]0-i until it turned to discord , let [her]354-your sister thank [Heaven]81-heaven for it , and go upon [her]354-your sister happier way , taking it as [her]354-your sister greatest blessing that [she]354-your sister has avoided [my]0-i way . ’ ‘[354-your sister] O [[my]0-i child]1020-my child , [[my]0-i child]1020-my child ! ’ [he]0-i said , in a forlorn manner , ‘[354-your sister] [I]0-i am [an unhappy man]2089-an unhappy man to see [you]92-louisa thus ! What avails it to [me]0-i that [you]92-louisa do not reproach [me]0-i , if [I]0-i so bitterly reproach [myself]0-i ! ’ [He]0-i bent [his]0-i head , and spoke low to [her]92-louisa . ‘[92-louisa] [Louisa]92-louisa , [I]0-i have a misgiving that some change may have been slowly working about [me]0-i in [this house]684-this house , by mere love and gratitude : that what the Head had left undone and could not do , the Heart may have been doing silently . Can it be so ? ’ [She]92-louisa made [him]0-i no reply . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i am not too proud to believe it , [Louisa]92-louisa . How could [I]0-i be arrogant , and [you]92-louisa before [me]0-i ! Can it be so ? Is it so , [[my]0-i dear]601-my dear ? ’ [He]0-i looked upon [her]92-louisa once more , lying cast away there ; and without another word went out of [the room]2901-the room . [He]0-i had not been long gone , when [she]92-louisa heard a light tread near the door , and knew that [some one]3472-some one stood beside [her]92-louisa . [She]92-louisa did not raise [her]92-louisa head . A dull anger that [she]92-louisa should be seen in [her]92-louisa distress , and that the involuntary look [she]92-louisa had so resented should come to this fulfilment , smouldered within [her]92-louisa like an unwholesome fire . [All closely imprisoned forces]4535-all closely imprisoned forces rend and destroy . The air that would be healthful to [the earth]690-the earth , the water that would enrich it , the heat that would ripen it , tear it when caged up . So in [her]92-louisa bosom even now ; the strongest qualities [she]92-louisa possessed , long turned upon themselves , became a heap of obduracy , that rose against [a friend]1213-a friend . It was well that soft touch came upon [her]92-louisa neck , and that [she]92-louisa understood [herself]92-louisa to be supposed to have fallen asleep . The sympathetic hand did not claim [her]92-louisa resentment . Let it lie there , let it lie . It lay there , warming into life a crowd of gentler thoughts ; and [she]92-louisa rested . As [she]92-louisa softened with the quiet , and the consciousness of being so watched , some tears made their way into [her]92-louisa eyes . The face touched [hers]92-louisa , and [she]92-louisa knew that there were tears upon it too , and [she]92-louisa the cause of them . As [Louisa]92-louisa feigned to rouse [herself]92-louisa , and sat up , [Sissy]76-sissy retired , so that [she]92-louisa stood placidly near the bedside . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i hope [I]0-i have not disturbed [you]2092-you . [I]0-i have come to ask if [you]2092-you would let [me]0-i stay with [you]2092-you ? ’ ‘[2092-you] Why should [you]2092-you stay with [me]0-i ? [[My]0-i sister]738-my sister will miss [you]2092-you . [You]2092-you are everything to [her]738-my sister . ’ ‘[0-i] Am [I]0-i ? ’ returned [Sissy]76-sissy , shaking [her]76-sissy head . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i would be something to [you]2092-you , if [I]0-i might . ’ ‘[0-i] What ? ’ said [Louisa]92-louisa , almost sternly . ‘[2092-you] Whatever [you]2092-you want most , if [I]0-i could be that . At all events , [I]0-i would like to try to be as near it as [I]0-i can . And however far off that may be , [I]0-i will never tire of trying . Will [you]2092-you let [me]0-i ? ’ ‘[2092-you] [[My]0-i father]4230-my father sent [you]2092-you to ask [me]0-i . ’ ‘[4230-my father] No indeed , ’ replied [Sissy]76-sissy . ‘[4230-my father] [He]4230-my father told [me]0-i that [I]0-i might come in now , but [he]4230-my father sent [me]0-i away from [the room]2901-the room this morning — or at least — ’ [She]2092-you hesitated and stopped . ‘[4230-my father] At least , what ? ’ said [Louisa]92-louisa , with [her]92-louisa searching eyes upon [her]2092-you . ‘[4230-my father] [I]0-i thought it best [myself]0-i that [I]0-i should be sent away , for [I]0-i felt very uncertain whether [you]0-i would like to find [me]0-i [here]366-here . ’ ‘[0-i] Have [I]0-i always hated [you]0-i so much ? ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i hope not , for [I]0-i have always loved [you]0-i , and have always wished that [you]0-i should know it . But [you]0-i changed to [me]0-i a little , shortly before [you]0-i left [home]2856-home . Not that [I]0-i wondered at it . [You]0-i knew so much , and [I]0-i knew so little , and it was so natural in many ways , going as [you]0-i were among [other friends]2098-other friends , that [I]0-i had nothing to complain of , and was not at all hurt . ’ [Her]4538-her colour rose as [she]4538-her said it modestly and hurriedly . [Louisa]92-louisa understood the loving pretence , and [her]92-louisa heart smote [her]92-louisa . ‘[0-i] May [I]0-i try ? ’ said [Sissy]76-sissy , emboldened to raise [her]76-sissy hand to the neck that was insensibly drooping towards [her]92-louisa . [Louisa]92-louisa , taking down the hand that would have embraced [her]92-louisa in another moment , held it in one of [hers]92-louisa , and answered : ‘[0-i] First , [Sissy]76-sissy , do [you]76-sissy know what [I]0-i am ? [I]0-i am so proud and so hardened , so confused and troubled , so resentful and unjust to [every one]4105-every one and to [myself]0-i , that everything is stormy , dark , and wicked to [me]0-i . Does not that repel [you]76-sissy ? ’ ‘[76-sissy] No ! ’ ‘[76-sissy] [I]0-i am so unhappy , and all that should have made [me]0-i otherwise is so laid waste , that if [I]0-i had been bereft of sense to this hour , and instead of being as learned as [you]76-sissy think [me]0-i , had to begin to acquire the simplest truths , [I]0-i could not want a guide to peace , contentment , honour , all the good of which [I]0-i am quite devoid , more abjectly than [I]0-i do . Does not that repel [you]76-sissy ? ’ ‘[76-sissy] No ! ’ In the innocence of [her]92-louisa brave affection , and the brimming up of [her]92-louisa old devoted spirit , [the once deserted girl]4539-the once deserted girl shone like a beautiful light upon the darkness of the other . [Louisa]92-louisa raised the hand that it might clasp [her]92-louisa neck and join its fellow there . [She]92-louisa fell upon [her]92-louisa knees , and clinging to [[this stroller]4540-this stroller ’s child]4541-this stroller ’s child looked up at [her]92-louisa almost with veneration . ‘[76-sissy] Forgive [me]0-i , pity [me]0-i , help [me]0-i ! Have compassion on [my]0-i great need , and let [me]0-i lay this head of mine upon a loving heart ! ’ ‘[0-i] O lay it here ! ’ cried [Sissy]76-sissy . ‘[0-i] Lay it here , [[my]0-i dear]601-my dear . ’ [Mr. James Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse passed a whole night and a day in a state of so much hurry , that [the World]49-the world , with its best glass in [his]167-mr. harthouse eye , would scarcely have recognized [him]167-mr. harthouse during that insane interval , as [the brother Jem of [the honourable and jocular member]4144-the honourable and jocular member]4542-the brother jem of the honourable and jocular member . [He]167-mr. harthouse was positively agitated . [He]167-mr. harthouse several times spoke with an emphasis , similar to the vulgar manner . [He]167-mr. harthouse went in and went out in an unaccountable way , like [a man without an object]4544-a man without an object . [He]167-mr. harthouse rode like [a highwayman]4545-a highwayman . In a word , [he]167-mr. harthouse was so horribly bored by existing circumstances , that [he]167-mr. harthouse forgot to go in for boredom in the manner prescribed by [the authorities]4546-the authorities . After putting [his]167-mr. harthouse horse at [Coketown]4-coketown through the storm , as if it were a leap , [he]167-mr. harthouse waited up all night : from time to time ringing [his]167-mr. harthouse bell with the greatest fury , charging [the porter who kept watch with delinquency in withholding letters or messages that could not fail to have been entrusted to [him]167-mr. harthouse]4547-the porter who kept watch with delinquency in withholding letters or messages that could not fail to have been entrusted to him , and demanding restitution on the spot . The dawn coming , the morning coming , and the day coming , and neither message nor letter coming with either , [he]167-mr. harthouse went down to [the country house]4441-the country house . There , the report was , [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby away , and [Mrs. Bounderby]155-mrs. bounderby in [town]439-town . Left for [town]439-town suddenly last evening . Not even known to be gone until receipt of message , importing that [her]155-mrs. bounderby return was not to be expected for the present . In these circumstances [he]167-mr. harthouse had nothing for it but to follow [her]155-mrs. bounderby to [town]439-town . [He]167-mr. harthouse went to [the house in [town]439-town]4552-the house in town . [Mrs. Bounderby]155-mrs. bounderby not [there]425-there . [He]167-mr. harthouse looked in at [the Bank]3524-the bank . [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby away and [Mrs. Sparsit]4556-mrs. sparsit away . [Mrs. Sparsit]4557-mrs. sparsit away ? Who could have been reduced to sudden extremity for the company of [that griffin]4558-that griffin ! ‘[0-i] Well ! [I]0-i do n’t know , ’ said [Tom]71-tom , who had [his]71-tom own reasons for being uneasy about it . ‘[2101-she] [She]2101-she was off somewhere at daybreak this morning . [She]2101-she ’s always full of mystery ; [I]0-i hate [her]2101-she . So [I]0-i do [that white chap]2102-that white chap ; [he]2102-that white chap ’s always got [his]2102-that white chap blinking eyes upon [a fellow]4234-a fellow . ’ ‘[2102-that white chap] Where were [you]0-i last night , [Tom]71-tom ? ’ ‘[71-tom] Where was [I]0-i last night ! ’ said [Tom]71-tom . ‘[0-i] Come ! [I]0-i like that . [I]0-i was waiting for [you]71-tom , [Mr. Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse , till it came down as [I]0-i never saw it come down before . Where was [I]0-i too ! Where were [you]71-tom , [you]71-tom mean . ’ ‘[71-tom] [I]0-i was prevented from coming — detained . ’ ‘[0-i] Detained ! ’ murmured [Tom]71-tom . ‘[2104-two of us] [Two of [us]2105-us]2104-two of us were detained . [I]0-i was detained looking for [you]71-tom , till [I]0-i lost [every train]2106-every train but the mail . It would have been a pleasant job to go down by that on such a night , and have to walk [home]2856-home through [a pond]2108-a pond . [I]0-i was obliged to sleep in [town]439-town after all . ’ ‘[0-i] Where ? ’ ‘[0-i] Where ? Why , in [my]0-i own bed at [Bounderby ’s]93-mr. bounderby . ’ ‘[71-tom] Did [you]71-tom see [[your]71-tom sister]354-your sister ? ’ ‘[71-tom] How [the deuce]2111-the deuce , ’ returned [Tom]71-tom , staring , ‘[2111-the deuce] could [I]0-i see [[my]0-i sister]738-my sister when [she]738-my sister was fifteen miles off ? ’ Cursing these quick retorts of [the young gentleman to whom [he]0-i was so true [a friend]1213-a friend]4559-the young gentleman to whom he was so true a friend , [Mr. Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse disembarrassed [himself]167-mr. harthouse of that interview with the smallest conceivable amount of ceremony , and debated for the hundredth time what all this could mean ? [He]167-mr. harthouse made only one thing clear . It was , that whether [she]738-my sister was in [town]439-town or out of [town]439-town , whether [he]167-mr. harthouse had been premature with [her]738-my sister who was so hard to comprehend , or [she]738-my sister had lost courage , or [they]4563-they were discovered , or some mischance or mistake , at present incomprehensible , had occurred , [he]167-mr. harthouse must remain to confront [his]167-mr. harthouse fortune , whatever it was . [The hotel where [he]167-mr. harthouse was known to live when condemned to [that region of blackness]4565-that region of blackness]4564-the hotel where he was known to live when condemned to that region of blackness , was the stake to which [he]167-mr. harthouse was tied . As to all the rest — What will be , will be . ‘[2111-the deuce] So , whether [I]0-i am waiting for a hostile message , or an assignation , or a penitent remonstrance , or an impromptu wrestle with [[my]0-i friend]508-my friend [Bounderby]155-mrs. bounderby in the Lancashire manner — which would seem as likely as anything else in the present state of affairs — [I]0-i ’ll dine , ’ said [Mr. James Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse . ‘[0-i] [Bounderby]155-mrs. bounderby has the advantage in point of weight ; and if anything of a British nature is to come off between [us]2114-us , it may be as well to be in training . ’ Therefore [he]167-mr. harthouse rang the bell , and tossing [himself]167-mr. harthouse negligently on a sofa , ordered ‘[155-mrs. bounderby] Some dinner at six — with a beefsteak in it , ’ and got through the intervening time as well as [he]167-mr. harthouse could . That was not particularly well ; for [he]167-mr. harthouse remained in the greatest perplexity , and , as the hours went on , and no kind of explanation offered itself , [his]167-mr. harthouse perplexity augmented at compound interest . However , [he]167-mr. harthouse took affairs as coolly as it was in human nature to do , and entertained [himself]167-mr. harthouse with the facetious idea of the training more than once . ‘[155-mrs. bounderby] It would n’t be bad , ’ [he]167-mr. harthouse yawned at one time , ‘[155-mrs. bounderby] to give [the waiter]2115-the waiter five shillings , and throw [him]2115-the waiter . ’ At another time it occurred to [him]167-mr. harthouse , ‘[2116-a fellow of about thirteen or fourteen stone] Or [a fellow of about thirteen or fourteen stone]2116-a fellow of about thirteen or fourteen stone might be hired by the hour . ’ But these jests did not tell materially on the afternoon , or [his]167-mr. harthouse suspense ; and , sooth to say , [they]2114-us both lagged fearfully . It was impossible , even before dinner , to avoid often walking about in the pattern of the carpet , looking out of the window , listening at the door for footsteps , and occasionally becoming rather hot when any steps approached [that room]4566-that room . But , after dinner , when the day turned to twilight , and the twilight turned to night , and still no communication was made to [him]167-mr. harthouse , it began to be as [he]167-mr. harthouse expressed it , ‘[2116-a fellow of about thirteen or fourteen stone] like the Holy Office and slow torture . ’ However , still true to [his]167-mr. harthouse conviction that indifference was the genuine high - breeding ( the only conviction [he]167-mr. harthouse had ) , [he]167-mr. harthouse seized this crisis as the opportunity for ordering candles and a newspaper . [He]167-mr. harthouse had been trying in vain , for half an hour , to read this newspaper , when [the waiter]2115-the waiter appeared and said , at once mysteriously and apologetically : ‘[2116-a fellow of about thirteen or fourteen stone] Beg [your]2117-you pardon , [sir]2771-sir . [You]2117-you ’re wanted , [sir]2771-sir , if [you]2117-you please . ’[2117-you] A general recollection that this was the kind of thing [the Police]4288-the police said to [the swell mob]2120-the swell mob , caused [Mr. Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse to ask [the waiter]2115-the waiter in return , with bristling indignation , what the Devil [he]167-mr. harthouse meant by ‘ wanted ’[167-mr. harthouse] ? ‘ Beg [your]2117-you pardon , [sir]2771-sir . [Young lady outside]4570-young lady outside , [sir]2771-sir , wishes to see [you]2117-you . ’[167-mr. harthouse] ‘ Outside ? Where ? ’[167-mr. harthouse] ‘ Outside this door , [sir]2771-sir . ’[167-mr. harthouse] Giving [the waiter]2115-the waiter to [the personage before mentioned]2123-the personage before mentioned , as [a block - head duly qualified for that consignment]2124-a block - head duly qualified for that consignment , [Mr. Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse hurried into [the gallery]2125-the gallery . [A young woman whom [he]167-mr. harthouse had never seen]2126-a young woman whom he had never seen stood [there]425-there . [Plainly dressed , very quiet , very pretty]2128-plainly dressed , very quiet , very pretty . As [he]167-mr. harthouse conducted [her]2126-a young woman whom he had never seen into [the room]2901-the room and placed a chair for [her]2126-a young woman whom he had never seen , [he]167-mr. harthouse observed , by the light of the candles , that [she]2126-a young woman whom he had never seen was even prettier than [he]167-mr. harthouse had at first believed . [Her]2126-a young woman whom he had never seen face was innocent and youthful , and its expression remarkably pleasant . [She]2126-a young woman whom he had never seen was not afraid of [him]167-mr. harthouse , or in any way disconcerted ; [she]2126-a young woman whom he had never seen seemed to have [her]2126-a young woman whom he had never seen mind entirely preoccupied with the occasion of [her]2126-a young woman whom he had never seen visit , and to have substituted that consideration for [herself]2126-a young woman whom he had never seen . ‘ [I]2126-a young woman whom he had never seen speak to [Mr. Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse ? ’[2126-a young woman whom he had never seen] [she]2126-a young woman whom he had never seen said , when [they]2130-they were alone . ‘ To [Mr. Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse . ’[167-mr. harthouse] [He]167-mr. harthouse added in [his]167-mr. harthouse mind , ‘ And [you]2126-a young woman whom he had never seen speak to [him]167-mr. harthouse with the most confiding eyes [I]167-mr. harthouse ever saw , and the most earnest voice ( though so quiet ) [I]167-mr. harthouse ever heard . ’[167-mr. harthouse] ‘ If [I]76-sissy do not understand — and [I]76-sissy do not , [sir]2771-sir ’[76-sissy] — said [Sissy]76-sissy , ‘ what [your]2771-sir honour as [a gentleman]1259-a gentleman binds [you]2771-sir to , in other matters : ’[76-sissy] the blood really rose in [his]167-mr. harthouse face as [she]2126-a young woman whom he had never seen began in these words : ‘ [I]2126-a young woman whom he had never seen am sure [I]2126-a young woman whom he had never seen may rely upon it to keep [my]2126-a young woman whom he had never seen visit secret , and to keep secret what [I]2126-a young woman whom he had never seen am going to say . [I]2126-a young woman whom he had never seen will rely upon it , if [you]2771-sir will tell [me]2126-a young woman whom he had never seen [I]2126-a young woman whom he had never seen may so far trust — ’[2126-a young woman whom he had never seen] ‘ [You]2771-sir may , [I]76-sissy assure [you]2771-sir . ’[76-sissy] ‘ [I]2131-i am young , as [you]2771-sir see ; [I]2131-i am alone , as [you]2771-sir see . In coming to [you]2771-sir , [sir]2771-sir , [I]2131-i have no advice or encouragement beyond [my]2131-i own hope . ’[2131-i] [He]2131-i thought , ‘ But that is very strong , ’[2131-i] as [he]2131-i followed the momentary upward glance of [her]2132-her eyes . [He]2131-i thought besides , ‘ This is a very odd beginning . [I]2131-i do n’t see where [we]4576-we are going . ’[2131-i] ‘ [I]76-sissy think , ’[76-sissy] said [Sissy]76-sissy , ‘ [you]2771-sir have already guessed whom [I]76-sissy left just now ! ’[76-sissy] ‘ [I]2131-i have been in the greatest concern and uneasiness during the last four - and - twenty hours ( which have appeared as many years ) , ’[2131-i] [he]2131-i returned , ‘ on [a lady]4270-a lady ’s account . The hopes [I]2131-i have been encouraged to form that [you]2771-sir come from [that lady]3135-that lady , do not deceive [me]2131-i , [I]2131-i trust . ’[2131-i] ‘ [I]76-sissy left [her]3135-that lady within an hour . ’[76-sissy] ‘ At — ! ’[2131-i] ‘ At [[her]3135-that lady father]2855-her father ’s . ’[76-sissy] [Mr. Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse ’s face lengthened in spite of [his]167-mr. harthouse coolness , and [his]167-mr. harthouse perplexity increased . ‘ Then [I]167-mr. harthouse certainly , ’[167-mr. harthouse] [he]167-mr. harthouse thought , ‘ do not see where [we]4580-we are going . ’[167-mr. harthouse] ‘ [She]3135-that lady hurried [there]425-there last night . [She]3135-that lady arrived [there]425-there in great agitation , and was insensible all through the night . [I]167-mr. harthouse live at [[her]3135-that lady father]2855-her father ’s , and was with [her]3135-that lady . [You]167-mr. harthouse may be sure , [sir]2771-sir , [you]167-mr. harthouse will never see [her]3135-that lady again as long as [you]167-mr. harthouse live . ’[167-mr. harthouse] [Mr. Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse drew a long breath ; and , if ever [man]2967-man found [himself]167-mr. harthouse in the position of not knowing what to say , made the discovery beyond all question that [he]167-mr. harthouse was so circumstanced . The child - like ingenuousness with which [[his]167-mr. harthouse visitor]3743-his visitor spoke , [her]3743-his visitor modest fearlessness , [her]3743-his visitor truthfulness which put all artifice aside , [her]3743-his visitor entire forgetfulness of [herself]3743-his visitor in [her]3743-his visitor earnest quiet holding to the object with which [she]3743-his visitor had come ; all this , together with [her]3743-his visitor reliance on [his]167-mr. harthouse easily given promise — which in itself shamed [him]167-mr. harthouse — presented something in which [he]167-mr. harthouse was so inexperienced , and against which [he]167-mr. harthouse knew any of [his]167-mr. harthouse usual weapons would fall so powerless ; that not a word could [he]167-mr. harthouse rally to [his]167-mr. harthouse relief . At last [he]167-mr. harthouse said : ‘ So startling an announcement , so confidently made , and by such lips , is really disconcerting in the last degree . May [I]167-mr. harthouse be permitted to inquire , if [you]167-mr. harthouse are charged to convey that information to [me]167-mr. harthouse in those hopeless words , by [the lady of whom [we]4586-we speak]4585-the lady of whom we speak ? ’[167-mr. harthouse] ‘ [I]167-mr. harthouse have no charge from [her]4585-the lady of whom we speak . ’[167-mr. harthouse] ‘ [The drowning man]4587-the drowning man catches at the straw . With no disrespect for [your]167-mr. harthouse judgment , and with no doubt of [your]167-mr. harthouse sincerity , excuse [my]167-mr. harthouse saying that [I]167-mr. harthouse cling to the belief that there is yet hope that [I]167-mr. harthouse am not condemned to perpetual exile from [that lady]3135-that lady ’s presence . ’[167-mr. harthouse] ‘ There is not the least hope . The first object of [my]167-mr. harthouse coming [here]366-here , [sir]2771-sir , is to assure [you]2771-sir that [you]2771-sir must believe that there is no more hope of [your]2771-sir ever speaking with [her]4585-the lady of whom we speak again , than there would be if [she]4585-the lady of whom we speak had died when [she]4585-the lady of whom we speak came [home]2856-home last night . ’[167-mr. harthouse] ‘ Must believe ? But if [I]167-mr. harthouse ca n’t — or if [I]167-mr. harthouse should , by infirmity of nature , be obstinate — and wo n’t — ’[167-mr. harthouse] ‘ It is still true . There is no hope . ’[167-mr. harthouse] [James Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse looked at [her]2135-her with an incredulous smile upon [his]167-mr. harthouse lips ; but [her]2135-her mind looked over and beyond [him]167-mr. harthouse , and the smile was quite thrown away . [He]167-mr. harthouse bit [his]167-mr. harthouse lip , and took a little time for consideration . ‘ Well ! If it should unhappily appear , ’[167-mr. harthouse] [he]167-mr. harthouse said , ‘ after due pains and duty on [my]167-mr. harthouse part , that [I]167-mr. harthouse am brought to a position so desolate as this banishment , [I]167-mr. harthouse shall not become [the lady ’s persecutor]4592-the lady ’s persecutor . But [you]2771-sir said [you]2771-sir had no commission from [her]4585-the lady of whom we speak ? ’[167-mr. harthouse] ‘ [I]2136-i have only the commission of [my]2136-i love for [her]4585-the lady of whom we speak , and [her]4585-the lady of whom we speak love for [me]2136-i . [I]2136-i have no other trust , than that [I]2136-i have been with [her]4585-the lady of whom we speak since [she]4585-the lady of whom we speak came [home]2856-home , and that [she]4585-the lady of whom we speak has given [me]2136-i [her]4585-the lady of whom we speak confidence . [I]2136-i have no further trust , than that [I]2136-i know something of [her]4585-the lady of whom we speak character and [her]4585-the lady of whom we speak marriage . [O Mr. Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse , [I]2136-i think [you]2136-i had that trust too ! ’[2136-i] [He]2136-i was touched in the cavity where [his]2136-i heart should have been — in that nest of addled eggs , where the birds of heaven would have lived if [they]2137-they had not been whistled away — by the fervour of this reproach . ‘ [I]2136-i am not [a moral sort of fellow]4594-a moral sort of fellow , ’[2136-i] [he]2136-i said , ‘ and [I]2136-i never make any pretensions to the character of [a moral sort of fellow]4594-a moral sort of fellow . [I]2136-i am as immoral as need be . At the same time , in bringing any distress upon [the lady who is the subject of the present conversation]4596-the lady who is the subject of the present conversation , or in unfortunately compromising [her]4585-the lady of whom we speak in any way , or in committing [myself]2136-i by any expression of sentiments towards [her]4585-the lady of whom we speak , not perfectly reconcilable with — in fact with — [the domestic hearth]4597-the domestic hearth ; or in taking any advantage of [[her]4585-the lady of whom we speak father]2855-her father ’s being [a machine]4599-a machine , or of [[her]4585-the lady of whom we speak brother]2932-her brother ’s being a whelp , or of [[her]4585-the lady of whom we speak husband]2903-her husband ’s being [a bear]4602-a bear ; [I]2136-i beg to be allowed to assure [you]4603-you that [I]2136-i have had no particularly evil intentions , but have glided on from one step to another with a smoothness so perfectly diabolical , that [I]2136-i had not the slightest idea the catalogue was half so long until [I]2136-i began to turn it over . Whereas [I]2136-i find , ’[2136-i] said [Mr. James Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse , in conclusion , ‘ that it is really in several volumes . ’[167-mr. harthouse] Though [he]167-mr. harthouse said all this in [his]167-mr. harthouse frivolous way , the way seemed , for that once , a conscious polishing of but an ugly surface . [He]167-mr. harthouse was silent for a moment ; and then proceeded with a more self - possessed air , though with traces of vexation and disappointment that would not be polished out . ‘ After what has been just now represented to [me]167-mr. harthouse , in a manner [I]167-mr. harthouse find it impossible to doubt — [I]167-mr. harthouse know of hardly any other source from which [I]167-mr. harthouse could have accepted it so readily — [I]167-mr. harthouse feel bound to say to [you]4603-you , in whom the confidence [you]4603-you have mentioned has been reposed , that [I]167-mr. harthouse can not refuse to contemplate the possibility ( however unexpected ) of [my]167-mr. harthouse seeing [the lady]3277-the lady no more . [I]167-mr. harthouse am solely to blame for the thing having come to this — and — and , [I]167-mr. harthouse can not say , ’[167-mr. harthouse] [he]167-mr. harthouse added , rather hard up for a general peroration , ‘ that [I]167-mr. harthouse have any sanguine expectation of ever becoming [a moral sort of fellow]4594-a moral sort of fellow , or that [I]167-mr. harthouse have any belief in any moral sort of fellow whatever . ’[167-mr. harthouse] [Sissy]76-sissy ’s face sufficiently showed that [her]76-sissy appeal to [him]167-mr. harthouse was not finished . ‘ [You]76-sissy spoke , ’[167-mr. harthouse] [he]167-mr. harthouse resumed , as [she]76-sissy raised [her]76-sissy eyes to [him]167-mr. harthouse again , ‘ of [your]76-sissy first object . [I]167-mr. harthouse may assume that there is a second to be mentioned ? ’[167-mr. harthouse] ‘ Yes . ’[76-sissy] ‘ Will [you]76-sissy oblige [me]167-mr. harthouse by confiding it ? ’[167-mr. harthouse] ‘ [Mr. Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse , ’[167-mr. harthouse] returned [Sissy]76-sissy , with a blending of gentleness and steadiness that quite defeated [him]167-mr. harthouse , and with a simple confidence in [his]167-mr. harthouse being bound to do what [she]76-sissy required , that held [him]167-mr. harthouse at a singular disadvantage , ‘ the only reparation that remains with [you]167-mr. harthouse , is to leave [here]366-here immediately and finally . [I]76-sissy am quite sure that [you]167-mr. harthouse can mitigate in no other way the wrong and harm [you]167-mr. harthouse have done . [I]76-sissy am quite sure that it is the only compensation [you]167-mr. harthouse have left it in [your]167-mr. harthouse power to make . [I]76-sissy do not say that it is much , or that it is enough ; but it is something , and it is necessary . Therefore , though without any other authority than [I]76-sissy have given [you]167-mr. harthouse , and even without the knowledge of [any other person than [yourself]167-mr. harthouse and [myself]76-sissy]4607-any other person than yourself and myself , [I]76-sissy ask [you]167-mr. harthouse to depart from [this place]729-this place to - night , under an obligation never to return to [it]729-this place . ’[76-sissy] If [she]76-sissy had asserted any influence over [him]167-mr. harthouse beyond [her]76-sissy plain faith in the truth and right of what [she]76-sissy said ; if [she]76-sissy had concealed the least doubt or irresolution , or had harboured for the best purpose any reserve or pretence ; if [she]76-sissy had shown , or felt , the lightest trace of any sensitiveness to [his]167-mr. harthouse ridicule or [his]167-mr. harthouse astonishment , or any remonstrance [he]167-mr. harthouse might offer ; [he]167-mr. harthouse would have carried it against [her]76-sissy at this point . But [he]167-mr. harthouse could as easily have changed a clear sky by looking at it in surprise , as affect [her]76-sissy . ‘ But do [you]76-sissy know , ’[167-mr. harthouse] [he]167-mr. harthouse asked , quite at a loss , ‘ the extent of what [you]76-sissy ask ? [You]76-sissy probably are not aware that [I]167-mr. harthouse am here on a public kind of business , preposterous enough in itself , but which [I]167-mr. harthouse have gone in for , and sworn by , and am supposed to be devoted to in quite a desperate manner ? [You]76-sissy probably are not aware of that , but [I]167-mr. harthouse assure [you]76-sissy it ’s the fact . ’[167-mr. harthouse] It had no effect on [Sissy]76-sissy , fact or no fact . ‘ Besides which , ’[167-mr. harthouse] said [Mr. Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse , taking a turn or two across [the room]2901-the room , dubiously , ‘ it ’s so alarmingly absurd . It would make [a man]484-a man so ridiculous , after going in for [these fellows]4290-these fellows , to back out in such an incomprehensible way . ’[167-mr. harthouse] ‘ [I]76-sissy am quite sure , ’[76-sissy] repeated [Sissy]76-sissy , ‘ that it is the only reparation in [your]167-mr. harthouse power , [sir]2771-sir . [I]76-sissy am quite sure , or [I]76-sissy would not have come [here]366-here . ’[76-sissy] [He]167-mr. harthouse glanced at [her]76-sissy face , and walked about again . ‘ Upon [my]167-mr. harthouse soul , [I]167-mr. harthouse do n’t know what to say . So immensely absurd ! ’[167-mr. harthouse] It fell to [his]167-mr. harthouse lot , now , to stipulate for secrecy . ‘ If [I]167-mr. harthouse were to do such a very ridiculous thing , ’[167-mr. harthouse] [he]167-mr. harthouse said , stopping again presently , and leaning against the chimney - piece , ‘ it could only be in the most inviolable confidence . ’[167-mr. harthouse] ‘ [I]76-sissy will trust to [you]167-mr. harthouse , [sir]2771-sir , ’[76-sissy] returned [Sissy]76-sissy , ‘ and [you]167-mr. harthouse will trust to [me]76-sissy . ’[76-sissy] [His]167-mr. harthouse leaning against the chimney - piece reminded [him]167-mr. harthouse of the night with the whelp . It was [the self - same chimney - piece]2139-the self - same chimney - piece , and somehow [he]167-mr. harthouse felt as if [he]167-mr. harthouse were [the whelp to - night]2140-the whelp to - night . [He]167-mr. harthouse could make no way at all . ‘ [I]167-mr. harthouse suppose [a man]484-a man never was placed in a more ridiculous position , ’[167-mr. harthouse] [he]167-mr. harthouse said , after looking down , and looking up , and laughing , and frowning , and walking off , and walking back again . ‘ But [I]167-mr. harthouse see no way out of it . What will be , will be . This will be , [I]167-mr. harthouse suppose . [I]167-mr. harthouse must take off [myself]167-mr. harthouse , [I]167-mr. harthouse imagine — in short , [I]167-mr. harthouse engage to do it . ’[167-mr. harthouse] [Sissy]76-sissy rose . [She]76-sissy was not surprised by the result , but [she]76-sissy was happy in it , and [her]76-sissy face beamed brightly . ‘ [You]167-mr. harthouse will permit [me]167-mr. harthouse to say , ’[167-mr. harthouse] continued [Mr. James Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse , ‘ that [I]167-mr. harthouse doubt if [any other ambassador]4615-any other ambassador , or [ambassadress]4616-ambassadress , could have addressed [me]167-mr. harthouse with the same success . [I]167-mr. harthouse must not only regard [myself]167-mr. harthouse as being in a very ridiculous position , but as being vanquished at all points . Will [you]167-mr. harthouse allow [me]167-mr. harthouse the privilege of remembering [[my]167-mr. harthouse enemy]4617-my enemy ’s name ? ’[167-mr. harthouse] ‘ [My]2141-the ambassadress name ? ’[2141-the ambassadress] said [the ambassadress]2141-the ambassadress . ‘ The only name [I]2141-the ambassadress could possibly care to know , to - night . ’[2141-the ambassadress] ‘ [Sissy Jupe]76-sissy . ’[167-mr. harthouse] ‘ Pardon [my]2141-the ambassadress curiosity at parting . Related to [the family]3509-the family ? ’[2141-the ambassadress] ‘ [I]76-sissy am only [a poor girl]4619-a poor girl , ’[76-sissy] returned [Sissy]76-sissy . ‘ [I]76-sissy was separated from [[my]76-sissy father]4230-my father — [he]4230-my father was only [a stroller]4621-a stroller — and taken pity on by [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom . [I]76-sissy have lived in [the house]2918-the house ever since . ’[76-sissy] [She]76-sissy was gone . ‘ [It]2142-the great pyramid wanted this to complete the defeat , ’[167-mr. harthouse] said [Mr. James Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse , sinking , with a resigned air , on the sofa , after standing transfixed a little while . ‘ The defeat may now be considered perfectly accomplished . [Only a poor girl]4623-only a poor girl — only [a stroller]4621-a stroller — only [James Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse made nothing of — only [James Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse [a Great Pyramid of failure]4625-a great pyramid of failure . ’[167-mr. harthouse] [The Great Pyramid]2142-the great pyramid put it into [his]167-mr. harthouse head to go up [the Nile]51-the nile . [He]167-mr. harthouse took a pen upon the instant , and wrote the following note ( in appropriate hieroglyphics ) to [[his]167-mr. harthouse brother]3737-his brother : [Dear Jack]208-dear jack , — All up at [Coketown]4-coketown . Bored out of [the place]2849-the place , and going in for camels . [Affectionately]209-affectionately , [Jem]167-mr. harthouse . [He]167-mr. harthouse rang the bell . ‘ Send [[my]167-mr. harthouse fellow]4626-my fellow here . ’[167-mr. harthouse] ‘ Gone to bed , [sir]2771-sir . ’[167-mr. harthouse] ‘ Tell [him]4626-my fellow to get up , and pack up . ’[167-mr. harthouse] [He]167-mr. harthouse wrote two more notes . One , to [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , announcing [his]93-mr. bounderby retirement from [that part of [the country]336-the country]2145-that part of the country , and showing where [he]93-mr. bounderby would be found for the next fortnight . The other , similar in effect , to [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom . Almost as soon as the ink was dry upon [their]2147-their superscriptions , [he]93-mr. bounderby had left [the tall chimneys of [Coketown]4-coketown]2148-the tall chimneys of coketown behind , and was in [a railway carriage]2149-a railway carriage , tearing and glaring over [the dark landscape]2150-the dark landscape . [The moral sort of fellows]2151-the moral sort of fellows might suppose that [Mr. James Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse derived some comfortable reflections afterwards , from this prompt retreat , as one of [his]167-mr. harthouse few actions that made any amends for anything , and as a token to [himself]167-mr. harthouse that [he]167-mr. harthouse had escaped the climax of a very bad business . But it was not so , at all . A secret sense of having failed and been ridiculous — a dread of what [other fellows who went in for similar sorts of things]2152-other fellows who went in for similar sorts of things , would say at [his]167-mr. harthouse expense if [they]2152-other fellows who went in for similar sorts of things knew it — so oppressed [him]167-mr. harthouse , that what was about the very best passage in [his]167-mr. harthouse life was the one of all others [he]167-mr. harthouse would not have owned to on any account , and the only one that made [him]167-mr. harthouse ashamed of [himself]167-mr. harthouse . [The indefatigable Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , with a violent cold upon [her]126-mrs. sparsit , [her]126-mrs. sparsit voice reduced to a whisper , and [her]126-mrs. sparsit stately frame so racked by continual sneezes that it seemed in danger of dismemberment , gave chase to [[her]126-mrs. sparsit patron]597-her patron until [she]126-mrs. sparsit found [him]597-her patron in [the metropolis]2154-the metropolis ; and there , majestically sweeping in upon [him]597-her patron at [[his]597-her patron hotel in [St. James ’s Street]52-st. james ’s street]2155-his hotel in st. james ’s street , exploded the combustibles with which [she]126-mrs. sparsit was charged , and blew up . Having executed [her]126-mrs. sparsit mission with infinite relish , [this high - minded woman]2156-this high - minded woman then fainted away on [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ’s coat - collar . [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ’s first procedure was to shake [Mrs. Sparsit]2157-mrs. sparsit off , and leave [her]2157-mrs. sparsit to progress as [she]2157-mrs. sparsit might through various stages of suffering on the floor . [He]93-mr. bounderby next had recourse to the administration of potent restoratives , such as screwing [the patient]2158-the patient ’s thumbs , smiting [her]2158-the patient hands , abundantly watering [her]2158-the patient face , and inserting salt in [her]2158-the patient mouth . When these attentions had recovered [her]2157-mrs. sparsit ( which [they]2159-they speedily did ) , [he]93-mr. bounderby hustled [her]2157-mrs. sparsit into [a fast train]2160-a fast train without offering any other refreshment , and carried [her]2157-mrs. sparsit back to [Coketown]4-coketown more dead than alive . Regarded as [a classical ruin]2161-a classical ruin , [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit was an interesting spectacle on [her]126-mrs. sparsit arrival at [her]126-mrs. sparsit journey ’s end ; but considered in any other light , the amount of damage [she]126-mrs. sparsit had by that time sustained was excessive , and impaired [her]126-mrs. sparsit claims to admiration . Utterly heedless of the wear and tear of [her]126-mrs. sparsit clothes and constitution , and adamant to [her]126-mrs. sparsit pathetic sneezes , [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby immediately crammed [her]126-mrs. sparsit into [a coach]3357-a coach , and bore [her]126-mrs. sparsit off to [Stone Lodge]3-stone lodge . ‘ Now , [Tom Gradgrind]71-tom , ’[93-mr. bounderby] said [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , bursting into [[[his]93-mr. bounderby father - in - law]2163-his father - in - law ’s room]2164-his father - in - law ’s room late at night ; ‘ here ’s [a lady here]4628-a lady here — [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit — [you]71-tom know [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit — who has something to say to [you]71-tom that will strike [you]71-tom dumb . ’[93-mr. bounderby] ‘ [You]71-tom have missed [my]71-tom letter ! ’[71-tom] exclaimed [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , surprised by the apparition . ‘ Missed [your]71-tom letter , [sir]2771-sir ! ’[93-mr. bounderby] bawled [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby . ‘ The present time is no time for letters . [No man]1479-no man shall talk to [Josiah Bounderby]97-bounderby of [Coketown]4-coketown about letters , with [his]97-bounderby mind in the state it ’s in now . ’[93-mr. bounderby] ‘ [Bounderby]97-bounderby , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , in a tone of temperate remonstrance , ‘ [I]71-tom speak of a very special letter [I]71-tom have written to [you]97-bounderby , in reference to [Louisa]92-louisa . ’[71-tom] ‘ [Tom Gradgrind]71-tom , ’[97-bounderby] replied [Bounderby]97-bounderby , knocking the flat of [his]97-bounderby hand several times with great vehemence on the table , ‘ [I]97-bounderby speak of a very special messenger that has come to [me]97-bounderby , in reference to [Louisa]92-louisa . [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , [ma’am]361-ma’am , stand forward ! ’[97-bounderby] [That unfortunate lady]2165-that unfortunate lady hereupon essaying to offer testimony , without any voice and with painful gestures expressive of an inflamed throat , became so aggravating and underwent so many facial contortions , that [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , unable to bear it , seized [her]2165-that unfortunate lady by the arm and shook [her]2165-that unfortunate lady . ‘ If [you]361-ma’am ca n’t get it out , [ma’am]361-ma’am , ’[93-mr. bounderby] said [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , ‘ leave [me]93-mr. bounderby to get it out . This is not a time for [a lady , however highly connected]4633-a lady , however highly connected , to be totally inaudible , and seemingly swallowing marbles . [Tom Gradgrind]71-tom , [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit latterly found [herself]126-mrs. sparsit , by accident , in a situation to overhear a conversation out of doors between [[your]93-mr. bounderby daughter]4634-your daughter and [[your]93-mr. bounderby precious gentleman - friend]4635-your precious gentleman - friend , [Mr. James Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse . ’[93-mr. bounderby] ‘ Indeed ! ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom . ‘ Ah ! Indeed ! ’[93-mr. bounderby] cried [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby . ‘ And in that conversation — ’[93-mr. bounderby] ‘ It is not necessary to repeat its tenor , [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby . [I]93-mr. bounderby know what passed . ’[93-mr. bounderby] ‘ [You]93-mr. bounderby do ? Perhaps , ’[93-mr. bounderby] said [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , staring with all [his]93-mr. bounderby might at [[his]93-mr. bounderby so quiet and assuasive father - in - law]2166-his so quiet and assuasive father - in - law , ‘ [you]93-mr. bounderby know where [[your]93-mr. bounderby daughter]4634-your daughter is at the present time ! ’[93-mr. bounderby] ‘ Undoubtedly . [She]4634-your daughter is here . ’[93-mr. bounderby] ‘ Here ? ’[93-mr. bounderby] ‘ [[My]93-mr. bounderby dear]601-my dear [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , let [me]93-mr. bounderby beg [you]93-mr. bounderby to restrain these loud out - breaks , on all accounts . [Louisa]92-louisa is here . The moment [she]92-louisa could detach [herself]92-louisa from that interview with [the person of whom [you]93-mr. bounderby speak]4638-the person of whom you speak , and whom [I]93-mr. bounderby deeply regret to have been the means of introducing to [you]93-mr. bounderby , [Louisa]92-louisa hurried [here]366-here , for protection . [I]93-mr. bounderby [myself]93-mr. bounderby had not been at [home]2856-home many hours , when [I]93-mr. bounderby received [her]4634-your daughter — [here]366-here , in [this room]1557-this room . [She]4634-your daughter hurried by [the train]1988-the train to [town]439-town , [she]4634-your daughter ran from [town]439-town to [this house]684-this house , through a raging storm , and presented [herself]4634-your daughter before [me]93-mr. bounderby in a state of distraction . Of course , [she]4634-your daughter has remained [here]366-here ever since .
