Let [me]93-mr. bounderby entreat [you]2168-that wretched woman , for [your]2168-that wretched woman own sake and for [hers]4634-your daughter , to be more quiet . ’[93-mr. bounderby] [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby silently gazed about [him]93-mr. bounderby for some moments , in every direction except [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit ’s direction ; and then , abruptly turning upon [the niece of [Lady Scadgers]127-lady scadgers]2167-the niece of lady scadgers , said to [that wretched woman]2168-that wretched woman : ‘ Now , [ma’am]361-ma’am ! [We]4649-we shall be happy to hear any little apology [you]2168-that wretched woman may think proper to offer , for going about [the country]336-the country at express pace , with no other luggage than [a Cock - and - a - Bull]4651-a cock - and - a - bull , [ma’am]361-ma’am ! ’[2167-the niece of lady scadgers] ‘ [Sir]2771-sir , ’[126-mrs. sparsit] whispered [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , ‘ [my]2168-that wretched woman nerves are at present too much shaken , and [my]2168-that wretched woman health is at present too much impaired , in [your]2771-sir service , to admit of [my]2168-that wretched woman doing more than taking refuge in tears . ’[2168-that wretched woman] ( Which [she]2168-that wretched woman did . ) ‘ Well , [ma’am]361-ma’am , ’[93-mr. bounderby] said [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , ‘ without making any observation to [you]361-ma’am that may not be made with propriety to [a woman of good family]4655-a woman of good family , what [I]93-mr. bounderby have got to add to that , is that there is something else in which it appears to [me]93-mr. bounderby [you]361-ma’am may take refuge , namely , [a coach]3357-a coach . And [the coach in which [we]4658-we came here]4657-the coach in which we came here being at the door , [you]361-ma’am ’ll allow [me]93-mr. bounderby to hand [you]361-ma’am down to [it]4657-the coach in which we came here , and pack [you]361-ma’am home to [the Bank]3524-the bank : where the best course for [you]361-ma’am to pursue , will be to put [your]361-ma’am feet into the hottest water [you]361-ma’am can bear , and take a glass of scalding rum and butter after [you]361-ma’am get into bed . ’[93-mr. bounderby] With these words , [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby extended [his]93-mr. bounderby right hand to [the weeping lady]2169-the weeping lady , and escorted [her]2169-the weeping lady to the conveyance in question , shedding many plaintive sneezes by the way . [He]93-mr. bounderby soon returned alone . ‘ Now , as [you]361-ma’am showed [me]93-mr. bounderby in [your]361-ma’am face , [Tom Gradgrind]71-tom , that [you]361-ma’am wanted to speak to [me]93-mr. bounderby , ’[93-mr. bounderby] [he]93-mr. bounderby resumed , ‘ here [I]93-mr. bounderby am . But , [I]93-mr. bounderby am not in a very agreeable state , [I]93-mr. bounderby tell [you]361-ma’am plainly : not relishing this business , even as it is , and not considering that [I]93-mr. bounderby am at any time as dutifully and submissively treated by [[your]361-ma’am daughter]4634-your daughter , as [Josiah Bounderby of Coketown]97-bounderby ought to be treated by [[his]97-bounderby wife]3471-his wife . [You]361-ma’am have [your]361-ma’am opinion , [I]93-mr. bounderby dare say ; and [I]93-mr. bounderby have [mine]93-mr. bounderby , [I]93-mr. bounderby know . If [you]361-ma’am mean to say anything to [me]93-mr. bounderby to - night , that goes against this candid remark , [you]361-ma’am had better let it alone . ’[93-mr. bounderby] [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , it will be observed , being much softened , [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby took particular pains to harden [himself]93-mr. bounderby at all points . It was [his]93-mr. bounderby amiable nature . ‘ [[My]71-tom dear]601-my dear [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , ’[71-tom] [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom began in reply . ‘ Now , [you]361-ma’am ’ll excuse [me]93-mr. bounderby , ’[93-mr. bounderby] said [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , ‘ but [I]93-mr. bounderby do n’t want to be too dear . That , to start with . When [I]93-mr. bounderby begin to be dear to [a man]484-a man , [I]93-mr. bounderby generally find that [his]484-a man intention is to come over [me]93-mr. bounderby . [I]93-mr. bounderby am not speaking to [you]361-ma’am politely ; but , as [you]361-ma’am are aware , [I]93-mr. bounderby am not polite . If [you]361-ma’am like politeness , [you]361-ma’am know where to get it . [You]361-ma’am have [[your]361-ma’am gentleman - friends]4664-your gentleman - friends , [you]361-ma’am know , and [they]4664-your gentleman - friends ’ll serve [you]361-ma’am with as much of the article as [you]361-ma’am want . [I]93-mr. bounderby do n’t keep it [myself]93-mr. bounderby . ’[93-mr. bounderby] ‘ [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , ’[71-tom] urged [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , ‘ [we]2170-we are all liable to mistakes — ’[71-tom] ‘ [I]93-mr. bounderby thought [you]0-i could n’t make [’em]4665-’em[93-mr. bounderby] , ’ interrupted [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby . ‘[71-tom] Perhaps [I]0-i thought so . But , [I]0-i say [we]2170-we are all liable to mistakes and [I]0-i should feel sensible of [your]0-i delicacy , and grateful for it , if [you]0-i would spare [me]0-i these references to [Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse . And [he]93-mr. bounderby sat for a little while pondering . ‘[0-i] [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , [I]0-i see reason to doubt whether [we]2170-we have ever quite understood [Louisa]92-louisa . ’ ‘[2170-we] Who do [you]0-i mean by [We]2170-we ? ’ ‘[0-i] Let [me]0-i say [I]0-i , then , ’ [he]93-mr. bounderby returned , in answer to the coarsely blurted question ; ‘[0-i] [I]0-i doubt whether [I]0-i have understood [Louisa]92-louisa . [I]0-i doubt whether [I]0-i have been quite right in the manner of [her]92-louisa education . ’ ‘[0-i] There [you]93-mr. bounderby hit it , ’ returned [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby . ‘[93-mr. bounderby] There [I]0-i agree with [you]93-mr. bounderby . [You]93-mr. bounderby have found it out at last , have [you]93-mr. bounderby ? Education ! [I]0-i ’ll tell [you]93-mr. bounderby what education is — To be tumbled out of doors , neck and crop , and put upon the shortest allowance of everything except blows . That ’s what [I]0-i call education . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i think [your]93-mr. bounderby good sense will perceive , ’ [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom remonstrated in all humility , ‘[0-i] that whatever the merits of such a system may be , it would be difficult of general application to [girls]2767-girls . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t see it at all , [sir]2771-sir , ’ returned [the obstinate Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby . ‘[0-i] Well , ’ sighed [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , ‘[0-i] [we]2173-we will not enter into the question . [I]0-i assure [you]93-mr. bounderby [I]0-i have no desire to be controversial . [I]0-i seek to repair what is amiss , if [I]0-i possibly can ; and [I]0-i hope [you]93-mr. bounderby will assist [me]0-i in a good spirit , [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , for [I]0-i have been very much distressed . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t understand [you]93-mr. bounderby , yet , ’ said [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , with determined obstinacy , ‘[0-i] and therefore [I]0-i wo n’t make any promises . ’ ‘[93-mr. bounderby] In the course of a few hours , [[my]0-i dear]601-my dear [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , ’ [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom proceeded , in the same depressed and propitiatory manner , ‘[93-mr. bounderby] [I]0-i appear to [myself]0-i to have become better informed as to [Louisa]92-louisa ’s character , than in previous years . The enlightenment has been painfully forced upon [me]0-i , and the discovery is not [mine]0-i . [I]0-i think there are — [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , [you]93-mr. bounderby will be surprised to hear [me]0-i say this — [I]0-i think there are qualities in [Louisa]92-louisa , which — which have been harshly neglected , and — and a little perverted . And — and [I]0-i would suggest to [you]93-mr. bounderby , that — that if [you]93-mr. bounderby would kindly meet [me]0-i in a timely endeavour to leave [her]92-louisa to [her]92-louisa better nature for a while — and to encourage it to develop itself by tenderness and consideration — it — it would be the better for the happiness of [all of [us]2175-all of us]2175-all of us . [Louisa]92-louisa , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , shading [his]0-i face with [his]0-i hand , ‘[0-i] has always been [[my]0-i favourite child]3599-my favourite child . ’ [The blustrous Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby crimsoned and swelled to such an extent on hearing these words , that [he]0-i seemed to be , and probably was , on the brink of a fit . With [his]0-i very ears a bright purple shot with crimson , [he]0-i pent up [his]0-i indignation , however , and said : ‘[0-i] [You]0-i ’d like to keep [her]92-louisa [here]366-here for a time ? ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i — [I]0-i had intended to recommend , [[my]0-i dear]601-my dear [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , that [you]93-mr. bounderby should allow [Louisa]92-louisa to remain [here]366-here on a visit , and be attended by [Sissy]76-sissy ( [I]0-i mean of course [Cecilia Jupe]76-sissy ) , who understands [her]92-louisa , and in whom [she]92-louisa trusts . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i gather from all this , [Tom Gradgrind]71-tom , ’ said [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , standing up with [his]93-mr. bounderby hands in [his]93-mr. bounderby pockets , ‘[71-tom] that [you]71-tom are of opinion that there ’s what [people]2821-people call some incompatibility between [Loo Bounderby]101-loo and [myself]0-i . ’ ‘[2821-people] [I]0-i fear there is at present a general incompatibility between [Louisa]92-louisa , and — and — and almost all the relations in which [I]0-i have placed [her]92-louisa , ’ was [[her]92-louisa father]2855-her father ’s sorrowful reply . ‘[0-i] Now , look [you]71-tom here , [Tom Gradgrind]71-tom , ’ said [Bounderby]101-loo the flushed , confronting [him]71-tom with [his]0-i legs wide apart , [his]0-i hands deeper in [his]0-i pockets , and [his]0-i hair like a hayfield wherein [his]0-i windy anger was boisterous . ‘[71-tom] [You]71-tom have said [your]71-tom say ; [I]0-i am going to say mine . [I]0-i am [a Coketown man]2181-a coketown man . [I]0-i am [[Josiah Bounderby]97-bounderby of [Coketown]4-coketown]390-josiah bounderby of coketown . [I]0-i know the bricks of [this town]1229-this town , and [I]0-i know the works of [this town]1229-this town , and [I]0-i know [the chimneys of [this town]1229-this town]2185-the chimneys of this town , and [I]0-i know the smoke of [this town]1229-this town , and [I]0-i know the Hands of [this town]1229-this town . [I]0-i know ’em all pretty well . [They]4667-they ’re[0-i] real . When [a man]484-a man tells [me]0-i anything about imaginative qualities , [I]0-i always tell [that man]523-that man , whoever [he]523-that man is , that [I]0-i know what [he]523-that man means . [He]523-that man means turtle soup and venison , with a gold spoon , and that [he]523-that man wants to be set up with [a coach]3357-a coach and six . That ’s what [[your]2192-you daughter]4634-your daughter wants . Since [you]2192-you are of opinion that [she]4634-your daughter ought to have what [she]4634-your daughter wants , [I]0-i recommend [you]2192-you to provide it for [her]4634-your daughter . Because , [Tom Gradgrind]71-tom , [she]4634-your daughter will never have it from [me]0-i . ’ ‘[4634-your daughter] [Bounderby]97-bounderby , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , ‘[4634-your daughter] [I]0-i hoped , after [my]0-i entreaty , [you]97-bounderby would have taken a different tone . ’ ‘[97-bounderby] Just wait a bit , ’ retorted [Bounderby]97-bounderby ; ‘[97-bounderby] [you]97-bounderby have said [your]97-bounderby say , [I]0-i believe . [I]0-i heard [you]97-bounderby out ; hear [me]0-i out , if [you]97-bounderby please . Do n’t make [yourself]97-bounderby a spectacle of unfairness as well as inconsistency , because , although [I]0-i am sorry to see [Tom Gradgrind]71-tom reduced to [his]71-tom present position , [I]0-i should be doubly sorry to see [him]71-tom brought so low as that . [I]0-i ’ll give [you]97-bounderby to understand , in reply to that , that there unquestionably is an incompatibility of the first magnitude — to be summed up in this — that [[your]97-bounderby daughter]4634-your daughter do n’t properly know [[her]4634-your daughter husband]2903-her husband ’s merits , and is not impressed with such a sense as would become [her]4634-your daughter , by [George]72-george ! of the honour of [his]2903-her husband alliance . That ’s plain speaking , [I]0-i hope . ’ ‘[97-bounderby] [Bounderby]97-bounderby , ’ urged [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , ‘[97-bounderby] this is unreasonable . ’ ‘[97-bounderby] Is it ? ’ said [Bounderby]97-bounderby . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i am glad to hear [you]97-bounderby say so . Because when [Tom Gradgrind]71-tom , with [his]71-tom new lights , tells [me]0-i that what [I]0-i say is unreasonable , [I]0-i am convinced at once it must be devilish sensible . With [your]97-bounderby permission [I]0-i am going on . [You]97-bounderby know [my]0-i origin ; and [you]97-bounderby know that for a good many years of [my]0-i life [I]0-i did n’t want a shoeing - horn , in consequence of not having a shoe . Yet [you]97-bounderby may believe or not , as [you]97-bounderby think proper , that there are [ladies]667-ladies — [born ladies]2198-born ladies — belonging to [families — Families]2199-families — families ! — who next to worship the ground [I]0-i walk on . ’ [He]0-i discharged this like a Rocket , at [[his]0-i father - in - law]2163-his father - in - law ’s head . ‘[667-ladies] Whereas [[your]97-bounderby daughter]4634-your daughter , ’ proceeded [Bounderby]97-bounderby , ‘[860-a born lady] is far from being [a born lady]860-a born lady . That [you]97-bounderby know , [yourself]97-bounderby . Why do [I]0-i say this ? ’ ‘[0-i] Not , [I]0-i fear , ’ observed [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , in a low voice , ‘[0-i] to spare [me]0-i . ’ ‘[0-i] Hear [me]0-i out , ’ said [Bounderby]97-bounderby , ‘[0-i] and refrain from cutting in till [your]97-bounderby turn comes round . [I]0-i say this , because [highly connected females]2202-highly connected females have been astonished to see the way in which [[your]97-bounderby daughter]4634-your daughter has conducted [herself]4634-your daughter , and to witness [her]4634-your daughter insensibility . [They]2202-highly connected females have wondered how [I]0-i have suffered it . And [I]0-i wonder [myself]0-i now , and [I]0-i wo n’t suffer it . ’ ‘[97-bounderby] [Bounderby]97-bounderby , ’ returned [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , rising , ‘[97-bounderby] the less [we]2204-we say to - night the better , [I]0-i think . ’ ‘[0-i] On the contrary , [Tom Gradgrind]71-tom , the more [we]2204-we say to - night , the better , [I]0-i think . That is , ’ [the consideration]4669-the consideration checked [him]97-bounderby , ‘[0-i] till [I]0-i have said all [I]0-i mean to say , and then [I]0-i do n’t care how soon [we]2204-we stop . [I]0-i come to a question that may shorten the business . What do [you]97-bounderby mean by the proposal [you]97-bounderby made just now ? ’ ‘[97-bounderby] What do [I]0-i mean , [Bounderby]97-bounderby ? ’ ‘[0-i] By [your]97-bounderby visiting proposition , ’ said [Bounderby]97-bounderby , with an inflexible jerk of the hayfield . ‘[97-bounderby] [I]0-i mean that [I]0-i hope [you]97-bounderby may be induced to arrange in a friendly manner , for allowing [Louisa]92-louisa a period of repose and reflection here , which may tend to a gradual alteration for the better in many respects . ’ ‘[0-i] To a softening down of [your]97-bounderby ideas of the incompatibility ? ’ said [Bounderby]97-bounderby . ‘[97-bounderby] If [you]97-bounderby put it in those terms . ’ ‘[97-bounderby] What made [you]97-bounderby think of this ? ’ said [Bounderby]97-bounderby . ‘[97-bounderby] [I]0-i have already said , [I]0-i fear [Louisa]92-louisa has not been understood . Is it asking too much , [Bounderby]97-bounderby , that [you]97-bounderby , so far [[her]92-louisa elder]2205-her elder , should aid in trying to set [her]92-louisa right ? [You]97-bounderby have accepted a great charge of [her]92-louisa ; for better for worse , for — ’ [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby may have been annoyed by the repetition of [his]93-mr. bounderby own words to [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen , but [he]93-mr. bounderby cut the quotation short with an angry start . ‘[97-bounderby] Come ! ’ said [he]93-mr. bounderby , ‘[97-bounderby] [I]0-i do n’t want to be told about that . [I]0-i know what [I]0-i took [her]92-louisa for , as well as [you]97-bounderby do . Never [you]97-bounderby mind what [I]0-i took [her]92-louisa for ; that ’s [my]0-i look out . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i was merely going on to remark , [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , that [we]2206-we may all be more or less in the wrong , not even excepting [you]93-mr. bounderby ; and that some yielding on [your]93-mr. bounderby part , remembering the trust [you]93-mr. bounderby have accepted , may not only be an act of true kindness , but perhaps a debt incurred towards [Louisa]92-louisa . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i think differently , ’ blustered [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i am going to finish this business according to [my]0-i own opinions . Now , [I]0-i do n’t want to make a quarrel of it with [you]93-mr. bounderby , [Tom Gradgrind]71-tom . To tell [you]93-mr. bounderby the truth , [I]0-i do n’t think it would be worthy of [my]0-i reputation to quarrel on such a subject . As to [[your]93-mr. bounderby gentleman - friend]2207-your gentleman - friend , [he]2207-your gentleman - friend may take [himself]2207-your gentleman - friend off , wherever [he]2207-your gentleman - friend likes best . If [he]2207-your gentleman - friend falls in [my]0-i way , [I]0-i shall tell [him]2207-your gentleman - friend [my]0-i mind ; if [he]2207-your gentleman - friend do n’t fall in [my]0-i way , [I]0-i sha n’t , for it wo n’t be worth [my]0-i while to do it . As to [[your]93-mr. bounderby daughter]4634-your daughter , whom [I]0-i made [Loo Bounderby]101-loo , and might have done better by leaving [Loo Gradgrind]210-loo gradgrind , if [she]4634-your daughter do n’t come [home]2856-home to - morrow , by twelve o’clock at noon , [I]0-i shall understand that [she]4634-your daughter prefers to stay away , and [I]0-i shall send [her]4634-your daughter wearing apparel and so forth over here , and [you]93-mr. bounderby ’ll take charge of [her]4634-your daughter for the future . What [I]0-i shall say to [people in general]3257-people in general , of the incompatibility that led to [my]0-i so laying down the law , will be this . [I]0-i am [Josiah Bounderby]97-bounderby , and [I]0-i had [my]0-i bringing - up ; [she]4634-your daughter ’s [the daughter of [Tom Gradgrind]71-tom]2211-the daughter of tom gradgrind , and [she]4634-your daughter had [her]4634-your daughter bringing - up ; and the two horses would n’t pull together . [I]0-i am pretty well known to be rather [an uncommon man]2212-an uncommon man , [I]0-i believe ; and [most people]1969-most people will understand fast enough that it must be [a woman rather out of the common]2214-a woman rather out of the common , also , who , in the long run , would come up to [my]0-i mark . ’ ‘[0-i] Let [me]0-i seriously entreat [you]97-bounderby to reconsider this , [Bounderby]97-bounderby , ’ urged [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , ‘[97-bounderby] before [you]97-bounderby commit [yourself]97-bounderby to such a decision . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i always come to a decision , ’ said [Bounderby]97-bounderby , tossing [his]97-bounderby hat on : ‘[0-i] and whatever [I]0-i do , [I]0-i do at once . [I]0-i should be surprised at [Tom Gradgrind]71-tom ’s addressing such a remark to [[Josiah Bounderby]97-bounderby of [Coketown]4-coketown]390-josiah bounderby of coketown , knowing what [he]97-bounderby knows of [him]71-tom , if [I]0-i could be surprised by anything [Tom Gradgrind]71-tom did , after [his]71-tom making [himself]71-tom a party to sentimental humbug . [I]0-i have given [you]97-bounderby [my]0-i decision , and [I]0-i have got no more to say . Good night ! ’ So [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby went [home]2856-home to [[his]93-mr. bounderby town house]4671-his town house to bed . At five minutes past twelve o’clock next day , [he]93-mr. bounderby directed [[Mrs. Bounderby]155-mrs. bounderby ’s property]4672-mrs. bounderby ’s property to be carefully packed up and sent to [[Tom Gradgrind]71-tom ’s]4673-tom gradgrind ’s ; advertised [[his]93-mr. bounderby country retreat]4674-his country retreat for sale by private contract ; and resumed a bachelor life . The robbery at [the Bank]3524-the bank had not languished before , and did not cease to occupy a front place in the attention of [the principal of that establishment]4676-the principal of that establishment now . In boastful proof of [his]93-mr. bounderby promptitude and activity , as [a remarkable man]4677-a remarkable man , and [a self - made man]2882-a self - made man , and a commercial wonder more admirable than [Venus]211-venus , who had risen out of the mud instead of [the sea]3246-the sea , [he]93-mr. bounderby liked to show how little [his]93-mr. bounderby domestic affairs abated [his]93-mr. bounderby business ardour . Consequently , in the first few weeks of [his]93-mr. bounderby resumed bachelorhood , [he]93-mr. bounderby even advanced upon [his]93-mr. bounderby usual display of bustle , and every day made such a rout in renewing [his]93-mr. bounderby investigations into the robbery , that [the officers who had it in hand]4680-the officers who had it in hand almost wished it had never been committed . [They]4680-the officers who had it in hand were at fault too , and off the scent . Although [they]4680-the officers who had it in hand had been so quiet since the first outbreak of the matter , that [most people]1969-most people really did suppose it to have been abandoned as hopeless , nothing new occurred . [No implicated man]4682-no implicated man or [woman]820-woman took untimely courage , or made a self - betraying step . More remarkable yet , [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen could not be heard of , and [the mysterious old woman]4684-the mysterious old woman remained a mystery . Things having come to this pass , and showing no latent signs of stirring beyond it , the upshot of [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ’s investigations was , that [he]93-mr. bounderby resolved to hazard a bold burst . [He]93-mr. bounderby drew up a placard , offering Twenty Pounds reward for the apprehension of [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen , suspected of complicity in the robbery of [Coketown Bank]53-coketown bank on such a night ; [he]93-mr. bounderby described [the said Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen by dress , complexion , estimated height , and manner , as minutely as [he]93-mr. bounderby could ; [he]93-mr. bounderby recited how [he]93-mr. bounderby had left [the town]2838-the town , and in what direction [he]93-mr. bounderby had been last seen going ; [he]93-mr. bounderby had the whole printed in great black letters on a staring broadsheet ; and [he]93-mr. bounderby caused the walls to be posted with it in the dead of night , so that it should strike upon the sight of [the whole population]4686-the whole population at one blow . The factory - bells had need to ring [their]1969-most people loudest that morning to disperse [the groups of [workers who stood in the tardy daybreak]4688-workers who stood in the tardy daybreak]4687-the groups of workers who stood in the tardy daybreak , collected round the placards , devouring [them]4687-the groups of workers who stood in the tardy daybreak with eager eyes . Not the least eager of [the eyes assembled]4689-the eyes assembled , were the eyes of [those who could not read]4690-those who could not read . [These people]570-these people , as [they]570-these people listened to the friendly voice that read aloud — there was always some such ready to help [them]570-these people — stared at the characters which meant so much with a vague awe and respect that would have been half ludicrous , if any aspect of public ignorance could ever be otherwise than threatening and full of evil . Many ears and eyes were busy with a vision of the matter of these placards , among turning spindles , rattling looms , and whirling wheels , for hours afterwards ; and when the Hands cleared out again into [the streets]2975-the streets , there were still [as many readers as before]4693-as many readers as before . [Slackbridge]172-slackbridge , [the delegate]4694-the delegate , had to address [[his]172-slackbridge audience]4695-his audience too that night ; and [Slackbridge]172-slackbridge had obtained a clean bill from the printer , and had brought it in [his]172-slackbridge pocket . Oh , [[my]0-i friends]1421-my friends and [fellow - countrymen]1424-fellow - countrymen , [the down - trodden operatives of [Coketown]4-coketown]1422-the down - trodden operatives of coketown , oh , [[my]0-i fellow - brothers]4699-my fellow - brothers and [fellow - workmen]1428-fellow - workmen and [fellow - citizens]4701-fellow - citizens and [fellow - men]1429-fellow - men , what a to - do was there , when [Slackbridge]172-slackbridge unfolded what [he]172-slackbridge called ‘[0-i] that damning document , ’ and held it up to the gaze , and for the execration of [the working - man community]4703-the working - man community ! ‘[0-i] Oh , [[my]0-i fellow - men]2216-my fellow - men , behold of what [a traitor in the camp of those great spirits who are enrolled upon the holy scroll of Justice and of Union]2217-a traitor in the camp of those great spirits who are enrolled upon the holy scroll of justice and of union , is appropriately capable ! Oh , [[my]0-i prostrate friends]2218-my prostrate friends , with the galling yoke of tyrants on [your]2218-my prostrate friends necks and the iron foot of despotism treading down [your]2218-my prostrate friends fallen forms into the dust of the earth , upon which right glad would [[your]2218-my prostrate friends oppressors]2219-your oppressors be to see [you]2218-my prostrate friends creeping on [your]2218-my prostrate friends bellies all the days of [your]2218-my prostrate friends lives , like the serpent in [the garden]1728-the garden — oh , [[my]0-i brothers]3892-my brothers , and shall [I]0-i as [a man]484-a man not add , [[my]0-i sisters]2223-my sisters too , what do [you]3892-my brothers say , now , of [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen , with a slight stoop in [his]144-stephen shoulders and about five foot seven in height , as set forth in this degrading and disgusting document , this blighting bill , this pernicious placard , this abominable advertisement ; and with what majesty of denouncement will [you]2218-my prostrate friends crush [the viper , who would bring this stain and shame upon the God - like race that happily has cast [him]144-stephen out for ever ! Yes , [[my]0-i compatriots]2225-my compatriots]2224-the viper , who would bring this stain and shame upon the god - like race that happily has cast him out for ever ! yes , my compatriots , happily cast [him]144-stephen out and sent [him]144-stephen forth ! For [you]2218-my prostrate friends remember how [he]144-stephen stood here before [you]2218-my prostrate friends on [this platform]2226-this platform ; [you]2218-my prostrate friends remember how , face to face and foot to foot , [I]0-i pursued [him]144-stephen through all [his]144-stephen intricate windings ; [you]2218-my prostrate friends remember how [he]144-stephen sneaked and slunk , and sidled , and splitted of straws , until , with not an inch of ground to which to cling , [I]0-i hurled [him]144-stephen out from amongst [us]2227-us : an object for the undying finger of scorn to point at , and for the avenging fire of every free and thinking mind to scorch and scar ! And now , [[my]0-i friends]1421-my friends — [[my]0-i labouring friends]2229-my labouring friends , for [I]0-i rejoice and triumph in that stigma — [my]0-i [friends whose hard but honest beds are made in toil , and whose scanty but independent pots are boiled in hardship]2230-friends whose hard but honest beds are made in toil , and whose scanty but independent pots are boiled in hardship ; and now , [I]0-i say , [[my]0-i friends]1421-my friends , what appellation has [that dastard craven]2232-that dastard craven taken to [himself]2232-that dastard craven , when , with the mask torn from [his]2232-that dastard craven features , [he]2232-that dastard craven stands before [us]2227-us in all [his]2232-that dastard craven native deformity , a What ? [A thief]2233-a thief ! [A plunderer]2234-a plunderer ! [A proscribed fugitive]2235-a proscribed fugitive , with a price upon [his]2232-that dastard craven head ; a fester and a wound upon the noble character of [the Coketown operative]2236-the coketown operative ! Therefore , [[my]0-i band of [brothers]1436-brothers]2237-my band of brothers in a sacred bond , to which [[your]2239-your children]3889-your children and [[[your]2239-your children]3889-your children ’s children yet unborn]2242-your children ’s children yet unborn have set [their]2243-their infant hands and seals , [I]0-i propose to [you]2239-your on the part of [the United Aggregate Tribunal]1447-the united aggregate tribunal , ever watchful for [your]2239-your welfare , ever zealous for [your]2239-your benefit , that this meeting does Resolve : That [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen , [weaver]2245-weaver , referred to in this placard , having been already solemnly disowned by [the community of [Coketown]4-coketown Hands]2246-the community of coketown hands , the same are free from the shame of [his]144-stephen misdeeds , and can not as [a class]2247-a class be reproached with [his]144-stephen dishonest actions ! ’ Thus [Slackbridge]172-slackbridge ; gnashing and perspiring after a prodigious sort . [A few stern voices]4704-a few stern voices called out ‘[93-mr. bounderby] No ! ’ and a score or two hailed , with assenting cries of ‘[93-mr. bounderby] Hear , hear ! ’ the caution from [one man]4705-one man , ‘[93-mr. bounderby] [Slackbridge]172-slackbridge , y’or over hetter in’t ; y’or a goen too fast ! ’ But these were pigmies against [an army]4706-an army ; [the general assemblage]4707-the general assemblage subscribed to the gospel according to [Slackbridge]172-slackbridge , and gave three cheers for [him]172-slackbridge , as [he]172-slackbridge sat demonstratively panting at [them]4706-an army . [These men]3861-these men and [women]3196-women were yet in [the streets]2975-the streets , passing quietly to [[their]3861-these men homes]4711-their homes , when [Sissy]76-sissy , who had been called away from [Louisa]92-louisa some minutes before , returned . ‘[93-mr. bounderby] Who is it ? ’ asked [Louisa]92-louisa . ‘[93-mr. bounderby] It is [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , ’ said [Sissy]76-sissy , timid of the name , ‘[93-mr. bounderby] and [[your]2248-you brother]3779-your brother [Mr. Tom]71-tom , and [a young woman who says [her]2250-a young woman who says her name is rachael , and that you know her name is [Rachael]146-rachael , and that [you]2248-you know [her]2250-a young woman who says her name is rachael , and that you know her]2250-a young woman who says her name is rachael , and that you know her . ’ ‘[2250-a young woman who says her name is rachael , and that you know her] What do [they]2251-they want , [[Sissy]76-sissy dear]2252-sissy dear ? ’ ‘[2251-they] [They]2251-they want to see [you]2248-you . [Rachael]146-rachael has been crying , and seems angry . ’ ‘[146-rachael] [Father]108-father , ’ said [Louisa]92-louisa , for [he]108-father was present , ‘[108-father] [I]0-i can not refuse to see [them]2251-they , for a reason that will explain itself . Shall [they]2251-they come in [here]366-here ? ’ As [he]108-father answered in the affirmative , [Sissy]76-sissy went away to bring [them]2251-they . [She]76-sissy reappeared with [them]2251-they directly . [Tom]71-tom was last ; and remained standing in the obscurest part of [the room]2901-the room , near the door . ‘[155-mrs. bounderby] [Mrs. Bounderby]155-mrs. bounderby , ’ said [[her]76-sissy husband]2903-her husband , entering with a cool nod , ‘[155-mrs. bounderby] [I]0-i do n’t disturb [you]155-mrs. bounderby , [I]0-i hope . [[My]0-i brother]1334-my brother was with [me]0-i . ’ ‘[1334-my brother] Why could n’t [you]155-mrs. bounderby say so , [young Tom]71-tom ? ’ demanded [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby . ‘[155-mrs. bounderby] [I]0-i promised [[my]0-i sister]738-my sister [I]0-i would n’t . ’ Which [Louisa]92-louisa hastily confirmed . ‘[0-i] And besides , ’ said [the whelp]1387-the whelp bitterly , ‘[738-my sister] [she]738-my sister tells [her]738-my sister own story so precious well — and so full — that what business had [I]0-i to take it out of [her]738-my sister mouth ! ’ ‘[1631-young lady] Say , [young lady]1631-young lady , if [you]1631-young lady please , ’ pursued [Rachael]146-rachael , ‘[1631-young lady] why , in an evil hour , [you]1631-young lady ever came to [Stephen]144-stephen ’s that night . ’ ‘[1631-young lady] [I]0-i felt compassion for [him]144-stephen , ’ said [Louisa]92-louisa , [her]92-louisa colour deepening , ‘[0-i] and [I]0-i wished to know what [he]144-stephen was going to do , and wished to offer [him]144-stephen assistance . ’ ‘[361-ma’am] Thank [you]1631-young lady , [ma’am]361-ma’am , ’ said [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby . ‘[1631-young lady] Much flattered and obliged . ’ ‘[1631-young lady] Did [you]1631-young lady offer [him]144-stephen , ’ asked [Rachael]146-rachael , ‘[1631-young lady] a bank - note ? ’ ‘[1631-young lady] Yes ; but [he]144-stephen refused it , and would only take two pounds in gold . ’ [Rachael]146-rachael cast [her]146-rachael eyes towards [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby again . ‘[1631-young lady] Oh , certainly ! ’ said [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby . ‘[1631-young lady] If [you]1631-young lady put the question whether [your]1631-young lady ridiculous and improbable account was true or not , [I]0-i am bound to say it ’s confirmed . ’ ‘[1631-young lady] [Young lady]1631-young lady , ’ said [Rachael]146-rachael , ‘[1631-young lady] [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen is now named as [a thief in public print all over [this town]1229-this town]2268-a thief in public print all over this town , and where else ! There have been a meeting to - night where [he]144-stephen have been spoken of in the same shameful way . [Stephen]144-stephen ! [The honestest lad]2270-the honestest lad , [the truest lad]2271-the truest lad , the best ! ’ [Her]146-rachael indignation failed [her]146-rachael , and [she]146-rachael broke off sobbing . ‘[144-stephen] [I]0-i am very , very sorry , ’ said [Louisa]92-louisa . ‘[0-i] Oh , [young lady]1631-young lady , [young lady]1631-young lady , ’ returned [Rachael]146-rachael , ‘[1631-young lady] [I]0-i hope [you]1631-young lady may be , but [I]0-i do n’t know ! [You]1631-young lady ought to be bundled out for not knowing how to behave [yourself]1631-young lady , and [you]1631-young lady would be by rights . ’ [She]1631-young lady said nothing in reply ; and [her]1631-young lady low weeping was the only sound that was heard , until [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby spoke . ‘[1631-young lady] Come ! ’ said [he]93-mr. bounderby , ‘[1631-young lady] [you]1631-young lady know what [you]1631-young lady have engaged to do . [You]1631-young lady had better give [your]1631-young lady mind to that ; not this . ’ ‘[1631-young lady] ’ Deed , [I]146-rachael am loath , ’[146-rachael] returned [Rachael]146-rachael , drying [her]146-rachael eyes , ‘ that [any here]4717-any here should see [me]146-rachael like this ; but [I]146-rachael wo n’t be seen so again . [Young lady]1631-young lady , when [I]146-rachael had read what ’s put in print of [Stephen]144-stephen — and what has just as much truth in it as if it had been put in print of [you]1631-young lady — [I]146-rachael went straight to [the Bank]3524-the bank to say [I]146-rachael knew where [Stephen]144-stephen was , and to give a sure and certain promise that [he]144-stephen should be here in two days . Soon as [I]0-i come out of [the Mill]54-the mill to - night , [I]0-i hastened to hear what was said of [Stephen]144-stephen — for [I]0-i know wi ’ pride [he]144-stephen will come back to shame it ! — and then [I]0-i went again to seek [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , and [I]0-i found [him]93-mr. bounderby , and [I]0-i told [him]93-mr. bounderby every word [I]0-i knew ; and [he]93-mr. bounderby believed no word [I]0-i said , and brought [me]0-i here . ’[0-i] ‘ So far , that ’s true enough , ’[93-mr. bounderby] assented [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , with [his]93-mr. bounderby hands in [his]93-mr. bounderby pockets and [his]93-mr. bounderby hat on . ‘ But [I]93-mr. bounderby have known [[you]4721-you people]1545-you people before to - day , [you]4721-you ’ll observe , and [I]93-mr. bounderby know [you]4721-you never die for want of talking . [The post - office]2281-the post - office has n’t been forgotten either . What [I]0-i ’ll tell [you]2278-you is , that no letter to [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen has ever got into it . Therefore , what has become of [yours]2278-you , [I]0-i leave [you]2278-you to guess . Perhaps [you]2278-you ’re mistaken , and never wrote any . ’[2278-you] ‘ [He]93-mr. bounderby had n’t been gone from [here]366-here , [young lady]1631-young lady , ’[146-rachael] said [Rachael]146-rachael , turning appealingly to [Louisa]92-louisa , ‘ as much as a week , when [he]93-mr. bounderby sent [me]146-rachael the only letter [I]146-rachael have had from [him]93-mr. bounderby , saying that [he]93-mr. bounderby was forced to seek work in another name . ’[146-rachael] ‘ Oh , by [George]72-george ! ’[93-mr. bounderby] cried [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , shaking [his]93-mr. bounderby head , with a whistle , ‘ [he]93-mr. bounderby changes [his]93-mr. bounderby name , does [he]93-mr. bounderby !
