[The masters]4730-the masters against [him]2282-he on one hand , [the men against [him]2282-he]4731-the men against him on the other , [he]2282-he only wantin to work hard in peace , and do what [he]2282-he felt right . Can [a man]484-a man have no soul of [his]484-a man own , no mind of [his]484-a man own ? Must [he]2282-he go wrong all through wi ’[93-mr. bounderby] this side , or must [he]2282-he go wrong all through wi ’ that , or else be hunted like a hare ? ’[93-mr. bounderby] ‘ Indeed , indeed , [I]92-louisa pity [him]2282-he from [my]92-louisa heart , ’[92-louisa] returned [Louisa]92-louisa ; ‘ and [I]92-louisa hope that [he]2282-he will clear [himself]2282-he . ’[92-louisa] ‘ [You]92-louisa need have no fear of that , [young lady]1631-young lady . [He]2282-he is sure ! ’[93-mr. bounderby] ‘ [All the surer]4734-all the surer , [I]93-mr. bounderby suppose , ’[93-mr. bounderby] said [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , ‘ for [your]93-mr. bounderby refusing to tell where [he]2282-he is ? Eh ? ’[93-mr. bounderby] ‘ [He]2282-he shall not , through any act of [mine]0-i , come back wi ’[93-mr. bounderby] the unmerited reproach of being brought back . [He]2282-he shall come back of [his]2282-he own accord to clear [himself]2282-he , and put all those that have injured [his]2282-he good character , and [he]2282-he not here for its defence , to shame . [I]0-i have told [him]2282-he what has been done against [him]2282-he , ’ said [Rachael]146-rachael , throwing off all distrust as a rock throws of [the sea]3246-the sea , ‘[0-i] and [he]2282-he will be here , at furthest , in two days . ’ ‘[2282-he] Notwithstanding which , ’ added [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , ‘[2282-he] if [he]2282-he can be laid hold of any sooner , [he]2282-he shall have an earlier opportunity of clearing [himself]2282-he . As to [you]2283-you , [I]0-i have nothing against [you]2283-you ; what [you]2283-you came and told [me]0-i turns out to be true , and [I]0-i have given [you]2283-you the means of proving it to be true , and there ’s an end of it . [I]0-i wish [you]2283-you good night all ! [I]0-i must be off to look a little further into this . ’ [Tom]71-tom came out of [his]71-tom corner when [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby moved , moved with [him]71-tom , kept close to [him]71-tom , and went away with [him]71-tom . The only parting salutation of which [he]71-tom delivered [himself]71-tom was a sulky ‘[0-i] Good night , [father]2781-father ! ’ With a brief speech , and a scowl at [[his]71-tom sister]716-his sister , [he]71-tom left [the house]2918-the house . Since [his]71-tom sheet - anchor had come [home]2856-home , [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom had been sparing of speech . [He]71-tom still sat silent , when [Louisa]92-louisa mildly said : ‘[2781-father] [Rachael]146-rachael , [you]146-rachael will not distrust [me]0-i one day , when [you]146-rachael know [me]0-i better . ’ ‘[146-rachael] It goes against [me]0-i , ’ [Rachael]146-rachael answered , in a gentler manner , ‘[146-rachael] to mistrust [any one]495-any one ; but when [I]0-i am so mistrusted — when [we]2286-we all are — [I]0-i can not keep such things quite out of [my]0-i mind . [I]0-i ask [your]146-rachael pardon for having done [you]146-rachael an injury . [I]0-i do n’t think what [I]0-i said now . Yet [I]0-i might come to think it again , wi ’ [the poor lad]1649-the poor lad so wronged . ’[146-rachael] ‘ Did [you]146-rachael tell [him]1649-the poor lad in [your]146-rachael letter , ’[76-sissy] inquired [Sissy]76-sissy , ‘ that suspicion seemed to have fallen upon [him]1649-the poor lad , because [he]1649-the poor lad had been seen about [the Bank]33-the bank at night ? [He]1649-the poor lad would then know what [he]1649-the poor lad would have to explain on coming back , and would be ready . ’[76-sissy] ‘ Yes , [dear]3016-dear , ’[76-sissy] [she]76-sissy returned ; ‘ but [I]76-sissy ca n’t guess what can have ever taken [him]1649-the poor lad [there]425-there . [He]1649-the poor lad never used to go [there]425-there . It was never in [his]1649-the poor lad way . [His]1649-the poor lad way was the same as [mine]76-sissy , and not near it . ’[76-sissy] [Sissy]76-sissy had already been at [her]76-sissy side asking [her]76-sissy where [she]76-sissy lived , and whether [she]76-sissy might come to - morrow night , to inquire if there were news of [him]2287-him . ‘ [I]146-rachael doubt , ’[146-rachael] said [Rachael]146-rachael , ‘ if [he]1649-the poor lad can be [here]366-here till next day . ’[146-rachael] ‘ Then [I]76-sissy will come next night too , ’[76-sissy] said [Sissy]76-sissy . When [Rachael]146-rachael , assenting to this , was gone , [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom lifted up [his]71-tom head , and said to [[his]71-tom daughter]2865-his daughter : ‘ [Louisa]92-louisa , [[my]71-tom dear]601-my dear , [I]71-tom have never , that [I]71-tom know of , seen [this man]2994-this man . Do [you]92-louisa believe [him]2994-this man to be implicated ? ’[71-tom] ‘ [I]146-rachael think [I]146-rachael have believed it , [father]2781-father , though with great difficulty . [I]146-rachael do not believe it now . ’[146-rachael] ‘ That is to say , [you]92-louisa once persuaded [yourself]92-louisa to believe it , from knowing [him]2994-this man to be suspected . [His]71-tom appearance and manner ; are [they]4747-they so honest ? ’[71-tom] ‘ Very honest . ’[71-tom] ‘ And [her]92-louisa confidence not to be shaken ! [I]71-tom ask [myself]71-tom , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , musing , ‘ does [the real culprit]4748-the real culprit know of these accusations ? Where is [he]2994-this man ? Who is [he]2994-this man ? ’[71-tom] [His]71-tom hair had latterly began to change its colour . As [he]71-tom leaned upon [his]71-tom hand again , looking gray and old , [Louisa]92-louisa , with a face of fear and pity , hurriedly went over to [him]71-tom , and sat close at [his]71-tom side . [Her]92-louisa eyes by accident met [Sissy]76-sissy ’s at the moment . [Sissy]76-sissy flushed and started , and [Louisa]92-louisa put [her]92-louisa finger on [her]92-louisa lip . Next night , when [Sissy]76-sissy returned [home]2856-home and told [Louisa]92-louisa that [Stephen]144-stephen was not come , [she]76-sissy told it in a whisper . Next night again , when [she]92-louisa came [home]2856-home with the same account , and added that [he]71-tom had not been heard of , [she]92-louisa spoke in the same low frightened tone . From the moment of that interchange of looks , [they]2291-they never uttered [his]71-tom name , or any reference to [him]71-tom , aloud ; nor ever pursued the subject of the robbery , when [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom spoke of it . The two appointed days ran out , three days and nights ran out , and [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen was not come , and remained unheard of . On the fourth day , [Rachael]146-rachael , with unabated confidence , but considering [her]146-rachael despatch to have miscarried , went up to [the Bank]3524-the bank , and showed [her]146-rachael letter from [him]71-tom with [his]71-tom address , at [a working colony]2293-a working colony , one of many , not upon [the main road]2294-the main road , sixty miles away . [Messengers]2295-messengers were sent to [that place]1896-that place , and [the whole town]1127-the whole town looked for [Stephen]144-stephen to be brought in next day . During this whole time [the whelp]1387-the whelp moved about with [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby like [his]1387-the whelp shadow , assisting in all the proceedings . [He]1387-the whelp was greatly excited , horribly fevered , bit [his]1387-the whelp nails down to the quick , spoke in a hard rattling voice , and with lips that were black and burnt up . At the hour when [the suspected man]2299-the suspected man was looked for , [the whelp]1387-the whelp was at [the station]3414-the station ; offering to wager that [he]1387-the whelp had made off before the arrival of [those who were sent in quest of [him]1387-the whelp]2302-those who were sent in quest of him , and that [he]1387-the whelp would not appear . [The whelp]1387-the whelp was right . [The messengers]2304-the messengers returned alone . [Rachael]146-rachael ’s letter had gone , [Rachael]146-rachael ’s letter had been delivered . [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen had decamped in that same hour ; and [no soul]2305-no soul knew more of [him]144-stephen . The only doubt in [Coketown]4-coketown was , whether [Rachael]146-rachael had written in good faith , believing that [he]144-stephen really would come back , or warning [him]144-stephen to fly . On this point opinion was divided . Six days , seven days , far on into another week . [The wretched whelp]2306-the wretched whelp plucked up a ghastly courage , and began to grow defiant . ‘ Was [the suspected fellow]4749-the suspected fellow [the thief]4750-the thief ? A pretty question ! If not , where was [the man]516-the man , and why did [he]516-the man not come back ? ’[2306-the wretched whelp] Where was [the man]516-the man , and why did [he]516-the man not come back ? In the dead of night the echoes of [his]144-stephen own words , which had rolled Heaven knows how far away in the daytime , came back instead , and abided by [him]144-stephen until morning . Day and night again , day and night again . No [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen . Where was [the man]516-the man , and why did [he]516-the man not come back ? Every night , [Sissy]76-sissy went to [[Rachael]146-rachael ’s lodging]2309-rachael ’s lodging , and sat with [her]146-rachael in [[her]76-sissy small neat room]2310-her small neat room . All day , [Rachael]146-rachael toiled as [such people]2311-such people must toil , whatever [their]2311-such people anxieties . The smoke - serpents were [indifferent who was lost or found , who turned out bad or good]2312-indifferent who was lost or found , who turned out bad or good ; [the melancholy mad elephants]1134-the melancholy mad elephants , like [the Hard Fact men]2314-the hard fact men , abated nothing of [their]1134-the melancholy mad elephants set routine , whatever happened . Day and night again , day and night again . The monotony was unbroken . Even [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen ’s disappearance was falling into the general way , and becoming as monotonous a wonder as any piece of machinery in [Coketown]4-coketown . ‘ [I]146-rachael misdoubt , ’[146-rachael] said [Rachael]146-rachael , ‘ if there is as many as twenty left in all [this place]729-this place , who have any trust in [the poor dear lad]4753-the poor dear lad now . ’[146-rachael] [She]146-rachael said it to [Sissy]76-sissy , as [they]2315-they sat in [[her]146-rachael lodging]2316-her lodging , lighted only by the lamp at [the street corner]2317-the street corner . [Sissy]76-sissy had come [there]425-there when it was already dark , to await [her]146-rachael return from work ; and [they]2315-they had since sat at the window where [Rachael]146-rachael had found [her]146-rachael , wanting no brighter light to shine on [their]2315-they sorrowful talk . ‘ If it had n’t been mercifully brought about , that [I]146-rachael was to have [you]76-sissy to speak to , ’[146-rachael] pursued [Rachael]146-rachael , ‘ times are , when [I]146-rachael think [my]146-rachael mind would not have kept right . But [I]146-rachael get hope and strength through [you]76-sissy ; and [you]76-sissy believe that though appearances may rise against [him]4754-him , [he]4754-him will be proved clear ? ’[146-rachael] ‘ [I]146-rachael do believe so , ’[146-rachael] returned [Sissy]76-sissy , ‘ with [my]146-rachael whole heart . [I]146-rachael feel so certain , [Rachael]146-rachael , that the confidence [you]76-sissy hold in [yours]76-sissy against all discouragement , is not like to be wrong , that [I]146-rachael have no more doubt of [him]4754-him than if [I]146-rachael had known [him]4754-him through as many years of trial as [you]76-sissy have . ’[146-rachael] ‘ And [I]213-rachel , [[my]213-rachel dear]601-my dear , ’[213-rachel] said [Rachel]213-rachel , with a tremble in [her]213-rachel voice , ‘ have known [him]4754-him through [them]4756-them all , to be , according to [his]4754-him quiet ways , so faithful to everything honest and good , that if [he]4754-him was never to be heard of more , and [I]213-rachel was to live to be a hundred years old , [I]213-rachel could say with [my]213-rachel last breath , [God]147-god knows [my]213-rachel heart . [I]213-rachel have never once left trusting [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen ! ’[213-rachel] ‘ [We]4757-we all believe , up at [the Lodge]641-the lodge , [Rachael]146-rachael , that [he]4754-him will be freed from suspicion , sooner or later . ’[146-rachael] ‘ The better [I]146-rachael know it to be so believed there , [[my]146-rachael dear]601-my dear , ’[146-rachael] said [Rachael]146-rachael , ‘ and the kinder [I]146-rachael feel it that [you]146-rachael come away from there , purposely to comfort [me]146-rachael , and keep [me]146-rachael company , and be seen wi ’[146-rachael] [me]0-i when [I]0-i am not yet free from all suspicion [myself]0-i , the more grieved [I]0-i am that [I]0-i should ever have spoken those mistrusting words to [the young lady]2319-the young lady . And yet [I]0-i — ’ ‘[0-i] [You]0-i do n’t mistrust [her]2319-the young lady now , [Rachael]146-rachael ? ’ ‘[0-i] Now that [you]0-i have brought [us]2320-us more together , no . But [I]0-i ca n’t at all times keep out of [my]0-i mind — ’ [Her]2319-the young lady voice so sunk into a low and slow communing with [herself]2319-the young lady , that [Sissy]76-sissy , sitting by [her]76-sissy side , was obliged to listen with attention . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ca n’t at all times keep out of [my]0-i mind , mistrustings of [some one]3472-some one . [I]0-i ca n’t think [who ’ tis]4760-who ’ tis , [I]4760-who ’ tis ca n’t think how or why it may be done , but [I]4760-who ’ tis mistrust that [some one]3472-some one has put [Stephen]144-stephen out of the way . [I]4760-who ’ tis mistrust that by [his]144-stephen coming back of [his]144-stephen own accord , and showing [himself]144-stephen innocent before [them]4762-them all , [some one]3472-some one would be confounded , who — to prevent that — has stopped [him]144-stephen , and put [him]144-stephen out of the way . ’[4760-who ’ tis] ‘ That is a dreadful thought , ’[76-sissy] said [Sissy]76-sissy , turning pale . ‘ It is a dreadful thought to think [he]144-stephen may be murdered . ’[76-sissy] [Sissy]76-sissy shuddered , and turned paler yet . ‘ When it makes its way into [my]146-rachael mind , [dear]3016-dear , ’[146-rachael] said [Rachael]146-rachael , ‘ and it will come sometimes , though [I]146-rachael do all [I]146-rachael can to keep it out , wi ’[146-rachael] counting on to high numbers as [I]0-i work , and saying over and over again pieces that [I]0-i knew when [I]0-i were [a child]436-a child — [I]0-i fall into such a wild , hot hurry , that , however tired [I]0-i am , [I]0-i want to walk fast , miles and miles . [I]0-i must get the better of this before bed - time . [I]0-i ’ll walk [home]2856-home wi ’ [you]3016-dear . ’[0-i] ‘ [He]144-stephen might fall ill upon the journey back , ’[76-sissy] said [Sissy]76-sissy , faintly offering a worn - out scrap of hope ; ‘ and in such a case , there are many places on [the road]2846-the road where [he]144-stephen might stop . ’[76-sissy] ‘ But [he]144-stephen is in none of them . [He]144-stephen has been sought for in all , and [he]144-stephen ’s not [there]425-there . ’[0-i] ‘ True , ’[76-sissy] was [Sissy]76-sissy ’s reluctant admission . ‘ [He]144-stephen ’d walk the journey in two days . If [he]144-stephen was footsore and could n’t walk , [I]76-sissy sent [him]144-stephen , in the letter [he]144-stephen got , the money to ride , lest [he]144-stephen should have none of [his]144-stephen own to spare . ’[76-sissy] ‘ Let [us]2324-us hope that to - morrow will bring something better , [Rachael]146-rachael . Come into the air ! ’[76-sissy] [Her]76-sissy gentle hand adjusted [Rachael]146-rachael ’s shawl upon [her]76-sissy shining black hair in the usual manner of [her]76-sissy wearing it , and [they]2324-us went out . The night being fine , little knots of [Hands]150-the hands were here and there lingering at [street corners]2325-street corners ; but it was supper - time with the greater part of [them]2326-them , and there were but [few people]2327-few people in [the streets]2975-the streets . ‘ [You]146-rachael ’re[146-rachael] not so hurried now , [Rachael]146-rachael , and [your]146-rachael hand is cooler . ’ ‘[146-rachael] [I]0-i get better , [dear]3016-dear , if [I]0-i can only walk , and breathe a little fresh . ‘ Times when [I]146-rachael ca n’t , [I]146-rachael turn weak and confused . ’[146-rachael] ‘ But [you]146-rachael must not begin to fail , [Rachael]146-rachael , for [you]146-rachael may be wanted at any time to stand by [Stephen]144-stephen . To - morrow is Saturday . If no news comes to - morrow , let [us]2330-them walk in [the country]336-the country on Sunday morning , and strengthen [you]146-rachael for another week . Will [you]146-rachael go ? ’[146-rachael] ‘ Yes , [dear]3016-dear . ’[2330-them] [They]2330-them were by this time in [the street where [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ’s house stood]2331-the street where mr. bounderby ’s house stood . The way to [[Sissy]76-sissy ’s destination]2332-sissy ’s destination led [them]2330-them past the door , and [they]2330-them were going straight towards [it]2332-sissy ’s destination . [Some train]2333-some train had newly arrived in [Coketown]4-coketown , which had put [a number of vehicles]2334-a number of vehicles in motion , and scattered a considerable bustle about [the town]2838-the town . [Several coaches]2336-several coaches were rattling before [them]2330-them and behind [them]2330-them as [they]2330-them approached [[Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ’s]3406-mr. bounderby ’s , and [one of [the latter]3160-the latter]2338-one of the latter drew up with such briskness as [they]2330-them were in the act of passing [the house]2918-the house , that [they]2330-them looked round involuntarily . The bright gaslight over [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ’s steps showed [them]2330-them [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit in [the coach]2341-the coach , in an ecstasy of excitement , struggling to open the door ; [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit seeing [them]2330-them at the same moment , called to [them]2330-them to stop . ‘ It ’s a coincidence , ’[126-mrs. sparsit] exclaimed [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , as [she]126-mrs. sparsit was released by [the coachman]2022-the coachman . ‘ It ’s a Providence ! Come out , [ma’am]361-ma’am ! ’[126-mrs. sparsit] then said [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , to [some one inside]2343-some one inside , ‘ come out , or [we]2330-them ’ll have [you]2343-some one inside dragged out ! ’[126-mrs. sparsit] Hereupon , no other than [the mysterious old woman]4684-the mysterious old woman descended . Whom [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit incontinently collared . ‘ Leave [her]4684-the mysterious old woman alone , [everybody]404-everybody ! ’[126-mrs. sparsit] cried [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , with great energy . ‘ Let [nobody]365-nobody touch [her]4684-the mysterious old woman . [She]4684-the mysterious old woman belongs to [me]126-mrs. sparsit . Come in , [ma’am]361-ma’am ! ’[126-mrs. sparsit] then said [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , reversing [her]126-mrs. sparsit former word of command . ‘ Come in , [ma’am]361-ma’am , or [we]4774-we ’ll have [you]361-ma’am dragged in ! ’[126-mrs. sparsit] The spectacle of [a matron of classical deportment]2345-a matron of classical deportment , seizing [an ancient woman]2346-an ancient woman by the throat , and hauling [her]2346-an ancient woman into [a dwelling - house]2347-a dwelling - house , would have been under any circumstances , sufficient temptation to [all true English stragglers]2348-all true english stragglers so blest as to witness it , to force a way into [that dwelling - house]2349-that dwelling - house and see the matter out . But when the phenomenon was enhanced by the notoriety and mystery by this time associated all over [the town]2838-the town with the Bank robbery , it would have lured [the stragglers]2351-the stragglers in , with an irresistible attraction , though the roof had been expected to fall upon [their]2351-the stragglers heads . Accordingly , [the chance witnesses on the ground]2352-the chance witnesses on the ground , consisting of [the busiest of [the neighbours to the number of some five - and - twenty]2354-the neighbours to the number of some five - and - twenty]2353-the busiest of the neighbours to the number of some five - and - twenty , closed in after [Sissy]76-sissy and [Rachael]146-rachael , as [they]2352-the chance witnesses on the ground closed in after [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit and [her]126-mrs. sparsit prize ; and [the whole body]2355-the whole body made a disorderly irruption into [[Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ’s dining - room]2356-mr. bounderby ’s dining - room , where [the people behind]2357-the people behind lost not a moment ’s time in mounting on the chairs , to get the better of [the people in front]2358-the people in front . ‘ Fetch [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby down ! ’[126-mrs. sparsit] cried [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit . ‘ [Rachael]146-rachael , [young woman]4775-young woman ; [you]4775-young woman know who this is ? ’[126-mrs. sparsit] ‘ It ’s [Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler , ’[146-rachael] said [Rachael]146-rachael . ‘ [I]126-mrs. sparsit should think it is ! ’[126-mrs. sparsit] cried [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , exulting . ‘ [Fetch Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby . Stand away , [everybody]404-everybody ! ’[126-mrs. sparsit] Here [old Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler , muffling [herself]182-mrs. pegler up , and shrinking from observation , whispered a word of entreaty . ‘ Do n’t tell [me]126-mrs. sparsit , ’[126-mrs. sparsit] said [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , aloud . ‘ [I]126-mrs. sparsit have told [you]93-mr. bounderby twenty times , coming along , that [I]126-mrs. sparsit will not leave [you]93-mr. bounderby till [I]126-mrs. sparsit have handed [you]93-mr. bounderby over to [him]93-mr. bounderby [myself]126-mrs. sparsit . ’[126-mrs. sparsit] [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby now appeared , accompanied by [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom and the whelp , with whom [he]93-mr. bounderby had been holding conference up - stairs . [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby looked more astonished than hospitable , at sight of [this uninvited party in [[his]93-mr. bounderby dining - room]2360-his dining - room]2359-this uninvited party in his dining - room . ‘ Why , what ’s the matter now ! ’[93-mr. bounderby] said [he]93-mr. bounderby . ‘ [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , [ma’am]361-ma’am ? ’[93-mr. bounderby] ‘ [Sir]2771-sir , ’[2361-that worthy woman] explained [that worthy woman]2361-that worthy woman , ‘ [I]2361-that worthy woman trust it is [my]2361-that worthy woman good fortune to produce [a person [you]2771-sir have much desired to find]4779-a person you have much desired to find . Stimulated by [my]2361-that worthy woman wish to relieve [your]2771-sir mind , [sir]2771-sir , and connecting together such imperfect clues to [the part of [the country]336-the country in which [that person]4783-that person might be supposed to reside]4781-the part of the country in which that person might be supposed to reside , as have been afforded by [the young woman]4784-the young woman , [Rachael]146-rachael , fortunately now present to identify , [I]2361-that worthy woman have had the happiness to succeed , and to bring [that person]4783-that person with [me]2361-that worthy woman — [I]2361-that worthy woman need not say most unwillingly on [her]4783-that person part . It has not been , [sir]2771-sir , without some trouble that [I]2361-that worthy woman have effected this ; but trouble in [your]2771-sir service is to [me]2361-that worthy woman a pleasure , and hunger , thirst , and cold a real gratification . ’[2361-that worthy woman] Here [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit ceased ; for [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ’s visage exhibited an extraordinary combination of all possible colours and expressions of discomfiture , as [old Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler was disclosed to [his]93-mr. bounderby view . ‘ Why , what do [you]182-mrs. pegler mean by this ? ’[93-mr. bounderby] was [his]93-mr. bounderby highly unexpected demand , in great warmth . ‘ [I]93-mr. bounderby ask [you]182-mrs. pegler , what do [you]182-mrs. pegler mean by this , [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , [ma’am]361-ma’am ? ’[93-mr. bounderby] ‘ [Sir]2771-sir ! ’[126-mrs. sparsit] exclaimed [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , faintly . ‘ Why do n’t [you]182-mrs. pegler mind [your]182-mrs. pegler own business , [ma’am]361-ma’am ? ’[93-mr. bounderby] roared [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby . ‘ How dare [you]182-mrs. pegler go and poke [your]182-mrs. pegler officious nose into [my]93-mr. bounderby family affairs ? ’[93-mr. bounderby] This allusion to [her]126-mrs. sparsit favourite feature overpowered [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit . [She]126-mrs. sparsit sat down stiffly in a chair , as if [she]126-mrs. sparsit were frozen ; and with a fixed stare at [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , slowly grated [her]126-mrs. sparsit mittens against one another , as if they were frozen too . ‘ [[My]182-mrs. pegler dear]601-my dear [Josiah]97-bounderby ! ’[182-mrs. pegler] cried [Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler , trembling . ‘ [[My]182-mrs. pegler darling boy]4791-my darling boy ! [I]182-mrs. pegler am not to blame . It ’s not [my]182-mrs. pegler fault , [Josiah]97-bounderby . [I]182-mrs. pegler told [this lady]619-this lady over and over again , that [I]182-mrs. pegler knew [she]619-this lady was doing what would not be agreeable to [you]97-bounderby , but [she]619-this lady would do it . ’[182-mrs. pegler] ‘ What did [you]93-mr. bounderby let [her]619-this lady bring [you]97-bounderby for ? Could n’t [you]93-mr. bounderby knock [her]619-this lady cap off , or [her]619-this lady tooth out , or scratch [her]619-this lady , or do something or other to [her]619-this lady ? ’[97-bounderby] asked [Bounderby]97-bounderby . ‘ [[My]97-bounderby own boy]4793-my own boy ! [She]619-this lady threatened [me]97-bounderby that if [I]97-bounderby resisted [her]619-this lady , [I]97-bounderby should be brought by [constables]4794-constables , and it was better to come quietly than make that stir in such a ’[97-bounderby] — [Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler glanced timidly but proudly round the walls — ‘ such [a fine house as this]4795-a fine house as this . Indeed , indeed , it is not [my]182-mrs. pegler fault ! [[My]182-mrs. pegler dear]601-my dear , [noble , stately boy]4797-noble , stately boy ! [I]182-mrs. pegler have always lived quiet , and secret , [Josiah]97-bounderby , [[my]182-mrs. pegler dear]601-my dear . [I]182-mrs. pegler have never broken the condition once . [I]182-mrs. pegler have never said [I]182-mrs. pegler was [[your]97-bounderby mother]3258-your mother . [I]182-mrs. pegler have admired [you]97-bounderby at a distance ; and if [I]182-mrs. pegler have come to [town]439-town sometimes , with long times between , to take a proud peep at [you]97-bounderby , [I]182-mrs. pegler have done it unbeknown , [[my]182-mrs. pegler love]4801-my love , and gone away again . ’[182-mrs. pegler] [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , with [his]93-mr. bounderby hands in [his]93-mr. bounderby pockets , walked in impatient mortification up and down at the side of the long dining - table , while [the spectators]3049-the spectators greedily took in every syllable of [Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler ’s appeal , and at each succeeding syllable became more and more round - eyed . [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby still walking up and down when [Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler had done , [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom addressed [that maligned old lady]2363-that maligned old lady : ‘ [I]71-tom am surprised , [madam]4802-madam , ’[71-tom] [he]71-tom observed with severity , ‘ that in [your]4802-madam old age [you]4802-madam have the face to claim [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby for [[your]4802-madam son]2255-your son , after [your]4802-madam unnatural and inhuman treatment of [him]2255-your son . ’[71-tom] ‘ [Me]182-mrs. pegler unnatural ! ’[182-mrs. pegler] cried poor old [Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler . ‘ [Me]182-mrs. pegler inhuman ! To [[my]182-mrs. pegler dear boy]4804-my dear boy ? ’[182-mrs. pegler] ‘ [Dear]3016-dear ! ’[71-tom] repeated [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom . ‘ Yes ; dear in [his]2255-your son self - made prosperity , [madam]4802-madam , [I]71-tom dare say . Not very dear , however , when [you]4802-madam deserted [him]2255-your son in [his]2255-your son infancy , and left [him]2255-your son to the brutality of [a drunken grandmother]4807-a drunken grandmother . ’[71-tom] ‘ [I]182-mrs. pegler deserted [[my]182-mrs. pegler Josiah]4808-my josiah ! ’[182-mrs. pegler] cried [Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler , clasping [her]182-mrs. pegler hands . ‘ Now , [Lord]4809-lord forgive [you]71-tom , [sir]2771-sir , for [your]71-tom wicked imaginations , and for [your]71-tom scandal against the memory of [[my]182-mrs. pegler poor mother]4811-my poor mother , who died in [my]182-mrs. pegler arms before [Josiah]97-bounderby was born . May [you]71-tom repent of it , [sir]2771-sir , and live to know better ! ’[182-mrs. pegler] [She]182-mrs. pegler was so very earnest and injured , that [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , shocked by the possibility which dawned upon [him]71-tom , said in a gentler tone : ‘ Do [you]182-mrs. pegler deny , then , [madam]4802-madam , that [you]71-tom left [[your]71-tom son]2255-your son to — to be brought up in the gutter ? ’[71-tom] ‘ [Josiah]97-bounderby in the gutter ! ’[182-mrs. pegler] exclaimed [Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler . ‘ No such a thing , [sir]2771-sir . Never ! For shame on [you]2771-sir ! [[My]182-mrs. pegler dear boy]4804-my dear boy knows , and will give [you]2771-sir to know , that though [he]97-bounderby come of [humble parents]4817-humble parents , [he]97-bounderby come of parents that loved [him]97-bounderby as dear as [the best]4818-the best could , and never thought it hardship on [themselves]4817-humble parents to pinch a bit that [he]97-bounderby might write and cipher beautiful , and [I]182-mrs. pegler ’ve [his]97-bounderby books at [home]2856-home to show it ! Aye , have [I]182-mrs. pegler ! ’[182-mrs. pegler] said [Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler , with indignant pride . ‘ And [[my]182-mrs. pegler dear boy]4804-my dear boy knows , and will give [you]2771-sir to know , [sir]2771-sir , that after [[his]97-bounderby beloved father]4822-his beloved father died , when [he]97-bounderby was eight years old , [[his]97-bounderby mother]2893-his mother , too , could pinch a bit , as it was [her]2893-his mother duty and [her]2893-his mother pleasure and [her]2893-his mother pride to do it , to help [him]97-bounderby out in life , and put [him]97-bounderby ’[182-mrs. pegler] prentice . And [a steady lad]2364-a steady lad [he]2364-a steady lad was , and [a kind master]2365-a kind master [he]2364-a steady lad had to lend [him]2364-a steady lad a hand , and well [he]2364-a steady lad worked [his]2364-a steady lad own way forward to be rich and thriving . And [I]0-i ’ll give [you]2366-you to know , [sir]2771-sir — for this [[my]0-i dear boy]4804-my dear boy wo n’t — that though [[his]4804-my dear boy mother]2893-his mother kept but [a little village shop]2370-a little village shop , [he]4804-my dear boy never forgot [her]2893-his mother , but pensioned [me]0-i on thirty pound a year — more than [I]0-i want , for [I]0-i put by out of it — only making the condition that [I]0-i was to keep down in [my]0-i own part , and make no boasts about [him]4804-my dear boy , and not trouble [him]4804-my dear boy . And [I]0-i never have , except with looking at [him]4804-my dear boy once a year , when [he]4804-my dear boy has never knowed it . And it ’s right , ’ said poor old [Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler , in affectionate championship , ‘[0-i] that [I]0-i should keep down in [my]0-i own part , and [I]0-i have no doubts that if [I]0-i was [here]366-here [I]0-i should do a many unbefitting things , and [I]0-i am well contented , and [I]0-i can keep [my]0-i pride in [my]0-i Josiah to [myself]0-i , and [I]0-i can love for love ’s own sake ! And [I]0-i am ashamed of [you]4804-my dear boy , [sir]2771-sir , ’ said [Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler , lastly , ‘[0-i] for [your]4804-my dear boy slanders and suspicions . And [I]0-i never stood [here]366-here before , nor never wanted to stand [here]366-here when [[my]0-i dear son]2375-my dear son said no . And [I]0-i should n’t be [here]366-here now , if it had n’t been for being brought [here]366-here . And for shame upon [you]4804-my dear boy , Oh , for shame , to accuse [me]0-i of being [a bad mother]2378-a bad mother to [[my]0-i son]2379-my son , with [[my]0-i son]2379-my son standing here to tell [you]4804-my dear boy so different ! ’ [The bystanders]4824-the bystanders , on and off the dining - room chairs , raised a murmur of sympathy with [Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler , and [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom felt [himself]71-tom innocently placed in a very distressing predicament , when [Mr. Bounderby , who had never]93-mr. bounderby [ceased walking up and down , and had every moment swelled larger and larger , and grown redder and redder]4825-ceased walking up and down , and had every moment swelled larger and larger , and grown redder and redder , stopped short . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t exactly know , ’ said [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , ‘[0-i] how [I]0-i come to be favoured with the attendance of [the present company]2381-the present company , but [I]0-i do n’t inquire . When [they]2381-the present company ’re quite satisfied , perhaps [they]2381-the present company ’ll be so good as to disperse ; whether [they]2381-the present company ’re[2381-the present company] satisfied or not , perhaps [they]2381-the present company ’ll be so good as to disperse . [I]0-i ’m not bound to deliver a lecture on [my]71-tom family affairs , [I]71-tom have not undertaken to do it , and [I]71-tom ’m[71-tom] not a going to do it . Therefore [those who expect any explanation whatever upon that branch of the subject]2382-those who expect any explanation whatever upon that branch of the subject , will be disappointed — particularly [Tom Gradgrind]71-tom , and [he]71-tom ca n’t know it too soon . In reference to the Bank robbery , there has been a mistake made , concerning [[my]0-i mother]367-my mother . If there had n’t been over - officiousness it would n’t have been made , and [I]0-i hate over - officiousness at all times , whether or no . Good evening ! ’ Although [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby carried it off in these terms , holding the door open for [the company]3107-the company to depart , there was a blustering sheepishness upon [him]93-mr. bounderby , at once extremely crestfallen and superlatively absurd . [Detected]214-detected as [the Bully of humility]4827-the bully of humility , who had built [his]93-mr. bounderby windy reputation upon lies , and in [his]93-mr. bounderby boastfulness had put the honest truth as far away from [him]93-mr. bounderby as if [he]93-mr. bounderby had advanced the mean claim ( there is no meaner ) to tack [himself]93-mr. bounderby on to a pedigree , [he]93-mr. bounderby cut a most ridiculous figure . With [the people]2827-the people filing off at the door [he]93-mr. bounderby held , who [he]93-mr. bounderby knew would carry what had passed to [the whole town]1127-the whole town , to be given to the four winds , [he]93-mr. bounderby could not have looked [a Bully more shorn and forlorn]4830-a bully more shorn and forlorn , if [he]93-mr. bounderby had had [his]93-mr. bounderby ears cropped . Even [that unlucky female]4831-that unlucky female , [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , fallen from [her]4831-that unlucky female pinnacle of exultation into [the Slough of Despond]55-the slough of despond , was not in so bad a plight as [that remarkable man]4832-that remarkable man and self - made [Humbug]215-humbug , [Josiah Bounderby]97-bounderby of [Coketown]4-coketown . [Rachael]146-rachael and [Sissy]76-sissy , leaving [Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler to occupy a bed at [[her]182-mrs. pegler son]4833-her son ’s for that night , walked together to the gate of [Stone Lodge]3-stone lodge and there parted . [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom joined [them]4834-them before [they]4834-them had gone very far , and spoke with much interest of [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen ; for whom [he]71-tom thought this signal failure of the suspicions against [Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler was likely to work well . As to the whelp ; throughout this scene as on all other late occasions , [he]144-stephen had stuck close to [Bounderby]97-bounderby . [He]144-stephen seemed to feel that as long as [Bounderby]97-bounderby could make no discovery without [his]144-stephen knowledge , [he]144-stephen was so far safe . [He]144-stephen never visited [[his]144-stephen sister]716-his sister , and had only seen [her]716-his sister once since [she]716-his sister went [home]2856-home : that is to say on the night when [he]144-stephen still stuck close to [Bounderby]97-bounderby , as already related . There was one dim unformed fear lingering about [[his]144-stephen sister]716-his sister ’s mind , to which [she]716-his sister never gave utterance , which surrounded [the graceless and ungrateful boy]4838-the graceless and ungrateful boy with a dreadful mystery . The same dark possibility had presented itself in the same shapeless guise , this very day , to [Sissy]76-sissy , when [Rachael]146-rachael spoke of [some one who would be confounded by [Stephen]144-stephen ’s return , having put [him]144-stephen out of the way]4839-some one who would be confounded by stephen ’s return , having put him out of the way . [Louisa]92-louisa had never spoken of harbouring any suspicion of [[her]92-louisa brother]2932-her brother in connexion with the robbery , [she]92-louisa and [Sissy]76-sissy had held no confidence on the subject , save in that one interchange of looks when [the unconscious father]4841-the unconscious father rested [his]4841-the unconscious father gray head on [his]4841-the unconscious father hand ; but it was understood between [them]4842-them , and [they]4842-them both knew it . This other fear was so awful , that it hovered about each of [them]4842-them like a ghostly shadow ; neither daring to think of its being near [herself]92-louisa , far less of its being near the other . And still the forced spirit which [the whelp]1387-the whelp had plucked up , throve with [him]144-stephen . If [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen was not [the thief]4750-the thief , let [him]144-stephen show [himself]144-stephen . Why did n’t [he]144-stephen ? Another night . Another day and night . No [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen . Where was [the man]516-the man , and why did [he]144-stephen not come back ? The Sunday was a bright Sunday in autumn , clear and cool , when early in the morning [Sissy]76-sissy and [Rachael]146-rachael met , to walk in [the country]336-the country . As [Coketown]4-coketown cast ashes not only on its own head but on [the neighbourhood]3329-the neighbourhood ’s too — after the manner of [those pious persons who do penance for [their]4848-those pious persons who do penance for their own sins by putting other people into sackcloth own sins by putting [other people into sackcloth]4849-other people into sackcloth]4848-those pious persons who do penance for their own sins by putting other people into sackcloth — it was customary for [those who now and then thirsted for a draught of pure air , which is not absolutely the most wicked among the vanities of life]4850-those who now and then thirsted for a draught of pure air , which is not absolutely the most wicked among the vanities of life , to get a few miles away by [the railroad]1105-the railroad , and then begin [their]4848-those pious persons who do penance for their own sins by putting other people into sackcloth walk , or [their]4848-those pious persons who do penance for their own sins by putting other people into sackcloth lounge in [the fields]4852-the fields . [Sissy]76-sissy and [Rachael]146-rachael helped [themselves]4848-those pious persons who do penance for their own sins by putting other people into sackcloth out of the smoke by the usual means , and were put down at [a station about midway between [the town]2838-the town and [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ’s retreat]4853-a station about midway between the town and mr. bounderby ’s retreat . Though [the green landscape]4855-the green landscape was blotted here and there with heaps of coal , [it]4855-the green landscape was green elsewhere , and there were trees to see , and there were larks singing ( though it was Sunday ) , and there were pleasant scents in the air , and all was over - arched by a bright blue sky . In the distance one way , [Coketown]4-coketown showed as a black mist ; in another distance [hills]4856-hills began to rise ; in a third , there was a faint change in the light of the horizon where it shone upon [the far - off sea]4857-the far - off sea . Under [their]2385-they feet , the grass was fresh ; beautiful shadows of branches flickered upon it , and speckled it ; hedgerows were luxuriant ; everything was at peace . Engines at [pits]4858-pits ’[0-i] mouths , and lean old horses that had worn the circle of [their]2384-their daily labour into the ground , were alike quiet ; wheels had ceased for a short space to turn ; and the great wheel of earth seemed to revolve without the shocks and noises of another time . [They]2385-they walked on across [the fields]4852-the fields and down [the shady lanes]2387-the shady lanes , sometimes getting over a fragment of a fence so rotten that it dropped at a touch of the foot , sometimes passing near a wreck of bricks and beams overgrown with grass , marking the site of [deserted works]2388-deserted works . [They]2385-they followed paths and tracks , however slight . [Mounds where the grass was rank and high]2389-mounds where the grass was rank and high , and where brambles , dock - weed , and [such - like vegetation]2390-such - like vegetation , were confusedly heaped together , [they]2385-they always avoided ; for dismal stories were told in [that country of [the old pits hidden beneath such indications]2392-the old pits hidden beneath such indications]2391-that country of the old pits hidden beneath such indications . The sun was high when [they]2385-they sat down to rest . [They]2385-they had seen [no one]3086-no one , near or distant , for a long time ; and the solitude remained unbroken . ‘ It is so still here , [Rachael]146-rachael , and the way is so untrodden , that [I]76-sissy think [we]2385-they must be [the first who have been [here]366-here all the summer]4859-the first who have been here all the summer . ’[76-sissy] As [Sissy]76-sissy said it , [her]76-sissy eyes were attracted by another of those rotten fragments of fence upon the ground . [She]76-sissy got up to look at [it]2394-it . ‘ And yet [I]76-sissy do n’t know . This has not been broken very long . The wood is quite fresh where it gave way . [Here]366-here are footsteps too . — O [Rachael]146-rachael ! ’[76-sissy] [She]76-sissy ran back , and caught [her]76-sissy round the neck . [Rachael]146-rachael had already started up . ‘ What is the matter ? ’[146-rachael] ‘ [I]2385-they do n’t know . There is a hat lying in the grass . ’[2385-they] [They]2385-they went forward together . [Rachael]146-rachael took it up , shaking from head to foot . [She]146-rachael broke into a passion of tears and lamentations : [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen was written in [his]144-stephen own hand on the inside . ‘ O [the poor lad]1649-the poor lad , [the poor lad]1649-the poor lad ! [He]1649-the poor lad has been made away with . [He]1649-the poor lad is lying murdered here ! ’[144-stephen] ‘ Is there — has the hat any blood upon it ? ’[76-sissy] [Sissy]76-sissy faltered . [They]2385-they were afraid to look ; but [they]2385-they did examine it , and found no mark of violence , inside or out . It had been lying there some days , for rain and dew had stained it , and the mark of its shape was on the grass where it had fallen . [They]2385-they looked fearfully about [them]2385-they , without moving , but could see nothing more . ‘ [Rachael]146-rachael , ’[76-sissy] [Sissy]76-sissy whispered , ‘ [I]76-sissy will go on a little by [myself]76-sissy . ’[76-sissy] [She]146-rachael had unclasped [her]146-rachael hand , and was in the act of stepping forward , when [Rachael]146-rachael caught [her]146-rachael in both arms with a scream that resounded over [the wide landscape]2395-the wide landscape . Before [them]2385-they , at [their]2385-they very feet , was the brink of [a black ragged chasm hidden by the thick grass]2396-a black ragged chasm hidden by the thick grass . [They]2385-they sprang back , and fell upon [their]2385-they knees , each hiding [her]146-rachael face upon [the other]287-the other ’s neck . ‘ O , [[my]146-rachael good Lord]4864-my good lord ! [He]4865-he ’s down there ! Down there ! ’[146-rachael] At first this , and [her]146-rachael terrific screams , were all that could be got from [Rachael]146-rachael , by any tears , by any prayers , by any representations , by any means . It was impossible to hush [her]146-rachael ; and it was deadly necessary to hold [her]146-rachael , or [she]146-rachael would have flung [herself]146-rachael down the shaft . ‘ [Rachael]146-rachael , dear [Rachael]146-rachael , good [Rachael]146-rachael , for the love of [Heaven]81-heaven , not these dreadful cries ! Think of [Stephen]144-stephen , think of [Stephen]144-stephen , think of [Stephen]144-stephen ! ’[146-rachael] By an earnest repetition of this entreaty , poured out in all the agony of such a moment , [Sissy]76-sissy at last brought [her]146-rachael to be silent , and to look at [her]146-rachael with a tearless face of stone . ‘ [Rachael]146-rachael , [Stephen]144-stephen may be living . [You]146-rachael would n’t leave [him]144-stephen lying maimed at the bottom of [this dreadful place]4866-this dreadful place , a moment , if [you]146-rachael could bring help to [him]144-stephen ? ’[76-sissy] ‘ No , no , no ! ’[2399-him] ‘ Do n’t stir from here , for [his]144-stephen sake ! Let [me]146-rachael go and listen . ’[146-rachael] [She]146-rachael shuddered to approach the pit ; but [she]146-rachael crept towards [it]2398-it on [her]146-rachael hands and knees , and called to [him]2399-him as loud as [she]146-rachael could call . [She]146-rachael listened , but no sound replied . [She]146-rachael called again and listened ; still no answering sound . [She]146-rachael did this , twenty , thirty times . [She]146-rachael took a little clod of earth from the broken ground where [he]2399-him had stumbled , and threw it in . [She]146-rachael could not hear it fall . [The wide prospect]2400-the wide prospect , so beautiful in [its]2400-the wide prospect stillness but a few minutes ago , almost carried despair to [her]146-rachael brave heart , as [she]146-rachael rose and looked all round [her]146-rachael , seeing no help . ‘ [Rachael]146-rachael , [we]4867-we must lose not a moment . [We]4867-we must go in different directions , seeking aid . [You]146-rachael shall go by the way [we]4867-we have come , and [I]146-rachael will go forward by the path . Tell [any one]495-any one [you]146-rachael see , and [every one]4105-every one what has happened . Think of [Stephen]144-stephen , think of [Stephen]144-stephen ! ’[146-rachael] [She]146-rachael knew by [Rachael]146-rachael ’s face that [she]146-rachael might trust [her]146-rachael now . And after standing for a moment to see [her]146-rachael running , wringing [her]146-rachael hands as [she]146-rachael ran , [she]146-rachael turned and went upon [her]146-rachael own search ; [she]146-rachael stopped at the hedge to tie [her]146-rachael shawl there as a guide to [the place]2849-the place , then threw [her]146-rachael bonnet aside , and ran as [she]146-rachael had never run before . Run , [Sissy]76-sissy , run , in [Heaven]81-heaven ’s name ! Do n’t stop for breath . Run , run ! Quickening [herself]146-rachael by carrying such entreaties in [her]146-rachael thoughts , [she]146-rachael ran from [field]2402-field to [field]2402-field , and [lane]2404-lane to [lane]2404-lane , and place to place , as [she]146-rachael had never run before ; until [she]146-rachael came to [a shed by [an engine - house]2407-an engine - house , where [two men]2408-two men lay in the shade , asleep on straw]2406-a shed by an engine - house , where two men lay in the shade , asleep on straw . First to wake [them]2408-two men , and next to tell [them]2408-two men , all so wild and breathless as [she]146-rachael was , what had brought [her]146-rachael there , were difficulties ; but [they]2408-two men no sooner understood [her]146-rachael than [their]2408-two men spirits were on fire like [hers]146-rachael . [One of [the men]3089-the men]2409-one of the men was in a drunken slumber , but on [[his]2409-one of the men comrade]2411-his comrade ’s shouting to [him]2409-one of the men that [a man]484-a man had fallen down [the Old Hell Shaft]56-the old hell shaft , [he]2409-one of the men started out to a pool of dirty water , put [his]2409-one of the men head in it , and came back sober . With [these two men]2413-these two men [she]146-rachael ran to another half - a - mile further , and with that one to another , while [they]2413-these two men ran elsewhere . Then a horse was found ; and [she]146-rachael got [another man to ride for life or death]2414-another man to ride for life or death to [the railroad]1105-the railroad , and send a message to [Louisa]92-louisa , which [she]146-rachael wrote and gave [him]2414-another man to ride for life or death . By this time [a whole village]2416-a whole village was up : and windlasses , ropes , poles , candles , lanterns , all things necessary , were fast collecting and being brought into one place , to be carried to [the Old Hell Shaft]2417-the old hell shaft . It seemed now hours and hours since [she]146-rachael had left [the lost man]2418-the lost man lying in the grave where [he]2418-the lost man had been buried alive . [She]146-rachael could not bear to remain away from it any longer — it was like deserting [him]2418-the lost man — and [she]146-rachael hurried swiftly back , accompanied by [half - a - dozen labourers]2419-half - a - dozen labourers , including [the drunken man whom the news had sobered]2420-the drunken man whom the news had sobered , and who was [the best man of all]2421-the best man of all . When [they]2413-these two men came to [the Old Hell Shaft]2417-the old hell shaft , [they]2413-these two men found [it]2417-the old hell shaft as lonely as [she]146-rachael had left [it]2417-the old hell shaft . [The men]3089-the men called and listened as [she]146-rachael had done , and examined the edge of the chasm , and settled how it had happened , and then sat down to wait until the implements [they]3089-the men wanted should come up . Every sound of insects in the air , every stirring of the leaves , every whisper among [these men]3861-these men , made [Sissy]76-sissy tremble , for [she]76-sissy thought it was a cry at the bottom of [the pit]2425-the pit . But the wind blew idly over it , and no sound arose to the surface , and [they]2413-these two men sat upon the grass , waiting and waiting . After [they]2413-these two men had waited some time , [straggling people who had heard of the accident]2426-straggling people who had heard of the accident began to come up ; then the real help of implements began to arrive . In the midst of this , [Rachael]146-rachael returned ; and with [[her]146-rachael party]2427-her party there was [a surgeon]2428-a surgeon , who brought some wine and medicines . But , the expectation among [the people]2827-the people that [the man]516-the man would be found alive was very slight indeed . There being now [people enough present to impede the work]2431-people enough present to impede the work , [the sobered man]2432-the sobered man put [himself]2432-the sobered man at the head of the rest , or was put there by the general consent , and made a large ring round [the Old Hell Shaft]56-the old hell shaft , and appointed [men to keep it]2433-men to keep it . [Besides such volunteers as were accepted to work]2434-besides such volunteers as were accepted to work , only [Sissy]76-sissy and [Rachael]146-rachael were at first permitted within this ring ; but , later in the day , when the message brought an express from [Coketown]4-coketown , [Mr. Gradgrind and Louisa]216-louisa , and [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , and [the whelp]1387-the whelp , were also [there]425-there . The sun was four hours lower than when [Sissy]76-sissy and [Rachael]146-rachael had first sat down upon the grass , before a means of enabling [two men]2408-two men to descend securely was rigged with poles and ropes . Difficulties had arisen in the construction of this machine , simple as it was ; requisites had been found wanting , and messages had had to go and return . It was five o’clock in the afternoon of the bright autumnal Sunday , before a candle was sent down to try the air , while [three or four rough faces]2438-three or four rough faces stood crowded close together , attentively watching it : [the man at the windlass]2439-the man at the windlass lowering as [they]2439-the man at the windlass were told . The candle was brought up again , feebly burning , and then some water was cast in . Then the bucket was hooked on ; and [the sobered man]2432-the sobered man and [another]2441-another got in with lights , giving the word ‘ Lower away ! ’[2441-another] As the rope went out , tight and strained , and the windlass creaked , there was not a breath among [the one or two hundred men]2442-the one or two hundred men and [women looking on]2443-women looking on , that came as it was wo nt to come . The signal was given and the windlass stopped , with abundant rope to spare . Apparently so long an interval ensued with [the men at the windlass]2444-the men at the windlass standing idle , that [some women]2445-some women shrieked that another accident had happened ! But [the surgeon who held the watch]2446-the surgeon who held the watch , declared five minutes not to have elapsed yet , and sternly admonished [them]2444-the men at the windlass to keep silence . [He]2446-the surgeon who held the watch had not well done speaking , when the windlass was reversed and worked again . [Practised eyes]217-practised eyes knew that it did not go as heavily as it would if [both workmen]2447-both workmen had been coming up , and that [only one]2448-only one was returning . The rope came in tight and strained ; and ring after ring was coiled upon the barrel of the windlass , and all eyes were fastened on the pit . [The sobered man]2432-the sobered man was brought up and leaped out briskly on the grass . There was an universal cry of ‘ Alive or dead ? ’[2446-the surgeon who held the watch] and then a deep , profound hush . When [he]2446-the surgeon who held the watch said ‘ Alive ! ’[2446-the surgeon who held the watch] a great shout arose and many eyes had tears in them . ‘ But [he]2432-the sobered man ’s hurt very bad , ’[2446-the surgeon who held the watch] [he]2446-the surgeon who held the watch added , as soon as [he]2446-the surgeon who held the watch could make [himself]2446-the surgeon who held the watch heard again . ‘ Where ’s [doctor]4870-doctor ? [He]2432-the sobered man ’s hurt so very bad , [sir]2771-sir , that [we]2444-the men at the windlass donno how to get [him]2432-the sobered man up . ’[2446-the surgeon who held the watch] [They]2444-the men at the windlass all consulted together , and looked anxiously at [the surgeon]2450-the surgeon , as [he]2446-the surgeon who held the watch asked some questions , and shook [his]2446-the surgeon who held the watch head on receiving the replies . The sun was setting now ; and the red light in the evening sky touched every face there , and caused it to be distinctly seen in all its rapt suspense . The consultation ended in [the men]3089-the men returning to the windlass , and [the pitman]2452-the pitman going down again , carrying the wine and some other small matters with [him]2452-the pitman . Then [the other man]2453-the other man came up . In the meantime , under [the surgeon]2450-the surgeon ’s directions , [some men]2455-some men brought a hurdle , on which [others]3223-others made a thick bed of spare clothes covered with loose straw , while [he]2446-the surgeon who held the watch [himself]2446-the surgeon who held the watch contrived some bandages and slings from shawls and handkerchiefs . As these were made , they were hung upon an arm of [the pitman who had last come up , with instructions how to use them]2457-the pitman who had last come up , with instructions how to use them : and as [he]2452-the pitman stood , shown by the light [he]2452-the pitman carried , leaning [his]2452-the pitman powerful loose hand upon one of the poles , and sometimes glancing down [the pit]2425-the pit , and sometimes glancing round upon [the people]2827-the people , [he]2452-the pitman was not the least conspicuous figure in the scene . It was dark now , and torches were kindled . It appeared from the little [this man]2994-this man said to those about [him]2452-the pitman , which was quickly repeated all over the circle , that [the lost man]2418-the lost man had fallen upon a mass of crumbled rubbish with which [the pit]2425-the pit was half choked up , and that [his]2452-the pitman fall had been further broken by some jagged earth at the side . [He]2452-the pitman lay upon [his]2452-the pitman back with one arm doubled under [him]2452-the pitman , and according to [his]2452-the pitman own belief had hardly stirred since [he]2452-the pitman fell , except that [he]2452-the pitman had moved [his]2452-the pitman free hand to a side pocket , in which [he]2452-the pitman remembered to have some bread and meat ( of which [he]2452-the pitman had swallowed crumbs ) , and had likewise scooped up a little water in it now and then . [He]2452-the pitman had come straight away from [his]2452-the pitman work , on being written to , and had walked the whole journey ; and was on [his]2452-the pitman way to [[Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ’s country house]2463-mr. bounderby ’s country house after dark , when [he]2452-the pitman fell . [He]2452-the pitman was crossing [that dangerous country]2464-that dangerous country at such a dangerous time , because [he]2452-the pitman was innocent of what was laid to [his]2452-the pitman charge , and could n’t rest from coming the nearest way to deliver [himself]2452-the pitman up . [The Old Hell Shaft]2417-the old hell shaft , [the pitman]2452-the pitman said , with a curse upon it , was worthy of its bad name to the last ; for though [Stephen]144-stephen could speak now , [he]144-stephen believed it would soon be found to have mangled the life out of [him]144-stephen . When all was ready , [this man]2994-this man , still taking [his]2452-the pitman last hurried charges from [[his]2452-the pitman comrades]2468-his comrades and [the surgeon after the windlass]2469-the surgeon after the windlass had begun to lower [him]2452-the pitman , disappeared into [the pit]2425-the pit . The rope went out as before , the signal was made as before , and the windlass stopped . [No man]1479-no man removed [his]1479-no man hand from it now . [Every one]4105-every one waited with [his]4105-every one grasp set , and [his]4105-every one body bent down to the work , ready to reverse and wind in . At length the signal was given , and all the ring leaned forward . For , now , the rope came in , tightened and strained to its utmost as it appeared , and [the men]3089-the men turned heavily , and the windlass complained . It was scarcely endurable to look at the rope , and think of its giving way . But , ring after ring was coiled upon the barrel of the windlass safely , and the connecting chains appeared , and finally the bucket with [the two men holding on at the sides]2474-the two men holding on at the sides — a sight to make the head swim , and oppress the heart — and tenderly supporting between [them]2474-the two men holding on at the sides , slung and tied within , the figure of [a poor , crushed , human creature]2475-a poor , crushed , human creature . A low murmur of pity went round [the throng]2476-the throng , and [the women]3090-the women wept aloud , as this form , almost without form , was moved very slowly from its iron deliverance , and laid upon the bed of straw . At first , [none but [the surgeon]2450-the surgeon]2478-none but the surgeon went close to it . [He]2450-the surgeon did what [he]2450-the surgeon could in its adjustment on the couch , but the best that [he]2450-the surgeon could do was to cover it . That gently done , [he]2450-the surgeon called to [him]2450-the surgeon [Rachael]146-rachael and [Sissy]76-sissy . And at that time [the pale , worn , patient face]2480-the pale , worn , patient face was seen looking up at the sky , with the broken right hand lying bare on the outside of the covering garments , as if waiting to be taken by another hand . [They]2474-the two men holding on at the sides gave [him]2450-the surgeon drink , moistened [his]2450-the surgeon face with water , and administered some drops of cordial and wine . Though [he]2450-the surgeon lay quite motionless looking up at the sky , [he]2450-the surgeon smiled and said , ‘ [Rachael]146-rachael . ’[2450-the surgeon] [She]3090-the women stooped down on the grass at [his]2450-the surgeon side , and bent over [him]2450-the surgeon until [her]3090-the women eyes were between [his]2450-the surgeon and the sky , for [he]2450-the surgeon could not so much as turn them to look at [her]3090-the women . ‘ [Rachael]146-rachael , [[my]3090-the women dear]601-my dear . ’[3090-the women] [She]3090-the women took [his]2450-the surgeon hand . [He]2450-the surgeon smiled again and said , ‘ Do n’t let ’[2450-the surgeon] t go . ’ ‘[2450-the surgeon] [Thou’rt]2481-thou’rt in great pain , [[my]0-i own dear]2482-my own dear [Stephen]144-stephen ? ’ ‘[144-stephen] [I]0-i ha ’ been , but not now . [I]144-stephen ha ’[144-stephen] been — dreadful , and dree , and long , [[my]0-i dear]601-my dear — but ’ tis ower now . Ah , [Rachael]146-rachael , aw a muddle ! Fro ’[144-stephen] first to last , a muddle ! ’ The spectre of [his]0-i old look seemed to pass as [he]0-i said the word . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ha ’ fell into [th ’[0-i] pit]4873-th ’ pit , [[my]0-i dear]601-my dear , as have cost [wi’in]2485-wi’in the knowledge o ’ old fok now livin , [hundreds and hundreds o ’[0-i] men]4874-hundreds and hundreds o ’ men ’s lives — [fathers]2486-fathers , [sons]2487-sons , [brothers]1436-brothers , dear to [thousands an ’ thousands]4875-thousands an ’ thousands , an ’[4875-thousands an ’ thousands] keeping ’em fro ’[4875-thousands an ’ thousands] want and hunger . [I]0-i ha ’ fell into [a pit that ha ’[4875-thousands an ’ thousands] been wi ’ th ’[4875-thousands an ’ thousands] Firedamp crueller than battle]4876-a pit that ha ’ been wi ’ th ’ firedamp crueller than battle . [I]0-i ha ’ read on ’[0-i] t in the public petition , as onny one may read , fro ’ [the men that works in [pits]4858-pits]4877-the men that works in pits , in which [they]2489-the lawmakers ha ’[0-i] pray’n and pray’n [the lawmakers]2489-the lawmakers for Christ ’s sake not to let [their]2489-the lawmakers work be murder to [’em]4879-’em , but to spare ’em[0-i] for [th ’ wives]4880-th ’ wives and children that [they]2489-the lawmakers loves as well as [gentlefok]4881-gentlefok loves [theirs]2489-the lawmakers . When it were in work , it killed wi’out need ; when ’[0-i] tis let alone , it kills wi’out need . See how [we]2490-we die an ’ no need , one way an ’[0-i] another — in a muddle — every day ! ’ [He]0-i faintly said it , without any anger against [any one]495-any one . Merely as the truth . ‘[0-i] [[Thy]0-i little sister]3494-thy little sister , [Rachael]146-rachael , [thou]0-i hast not forgot [her]3494-thy little sister . [Thou’rt]0-i not like to forget [her]3494-thy little sister now , and [me]0-i so nigh [her]3494-thy little sister .
