A muddle ! Aw a muddle ! ’[216-louisa] [Louisa]216-louisa approached [him]0-i ; but [he]0-i could not see [her]3494-thy little sister , lying with [his]0-i face turned up to the night sky . ‘ If aw th ’[0-i] things that tooches [us]2493-us , [[my]0-i dear]601-my dear , was not so muddled , [I]0-i should’n [ha]2495-ha ’ had’n need to coom heer . If [we]2493-us was not in a muddle among [ourseln]4885-ourseln , [I]0-i should’n [ha]2495-ha ’[4886-workin ’ brothers] been , by [[my]0-i own fellow weavers]2496-my own fellow weavers and [workin ’ brothers]4886-workin ’ brothers , so mistook . If [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby had ever know’d [me]146-rachael right — if [he]93-mr. bounderby ’d ever know’d [me]146-rachael at aw — [he]93-mr. bounderby would’n [ha]2495-ha ’[146-rachael] took’n offence wi ’ [me]146-rachael . [He]93-mr. bounderby would’n [ha]2495-ha ’[146-rachael] suspect’n [me]0-i . But look up [yonder]2497-yonder , [Rachael]146-rachael ! Look aboove ! ’ Following [his]0-i eyes , [she]146-rachael saw that [he]0-i was gazing at a star .[146-rachael]

‘ It ha ’[146-rachael] shined upon [me]0-i , ’ [he]0-i said reverently , ‘[146-rachael] in [my]0-i pain and trouble down below . It ha ’ shined into [my]146-rachael mind . [I]146-rachael ha ’[146-rachael] look’n at ’ t and thowt o ’[146-rachael] [thee]2498-thee , [Rachael]146-rachael , till the muddle in [my]0-i mind have cleared awa , above a bit , [I]0-i hope . If soom ha ’ been wantin ’[2499-ha] in unnerstan’in [me]0-i better , [I]0-i , too , [ha]2499-ha ’ been wantin ’[2499-ha] in unnerstan’in [them]2500-them better . When [I]0-i got [thy]2498-thee letter , [I]0-i easily believen that what [the yoong ledy sen]2501-the yoong ledy sen and done to [me]0-i , and what [[her]2501-the yoong ledy sen brother]2932-her brother sen and done to [me]0-i , was one , and that there were a wicked plot betwixt ’em . When [I]2501-the yoong ledy sen fell , [I]2501-the yoong ledy sen were in anger wi ’[2501-the yoong ledy sen] [her]2501-the yoong ledy sen , an ’ hurryin on t ’[0-i] be as onjust t ’ [her]2501-the yoong ledy sen as oothers was t ’[0-i] [me]0-i . But in [our]2503-our judgments , like as in [our]2503-our doins , [we]2503-our mun bear and forbear . In [my]0-i pain an ’ trouble , lookin up yonder , — wi ’[0-i] it shinin on [me]0-i — [I]0-i ha ’ seen more clear , and [ha]4887-ha ’[0-i] made it [my]0-i dyin prayer that aw th ’ world may on’y coom toogether more , an ’[0-i] get [a better unnerstan’in o ’ one another]4888-a better unnerstan’in o ’ one another , than when [I]0-i were in ’[0-i] t [[my]0-i own weak seln]2504-my own weak seln . ’ [Louisa]216-louisa hearing what [he]0-i said , bent over [him]0-i on the opposite side to [Rachael]146-rachael , so that [he]0-i could see [her]146-rachael . ‘[2505-you] [You]2505-you ha ’ heard ? ’[0-i] [he]0-i said , after a few moments ’ silence . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ha ’ not forgot [you]216-louisa , [ledy]4889-ledy . ’[0-i] ‘ Yes , [Stephen]144-stephen , [I]2506-a father have heard [you]144-stephen . And [your]144-stephen prayer is [mine]2506-a father . ’[2506-a father] ‘ [You]144-stephen ha ’[0-i] [a father]2506-a father . Will [yo]2505-you tak ’ a message to [him]0-i ? ’[0-i] ‘ [He]0-i is here , ’[216-louisa] said [Louisa]216-louisa , with dread . ‘ Shall [I]0-i bring [him]0-i to [you]2855-her father ? ’[0-i] ‘ If [yo]2855-her father please . ’[216-louisa] [Louisa]216-louisa returned with [[her]2507-her father]2855-her father . Standing hand - in - hand , [they]2509-they both looked down upon the solemn countenance . ‘ [Sir]2771-sir , [yo]2855-her father will clear [me]0-i an ’[0-i] mak [my]0-i name good wi ’ [aw men]4891-aw men . This [I]0-i leave to [yo]2855-her father . ’[0-i] [Mr. Gradgrind]216-louisa was troubled and asked how ? ‘ [Sir]2771-sir , ’[0-i] was the reply : ‘ [[yor]2855-her father son]4893-yor son will tell [yo]2855-her father how . Ask [him]4893-yor son . [I]0-i mak no charges : [I]0-i leave none ahint [me]0-i : not a single word . [I]0-i ha ’[0-i] seen an ’ spok’n wi ’[4893-yor son] [yor son]4893-yor son , one night . [I]0-i ask no more o ’ [yo]2855-her father than that [yo]2855-her father clear [me]0-i — an ’[0-i] [I]0-i trust to [yo]4893-yor son to do ’ t. ’[2511-the bearers] [The bearers]2511-the bearers being now ready to carry [him]4893-yor son away , and [the surgeon]2450-the surgeon being anxious for [his]4893-yor son removal , [those who had torches or lanterns , prepared to go in front of the litter]2513-those who had torches or lanterns , prepared to go in front of the litter . Before it was raised , and while [they]2514-they were arranging how to go , [he]4893-yor son said to [Rachael]146-rachael , looking upward at the star : ‘ Often as [I]4893-yor son coom to [myseln]4894-myseln , and found it shinin ’[4893-yor son] on [me]0-i down there in [my]0-i trouble , [I]0-i thowt it were the star as guided to [[[Our]2515-our Saviour]2516-our saviour ’s home]2517-our saviour ’s home . [I]0-i awmust think it be the very star ! ’ [They]2514-they lifted [him]4893-yor son up , and [he]4893-yor son was overjoyed to find that [they]2514-they were about to take [him]4893-yor son in the direction whither the star seemed to [him]4893-yor son to lead . ‘[146-rachael] [Rachael]146-rachael , [beloved lass]2518-beloved lass ! Do n’t let go [my]0-i hand . [We]2519-we may walk toogether t’night , [[my]0-i dear]601-my dear ! ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i will hold [thy]601-my dear hand , and keep beside [thee]601-my dear , [Stephen]144-stephen , all the way . ’ ‘[0-i] Bless [thee]601-my dear ! Will soombody be pleased to coover [my]0-i face ! ’ [They]2514-they carried [him]4893-yor son very gently along [the fields]4852-the fields , and down [the lanes]4429-the lanes , and over [the wide landscape]2395-the wide landscape ; [Rachael]146-rachael always holding the hand in [hers]146-rachael . Very few whispers broke the mournful silence . It was soon a funeral procession . The star had shown [him]4893-yor son where to find [the God of [the poor]1593-the poor]4898-the god of the poor ; and through humility , and sorrow , and forgiveness , [he]4893-yor son had gone to [[[his]4893-yor son Redeemer]4900-his redeemer ’s rest]4901-his redeemer ’s rest . Before the ring formed round [the Old Hell Shaft]56-the old hell shaft was broken , [one figure]4902-one figure had disappeared from within it . [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby and [his]93-mr. bounderby shadow had not stood near [Louisa]216-louisa , who held [[her]4903-her father]2855-her father ’s arm , but in a retired place by [themselves]4905-themselves . When [Mr. Gradgrind]216-louisa was summoned to [the couch]4906-the couch , [Sissy]76-sissy , attentive to all that happened , slipped behind that wicked shadow — a sight in the horror of [his]93-mr. bounderby face , if there had been eyes there for any sight but one — and whispered in [his]93-mr. bounderby ear . Without turning [his]93-mr. bounderby head , [he]93-mr. bounderby conferred with [her]76-sissy a few moments , and vanished . Thus [the whelp]1387-the whelp had gone out of the circle before [the people]2827-the people moved . When [the father]438-the father reached [home]2856-home , [he]438-the father sent a message to [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ’s , desiring [[his]93-mr. bounderby son]1496-his son to come to [him]93-mr. bounderby directly . The reply was , that [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby having missed [him]2522-him in [the crowd]1976-the crowd , and seeing nothing of [him]2522-him since , had supposed [him]2522-him to be at [Stone Lodge]3-stone lodge . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i believe , [father]2781-father , ’ said [Louisa]216-louisa , ‘[2781-father] [he]2522-him will not come back to [town]439-town to - night . ’ [Mr. Gradgrind]216-louisa turned away , and said no more . In the morning , [he]216-louisa went down to [the Bank]3524-the bank [himself]216-louisa as soon as it was opened , and seeing [[his]93-mr. bounderby son]1496-his son ’s place empty ( [he]216-louisa had not the courage to look in at first ) went back along [the street]461-the street to meet [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby on [his]93-mr. bounderby way [there]425-there . To whom [he]216-louisa said that , for reasons [he]216-louisa would soon explain , but entreated not then to be asked for , [he]216-louisa had found it necessary to employ [[his]93-mr. bounderby son]1496-his son at a distance for a little while . Also , that [he]216-louisa was charged with the duty of vindicating [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen ’s memory , and declaring [the thief]4750-the thief . [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby quite confounded , stood stock - still in [the street]461-the street after [[his]93-mr. bounderby father - in - law]2163-his father - in - law had left [him]93-mr. bounderby , swelling like an immense soap - bubble , without its beauty . [Mr. Gradgrind]216-louisa went [home]2856-home , locked [himself]216-louisa in [[his]216-louisa room]945-his room , and kept it all that day . When [Sissy]76-sissy and [Louisa]216-louisa tapped at [his]216-louisa door , [he]216-louisa said , without opening it , ‘[2522-him] Not now , [[my]0-i dears]2524-my dears ; in the evening . ’ On [their]2524-my dears return in the evening , [he]216-louisa said , ‘[2522-him] [I]0-i am not able yet — to - morrow . ’ [He]216-louisa ate nothing all day , and had no candle after dark ; and [they]2524-my dears heard [him]216-louisa walking to and fro late at night . But , in the morning [he]216-louisa appeared at breakfast at the usual hour , and took [his]216-louisa usual place at the table . Aged and bent [he]216-louisa looked , and quite bowed down ; and yet [he]216-louisa looked [a wiser man]4923-a wiser man , and [a better man]4924-a better man , than in the days when in this life [he]216-louisa wanted nothing — but Facts . Before [he]216-louisa left [the room]2901-the room , [he]216-louisa appointed a time for [them]2524-my dears to come to [him]216-louisa ; and so , with [his]216-louisa gray head drooping , went away . ‘[2522-him] [Dear father]2525-dear father , ’ said [Louisa]216-louisa , when [they]2524-my dears kept [their]2524-my dears appointment , ‘[2522-him] [you]2525-dear father have [three young children]2526-three young children left . [They]2526-three young children will be different , [I]0-i will be different yet , with [Heaven]81-heaven ’s help . ’ [She]4926-she gave [her]4926-she hand to [Sissy]76-sissy , as if [she]4926-she meant with [her]4926-she help too . ‘[0-i] [[Your]0-i wretched brother]2527-your wretched brother , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]216-louisa . ‘[0-i] Do [you]0-i think [he]2527-your wretched brother had planned this robbery , when [he]2527-your wretched brother went with [you]0-i to [the lodging]2528-the lodging ? ’ ‘[2527-your wretched brother] [I]0-i fear so , [father]2781-father . [I]0-i know [he]2527-your wretched brother had wanted money very much , and had spent a great deal . ’ ‘[2527-your wretched brother] [The poor man]3972-the poor man being about to leave [the town]2838-the town , it came into [his]2527-your wretched brother evil brain to cast suspicion on [him]2527-your wretched brother ? ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i think it must have flashed upon [him]2527-your wretched brother while [he]2527-your wretched brother sat there , [father]2781-father . For [I]0-i asked [him]2527-your wretched brother to go [there]425-there with [me]0-i . The visit did not originate with [him]2527-your wretched brother . ’ ‘[2527-your wretched brother] [He]2527-your wretched brother had some conversation with [the poor man]3972-the poor man . Did [he]2527-your wretched brother take [him]2527-your wretched brother aside ? ’ ‘[2527-your wretched brother] [He]2527-your wretched brother took [him]2527-your wretched brother out of [the room]2901-the room . [I]0-i asked [him]2527-your wretched brother afterwards , why [he]2527-your wretched brother had done so , and [he]2527-your wretched brother made a plausible excuse ; but since last night , [father]2781-father , and when [I]0-i remember the circumstances by its light , [I]0-i am afraid [I]0-i can imagine too truly what passed between [them]2537-them . ’ ‘[0-i] Let [me]0-i know , ’ said [[her]4927-her father]2855-her father , ‘[0-i] if [your]0-i thoughts present [[your]0-i guilty brother]2538-your guilty brother in the same dark view as [mine]0-i . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i fear , [father]2781-father , ’ hesitated [Louisa]216-louisa , ‘[2527-your wretched brother] that [he]2527-your wretched brother must have made some representation to [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen — perhaps in [my]0-i name , perhaps in [his]2527-your wretched brother own — which induced [him]2527-your wretched brother to do in good faith and honesty , what [he]2527-your wretched brother had never done before , and to wait about the Bank those two or three nights before [he]2527-your wretched brother left [the town]2838-the town . ’ ‘[2527-your wretched brother] Too plain ! ’ returned [the father]438-the father . ‘[2527-your wretched brother] Too plain ! ’ [He]438-the father shaded [his]438-the father face , and remained silent for some moments . Recovering [himself]438-the father , [he]438-the father said : ‘[2527-your wretched brother] And now , how is [he]2527-your wretched brother to be found ? How is [he]2527-your wretched brother to be saved from justice ? In the few hours that [I]0-i can possibly allow to elapse before [I]0-i publish the truth , how is [he]2527-your wretched brother to be found by [us]2541-us , and only by [us]2541-us ? Ten thousand pounds could not effect it . ’ ‘[76-sissy] [Sissy]76-sissy has effected it , [father]2781-father . ’ [He]438-the father raised [his]438-the father eyes to where [she]76-sissy stood , like [a good fairy in [[his]438-the father house]1503-his house]4930-a good fairy in his house , and said in a tone of softened gratitude and grateful kindness , ‘[76-sissy] It is always [you]76-sissy , [[my]0-i child]1020-my child ! ’ ‘[76-sissy] [We]2541-us had [our]2541-us fears , ’ [Sissy]76-sissy explained , glancing at [Louisa]216-louisa , ‘[2541-us] before yesterday ; and when [I]0-i saw [you]76-sissy brought to the side of the litter last night , and heard what passed ( being close to [Rachael]146-rachael all the time ) , [I]0-i went to [him]2781-father when [no one]3086-no one saw , and said to [him]2781-father , “ Do n’t look at [me]0-i . See where [[your]76-sissy father]2783-your father is . Escape at once , for [his]2783-your father sake and [your]76-sissy own ! ” [He]2781-father was in a tremble before [I]0-i whispered to [him]2781-father , and [he]2781-father started and trembled more then , and said , “ Where can [I]0-i go ? [I]0-i have very little money , and [I]0-i do n’t know who will hide [me]0-i ! ” [I]0-i thought of [[father]2781-father ’s old circus]2547-father ’s old circus . [I]0-i have not forgotten where [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary goes at this time of year , and [I]0-i read of [him]88-mr. sleary in a paper only the other day . [I]0-i told [him]2781-father to hurry there , and tell [his]88-mr. sleary name , and ask [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary to hide [him]88-mr. sleary till [I]0-i came . “ [I]0-i ’ll get to [him]88-mr. sleary before the morning , ” [he]2781-father said . And [I]0-i saw [him]88-mr. sleary shrink away among [the people]2827-the people . ’ ‘[88-mr. sleary] Thank [Heaven]81-heaven ! ’ exclaimed [[his]88-mr. sleary father]3044-his father . ‘[81-heaven] [He]88-mr. sleary may be got abroad yet . ’ It was the more hopeful as [the town to which [Sissy]76-sissy had directed [him]88-mr. sleary]4933-the town to which sissy had directed him was within three hours ’[2781-father] journey of [Liverpool]57-liverpool , whence [he]88-mr. sleary could be swiftly dispatched to [any part of [the world]301-the world]2549-any part of the world . But , caution being necessary in communicating with [him]88-mr. sleary — for there was a greater danger every moment of [his]88-mr. sleary being suspected now , and [nobody]365-nobody could be sure at heart but that [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby [himself]93-mr. bounderby , in a bullying vein of public zeal , might play a Roman part — it was consented that [Sissy]76-sissy and [Louisa]216-louisa should repair to [the place in question]2552-the place in question , by a circuitous course , alone ; and that [the unhappy father]2553-the unhappy father , setting forth in an opposite direction , should get round to the same bourne by another and wider route . It was further agreed that [he]88-mr. sleary should not present [himself]88-mr. sleary to [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary , lest [his]88-mr. sleary intentions should be mistrusted , or the intelligence of [his]88-mr. sleary arrival should cause [[his]88-mr. sleary son]1496-his son to take flight anew ; but , that the communication should be left to [Sissy]76-sissy and [Louisa]216-louisa to open ; and that [they]2555-they should inform the cause of so much misery and disgrace , of [[his]1496-his son father]3044-his father ’s being at hand and of the purpose for which [they]2555-they had come . When these arrangements had been well considered and were fully understood by [all three]2557-all three , it was time to begin to carry [them]2555-they into execution . Early in the afternoon , [Mr. Gradgrind]216-louisa walked direct from [[his]216-louisa own house]3607-his own house into [the country]336-the country , to be taken up on the line by which [he]216-louisa was to travel ; and at night [the remaining two]2560-the remaining two set forth upon [their]2560-the remaining two different course , encouraged by not seeing any face [they]2560-the remaining two knew . [The two]758-the two travelled all night , except when [they]758-the two were left , for odd numbers of minutes , at [branch - places]2562-branch - places , up illimitable flights of steps , or down [wells]2563-wells — which was the only variety of those branches — and , early in the morning , were turned out on [a swamp]2564-a swamp , a mile or two from [the town]2838-the town [they]758-the two sought . From [this dismal spot]2566-this dismal spot [they]758-the two were rescued by [a savage old postilion , who happened to be up early , kicking a horse in a fly]2567-a savage old postilion , who happened to be up early , kicking a horse in a fly : and so were smuggled into [the town]2838-the town by all [the back lanes where the pigs lived]2569-the back lanes where the pigs lived : which , although not a magnificent or even savoury approach , was , as is usual in such cases , [the legitimate highway]2570-the legitimate highway . The first thing [they]758-the two saw on entering [the town]2838-the town was the skeleton of [[Sleary]88-mr. sleary ’s Circus]2572-sleary ’s circus . [The company]3107-the company had departed for [another town]2574-another town more than twenty miles off , and had opened [there]425-there last night . The connection between [the two places]2576-the two places was by [a hilly turnpike - road]2577-a hilly turnpike - road , and the travelling on [that road]2578-that road was very slow . Though [they]758-the two took but a hasty breakfast , and no rest ( which it would have been in vain to seek under such anxious circumstances ) , it was noon before [they]758-the two began to find the bills of [Sleary]88-mr. sleary ’s Horse - riding on [barns]2579-barns and walls , and one o’clock when [they]758-the two stopped in [the market - place]2580-the market - place . A Grand Morning Performance by [the Riders]2581-the riders , commencing at that very hour , was in course of announcement by [the bellman]2582-the bellman as [they]758-the two set [their]758-the two feet upon the stones of [the street]461-the street . [Sissy]76-sissy recommended that , to avoid making inquiries and attracting attention in [the town]2838-the town , [they]758-the two should present [themselves]758-the two to pay at the door . If [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary were taking the money , [he]88-mr. sleary would be sure to know [her]2585-her , and would proceed with discretion . If [he]88-mr. sleary were not , [he]88-mr. sleary would be sure to see [them]758-the two inside ; and , knowing what [he]88-mr. sleary had done with [the fugitive]2586-the fugitive , would proceed with discretion still . Therefore , [they]758-the two repaired , with fluttering hearts , to the well - remembered booth . The flag with the inscription [Sleary]88-mr. sleary ’s Horse - riding was [there]425-there ; and [the Gothic niche]2588-the gothic niche was there ; but [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary was not [there]425-there . [Master Kidderminster]111-master kidderminster , grown too maturely turfy to be received by the wildest credulity as [Cupid]110-cupid any more , had yielded to the invincible force of circumstances ( and [his]111-master kidderminster beard ) , and , in the capacity of [a man who made [himself]111-master kidderminster generally useful]2590-a man who made himself generally useful , presided on this occasion over the exchequer — having also a drum in reserve , on which to expend [his]111-master kidderminster leisure moments and superfluous forces . In the extreme sharpness of [his]111-master kidderminster look out for base coin , [Mr. Kidderminster]111-master kidderminster , as at present situated , never saw anything but money ; so [Sissy]76-sissy passed [him]111-master kidderminster unrecognised , and [they]758-the two went in . [The Emperor of [Japan]58-japan]2591-the emperor of japan , on a steady old white horse stencilled with black spots , was twirling five wash - hand basins at once , as it is the favourite recreation of [that monarch]2592-that monarch to do . [Sissy]76-sissy , though well acquainted with [his]88-mr. sleary Royal line , had no personal knowledge of [the present Emperor]2593-the present emperor , and [his]2591-the emperor of japan reign was peaceful . [Miss Josephine Sleary]89-josephine , in [her]89-josephine celebrated graceful Equestrian Tyrolean Flower Act , was then announced by [a new clown]2594-a new clown ( who humorously said Cauliflower Act ) , and [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary appeared , leading [her]89-josephine in . [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary had only made one cut at [the Clown]2595-the clown with [his]88-mr. sleary long whip - lash , and [the Clown]2595-the clown had only said , ‘ If [you]76-sissy do it again , [I]2595-the clown ’ll throw the horse at [you]76-sissy ! ’[2595-the clown] when [Sissy]76-sissy was recognised both by [father]2781-father and [daughter]2598-daughter . But [they]2599-they got through the Act with great self - possession ; and [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary , saving for the first instant , conveyed no more expression into [his]88-mr. sleary locomotive eye than into [his]88-mr. sleary fixed one . The performance seemed a little long to [Sissy]76-sissy and [Louisa]216-louisa , particularly when it stopped to afford [the Clown]2595-the clown an opportunity of telling [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary ( who said ‘ Indeed , [sir]2771-sir ! ’[88-mr. sleary] to all [his]88-mr. sleary observations in the calmest way , and with [his]88-mr. sleary eye on [the house]2918-the house ) about two legs sitting on three legs looking at one leg , when in came four legs , and laid hold of one leg , and up got two legs , caught hold of three legs , and threw [’em]4935-’em at four legs , who ran away with one leg . For , although an ingenious Allegory relating to [a butcher]4936-a butcher , a three - legged stool , a dog , and a leg of mutton , this narrative consumed time ; and [they]2599-they were in great suspense . At last , however , [little fair - haired Josephine]89-josephine made [her]89-josephine curtsey amid great applause ; and [the Clown , left alone in the ring]4937-the clown , left alone in the ring , had just warmed [himself]2595-the clown , and said , ‘[0-i] Now [I]0-i ’ll have a turn ! ’ when [Sissy]76-sissy was touched on the shoulder , and beckoned out . [She]76-sissy took [Louisa]216-louisa with [her]76-sissy ; and [they]2599-they were received by [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary in [a very little private apartment]4938-a very little private apartment , with canvas sides , a grass floor , and a wooden ceiling all aslant , on which [the box company]4939-the box company stamped [their]4939-the box company approbation , as if [they]4939-the box company were coming through . ‘[0-i] Thethilia , ’ said [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary , who had brandy and water at hand , ‘[0-i] it doth [me]0-i good to [thee]2602-you [you]2602-you . [You]2602-you wath alwayth a favourite with [uth]2603-uth , and [you]2602-you ’ve done uth credith thinth the old timeth [I]0-i ’m thure . [You]2602-you mutht [thee]2602-you [[our]4940-our people]3021-our people , [[my]0-i dear]601-my dear , afore [we]4940-our thpeak of [bithnith]59-bithnith , or [they]3021-our people ’ll break [their]3021-our people hearth — ethpethially [the women]3090-the women . [Here’th Jothphine]218-here’th jothphine hath been and got married to [E. W. B. Childerth]219-childerth , and [thee]2602-you hath got [a boy]728-a boy , and though [he’th]728-a boy only three yearth old , [he]728-a boy thtickth on to any pony [you]2602-you can bring againtht [him]728-a boy . [He’th]728-a boy named The Little Wonder of Thcolathtic Equitation ; and if [you]2602-you do n’t hear of [that boy]648-that boy at [Athley’th]60-athley’th , [you]2602-you ’ll hear of [him]728-a boy at [Parith]61-parith . And [you]2602-you recollect [Kidderminthter]4946-kidderminthter , that wath thought to be rather thweet upon [yourthelf]4947-yourthelf ? Well . [He’th]728-a boy married too . Married [a widder]1617-a widder . Old enough to be hith [mother]3218-mother . [Thee]2605-you wath Tightrope , [thee]2605-you wath , and now [thee’th]2605-you nothing — on accounth of fat . [They]2607-our children ’ve got [two children]4950-two children , tho [we]2606-we ’re[0-i] thtrong in the Fairy bithnith and [the Nurthery dodge]2604-the nurthery dodge . If [you]2605-you wath to [thee]2605-you [[our]2606-we Children]2607-our children in [the Wood]1712-the wood , with [[their]2607-our children father]2831-their father and [mother]3218-mother both a dyin ’ on a horthe — [[their]2607-our children uncle]4951-their uncle a retheiving of [’em]4952-’em[2605-you] ath hith wardth , upon a horthe — themthelvth both a goin’ a black - berryin ’ on a horthe — and [the Robinth]220-the robinth a coming in to cover ’em[2605-you] with leavth , upon a horthe — [you]2605-you ’d thay it wath the completetht thing ath ever [you]2605-you thet [your]2605-you eyeth on ! [He]0-i wath throw’d a heavy back - fall off a Elephant in a thort of a Pagoda thing ath [the Thultan of [the Indieth]62-the indieth]2614-the thultan of the indieth , and [he]0-i never got the better of it ; and [thee]123-emma gordon married a thecond time — married [a Cheethemonger]221-a cheethemonger [ath]2615-ath fell in love with [her]123-emma gordon from the front — and [he’th]0-i [a Overtheer and makin ’ a fortun]4953-a overtheer and makin ’ a fortun . ’[0-i] These various changes , [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary , very short of breath now , related with great heartiness , and with a wonderful kind of innocence , considering what [a bleary and brandy - and - watery old veteran]2616-a bleary and brandy - and - watery old veteran [he]0-i was . Afterwards [he]0-i brought in [Josephine]89-josephine , and [E. W. B. Childers]109-mr. childers ( rather deeply lined in the jaws by daylight ) , and [the Little Wonder of Scholastic Equitation]2617-the little wonder of scholastic equitation , and in a word , [all the company]2618-all the company . Amazing creatures [they]2619-they were in [Louisa]216-louisa ’s eyes , so white and pink of complexion , so scant of dress , and so demonstrative of leg ; but it was very agreeable to see [them]2619-they crowding about [Sissy]76-sissy , and very natural in [Sissy]76-sissy to be unable to refrain from tears . ‘ There ! Now [Thethilia]122-thethilia hath kithd [all the children]4954-all the children , and hugged [all the women]4955-all the women , and [thaken]122-thethilia handth all round with [all the men]4956-all the men , clear , [every one of [you]4958-you]4957-every one of you , and ring in the band for the thecond part ! ’[0-i] As soon as [they]2619-they were gone , [he]0-i continued in a low tone . ‘ Now , [Thethilia]122-thethilia , [I]0-i do n’t athk to know [any thecreth]4959-any thecreth , but [I]0-i thuppothe [I]0-i may conthider thith to be [Mith]4960-mith Thquire . ’[0-i] ‘ This is [[his]0-i sister]716-his sister . Yes . ’[0-i] ‘ And t’other [on’th daughter]4962-on’th daughter . That’h what [I]0-i mean . Hope [I]0-i [thee]0-i [you]0-i well , [mith]4960-mith . And [I]0-i hope the Thquire’th well ? ’[0-i] ‘ [[My]216-louisa father]4230-my father will be here soon , ’[216-louisa] said [Louisa]216-louisa , anxious to bring [him]0-i to the point . ‘ Is [[my]216-louisa brother]1334-my brother safe ? ’[216-louisa] ‘ [Thafe]222-thafe and [thound]4965-thound ! ’[0-i] [he]0-i replied . ‘ [I]0-i want [you]0-i jutht to take a peep at the Ring , mith , through here . [Thethilia]122-thethilia , [you]0-i know the dodgeth ; find a thpy - hole for [yourthelf]1334-my brother . ’[0-i] [They]2620-they each looked through a chink in the boards . ‘ That’h [Jack the Giant Killer]223-jack the giant killer — piethe of [comic infant bithnith]4966-comic infant bithnith , ’[88-mr. sleary] said [Sleary]88-mr. sleary . ‘ There’th [a property - houthe]4967-a property - houthe , [you]0-i [thee]0-i , for [Jack]223-jack the giant killer to hide in ; there’th [my]88-mr. sleary Clown with a thauthepan - lid and a thpit , for [Jack’th thervant]224-jack’th thervant ; there’th little Jack himthelf in a thplendid thoot of armour ; there’th [two comic black thervanth twithe ath big ath the houthe]4968-two comic black thervanth twithe ath big ath the houthe , to thtand by it and to bring it in and clear it ; and [the Giant]4969-the giant ( [a very ecthpenthive bathket one]4970-a very ecthpenthive bathket one ) , [he]4969-the giant an’t on yet . Now , do [you]2621-your [thee]2621-your ’em[88-mr. sleary] all ? ’ ‘[88-mr. sleary] Yes , ’ [they]2621-your both said . ‘[88-mr. sleary] Look at ’em again , ’[88-mr. sleary] said [Sleary]88-mr. sleary , ‘ look at ’em[88-mr. sleary] well . [I]0-i do n’t want to know what [your]2621-your brother’th been up to ; ith better for [me]0-i not to know . [[Your]2621-your brother]3779-your brother ith one [them]2625-them black thervanth . ’ [Louisa]216-louisa uttered an exclamation , partly of distress , partly of satisfaction . ‘[2625-them] Ith a fact , ’ said [Sleary]88-mr. sleary , ‘[2625-them] and even knowin ’ it , [you]2621-your could n’t put [your]2621-your finger on [him]3779-your brother . Let [the Thquire]4971-the thquire come . [I]216-louisa thall keep [[your]2621-your brother]3779-your brother here after the performanth . [I]216-louisa thant undreth [him]3779-your brother , nor yet [wath]4973-wath hith paint off . Let [the Thquire]4971-the thquire come here after [the performanth]4975-the performanth , or come [here]366-here [yourthelf]4977-yourthelf after [the performanth]4975-the performanth , and [you]2621-your thall find [[your]2621-your brother]3779-your brother , and have the whole plathe to talk to [him]3779-your brother in . Never mind the lookth of [him]3779-your brother , ath long ath [he’th]3779-your brother well hid . ’[216-louisa] [Louisa]216-louisa , with many thanks and with a lightened load , detained [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary no longer then . [She]2626-her left [her]2626-her love for [[her]2626-her brother]2932-her brother , with [her]2626-her eyes full of tears ; and [she]2626-her and [Sissy]76-sissy went away until later in the afternoon . [Mr. Gradgrind]216-louisa arrived within an hour afterwards . [He]216-louisa too had encountered [no one whom [he]216-louisa knew]2628-no one whom he knew ; and was now sanguine with [Sleary]88-mr. sleary ’s assistance , of getting [[his]216-louisa disgraced son]2629-his disgraced son to [Liverpool]57-liverpool in the night . As [neither of [the three]1592-the three]2630-neither of the three could be [[his]216-louisa companion]1410-his companion without almost identifying [him]216-louisa under any disguise , [he]216-louisa prepared a letter to [a correspondent whom [he]216-louisa could trust]2633-a correspondent whom he could trust , beseeching [him]2633-a correspondent whom he could trust to ship [the bearer]2634-the bearer off at any cost , to [North]63-north or [South America]64-south america , or [any distant part of [the world]301-the world to which [he]216-louisa could be the most speedily and privately dispatched]2635-any distant part of the world to which he could be the most speedily and privately dispatched . This done , [they]1592-the three walked about , waiting for [the Circus]407-the circus to be quite vacated ; not only by [the audience]1469-the audience , but by [the company]3107-the company and by the horses . After watching it a long time , [they]1592-the three saw [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary bring out a chair and sit down by the side - door , smoking ; as if that were [his]88-mr. sleary signal that [they]1592-the three might approach . ‘ [Your]1592-the three thervant , Thquire , ’[88-mr. sleary] was [his]88-mr. sleary cautious salutation as [they]1592-the three passed in . ‘ If [you]1592-the three want [me]88-mr. sleary [you]1592-the three ’ll find [me]88-mr. sleary here . [You]1592-the three muthn’t mind [your]1592-the three thon having a comic livery on . ’[88-mr. sleary] [They]1592-the three all three went in ; and [Mr. Gradgrind]216-louisa sat down forlorn , on [the Clown]2595-the clown ’s performing chair in the middle of the ring . On one of the back benches , remote in the subdued light and the strangeness of [the place]2849-the place , sat [the villainous whelp]2642-the villainous whelp , sulky to [the last , whom [he]216-louisa had the misery to call [[his]216-louisa son]1496-his son]2643-the last , whom he had the misery to call his son . In a preposterous coat , like a beadle ’s , with cuffs and flaps exaggerated to an unspeakable extent ; in an immense waistcoat , knee - breeches , buckled shoes , and a mad cocked hat ; with nothing fitting [him]216-louisa , and everything of coarse material , moth - eaten and full of holes ; with seams in [his]216-louisa black face , where fear and heat had started through the greasy composition daubed all over it ; anything so grimly , detestably , ridiculously shameful as the whelp in [his]216-louisa comic livery , [Mr. Gradgrind]216-louisa never could by any other means have believed in , weighable and measurable fact though it was . And [one of [[his]216-louisa model children]2646-his model children]2645-one of his model children had come to this ! At first [the whelp]1387-the whelp would not draw any nearer , but persisted in remaining up there by [himself]1387-the whelp . Yielding at length , if any concession so sullenly made can be called yielding , to the entreaties of [Sissy]76-sissy — for [Louisa]216-louisa [he]216-louisa disowned altogether — [he]216-louisa came down , bench by bench , until [he]216-louisa stood in the sawdust , on the verge of the circle , as far as possible , within its limits from where [[his]1496-his son father]3044-his father sat . ‘ How was this done ? ’[438-the father] asked [the father]438-the father . ‘ How was what done ? ’[2650-the son] moodily answered [the son]2650-the son . ‘ This robbery , ’[438-the father] said [the father]438-the father , raising [his]438-the father voice upon the word . ‘ [I]438-the father forced the safe [myself]438-the father over night , and shut it up ajar before [I]438-the father went away . [I]438-the father had had the key that was found , made long before . [I]438-the father dropped it that morning , that it might be supposed to have been used . [I]438-the father did n’t take the money all at once . [I]438-the father pretended to put [my]438-the father balance away every night , but [I]438-the father did n’t . Now [you]2650-the son know all about it . ’[438-the father] ‘ If a thunderbolt had fallen on [me]438-the father , ’[438-the father] said [the father]438-the father , ‘ it would have shocked [me]438-the father less than this ! ’[438-the father] ‘ [I]2650-the son do n’t see why , ’[2650-the son] grumbled [the son]2650-the son . ‘ [So many people]4980-so many people are employed in situations of trust ; [so many people]4980-so many people , out of so many , will be dishonest . [I]2650-the son have heard [you]2650-the son talk , a hundred times , of its being a law . How can [I]2650-the son help laws ? [You]2650-the son have comforted [others]3223-others with such things , [father]2781-father . Comfort [yourself]2650-the son ! ’[2650-the son] [The father]438-the father buried [his]438-the father face in [his]438-the father hands , and [the son]2650-the son stood in [his]2650-the son disgraceful grotesqueness , biting straw : [his]2650-the son hands , with the black partly worn away inside , looking like the hands of a monkey . The evening was fast closing in ; and from time to time , [he]2650-the son turned the whites of [his]2650-the son eyes restlessly and impatiently towards [[his]2650-the son father]3044-his father . They were the only parts of [his]2650-the son face that showed any life or expression , the pigment upon it was so thick . ‘ [You]2650-the son must be got to [Liverpool]57-liverpool , and sent abroad . ’[1387-the whelp] ‘ [I]1387-the whelp suppose [I]1387-the whelp must . [I]1387-the whelp ca n’t be more miserable anywhere , ’[1387-the whelp] whimpered [the whelp]1387-the whelp , ‘ than [I]1387-the whelp have been [here]366-here , ever since [I]1387-the whelp can remember . That ’s one thing . ’[1387-the whelp] [Mr. Gradgrind]216-louisa went to the door , and returned with [Sleary]88-mr. sleary , to whom [he]216-louisa submitted the question , How to get this deplorable object away ? ‘ Why , [I]216-louisa ’ve been thinking of it , [Thquire]120-thquire . There’th not muth time to lothe , tho [you]120-thquire muth [thay]4985-thay yeth or no . Ith over twenty mileth to the rail . There’th a coath in half an hour , that goeth to the rail , ‘[216-louisa] purpothe to [cath]2658-cath [the mail train]2659-the mail train . [That train]2660-that train will take [him]2650-the son right to [Liverpool]57-liverpool . ’ ‘[2650-the son] But look at [him]2650-the son , ’ groaned [Mr. Gradgrind]216-louisa . ‘[2650-the son] Will [any coach]2661-any coach — ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t mean that [he]2650-the son thould go in the comic livery , ’ said [Sleary]88-mr. sleary . ‘[0-i] [Thay]2662-thay the word , and [I]0-i ’ll make a Jothkin of [him]2650-the son , out of the wardrobe , in five minutes . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t understand , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]216-louisa . ‘[2663-a jothkin] [A Jothkin]2663-a jothkin — [a Carter]2664-a carter . Make up [your]0-i mind quick , Thquire . There ’ll be beer to feth . [I]0-i ’ve never met with nothing but beer ath’ll ever clean a comic blackamoor . ’ [Mr. Gradgrind]216-louisa rapidly assented ; [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary rapidly turned out from a box , a smock frock , a felt hat , and other essentials ; the whelp rapidly changed clothes behind a screen of baize ; [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary rapidly brought beer , and washed [him]2650-the son white again . ‘[0-i] Now , ’ said [Sleary]88-mr. sleary , ‘[0-i] come along to the coath , and jump up behind ; [I]0-i ’ll go with [you]0-i there , and [they]2665-they ’ll thuppothe [you]0-i [one of [[my]0-i people]3092-my people]2666-one of my people . [Thay]2668-thay farewell to [[your]0-i family]2669-your family , and tharp’th the word . ’ With which [he]88-mr. sleary delicately retired . ‘[2668-thay] Here is [your]0-i letter , ’ said [Mr. Gradgrind]216-louisa . ‘[2668-thay] All necessary means will be provided for [you]0-i . Atone , by repentance and better conduct , for the shocking action [you]0-i have committed , and the dreadful consequences to which it has led . Give [me]0-i [your]0-i hand , [[my]0-i poor boy]2670-my poor boy , and may [God]147-god forgive [you]0-i as [I]0-i do ! ’ [The culprit]4986-the culprit was moved to a few abject tears by these words and their pathetic tone . But , when [Louisa]216-louisa opened [her]4987-her arms , [he]0-i repulsed [her]4987-her afresh . ‘[0-i] Not [you]0-i . [I]0-i do n’t want to have anything to say to [you]0-i ! ’ ‘[0-i] O [Tom]71-tom , [Tom]71-tom , do [we]2671-we end so , after all [my]0-i love ! ’ ‘[71-tom] After all [your]0-i love ! ’ [he]0-i returned , obdurately . ‘[71-tom] Pretty love ! Leaving [old Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby to [himself]93-mr. bounderby , and packing [[my]0-i best friend]2672-my best friend [Mr. Harthouse]167-mr. harthouse off , and going [home]2856-home just when [I]0-i was in the greatest danger . Pretty love that ! Coming out with every word about [our]2671-we having gone to [that place]1896-that place , when [you]0-i saw the net was gathering round [me]0-i . Pretty love that ! [You]0-i have regularly given [me]0-i up . [You]0-i never cared for [me]0-i . ’ ‘[0-i] Tharp’th the word ! ’ said [Sleary]88-mr. sleary , at the door . [They]2671-we all confusedly went out : [Louisa]216-louisa crying to [him]0-i that [she]4988-her forgave [him]0-i , and loved [him]0-i still , and that [he]0-i would one day be sorry to have left [her]4988-her so , and glad to think of these [her]4988-her last words , far away : when [some one]3472-some one ran against [them]2671-we . [Mr. Gradgrind]216-louisa and [Sissy]76-sissy , who were both before [him]0-i while [[his]0-i sister]716-his sister yet clung to [his]0-i shoulder , stopped and recoiled . For , there was [Bitzer]77-bitzer , out of breath , [his]77-bitzer thin lips parted , [his]77-bitzer thin nostrils distended , [his]77-bitzer white eyelashes quivering , [his]77-bitzer colourless face more colourless than ever , as if [he]77-bitzer ran [himself]77-bitzer into a white heat , when [other people]4991-other people ran [themselves]4991-other people into a glow . There [he]77-bitzer stood , panting and heaving , as if [he]77-bitzer had never stopped since the night , now long ago , when [he]77-bitzer had run [them]4992-them down before . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ’m sorry to interfere with [your]4993-your plans , ’[77-bitzer] said [Bitzer]77-bitzer , shaking [his]77-bitzer head , ‘ but [I]77-bitzer ca n’t allow [myself]77-bitzer to be done by [horse - riders]4994-horse - riders . [I]77-bitzer must have [young Mr. Tom]71-tom ; [he]71-tom must n’t be got away by [horse - riders]4994-horse - riders ; here [he]71-tom is in a smock frock , and [I]77-bitzer must have [him]71-tom ! ’[77-bitzer] By the collar , too , it seemed . For , so [he]77-bitzer took possession of [him]77-bitzer . [They]2675-they went back into [the booth]3032-the booth , [Sleary]88-mr. sleary shutting the door to keep [intruders]2677-intruders out . [Bitzer]77-bitzer , still holding [the paralysed culprit by the collar]2678-the paralysed culprit by the collar , stood in the Ring , blinking at [[his]77-bitzer old patron]2679-his old patron through the darkness of the twilight . ‘ [Bitzer]77-bitzer , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , broken down , and miserably submissive to [him]77-bitzer , ‘ have [you]77-bitzer a heart ? ’[71-tom] ‘ The circulation , [sir]2771-sir , ’[77-bitzer] returned [Bitzer]77-bitzer , smiling at the oddity of the question , ‘ could n’t be carried on without one . [No man]1479-no man , [sir]2771-sir , acquainted with the facts established by [Harvey]225-harvey relating to the circulation of the blood , can doubt that [I]77-bitzer have a heart . ’[77-bitzer] ‘ Is it accessible , ’[71-tom] cried [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , ‘ to any compassionate influence ? ’[71-tom] ‘ It is accessible to Reason , [sir]2771-sir , ’[2680-the excellent young man] returned [the excellent young man]2680-the excellent young man . ‘ And to nothing else . ’[2681-they] [They]2681-they stood looking at [each other]2682-each other ; [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom ’s face as white as [the pursuer]2683-the pursuer ’s . ‘ What motive — even what motive in reason — can [you]77-bitzer have for preventing the escape of [this wretched youth]5000-this wretched youth , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , ‘ and crushing [[his]5000-this wretched youth miserable father]5001-his miserable father ? See [[his]5000-this wretched youth sister]716-his sister here . Pity [us]2681-they ! ’[71-tom] ‘ [Sir]2771-sir , ’[77-bitzer] returned [Bitzer]77-bitzer , in a very business - like and logical manner , ‘ since [you]2771-sir ask [me]77-bitzer what motive [I]77-bitzer have in reason , for taking [young Mr. Tom]71-tom back to [Coketown]4-coketown , it is only reasonable to let [you]2771-sir know . [I]77-bitzer have suspected [young Mr. Tom]71-tom of this bank - robbery from the first . [I]77-bitzer had had [my]77-bitzer eye upon [him]71-tom before that time , for [I]77-bitzer knew [his]71-tom ways . [I]77-bitzer have kept [my]77-bitzer observations to [myself]77-bitzer , but [I]77-bitzer have made them ; and [I]77-bitzer have got ample proofs against [him]71-tom now , besides [his]71-tom running away , and besides [his]71-tom own confession , which [I]77-bitzer was just in time to overhear . [I]77-bitzer had the pleasure of watching [[your]2771-sir house]5004-your house yesterday morning , and following [you]2771-sir here . [I]77-bitzer am going to take [young Mr. Tom]71-tom back to [Coketown]4-coketown , in order to deliver [him]71-tom over to [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby . [Sir]2771-sir , [I]77-bitzer have no doubt whatever that [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby will then promote [me]77-bitzer to [young Mr. Tom]71-tom ’s situation . And [I]77-bitzer wish to have [his]71-tom situation , [sir]2771-sir , for it will be a rise to [me]77-bitzer , and will do [me]77-bitzer good . ’[77-bitzer] ‘ If this is solely a question of self - interest with [you]2771-sir — ’[71-tom] [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom began . ‘ [I]77-bitzer beg [your]2771-sir pardon for interrupting [you]2771-sir , [sir]2771-sir , ’[77-bitzer] returned [Bitzer]77-bitzer ; ‘ but [I]77-bitzer am sure [you]2771-sir know that the whole social system is a question of self - interest . What [you]2771-sir must always appeal to , is [a person]1778-a person ’s self - interest . It ’s [your]2771-sir only hold . [We]5009-we are so constituted . [I]77-bitzer was brought up in that catechism when [I]77-bitzer was very young , [sir]2771-sir , as [you]2771-sir are aware . ’[77-bitzer] ‘ What sum of money , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , ‘ will [you]2771-sir set against [your]2771-sir expected promotion ? ’[71-tom] ‘ Thank [you]2771-sir , [sir]2771-sir , ’[77-bitzer] returned [Bitzer]77-bitzer , ‘ for hinting at the proposal ; but [I]77-bitzer will not set any sum against it . Knowing that [[your]2771-sir clear head]5012-your clear head would propose that alternative , [I]77-bitzer have gone over the calculations in [my]77-bitzer mind ; and [I]77-bitzer find that to compound a felony , even on very high terms indeed , would not be as safe and good for [me]77-bitzer as [my]77-bitzer improved prospects in [the Bank]3524-the bank . ’[77-bitzer] ‘ [Bitzer]77-bitzer , ’[71-tom] said [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom , stretching out [his]71-tom hands as though [he]71-tom would have said , See how miserable [I]0-i am ! ‘ [Bitzer]77-bitzer , [I]71-tom have but one chance left to soften [you]77-bitzer . [You]77-bitzer were many years at [[my]71-tom school]2039-my school . If , in remembrance of the pains bestowed upon [you]77-bitzer [there]425-there , [you]77-bitzer can persuade [yourself]77-bitzer in any degree to disregard [your]77-bitzer present interest and release [[my]71-tom son]2379-my son , [I]71-tom entreat and pray [you]77-bitzer to give [him]2379-my son the benefit of that remembrance . ’[71-tom] ‘ [I]2684-the old pupil really wonder , [sir]2771-sir , ’[2684-the old pupil] rejoined [the old pupil]2684-the old pupil in an argumentative manner , ‘ to find [you]2771-sir taking a position so untenable . [My]2684-the old pupil schooling was paid for ; it was a bargain ; and when [I]2684-the old pupil came away , the bargain ended . ’[2684-the old pupil] It was a fundamental principle of the Gradgrind philosophy that everything was to be paid for . [Nobody]365-nobody was ever on any account to give [anybody]2887-anybody anything , or render [anybody]2887-anybody help without purchase . Gratitude was to be abolished , and the virtues springing from it were not to be . Every inch of the existence of [mankind]2843-mankind , from birth to death , was to be a bargain across a counter . And if [we]2689-we did n’t get to [Heaven]81-heaven that way , it was not [a politico - economical place]2690-a politico - economical place , and [we]2689-we had no business [there]425-there . ‘ [I]77-bitzer do n’t deny , ’[77-bitzer] added [Bitzer]77-bitzer , ‘ that [my]77-bitzer schooling was cheap . But that comes right , [sir]2771-sir . [I]77-bitzer was made in the cheapest market , and have to dispose of [myself]77-bitzer in the dearest . ’[77-bitzer] [He]77-bitzer was a little troubled here , by [Louisa]216-louisa and [Sissy]76-sissy crying . ‘ Pray do n’t do that , ’[77-bitzer] said [he]77-bitzer , ‘ it ’s of no use doing that : it only worries . [You]2771-sir seem to think that [I]77-bitzer have some animosity against [young Mr. Tom]71-tom ; whereas [I]77-bitzer have none at all . [I]77-bitzer am only going , on the reasonable grounds [I]77-bitzer have mentioned , to take [him]71-tom back to [Coketown]4-coketown . If [he]71-tom was to resist , [I]77-bitzer should set up the cry of [Stop thief]5019-stop thief ! But , [he]71-tom wo n’t resist , [you]2771-sir may depend upon it . ’[77-bitzer] [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary , who with [his]88-mr. sleary mouth open and [his]88-mr. sleary rolling eye as immovably jammed in [his]88-mr. sleary head as [his]88-mr. sleary fixed one , had listened to these doctrines with profound attention , here stepped forward . ‘ [Thquire]120-thquire , [you]120-thquire know perfectly well , and [[your]120-thquire daughter]4634-your daughter knowth perfectly well ( better than [you]120-thquire , becauthe [I]216-louisa thed it to [her]4634-your daughter ) , that [I]216-louisa did n’t know what [your]120-thquire thon had done , and that [I]216-louisa did n’t want to know — [I]216-louisa thed it wath better not , though [I]216-louisa only thought , then , it wath thome thkylarking . However , [thith young man]5021-thith young man having made it known to be a robbery of [a bank]5022-a bank , why , that’h a theriouth thing ; muth too theriouth a thing for [me]216-louisa to compound , ath [thith]5023-thith [young man]527-young man hath very properly called it . Conthequently , [Thquire]120-thquire , [you]120-thquire muthn’t quarrel with [me]216-louisa if [I]216-louisa take [thith young man’th thide]5025-thith young man’th thide , and [thay]5023-thith [he’th]5025-thith young man’th thide right and there’th no help for it . But [I]216-louisa tell [you]120-thquire what [I]216-louisa ’ll do , [Thquire]120-thquire ; [I]216-louisa ’ll drive [[your]120-thquire thon]5026-your thon and [thith young man]5021-thith young man over to the rail , and prevent expothure here . [I]216-louisa ca n’t conthent to do more , but [I]216-louisa ’ll do that . ’[216-louisa] Fresh lamentations from [Louisa]216-louisa , and deeper affliction on [Mr. Gradgrind]216-louisa ’s part , followed this desertion of [them]2692-them by [[their]2692-them last friend]2693-their last friend . But , [Sissy]76-sissy glanced at [him]216-louisa with great attention ; nor did [she]76-sissy in [her]76-sissy own breast misunderstand [him]216-louisa . As [they]2692-them were all going out again , [he]216-louisa favoured [her]76-sissy with one slight roll of [his]216-louisa movable eye , desiring [her]76-sissy to linger behind . As [he]216-louisa locked the door , [he]216-louisa said excitedly : ‘ The Thquire thtood by [you]76-sissy , [Thethilia]122-thethilia , and [I]216-louisa ’ll thtand by [the Thquire]4971-the thquire . More than that : [thith]5029-thith ith a prethiouth rathcal , and belongth to that bluthtering Cove that [[my]216-louisa people]3092-my people nearly pitht out o ’[216-louisa] winder . It ’ll be a dark night ; [I]0-i ’ve got a horthe that ’ll do anything but thpeak ; [I]0-i ’ve got a pony that ’ll go fifteen mile an hour with [Childerth]219-childerth driving of [him]216-louisa ; [I]0-i ’ve got a dog that ’ll keep [a man]484-a man to one plathe four - and - twenty hourth . Get a word with [the young Thquire]2695-the young thquire . Tell [him]2695-the young thquire , when [he]2695-the young thquire theeth [our]2696-our horthe begin to danthe , not to be afraid of being thpilt , but to look out for a pony - gig coming up . Tell [him]2695-the young thquire , when [he]2695-the young thquire theeth that gig clothe by , to jump down , and it ’ll take [him]2695-the young thquire off at a rattling pathe . If [[my]0-i dog]2697-my dog leth [thith]2698-thith [young man]527-young man thtir a peg on foot , [I]0-i give [him]2695-the young thquire leave to go . And if [my]0-i horthe ever thtirth from [that thpot where [he]2695-the young thquire beginth a danthing]2700-that thpot where he beginth a danthing , till the morning — [I]0-i do n’t know [him]2695-the young thquire ? — Tharp’th the word ! ’ The word was so sharp , that in ten minutes [Mr. Childers]109-mr. childers , sauntering about [the market - place]2580-the market - place in a pair of slippers , had [his]109-mr. childers cue , and [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary ’s equipage was ready . It was a fine sight , to behold the learned dog barking round it , and [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary instructing [him]88-mr. sleary , with [his]88-mr. sleary one practicable eye , that [Bitzer]77-bitzer was the object of [his]88-mr. sleary particular attentions . Soon after dark [they]5032-they [all three]2557-all three got in and started ; the learned dog ( a formidable creature ) already pinning [Bitzer]77-bitzer with [his]88-mr. sleary eye , and sticking close to the wheel on [his]88-mr. sleary side , that [he]88-mr. sleary might be ready for [him]77-bitzer in the event of [his]88-mr. sleary showing the slightest disposition to alight . [The other three]5034-the other three sat up at [the inn]5035-the inn all night in great suspense . At eight o’clock in the morning [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary and the dog reappeared : both in high spirits . ‘[120-thquire] All right , [Thquire]120-thquire ! ’ said [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary , ‘[120-thquire] [your]120-thquire thon may be aboard - a - thip by thith time . [Childerth]219-childerth took [him]219-childerth off , an hour and a half after [we]2701-we left [there]425-there latht night . [The horthe]2703-the horthe danthed the polka till [he]219-childerth wath dead beat ( [he]219-childerth would have walthed if [he]219-childerth had n’t been in harneth ) , and then [I]0-i gave [him]219-childerth the word and [he]219-childerth went to thleep comfortable . When that prethiouth young [Rathcal]226-rathcal thed [he]219-childerth ’d go for’ard afoot , the dog hung on to hith neck - hankercher with all four legth in the air and pulled [him]219-childerth down and rolled [him]219-childerth over . Tho [he]219-childerth come back into the drag , and there [he]219-childerth that , ’ till [I]219-childerth turned the horthe’th head , at half - patht thixth thith morning . ’[219-childerth] [Mr. Gradgrind]216-louisa overwhelmed [him]219-childerth with thanks , of course ; and hinted as delicately as [he]216-louisa could , at a handsome remuneration in money . ‘ [I]216-louisa do n’t want money mythelf , [Thquire]120-thquire ; but [Childerth]219-childerth ith [a family man]5036-a family man , and if [you]216-louisa wath to like to offer [him]219-childerth a five - pound note , it might n’t be unactheptable . Likewithe if [you]216-louisa wath to thtand a collar for the dog , or a thet of bellth for [the horthe]2703-the horthe , [I]216-louisa thould be very glad to take [’em]5038-’em[216-louisa] . Brandy and water [I]0-i alwayth take . ’ [He]216-louisa had already called for a glass , and now called for another . ‘[216-louisa] If [you]216-louisa would n’t think it going too far , [Thquire]120-thquire , to make a little thpread for the company at about three and thixth ahead , not reckoning [Luth]227-luth , it would make [’em]5039-’em happy . ’[227-luth] All these little tokens of [his]216-louisa gratitude , [Mr. Gradgrind]216-louisa very willingly undertook to render . Though [he]216-louisa thought them far too slight , [he]216-louisa said , for such a service . ‘ Very well , [Thquire]120-thquire ; then , if [you]216-louisa ’ll only give a Horthe - riding , a bethpeak , whenever [you]216-louisa can , [you]216-louisa ’ll more than balanthe the account . Now , [Thquire]120-thquire , if [[your]216-louisa daughter]4634-your daughter will ethcuthe [me]216-louisa , [I]216-louisa thould like one parting word with [you]216-louisa . ’[216-louisa] [Louisa and Sissy]228-sissy withdrew into [an adjoining room]2704-an adjoining room ; [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary , stirring and drinking [his]88-mr. sleary brandy and water as [he]88-mr. sleary stood , went on : ‘ Thquire , — [you]216-louisa do n’t need to be told that dogth ith wonderful animalth . ’[88-mr. sleary] ‘ [Their]5041-their instinct , ’[216-louisa] said [Mr. Gradgrind]216-louisa , ‘ is surprising . ’[216-louisa] ‘ Whatever [you]216-louisa call it — and [I]88-mr. sleary ’m[88-mr. sleary] bletht if [I]0-i know what to call it ’ — said [Sleary]88-mr. sleary , ‘[216-louisa] it ith athtonithing . [We]5047-our wath getting up [[our]5047-our Children]2607-our children in [the Wood]68-the wood one morning , when there cometh into [our]5047-our Ring , by the thtage door , a dog . [He]5049-he had travelled a long way , [he]5049-he wath in [a very bad condithon]5050-a very bad condithon , [he]5049-he wath lame , and pretty well blind . [Joth’phine]124-joth’phine and [Childerth]219-childerth and [me]88-mr. sleary talked it over a long time , whether [I]88-mr. sleary thould write or not . But [we]5055-we agreed , “ No . There’th nothing comfortable to tell ; why unthettle [her]5052-a child he know’d mind , and make [her]5052-a child he know’d unhappy ? ” Tho , whether [[her]5052-a child he know’d father]2855-her father bathely detherted [her]5052-a child he know’d ; or whether [he]2855-her father broke [hith]5052-a child he know’d own heart alone , rather than pull [her]5052-a child he know’d down along with [him]2855-her father ; never will be known , now , Thquire , till — no , not till [we]5055-we know how the dogth findth [uth]5052-a child he know’d out ! ’[88-mr. sleary] ‘ [She]5052-a child he know’d keeps the bottle that [he]2855-her father sent [her]5052-a child he know’d for , to this hour ; and [she]5052-a child he know’d will believe in [his]2855-her father affection to the last moment of [her]5052-a child he know’d life , ’[216-louisa] said [Mr. Gradgrind]216-louisa . ‘ It theemth to prethent two thingth to [a perthon]5057-a perthon , do n’t it , Thquire ? ’[88-mr. sleary] said [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary , musing as [he]88-mr. sleary looked down into the depths of [his]88-mr. sleary brandy and water : ‘ one , that there ith a love in [the world]301-the world , not all Thelf - interetht after all , but thomething very different ; t’other , that it hath a way of ith own of calculating or not calculating , whith thomehow or another ith at leatht ath hard to give a name to , ath the wayth of the dogth ith ! ’[88-mr. sleary] [Mr. Gradgrind]216-louisa looked out of window , and made no reply . [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary emptied [his]88-mr. sleary glass and recalled [the ladies]2706-the ladies . ‘ [[Thethilia]122-thethilia [my]2706-the ladies dear]5059-thethilia my dear , [kith]5052-a child he know’d [me]2706-the ladies and good - bye ! [Mith]5052-a child he know’d Thquire , to [thee]5059-thethilia my dear [you]5059-thethilia my dear treating of [her]5052-a child he know’d like a thithter , and a thithter that [you]5059-thethilia my dear trutht and honour with all [your]5059-thethilia my dear heart and more , ith a very pretty thight to [me]2706-the ladies . [I]2706-the ladies hope [[your]5059-thethilia my dear brother]3779-your brother may live to be better detherving of [you]5059-thethilia my dear , and a greater comfort to [you]5059-thethilia my dear . Thquire , thake handth , firtht and latht ! Do n’t be croth with [uth]5061-uth poor vagabondth . [People]2821-people mutht be amuthed . [They]2821-people ca n’t be alwayth a learning , nor yet [they]2821-people ca n’t be alwayth a working , [they]2821-people an’t made for it . [You]5059-thethilia my dear mutht have uth , Thquire . Do [the withe thing and the kind thing]5063-the withe thing and the kind thing too , and make the betht of uth ; not the wurtht ! ’[2706-the ladies] ‘ And [I]88-mr. sleary never thought before , ’[88-mr. sleary] said [Mr. Sleary]88-mr. sleary , putting [his]88-mr. sleary head in at the door again to say it , ‘ that [I]88-mr. sleary wath tho muth of a Cackler ! ’[88-mr. sleary] It is a dangerous thing to see anything in the sphere of [a vain blusterer]2707-a vain blusterer , before [the vain blusterer]2708-the vain blusterer sees it [himself]2708-the vain blusterer . [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby felt that [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit had audaciously anticipated [him]93-mr. bounderby , and presumed to be wiser than [he]93-mr. bounderby . Inappeasably indignant with [her]126-mrs. sparsit for [her]126-mrs. sparsit triumphant discovery of [Mrs. Pegler]182-mrs. pegler , [he]93-mr. bounderby turned this presumption , on the part of [a woman in [her]2709-a woman in her dependent position dependent position]2709-a woman in her dependent position , over and over in [his]93-mr. bounderby mind , until it accumulated with turning like a great snowball . At last [he]93-mr. bounderby made the discovery that to discharge [this highly connected female]2710-this highly connected female — to have it in [his]93-mr. bounderby power to say , ‘ [She]2710-this highly connected female was [a woman of family]5064-a woman of family , and wanted to stick to [me]93-mr. bounderby , but [I]93-mr. bounderby would n’t have it , and got rid of [her]2710-this highly connected female ’[93-mr. bounderby] — would be to get the utmost possible amount of crowning glory out of the connection , and at the same time to punish [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit according to [her]126-mrs. sparsit deserts . Filled fuller than ever , with this great idea , [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby came in to lunch , and sat [himself]93-mr. bounderby down in [the dining - room of former days]2711-the dining - room of former days , where [his]93-mr. bounderby portrait was . [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit sat by the fire , with [her]126-mrs. sparsit foot in [her]126-mrs. sparsit cotton stirrup , little thinking whither [she]126-mrs. sparsit was posting . Since the [Pegler]182-mrs. pegler affair , [this gentlewoman]2712-this gentlewoman had covered [her]126-mrs. sparsit pity for [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby with a veil of quiet melancholy and contrition . In virtue thereof , it had become [her]126-mrs. sparsit habit to assume a woful look , which woful look [she]126-mrs. sparsit now bestowed upon [[her]126-mrs. sparsit patron]597-her patron . ‘ What ’s the matter now , [ma’am]361-ma’am ? ’[93-mr. bounderby] said [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , in a very short , rough way . ‘ Pray , [sir]2771-sir , ’[93-mr. bounderby] returned [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , ‘ do not bite [my]126-mrs. sparsit nose off . ’[126-mrs. sparsit] ‘ Bite [your]361-ma’am nose off , [ma’am]361-ma’am ? ’[93-mr. bounderby] repeated [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby . ‘ [Your]361-ma’am nose ! ’[93-mr. bounderby] meaning , as [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit conceived , that it was too developed a nose for the purpose . After which offensive implication , [he]93-mr. bounderby cut [himself]93-mr. bounderby a crust of bread , and threw the knife down with a noise . [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit took [her]126-mrs. sparsit foot out of [her]126-mrs. sparsit stirrup , and said , ‘ [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , [sir]2771-sir ! ’[126-mrs. sparsit] ‘ Well , [ma’am]361-ma’am ? ’[93-mr. bounderby] retorted [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby . ‘ What are [you]361-ma’am staring at ? ’[126-mrs. sparsit] ‘ May [I]126-mrs. sparsit ask , [sir]2771-sir , ’[126-mrs. sparsit] said [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , ‘ have [you]2771-sir been ruffled this morning ? ’[126-mrs. sparsit] ‘ Yes , [ma’am]361-ma’am . ’[126-mrs. sparsit] ‘ May [I]126-mrs. sparsit inquire , [sir]2771-sir , ’[126-mrs. sparsit] pursued [the injured woman]2714-the injured woman , ‘ whether [I]126-mrs. sparsit am the unfortunate cause of [your]2771-sir having lost [your]2771-sir temper ? ’[126-mrs. sparsit] ‘ Now , [I]93-mr. bounderby ’ll tell [you]361-ma’am what , [ma’am]361-ma’am , ’[93-mr. bounderby] said [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , ‘ [I]93-mr. bounderby am not come here to be bullied . [A female]5074-a female may be highly connected , but [she]5074-a female ca n’t be permitted to bother and badger [a man]484-a man in [my]93-mr. bounderby position , and [I]93-mr. bounderby am not going to put up with it . ’[93-mr. bounderby] ( [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby felt it necessary to get on : foreseeing that if [he]93-mr. bounderby allowed of details , [he]93-mr. bounderby would be beaten . ) [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit first elevated , then knitted , [her]126-mrs. sparsit Coriolanian eyebrows ; gathered up [her]126-mrs. sparsit work into its proper basket ; and rose . ‘ [Sir]2771-sir , ’[126-mrs. sparsit] said [she]126-mrs. sparsit , majestically . ‘ It is apparent to [me]126-mrs. sparsit that [I]126-mrs. sparsit am in [your]2771-sir way at present . [I]126-mrs. sparsit will retire to [[my]126-mrs. sparsit own apartment]5077-my own apartment . ’[126-mrs. sparsit] ‘ Allow [me]126-mrs. sparsit to open the door , [ma’am]361-ma’am . ’[126-mrs. sparsit] ‘ Thank [you]2771-sir , [sir]2771-sir ; [I]126-mrs. sparsit can do it for [myself]126-mrs. sparsit . ’[126-mrs. sparsit] ‘ [You]126-mrs. sparsit had better allow [me]93-mr. bounderby , [ma’am]361-ma’am , ’[93-mr. bounderby] said [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , passing [her]126-mrs. sparsit , and getting [his]93-mr. bounderby hand upon the lock ; ‘ because [I]93-mr. bounderby can take the opportunity of saying a word to [you]361-ma’am , before [you]361-ma’am go . [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , [ma’am]361-ma’am , [I]93-mr. bounderby rather think [you]361-ma’am are cramped [here]366-here , do [you]361-ma’am know ? It appears to [me]93-mr. bounderby , that , under [my]93-mr. bounderby humble roof , there ’s hardly opening enough for [a lady of [your]361-ma’am genius]5083-a lady of your genius in [other people]4991-other people ’s affairs . ’[93-mr. bounderby] [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit gave [him]93-mr. bounderby a look of the darkest scorn , and said with great politeness , ‘ Really , [sir]2771-sir ? ’[126-mrs. sparsit] ‘ [I]93-mr. bounderby have been thinking it over , [you]361-ma’am see , since the late affairs have happened , [ma’am]361-ma’am , ’[93-mr. bounderby] said [Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ; ‘ and it appears to [my]93-mr. bounderby poor judgment — ’[93-mr. bounderby] ‘ Oh ! Pray , [sir]2771-sir , ’[126-mrs. sparsit] [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit interposed , with sprightly cheerfulness , ‘ do n’t disparage [your]2771-sir judgment . [Everybody]404-everybody knows how unerring [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby ’s judgment is . [Everybody]404-everybody has had proofs of it . It must be the theme of general conversation . Disparage anything in [yourself]2771-sir but [your]2771-sir judgment , [sir]2771-sir , ’[126-mrs. sparsit] said [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , laughing . [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , very red and uncomfortable , resumed : ‘ It appears to [me]93-mr. bounderby , [ma’am]361-ma’am , [I]93-mr. bounderby say , that a different sort of establishment altogether would bring out [a lady of]5092-a lady of [your]361-ma’am powers . [I]126-mrs. sparsit really ought to apologise to [you]361-ma’am — being only [[Josiah Bounderby]97-bounderby of [Coketown]4-coketown]390-josiah bounderby of coketown — for having stood in [your]361-ma’am light so long . ’[126-mrs. sparsit] ‘ Pray do n’t name it , [sir]2771-sir , ’[126-mrs. sparsit] returned [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit . ‘ If that portrait could speak , [sir]2771-sir — but it has the advantage over the original of not possessing the power of committing [itself]5103-itself and disgusting others , — it would testify , that a long period has elapsed since [I]126-mrs. sparsit first habitually addressed it as the picture of [a Noodle]5104-a noodle . Nothing that [a Noodle]5104-a noodle does , can awaken surprise or indignation ; the proceedings of [a Noodle]5104-a noodle can only inspire contempt . ’[126-mrs. sparsit] Thus saying , [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit , with [her]126-mrs. sparsit Roman features like a medal struck to commemorate [her]126-mrs. sparsit scorn of [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby , surveyed [him]93-mr. bounderby fixedly from head to foot , swept disdainfully past [him]93-mr. bounderby , and ascended the staircase . [Mr. Bounderby]93-mr. bounderby closed the door , and stood before the fire ; projecting [himself]93-mr. bounderby after [his]93-mr. bounderby old explosive manner into [his]93-mr. bounderby portrait — and into futurity . Into how much of futurity ? [He]93-mr. bounderby saw [Mrs. Sparsit]126-mrs. sparsit fighting out a daily fight at the points of all the weapons in [the female armoury]2715-the female armoury , with the grudging , smarting , peevish , tormenting [Lady Scadgers]127-lady scadgers , still laid up in bed with [her]127-lady scadgers mysterious leg , and gobbling [her]127-lady scadgers insufficient income down by about the middle of every quarter , in [a mean little airless lodging]2716-a mean little airless lodging , a mere closet for one , a mere crib for two ; but did [he]93-mr. bounderby see more ? Did [he]93-mr. bounderby catch any glimpse of [himself]93-mr. bounderby making a show of [Bitzer]77-bitzer to [strangers]3139-strangers , as [the rising young man]2718-the rising young man , so devoted to [[his]93-mr. bounderby master]2719-his master ’s great merits , who had won young [Tom]71-tom ’s place , and had almost captured [young Tom]71-tom [himself]93-mr. bounderby , in the times when by various rascals [he]93-mr. bounderby was spirited away ? Did [he]93-mr. bounderby see any faint reflection of [his]93-mr. bounderby own image making a vain - glorious will , whereby [five - and - twenty Humbugs]2720-five - and - twenty humbugs , past five - and - fifty years of age , each taking upon [himself]93-mr. bounderby the name , [Josiah Bounderby]97-bounderby of [Coketown]4-coketown , should for ever dine in [Bounderby Hall]69-bounderby hall , for ever lodge in [Bounderby buildings]2721-bounderby buildings , for ever attend [a Bounderby chapel]2722-a bounderby chapel , for ever go to sleep under [a Bounderby chaplain]2723-a bounderby chaplain , for ever be supported out of [a Bounderby estate]2724-a bounderby estate , and for ever nauseate all healthy stomachs , with a vast amount of [Bounderby balderdash and bluster]2725-bounderby balderdash and bluster ? Had [he]93-mr. bounderby any prescience of the day , five years to come , when [Josiah Bounderby]97-bounderby of [Coketown]4-coketown was to die of a fit in [the Coketown street]2726-the coketown street , and this same precious will was to begin [its]2727-its long career of quibble , plunder , false pretences , vile example , little service and much law ? Probably not . Yet the portrait was to see it all out . Here was [Mr. Gradgrind]71-tom on the same day , and in the same hour , sitting thoughtful in [[his]71-tom own room]2728-his own room . How much of futurity did [he]93-mr. bounderby see ? Did [he]93-mr. bounderby see [himself]93-mr. bounderby , [a white - haired decrepit man]2729-a white - haired decrepit man , bending [his]93-mr. bounderby hitherto inflexible theories to appointed circumstances ; making [his]93-mr. bounderby facts and figures subservient to Faith , Hope , and Charity ; and no longer trying to grind that Heavenly trio in [[his]93-mr. bounderby dusty little mills]2730-his dusty little mills ? Did [he]93-mr. bounderby catch sight of [himself]93-mr. bounderby , therefore much despised by [[his]93-mr. bounderby late political associates]2731-his late political associates ? Did [he]93-mr. bounderby see [them]2731-his late political associates , in the era of its being quite settled that [the national dustmen]4502-the national dustmen have only to do with [one another]551-one another , and owe no duty to an abstraction called [a People]2734-a people , ‘ taunting [the honourable gentleman]5107-the honourable gentleman ’[93-mr. bounderby] with this and with that and with what not , five nights a - week , until the small hours of the morning ? Probably [he]93-mr. bounderby had that much foreknowledge , knowing [[his]93-mr. bounderby men]2735-his men . Here was [Louisa]216-louisa on the night of the same day , watching the fire as in days of yore , though with a gentler and a humbler face . How much of the future might arise before [her]2736-her vision ? Broadsides in [the streets]2975-the streets , signed with [[her]2736-her father]2855-her father ’s name , exonerating [the late Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen , [weaver]2245-weaver , from misplaced suspicion , and publishing the guilt of [[his]144-stephen own son]2740-his own son , with such extenuation as [his]144-stephen years and temptation ( [he]144-stephen could not bring [himself]144-stephen to add , [his]144-stephen education ) might beseech ; were of the Present . So , [Stephen Blackpool]144-stephen ’s tombstone , with [[her]2736-her father]2855-her father ’s record of [his]144-stephen death , was almost of the Present , for [she]2736-her knew it was to be . These things [she]2736-her could plainly see . But , how much of the Future ? [A working woman]3492-a working woman , christened [Rachael]146-rachael , after a long illness once again appearing at the ringing of the Factory bell , and passing to and fro at the set hours , among the Coketown Hands ; [a woman of pensive beauty , always dressed in black , but sweet - tempered and serene]2743-a woman of pensive beauty , always dressed in black , but sweet - tempered and serene , and even cheerful ; who , of [all [the people in [the place]2849-the place]2745-the people in the place , alone appeared to have compassion on [a degraded , drunken wretch of [her]2736-her own sex]2747-a degraded , drunken wretch of her own sex , who was sometimes seen in [the town]2838-the town secretly begging of [her]2736-her , and crying to [her]2736-her]2744-all the people in the place , alone appeared to have compassion on a degraded , drunken wretch of her own sex , who was sometimes seen in the town secretly begging of her , and crying to her ; [a woman working , ever working , but content to do it , and preferring to do it as [her]2736-her natural lot]2749-a woman working , ever working , but content to do it , and preferring to do it as her natural lot , until [she]2736-her should be too old to labour any more ? Did [Louisa]216-louisa see this ? Such a thing was to be . [A lonely brother]2750-a lonely brother , many thousands of miles away , writing , on paper blotted with tears , that [her]2736-her words had too soon come true , and that all the treasures in [the world]301-the world would be cheaply bartered for a sight of [her]2736-her dear face ? At length [this brother]2752-this brother coming nearer [home]2856-home , with hope of seeing [her]2736-her , and being delayed by illness ; and then a letter , in a strange hand , saying ‘ [he]2752-this brother died in [hospital]5108-hospital , of fever , such a day , and died in penitence and love of [you]216-louisa : [his]2752-this brother last word being [your]216-louisa name ’[216-louisa] ? Did [Louisa]216-louisa see these things ? Such things were to be . [Herself]216-louisa again [a wife]3629-a wife — [a mother]2755-a mother — lovingly watchful of [[her]2755-a mother children]411-her children , ever careful that [they]411-her children should have a childhood of the mind no less than a childhood of the body , as knowing it to be even a more beautiful thing , and a possession , any hoarded scrap of which , is a blessing and happiness to [the wisest]2757-the wisest ? Did [Louisa]216-louisa see this ? Such a thing was never to be . But , [happy [Sissy]228-sissy ’s happy children]2758-happy sissy ’s happy children loving [her]2736-her ; [all children]2759-all children loving [her]2736-her ; [she]2736-her , grown learned in childish lore ; thinking no innocent and pretty fancy ever to be despised ; trying hard to know [[her]2736-her humbler fellow - creatures]2760-her humbler fellow - creatures , and to beautify [their]2760-her humbler fellow - creatures lives of machinery and reality with those imaginative graces and delights , without which the heart of infancy will wither up , [the sturdiest physical manhood]2761-the sturdiest physical manhood will be morally stark death , and [the plainest national prosperity figures]2762-the plainest national prosperity figures can show , will be the Writing on the Wall , — [she]2736-her holding this course as part of no fantastic vow , or bond , or brotherhood , or sisterhood , or pledge , or covenant , or fancy dress , or fancy fair ; but simply as a duty to be done , — did [Louisa]228-sissy see these things of [herself]228-sissy ? These things were to be . [Dear reader]2763-dear reader ! It rests with [you]2763-dear reader and [me]0-i , whether , in [our]2764-our two fields of action , similar things shall be or not . Let them be ! [We]2764-our shall sit with lighter bosoms on the hearth , to see the ashes of [our]2764-our fires turn gray and cold .
